description:
503289BR


Introduction


At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.


Your Role and Responsibilities



In Addition, Our Focus On Our Team Is Unparalleled As Demonstrated By The Following


IBM's state-of-the-art Client Innovation Centre (CIC) opened in Nova Scotia in March 2013 and is the first of its kind in Canada. The Centre weaves together IBM’s business insights and industry-leading software portfolio and is ideally suited for any client that needs flexible access to emerging or niche skills that may not be cost effective to grow internally.



The CIC NS is one of IBM’s highest performing delivery centres worldwide – for retention, client satisfaction and utilization. Our employees are empowered to stay and grow within IBM.

We are very focused on continuous skill development – staff training is our third largest annual Centre investment. Employees are immersed in a culture of learning and constant growth

Investment in key partnership with universities, government and private sector groups which has resulted in IBM having a key influencing role in Nova Scotia’s ICT industry, especially in talent development.



We are currently recruiting for a DBA DB2 support. If you are on top of your profession and possess the following key skills, we invite you to apply to our openings.

The following is a summary of desired skills and pre-requisites for this position



5+ yrs of experience in offering DBA DB2 support for application production support , maintenance & development team.

Ensure integrity, availability and performance of DB2 database systems by providing technical support and maintenance.

Monitor database performance and recommend improvements for operational efficiency.

DB2 Experience including patching and upgrades

Strong knowledge of SQL

Understanding of internal dictionary views and tables

Strong performance tuning

Strong understanding of backup/recovery procedures

Good working Unix knowledge –including shell scripting and OS-level troubleshooting

Experience with large databases and clustered environments




Nice To Have Skills




DB2 Certified DBA certification

University or post-secondary education




Required Technical and Professional Expertise




Strong spoken and written English language skills

Prior experience in a consulting environment dealing with Sev1 client calls

Participation in on-call rotation/off hours deployment




Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise




Senior level –5+ years



Must have the ability to work in Canada without sponsorship.


About Business Unit


IBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants that design, build, and run foundational systems and services that is the backbone of the world's economy. IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter businesses by reimagining and reinventing through technology, with its outcome-focused methodologies, industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence.

This role requires you to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to your start date. Full vaccination refers to receiving dosage of COVID-19 vaccines that provide full protection in accordance with Canada Public Health and WHO guidance (full series of a 2 dose vaccine plus 14 days or a one dose vaccine plus 14 days from the last dose). Proof of vaccination status will be required. Booster vaccination requirements may be required. If you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical or religious reasons, we offer accommodations in accordance with applicable law.


Your Life @ IBM


Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.


About IBM


IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.


Location Statement


This role will involve working with technology that is covered by Export Regulations sanctions. If you are a Foreign National from any of the following US sanctioned countries (Cuba, Iran, North Korea, and Syria) on a work permit, you are not eligible for employment in this position.


Being You @ IBM


IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

industries: Software Development and Staffing and Recruiting
description:
The Application Database Administrator (ADBA) is responsible for designing, developing and maintaining databases and database infrastructure for internal and external clients including monitoring and supporting production environments.

 

 Responsibilities include:

 Middleware and applications

 Administers, creates, maintains and monitors client and internal databases.

 Applies database and other 3rd party software patches

 Designs & implements relational database schema using normalization principles.

 Develops automation scripts for monitoring and maintaining the databases.

 Documents server access for all systems.

 Manages system and database configuration changes.

 Performs database backup and restores.

 Performs database server installations and upgrades.

 Performs DBA activities in accordance with the defined procedures.

 Provides 24x7 software and hardware support for production systems.

 Troubleshoots performance problems, conducts performance tuning.

 Troubleshoots performance problems.

 Writes and debugs PL/SQL scripts and stored procedures.

 Installs, upgrades and configures Haemonetics software products

 Strong Oracle SQL and Postgres experience preferred

 AWS RDS experience would be a strong asset

 Experience supporting Java-based applications running on Tomcat servers

Title
: Database Administrator


Duration
: 6 months with possibility of extension


Location
: Ottawa, On





Background/Overview (including Statement of Work)


Under the supervision of the IT project manager, the database administrator (DBA) will be

responsible for the management of databases at the CECCE and the proper functioning of the

student management system. He or she also participates in the development, implementation,

and proper functioning of the CECCE's information management systems. The main

responsibilities are:

- ensure the proper functioning of the databases, their updates, and their availability.

- plan and make the necessary backup copies of databases.

- ensure after each restoration of the availability of databases at the redundancy site

- keep the database management systems up to date.

- Work in close collaboration with the programming team for the design of logical database

models and the creation of structures and objects necessary for the implementation of

computer applications.

- monitoring the physical storage of data and collaborating as needed with system

administrators to allocate the resources necessary for the proper functioning of database

systems.

- actively participate in the planning of data migrations between systems.

- building and creating PL/SQL and T-SQL scripts (stored procedures, functions, packages, etc.).

- analyze and optimize the performance of the database management system, Oracle, and SQL

server.

- extract and analyze data from different computer applications to meet the needs of other

departments and schools.

- develop and maintain up-to-date data exchange procedures between the Council and the

various partners such as Xello, Desire 2 Learn, CESAP, CFORP.

- produce extracts to meet the needs of the various partners, ministry of education, health

offices, school photographers, etc.; - create, among other things, Jasper Soft reports.

- take the necessary measures to solve computer problems arising from his work.











Mandatory Requirements


1) College diploma in computer science, programming, or a combination of education and

relevant experience deemed equivalent by the CECCE.

2) More than five (5) years of experience as a relational database administrator such as

Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server, or others.

3) Experience in relational database administration such as Oracle, MS SQL Server, or

others.

4) Experience with Oracle's PL/SQL and SQL Server's T-SQL

5) Experience with report generation tools such as Jasper Soft, Crystal Report or others.

6) Good knowledge of the Windows server environment.

7) Experience in project management.


8) Bilingual i.e., French, and English both spoken and written.

industries: Financial Services, Investment Banking, and Investment Management
IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Computer Games
description:
We are looking for a talented, self-motivated Data Engineer with broad technical skills to dive deep into large amounts of data and the desire to influence key decisions with data-driven analysis and insights. The position collaborates closely with the Marketing & Commercial Analytics team to implement data strategies for marketing, develop complex ETL pipelines and support dashboards that promote deeper understanding of our games.

The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in developing and establishing scalable, efficient, automated processes for large scale data analyses and possess excellent problem solving ability dealing with huge volumes of game data. The position will also stay apprised of latest trends and research on all aspects of data engineering and analytics. You will work with leaders from the Marketing, Commercial and Studios organization by providing them with data to understand campaign and commercial performance across multiple channels and territories.



Responsibilities




 As a Data Engineer you will be involved in the entire development life cycle from brainstorming ideas to implementing elegant solutions to derive data insights 

 You will gather requirements, model and design solutions to support reporting analytics and exploratory analysis 

 You will design, build, and launch efficient, scalable and reliable data pipelines to move and transform data 

 You will work with analysts, understand requirements, develop technical specifications for ETLs, including documentation 

 You will be responsible to support production code to produce comprehensive and accurate data artifacts. 

 You will oversee the process of adoption of new technologies and applications we use to collect, integrate, analyze, and deliver relevant analytical solutions. 

 You will guide communications between our users and studio engineers to provide scalable end-to-end solutions. 

 You will promote strategies to improve our data modeling, quality and architecture 

 You will work with big data solutions, data modeling, understand the ETL pipelines and dashboard tools. 

 You will be engaged in every step of the development life cycle, from collecting requirements, communicating to users, design, development and testing the products. 

 Explore data and suggest new opportunities to measure and assess the performance of our marketing and commercial actions 




Qualifications




 4+ years relevant industry experience in data engineering role who has Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field. 

 Proficiency in writing SQL queries and knowledge of cloud-based databases like Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery or other big data solutions. 

 Experience in data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing. 

 Experience with at least one of the programming languages like Python or Java 

 Experience with business intelligence tools like Power BI, Looker, Tableau or similar BI tools. 

 Experience working with unstructured datasets 

 Experience in the physical and logical design of database architecture for relational databases, data warehouses and data lakes. 

 Knowledge of latest data pipeline tools such as Airflow. 

 Developing APIs and integrating with 3rd party APIs 

 Summarize technical details to non-technical audience 

 Comfortable working with a multi-functional team, both locally and remote, understanding the perspectives of each partner. 

 Experience working in an agile development environment and familiar with Process Management tools such as JIRA, Target process, Trello or similar

industries: Construction, Staffing and Recruiting, and Oil and Gas
description:
West Fraser’s IT is continuing to grow, with multiple locations, we are larger than many startups! We are implementing new technology and the successful candidate should be a self-motivated achiever who gains satisfaction from providing excellent support services and thrives in a team-based environment.




Responsibilities






Installing, configuring and upgrading the databases

Modifying the database structure, as needed

Backing up and restoring databases

Liaising with database vendors for technical support

Monitor and optimize the performance of database queries including preparation of periodical metrics

Maintaining appropriate memory and disk space to ensure system performance

Troubleshooting live database issues

Maintaining the indexes

Maintaining established statistics

Checking database integrity

Assessing database integrity issues

Patching Database Server for security flaws

Conducting established security check protocol

Considering and granting security access requests

Reviewing availability groups and assessing for high availability

Ensuring adherence to our disaster recovery plan

Liaising with application support and developers on demand

Perform scheduled maintenance and support release deployment activities

Follow Change Management processes to implement database configuration changes

Trouble shoot and resolve database connectivity issues

Plan, deploy upgrades or modifications to improve performance and availability of SQL servers/ Oracle databases

Build, maintain overall systems architecture concerning databases back-end servers and computing environment

Oversee database policies and procedures to ensure the integrity and availability of databases

Develop, enhance tools and procedures used for automated checks and monitoring the status of databases

Enforce and maintain compliance of SQL, Oracle database environments with internal database security standards




Position Requirements




University degree in Computer Science or related information technology degree/diploma

3 - 5 years’ experience with Oracle or Microsoft database platforms

Driven and able to learn new technologies in short timeframes

Moderate knowledge of PL/SQL or T-SQL Languages

Unix shell scripting skills, windows batch scripting and PowerShell

Critical thinker and have adept problem-solving skills

Basic knowledge of Oracle and Microsoft data migration and ETL tools

Some experience with Monitoring & Diagnostic tools

Some knowledge working with Windows and Unix servers

Some knowledge of storage systems as it applies to hosting databases

Knowledge of SQL Clustering, High Availability (HA) and (DR) options for SQL Server and Oracle RAC is an asset

Implementing operational automation using scripts (Unix shell scripts, PowerShell, T-SQL, VB Scripts, etc.)

Experience performance tuning and troubleshooting of queries, stored procedures, and SSIS packages.

Experience Indexing for performance (index maintenance and statistics, index usage analysis, etc.).

Experienced with Database cloud services: Azure SQL, Oracle OCI is an asset

Experience with On-premises, Cloud, and Hybrid database environments design, development, and support

DR strategies design, implementation, and testing experience.

Understanding of Database security and implementation of best practices in database access

Experienced with Source Code repository such as (Subversion) to support software development life cycle

Strong written and verbal communication skills in both technical and non-technical scenarios

Positive and people-oriented personality that is action-oriented.

Microsoft SQL Server Certification, Oracle Database Certification is an asset

Experience with SQL Server 2012 and higher, Oracle 12c and higher is an asset

Experience working with Windows Server 2012 and higher is an asset

Experience working with Oracle Linux environments 6 and higher is an asset

Experience with Middleware such as Weblogic or IIS is an asset




If this position sounds like the start of a career for you, submit your cover letter and resume at 
www.westfraser.com/jobs
 click "apply now" in green at the top of the page.


For more information on West Fraser and our current opportunities, visit our website at: 
www.westfraser.com/jobs



West Fraser believes inclusive, diverse teams build a more vibrant workforce, safer operations and a stronger company overall. We strive to create workplaces and leadership teams that are reflective of the diverse communities we are a part of. We will not discriminate against 
any 
applicant for employment on the basis of race, gender, national origin or any other protected legal characteristic.



W

e thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Must-haves

-5 years minimum working as an Oracle DBA

-SQL PL/SQL (Development Experience)

- Scripting

Performance Tuning 




Plusses

+ETL understanding

+informatica and sas

+code revisioning

+fraud, security, AML

-banking/financial experience


 


Day-to-Day

Insight Global is looking for a Oracle DBA to join one of our top financial clients for a 6 month contract to start with possible extension.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting and Banking
description:
Oracle DBA


Apex Systems is a global IT services provider and our consulting practice has an opening for an Oracle DBA with experience supporting 100+ applications and experience with Ansible and scripting to place at our client, a Big Five Bank. This team is working 
exclusively
 with Apex.





Client:
 Big Five Bank


Terms:
 6-month Contract to Hire.


Full-time benefits include 
Bonuses, competitive benefits, and banking perks


Start Date: ASAP



Location:
 Currently 100% Remote, Post COVID, Downtown Toronto





Must Haves



3+ Years Oracle Database Admin Experience

Experience working in a complex environment, i.e. enterprise level bank, where you were supporting 100+ applications

Experience providing Level 2 support

Excellent communication skills, executive facing, experience reporting to VP’s

Practical experience in pro-active and reactive database performance tuning.

Performance Tuning and Query Optimization

TDE and oracle Vault and DB set and data mask

Ansible

Scripting, i.e. Script in dev to deal with archive log that is failing, fix something that is slow in development






Nice to Have



Experience with Oracle performance views, OEM, ASM, backup and recovery concepts (RMAN) and operating system concepts

Oracle 19

IBM Netezza

Azure






Job Description



Application Operations (AO) DBA resources will also work with the Application Development and DXC (HP) teams on information to be gathered during incidents. The resource will query certain results as part of production issue investigations.

Will review the run books and OSIs periodically in support of incident management capability.

Will work with AD and DXC to write and implement:

DB maintenance scripts, DB log clean up jobs, health checks, start-up and shutdown scripts

Exercise the app maintenance window to ensure that DBs run optimally

Will review and ensure proper alerting is in place and tested. The resource will review monitoring is in line with needs and make recommendations for improvements and for automation opportunities

Will work with AD to assess capacity needs and ensure the DB is sized and configured to handle the short – mid-term capacity needs

Profiling of databases and producing Query/profile reports where issues are observed – for example, provide to the AD team long-running queries

Support assessment of planned/implemented changes – assess the potential impact on database performance/capacity

Undertake investigation in conjunction with other teams at DXC and Our Client on agreed known problems (for example performance). These resources will not engage to support major incidents directly (unless specifically called upon by AO Management) – standard Incident Management processes and resources should be followed for that.

1.      Experience in C proramming

2.      Exposure to ARM architecture.

3.      Expertise in embedded testing domain eg: storage, medical, aero, network tc.

4.      Proficiency in devops or CI/CD are added+

5.      Knowledge of c/c++ are added+

6.      Good communication skills and should be based out of VC. They might need to come to office whenever site opens. Permanent remote working is not possible.

industries: Marketing Services, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Our mission is to bring community and belonging to everyone in the world. Reddit is a community of communities where people can dive into anything through experiences built around their interests, hobbies, and passions. With more than 50 million people visiting 100,000+ communities daily, it is home to the most open and authentic conversations on the internet. From pets to parenting, skincare to stocks, there’s a community for everybody on Reddit. For more information, visit redditinc.com.

"The front page of the internet,” Reddit brings over 430 million people together each month through their common interests, inviting them to share, vote, comment, and create across thousands of communities. Come for the cats, stay for the empathy.

As a data warehouse engineer, you will build scalable tools on top of Reddit's petabyte-scale warehouse to support all data customers of Reddit. Your work will enable data scientists, machine learning engineers, and product teams to create and access data at a massive scale. If you have a passion for building and maintaining high quality data tools, and want to improve how Reddit makes strategic decisions at the company level, then this is the team for you!



What You’ll Learn




You will be exposed to the full lifecycle of data at Reddit, and as a result will gain expertise on how to scale and improve the data culture across the entire company

You will work directly with a diverse team set including data science, experimentation, infrastructure, machine learning, and senior leadership

You will work with one of the largest and richest datasets in the world, and get exposure to leading data technologies (including the ones Reddit builds from the ground up)





What You’ll Do




Build and scale data orchestration services that support complex analysis across Reddit

Consistently evolve data model & data schema based on business and engineering requirements

Own data quality for crucial systems at Reddit, and serve as a primary resource for data expertise

Define and manage SLA for datasets that support production services





Who You Might Be




3+ years experience in the data warehouse space

3+ years experience working with large scale ETL systems (implementation, strategy, and maintenance)

3+ years of experience building clean, maintainable, and well-tested code

Fluent in Python and SQL

Excellent communication skills to collaborate with stakeholders at all levels of the company

Bonus points for background in data science, analytics, or data QA




Reddit is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at 

ApplicationAssistance@Reddit.com

.

Dawn InfoTek Inc. is a professional IT consulting team that partners with major financial institutions, investment firms and government sectors. We have been dedicated to delivering cutting-edge consulting services and recruiting all levels of IT positions for our clients.

We are currently seeking competent individuals to fulfill the role of Data Engineer to join our dynamic team for our client.

Responsibilities

• Design, construct, install, test and maintain highly scalable data management systems.
• Ensure systems meet business requirements and industry practices.
• Design, implement, automate and maintain large scale enterprise data ETL and data pipelines processes
• Build high-performance algorithms and predictive models

Candidate Requirements/Must Have Skills:
- 3+ years’ Experience as a Data Engineer
- Experienced with Hive and Python
- Strong PC skills including knowledge of Microsoft SharePoint.

Nice-To-Have Skills:
- Previous banking Experience an asset
- Familiarity with Airflow and Kubernetes an asset

Soft Skills:
• Ability to work as part of a team, as well as work independently or with minimal direction.
• Excellent written, presentation, and verbal communication skills.
• Collaborate with data architects, modelers and IT team members on project goals.

Degrees or certifications:
• Bachelor's degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or related field required.

Job Types: Full-time, Temporary

Pay: $40.00-$55.00 per hour

description:

The position collaborates closely with the Marketing & Commercial Analytics team to implement data strategies for marketing, develop complex ETL pipelines and support dashboards that promote deeper understanding of our games.

The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in developing and establishing scalable, efficient, automated processes for large scale data analyses and possess excellent problem solving ability dealing with huge volumes of game data. The position will also stay apprised of latest trends and research on all aspects of data engineering and analytics. You will work with leaders from the Marketing, Commercial and Studios organization by providing them with data to understand campaign and commercial performance across multiple channels and territories.



Responsibilities




 As a Data Engineer you will be involved in the entire development life cycle from brainstorming ideas to implementing elegant solutions to derive data insights

Help us boldly shape retail in Canada


Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class Owned Brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast. We are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Canadian Tire and its group of companies.

The 
 Data Science, Applied AI & Data Products/ Operations 
 team at Canadian Tire Corporation designs, develops, and automates customer-facing data products and services. These products and services enable and power customer-focused analytical solutions that add business value. The diverse and dynamic team consists of data scientists, engineers, developers, and analysts united by a common goal to enhance customer and brand experience across the corporation. The team utilizes the latest data technologies and advanced analytical techniques to build best in class product and services.

To help define where and how we work, CTC has introduced Hybrid Workplace Personas. While each role fits into a different persona category, this may evolve as employees progress in their career or business needs change. The Data Engineer position is categorized as a Connector, which means that the incumbent will be working with a variety of colleagues and partners to achieve business outcomes that require a mixed use of virtual and CTC campus presence.

Reporting to the Data Engineering Manager, the Junior Data Engineer will play a key role in the continued build-out of automated data pipelines. An ideal candidate works with an ‘automate first’ mindset and continuously strives to work more efficiently. You are collaborative, analytically savvy, strategically astute, and capable of delivering in a fast paced and innovative market.

The Junior Data Engineer will be exposed to a variety of tasks, covering a range of responsibilities across a full analytical project lifecycle. This may include but is not limited to the following: business requirements assessment, solution design (R&D), solution development, ETL pipeline development and documentation, production operations, and post model deployment assessment.



What You’ll Do




 Develop and optimize existing and new data products 

 Design and implement data pipelines to monitor, validate model assumptions and performance adhering to best-in-class coding standards 

 Develop and optimize existing and new data pipelines to standardize and automate 

 Approach problems with an entrepreneurial mindset 

 Work on ad-hoc projects that leverage multiple internal / external sources of data such as sales, inventory, cost, digital analytics, loyalty, driving patterns, etc. 

 Work with IT and business stakeholders to influence decision making with data / data products 




What You Bring




 Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience: degrees in disciplines such as Engineering, Science, Mathematics/Statistics, Computer Science are preferred. 

 More than 1 year of experience (including internship) in data domain or experience working with large datasets agnostic of any industry 

 Strong knowledge of SQL to perform complex data analysis is necessary, additional experience with Python / Spark or other languages to transform and process data 

 Excellent knowledge / experience in building machine learning and mathematical models 

 Working knowledge/experience in data technologies and analytical platforms / tools (Big Data Foundation/Hadoop, Azure, GCP, Big Query, Power BI, Data Studio, Airflow, Snowflake, etc.) 

 Experience with data intelligence/visualization platforms such as Looker, Google Data Studio, Tableau or other similar tools is a plus 

 Strong business acumen, including modelling and strategic business case development experience 

 Have a grasp of statistics, one or multiple programming languages, understanding of databases and solid foundation of relevant technical skills 

 Experience in translating business requirements into technical specifications 

 Ability to communicate with people at all levels of the organization in a professional and competent manner 




About Canadian Tire Corporation



As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies . To learn more follow us on LinkedIn .

CTC is committed to the fight against COVID-19 and being there for Canadians. In support of this, we have adopted a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy to protect the health and well-being of our employees. Employees will be required either to be fully vaccinated or undergo regular COVID-19 testing in order to access the workplace until further notice.

Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

Ontario-Toronto

Permanent

Full-time


Job Posting


Mar 8, 2022, 1:02:47 PM

Work at an award-winning top employer! If you are looking for an empowering and progressive place to shape your future, then you’ve landed in the right place at BCAA. With our corporate Head Office in Burnaby and locations around BC, we offer a wide variety of opportunities all across the province. Share our purpose to together mobilize a brighter future for all and help British Columbians down’s life’s many roads.




Full vaccination against COVID-19 is a precondition of new employment. A successful candidate offered employment at BCAA will need to provide proof of full vaccination prior to commencing employment. Exemptions permitted under applicable employment and human rights legislation.





Senior Data Engineer... If you know the title, you know the role! Contact us today.


BCAA’s Data and Analytics Centre of Excellence (COE) is a growing team of data scientists, developers and analysts who deliver value across the organization by leading the development of data science, information governance and digital solutions through best practices, research, support, and training for the organization’s analytics community. As a Senior Data Engineer within the DnA Centre of Excellence, you will provide hands-on leadership while working on a cross-functional team that is passionate about innovation and collaboratively solving complex problems.

The successful candidate will work closely with stakeholders across the organization to address business problems and support insight-driven decision making, while working alongside team members within the Data Science and Information Governance practice. Your ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical leaders and team members, and to support the implementation of solutions from self-serve analytics to advanced machine learning will be key to your success.




As a Senior Data Engineer, you will also work closely with BCAA’s Infrastructure and Product & Platform teams in the development of BCAA’s Data Lake, which enables new capabilities for our analytics community to leverage in exploring, developing, and deploying solutions that deliver value within the organization and to our customers. As part of maturing organizational practices, the DnA team provides support and education across various business units around the democratization of analytics and driving a culture of data-driven decision making.

The Data and Analytics CoE is part of a broader Chief Technology and Transformation Office (CTTO) team, which leads BCAA’s Information Services through several initiatives and programs, guided by a customer-centric approach. Our work as a Data and Analytics COE spans across the organization, collaborating with teams in several business units, including Roadside Assistance, Home Insurance, Travel Insurance, Marketing, Evo Car Share and the BCAA Call Centre, to name a few.





Key Responsibilities


Data Engineer/ETL 


Leads BCAA’s Data and Analytics Operations (DnA Ops) Data Engineering Practice

Designs scalable solutions that are flexible and can evolve within an ever-changing environment

Deploys data models and analysis for business processes, data usages (flow), process design and data design.

Develops solutions that strengthen data governance, security frameworks, data integrations and data integrity.

Works closely with DnA CoE data scientists, BI developers, information governance and business stakeholders to lead data processing solutions that deliver value throughout the enterprise

Provides organizational engineering and data architecture expertise; consulting services to design, deploy and maintain systems to enable downstream analytics, ensuring standards and best practices are embedded

Collaborates with stakeholders at all levels of the organization on a range of business problems, identifying and supporting the implementation of solutions to drive improved business results through advanced analytics

Thoroughly documents assumptions, requirements, methodology, test plans and facilitates knowledge sharing and insight on engineering and usage of new data engineering and data discovery tools

Analyzes both structured and unstructured data to identify patterns, trends/dependencies and communicate the results to the relevant stakeholders

Coordinates model-driven process engineering and automation initiatives

Assists with embedding the use of advanced analytical tools and techniques across analytics teams at BCAA.

Develops automated data and metadata processes for leverage organizational insight and action

Supports and enables collaboration across the business to democratize information and remove ‘data silos






Qualifications


Education

Bachelor’s Degree and/or Master’s degree in Data Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Actuarial Sciences or other STEM discipline




Experience 


Minimum of five years as a data engineer or ETL developer

Demonstrated experience building data warehouses, scalable data pipelines, provisioning self-serve analytic data models, AWS cloud stack



OR
 equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.

 

Other Skills / Qualifications


Superior communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to navigate and influence throughout the organization both technical & non-technical audiences

Technical leadership: you are considered the go-to expert in data engineering best-practices amongst industry peers

Data engineering champion: proven advocate for advancing core data engineering practices and engaging with the analytics community

Experience leading data projects from problem identification to production.

Experience supporting ML and AI experiments, business intelligence, data science models and reporting.

Experience handling large and complex data sets in all stages from extraction to modelling, structuring, filtering, discovery, and development of visualizations.

Industry experience developing, optimizing, and implementing machine learning models in a production environment.

Solid understanding of foundational statistical concepts

Strong analytics background: demonstrated experience with quantitative data analysis and utilizing data to drive decision-making, specifically related to measuring and demonstrating effectiveness.

Ability to connect systems using API’s, Python code or Bash scripts

Attention to detail and the ability to solve problems through technical solutions.

Strong working knowledge of source and target data structures, ETL and CDC processes and products, analysis, troubleshooting, and code review.

Working understanding of high-volume data processing and analysis, relational and NoSql Databases, and Machine Learning Tools/Frameworks.

Capability to learn and develop new engineering techniques as required.

Experience with the following tools/languages for data management and manipulation: Informatica, MapReduce, Rest APIs, Attunity Qlik-Replicate, Scala

Extensive experience in:

Python, SQL, NoSQL

AWS stack (certification preferred)

PowerBI, Tableau

description:
About OneComply:


OneComply (https://onecomply.com/) is challenging, with decades of experience, the billion-dollar industry of state regulatory compliance. Leveraging technical innovation and strong business analytics, OneComply streamlines the regulatory compliance and licensing process through intuitive data collection, tracking, and document automation. Our management team has an extensive track record in building great technology companies. With a rapidly growing client base, we are excited about our future.





The Role:


This role is perfect for you if you are extremely detail oriented, and love predictability and repetitive tasks.




The Data Administrator is a critical role that connects data required to complete regulatory forms, Onecomply’s database, and our OmniFill automation technology. Your daily work will include auditing forms and analyzing datasets to ensure they are correctly pulled from OneComply’s database, and working alongside team members to increase efficiencies along the way. You will work closely with the Application Analysts, the Head of Compliance, and the development team.





What You'll Do:



Audit applications submitted by Application Analyst to ensure accuracy meets client standards

Working through changes required to ensure forms are accurate

Implementing changes in PDF tagging language to increase efficiency in audit processes

Manage seed datasets to meet data testing requirements

Communicate with Application Teams on data deficiencies for remediation






Essential Knowledge /Experience:



Strong attention to detail and ability to work within data, administration, and technical systems

Love for all things analysis - you are a key team member between compliance and tech. so your input is crucial

Exceptionally high level of accuracy - one number off can make a big impact

Comfortable in fast paced environment as we are a growing technology start up






 Benefits and Perks:



Competitive salary

Extended Health Benefits

We encourage a healthy work-life balance and offer flexible schedules, a generous vacation policy

Generous parental leave plan

Ability for hybrid office and work from home schedule






Please apply immediately as we are interviewing asap.

description:
Title: IAM Engineer (SailPoint)
Company: Leading financial organization
Location: Scarborough, Ontario (100% remote until further notice)
Length: Full-time permanent
Salary: Negotiable base salary + 10% bonus + 4 weeks vacation + benefits + extras

The Team:
The objective of the Engineering Team is to develop and integrate IAM solutions for various IAM domains including identity lifecycle management, Directories, authentication & authorization, data access management, and access governance leveraging best practices and adhering to the Bank’s policies and information security standards

The Role:
The SailPoint Development Engineer is responsible for the practical analysis, design, development, implementation and support of mission-critical Identity and Access Management systems of medium to high complexity.

 Is this role right for you?
-You have a portfolio of work in Java that you are proud of and can share with us (GITHUB, etc.)
- You are passionate about programming and enjoy working on your own projects outside of work
- You are not a order taker but like to think through troubleshooting problems, guiding team members, stakeholders and clients, and leading a team of developers
- You enjoy implementing new systems or enhancements by reviewing programs written by team members, establishing, and executing system test procedures, developing an implementation plan, developing the required program and system documentation and ensuring all functionality has been delivered as required.
- You take pride in making recommendations towards developing new code standards or the reuse of existing code.
- You excel in working with a team of Business Analysts, testers and team members to understand business requirements that drive the analysis and design of quality technical solutions.
- You thrive in the total system life cycle and the responsibility of designing, coding, testing, implementing and supporting applications software that is delivered on time and within budget.
- You can provide post-implementation support and training to the computer operations staff on the production processing functionality.
- You can participate in an on-call pager rotation to provide after-hours maintenance support.
- You love initiating proactive communication with internal/external teams.

Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role?
- You have solid experience with SailPoint IIQ
- You have a strong sense of programming languages (Java, JSP/Servlets, Shell scripts, etc.)
- You are familiar with multiple operating systems, such as Linux
- You are confident in your database skills (SQL/NoSQL)
- You have working experience with DevOps CI/CD pipelines and tools
- You have experience with DevOps Delivery and tools such as Jira and Confluence
- You possess advanced communication (verbal/written/presentation).
- You have knowledge of API Gateway (bonus)
- You have a Test Driven Development (TDD) mindset (bonus)
- You have 5+ years of experience developing, deploying and maintaining complex enterprise web applications (asset)

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Role Overview



We are looking for someone to join our McAfee team who is passionate about problem solving of both simple to complex solutions. this person should share our passion for mauling internet access-restriction, digital privacy, and giant digital bear humor.

You will be responsible for managing and expanding data pipelines, writing code in Python, making SQL queries, and working with other teams. This role will offer exposure to optimizing the software that runs on a network of VPN servers distributed in 45+ countries. This position reports directly to the Engineering Manager.

This is a remote position in Canada. We will only consider candidates currently in Canada and are not offering relocation assistance at this time.



About The Role




Write concise, well-tested code in Python, and occasionally in Scala and other languages.

Manage data-pipelines: monitoring and expanding Airflow, fixing pipe errors, managing AWS infrastructure (SQS, Lambda, S3, DynamoDB, Redshift).

Create new and expanding on data pipelines to collect more analytics.

Ensure the privacy and security of our user management services.

Work with our connection’s analytics and censorship circumvention teams to determine data warehousing requirements and specifications.

Work as part of our data team to store and handle immense amounts of user data while respecting the privacy of our users.

Manage our Amazon Redshift database according to analytics needs.

Create and enhance our Periscope dashboards




About You




You are very comfortable working the terminal, with Linux or MacOS.

2+ years’ experience in Python (or similar)

2+ years’ experience working with data engineering technology

You have a strong knowledge of which tools to use and why

Experience with Apache Airflow and Amazon Lambda, DynamoDB, and Redshift.

Demonstrative experience using SQL, and star schemas/dimensional database design.

You take ownership and pride over your projects.

You have strong verbal and written communication skills and can tailor communications base on the audience. (business vs. technical)

Knowledgeable with anti-censorship technologies

Experience creating dashboards for data visualization




Company Overview



McAfee is a leader in personal security for consumers. Focused on protecting people, not just devices, McAfee consumer solutions adapt to users’ needs in an always online world, empowering them to live securely through integrated, intuitive solutions that protects their families and communities with the right security at the right moment.



Company Benefits And Perks



We work hard to embrace diversity and inclusion and encourage everyone at McAfee to bring their authentic selves to work every day. We offer a variety of social programs, flexible work hours and family-friendly benefits to all of our employees.


Pension and Retirement Plans

Medical, Dental and Vision Coverage

Paid Time Off

Paid Parental Leave

Support for Community Involvement


We're serious about our commitment to diversity which is why McAfee prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other legally protected status.

Job Category



Information Technology


Opportunity Awaits at Altus Group!



The opportunity


Reporting to the Engineering Manager we are looking for Software Developers with an R&D background interested in building data products and data solutions. As our new Data Engineer, you will have the chance to apply your technical acumen to advancing technology in the commercial real estate space. You will be part of a collaborative cross-functional group, solving complex data problems around resolution, linkage, and classification.



What’s In It For You




Impact and exposure. 
 Data is the future and our present. You will gain exposure to big data, functional programming, machine learning, and data science helping to advance engineering efforts targeted at problems not yet solved in the industry. This is a newly acquired, innovative and responsive product team undergoing an exciting transformation and alignment with Altus. This is a chance to join an engineering team as they ramp up their work, reach and impact; and a chance to grow with them, working across teams on exciting new solutions, and accessing an incredible amount of global industry data.


Career Development. 
 You want to be part of a global company that is forward-thinking and setting the standards in Real Estate technology. Your career opportunities will increase as we continue to scale as a company and as a team, including the chance to grow your skills, and your exposure on this team or on another product team.



As Our New Data Engineer You Will Focus On




 Building. You will contribute to the development of our knowledge graph. You will write high-quality code, participate actively in code reviews, and consistently help to ship software. 

 The data pipeline. You will contribute to the integration of new data, the improvement of existing data, and the integration of machine learning and data science efforts. You will also be involved in the maintenance, optimization, and operation of the data pipeline. 

 Collaboration. You will work closely with the R&D team to design, build and improve our complex data layer. You will play a critical role on the team and at Altus to meet the current and anticipated needs of our clients. 




Our New Senior Data Engineer Has




 The experience. You have 3+ years in software development, building products. Ideally, you have exposure to data software and solutions. You have strong Computer Science fundamentals and an interest in diving into complex problems. You have experience and are fluent in at least one programming language (Java, Javascript, Python, Scala). Ideally, you are familiar with Apache Spark or another distributed data processing framework. You continuously seek opportunities to expand your technical skills and knowledge, with an ability to quickly learn new tools. 

 The relationship building expertise. You have an appreciation for cross-team collaboration, particularly with our data scientists and API engineers. You can rapidly change priorities under tight deadlines. You have flexible communication and documentation skills. You can translate technical data and development concepts for a nontechnical audience. 



Come realize your potential at Altus Group!


Altus Group is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment where employees feel valued and respected, and where every employee has the opportunity to realize their potential. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations, if required, and will work with you to meet your needs. If you are a person with a disability and require assistance during the application process, please contact us at accessibility@altusgroup.com or 416-641-9500.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Marketing Services, and Internet Publishing
description:
At realtor.com, we process terabytes of data everyday and transform that data into information that powers decisions for millions of home buyers, renters, dreamers, and real estate professionals. We aim to radically simplify home buying/selling and help more people achieve the American dream on our realtor.com website and mobile apps.


What will you do?


We have lots of data, in motion and at rest. Our goal is to use this data to make the home buying experience a breeze for our consumers. We empower them with the most up to date information on properties, and we help match our consumers with the most suitable realtors who are equipped to meet their individual needs.

The Enterprise Data Team works on the coolest data projects and products that reports, predicts and affects the outcome - using data. This impactful role will promote the build-out and usage of the Customer data platform, data-driven decisions and data products for realtor.com, it’s customers and partners. Additionally, this role will be part of the core team contributing to the design and development of realtor.com’s Customer Data platform.



Responsibilities




Design, develop, and operate highly scalable, high-performance and low-cost data pipelines in distributed data processing platforms with AWS/cloud technologies..

Collaborate with Engineers, Analysts and Data Scientists in the organization to construct complex data sources for algorithms and machine learning models

Own and Interface with other technology teams to extract, transform, and load data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and AWS big data technologies.

Creation and support of Batch and real-time data pipelines built on AWS technologies including Glue, Kinesis, EMR, Lambda and Athena.

Develop tools, plug-ins and solutions for CI/CD workflow using tools such as Jenkins, Cloud Formation, Docker, Github and other microservices.

Continual research of the latest big data and visualization technologies to provide new capabilities and increase efficiency.

Drive and participate in architecture discussions, influence product roadmap, and take ownership and responsibility over new projects.

Maintain and support existing platforms and evolve to newer technology stacks and architectures.

Collaborate with the business applications team, product owners, Business stakeholders, Scrum-master to refine and estimate stories/epics.

Be an integral part of the scrum team to deliver on commitments on time and with good quality.

Review and ensure all code documentation is complete and updated periodically. Review work of Junior associates in the team.

Analyze the business Problems and deliver Optimal solutions using AWS Technologies.




Basic Qualifications




BS in Computer Science or equivalent degree; MS in Computer Science preferred.

10+ years of industry experience in software development, data engineering, business intelligence, or related fields with a track record of manipulating, processing, and extracting value from large datasets.

Demonstrated strength in data modeling, data transformation, and data warehousing.

Ability to write complex SQL statements.

Proficiency in programming language - Python.

Experience working with AWS big data technologies (S3, Athena, EMR, Glue, Lambda, Kinesis, API gateway, RDS, DynamoDB, Step Function etc).

Experience in architecting, implementing, and supporting Snowflake infrastructure and topologies.

Experience in Snowpipe for handling Streaming data is a plus.

Experience with software configuration management tools(Git) and CI/CD pipelines and their enabling tools such as Jenkins, Nexus, etc.

Knowledge of software engineering best practices across the development lifecycle, including agile methodologies, coding standards, code reviews, source management, build processes, testing, and operations.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Takes pride in efficient designs and accurate results

Objectively analyzes the pros, cons, and tradeoffs of a design path and helps the team to arrive at the most optimal solution, which may not be their own.

Ability to work with Product and Sales Ops to gather requirements and translate them into data engineering tasks.

Effective team player. Honest and respectful of others.




Additional Preferred Skills




Experience in Web application development

Experience using business intelligence reporting tools (Tableau, Quicksight etc.).

Experience using big data technologies (Hadoop, Hive, Hbase, Spark etc.)

Familiar with agile development and sprints.




About Realtor.com



At realtor.com®, we believe that everyone deserves a home of their own. We’re a community of nearly 2,000 employees who work hard to ensure that from the moment someone starts dreaming about a new home, to the moment they walk in the door and beyond, we’re there to lend a helping hand. Every month, over 85 million people trust us with their journey home by visiting our site and mobile apps, and we’d love to have you join our team to help.

We’ve got great offices in the U.S. and Canada with lots of sweet jobs to choose from, so we’re hoping you’ll join us on our journey to make buying, selling, renting, and living in homes easier and more rewarding for everyone.

Let’s make a difference, together. For Real.

description:
Empowering players to create is an exciting future for the gaming industry. At Electronic Arts we have many examples of players creating content, whether it be a skateboard park in Skate or fantastical mansions in the Sims 4. The future definitely has our players being more empowered to create with their imagination being the only limit.

To allow more players to become creators, we are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to shape the technology that powers creation. If you have experience with building services for user generated content through modern techniques connecting multiple services together we want to hear from you.

You will work with an experienced team that has collectively built and worked on games and backend services for more than two decades. You will work with multiple developers to bring the next game services to life.

We aim to improve in our development approaches and with our services. Many of our software engineers are "polyglots" and strive in multiple environments.



Responsibilities




Work in partnership with game teams to design shared services

Develop and launch high-traffic services for multi-platform AAA titles

Perform service load testing to resolve bottlenecks

Work with the engineering and DevOps teams on best practices

Research and integrate new technologies

Oversee the health, quality, maintainability and style of the server codebase




Qualifications




6+ years of technology industry experience

BS in Computer Science or other relevant experience

Experience with client/server architecture

Knowledge of HTTP and how to design and work with RESTful web services

Expert ability to analyze and interpret technical data

Experience with throughput, latency, memory and CPU use

Development experience with either Kotlin, Java, Go, and Node.js

Experience with source code management (Perforce, Git)

Public Cloud providers (AWS, GCE, Azure)

Understand containers, orchestrators and service mesh technologies (Docker, Kubernetes, Envoy, Istio, Linkerd, and Jaeger)

Understanding of different database and their performance characteristics (SQL and NoSQL)

Experience working with CI/CD technologies

Passion to investigate and adopt new technologies and practices


Bonus Skills


Experience shipping AAA games

Experience working with PlayStation and Xbox online systems

Experience with or exposure to micro-services

Experience with or with cloud native application development

Knowledge of gRPC, Protocol buffers and FlatBuffers

 (http://www.equinox.ca) is hiring a 
Jr. to Intermediate C# .Net Application Developer
 to help contribute to the success of our flagship product, 
CROW 
(Control Room Operations Window). Our multi-platform enterprise solution helps over 1,000 electric utilities and independent system operators all over North America to efficiently and safely schedule and report outages and incidents on the grid. You will be instrumental in ensuring CROW meets the future needs of our current and present customers. This is a full-time position, working remotely, and the primary duties are as follows:





Qualifications and Skills


The core requirements of these positions are as follows:


C# .Net development experience.

MS SQL Server experience is an asset (alternatively, experience with: Oracle, MySQL, PostgreSQL, etc.)

HTML5, SASS, and Typescript.

Angular (alternatively, experience with React)

PrimeNG

XML/XSLT/XSD/WSDL

ORM techniques.

LINQ

New high-end workstations.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Job Summary




DESCRIPTION


Amazon Web Services (AWS) has been leading the world into the cloud computing era since its inception in 2006. The AWS Partner Network (APN) is the vital ecosystem we have created with our tens of thousands of consulting and technology partners, to promote AWS in every industry, every size of company, and every region of the world. APN offerings include validating partner qualifications in distinct areas, lead/opportunity sharing, training and certifications, marketing assistance, funding reimbursement, et al. The AWS Partner Systems team is responsible for external and internal supporting Partner Sales, the APN, and other elements driving the AWS partner ecosystem. We serve three groups of stakeholders: partners who work with us to sell AWS, customers who use AWS, and internal users responsible for driving AWS sales and adoption via partners.

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.

Are you interested in building secured, highly available, performant, and scalable systems, web services, products and integrations between cloud and on-prem applications that support AWS' current and future growth? Are you seeking an environment where you can drive innovation? Do you have a passion for ensuring a positive customer experience? This is the job for you.

AWS Partner Systems is looking for a results-oriented, self-driven individual who can help us create the next generation of distributed, scalable systems that support AWS' current and future business needs. In this role, you will enjoy working in a fast-paced environment, relish working with high volume of data, the challenge of highly complex business contexts that are typically being defined in real-time. You will design and develop services that processes millions of transactions in secured environment.

As Salesforce Developer, you'll be a core member of the team supporting all of our partners. While the Salesforce.com platform will be your strongest focus, you'll be willing and able to learn and support other technologies such as AWS services , as needed. You will build highly secured, scalable, extendable, and performant solutions. Working closely with product and tech teams. You will design, build, test, iterate and deploy new features, system integrations, enhancements to existing features, and provide operational support. You'll play a leading role in code reviews, guiding junior resources towards better designs and clean, standardized coding.

Work/Life Harmony

Our team puts a high value on work-live harmony. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives. Our team is located in the Seattle office but we're flexible when team members need to occasionally work from home. We generally keep core in-office hours from 10am - 5pm. About half of us come in earlier and the other half of us stay later.

Mentorship & Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship.

We care about your career growth. We try to assign projects and tasks based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee- led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

We’re looking for a new teammate who is enthusiastic, empathetic, curious, motivated, reliable, and able to work effectively with a diverse team of peers; someone who will help us amplify the positive & inclusive team culture we’ve been building.




Basic Qualifications




 1+ years of post-internship, hands-on engineering experience on the Force.com platform

 1+ years of experience with Visualforce, Apex and/or SOQL/SOSL

 4-year college degree in computer science or computer engineering; alternate degrees that seem related may be considered; higher amounts of overall work experience may also be considered, in lieu of the 4-year degree




Preferred Qualifications




 Graduate degree in relevant area such as computer science, software engineering or information systems

 Proficiency in related web technologies (HTML/CSS, frameworks, libraries such as jQuery)

 Proficiency in related integration technologies (JSON, XML, REST, SOAP)

 Experience of working on one of the widely used programming languages such as Python or Java

 Force.com certifications - Administrator, Developer, Advanced Developer, Architect

 Experience with Force.com Communities and Lightning

 Prior experience as a dev, web dev, or dev on other technologies

 Knowledge of Agile practices, particularly sprint planning and estimation


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records

If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.
