Job ID: A1971899

TD Description


Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.com
 


Department Overview


TD Insurance is part of TD Bank Group, one of Canada’s largest financial institutions. TD Insurance helps protect clients from the ‘accidents of life’ with a wide range of products including credit protection, life, health, travel, home and auto insurance. With more than three million clients, TD Insurance authorized products and services are available online, over the phone, and through a network of more than 1,000 TD Canada Trust branches.

In Canada, we have two lines of business, General Insurance and Life and Health. Our General Insurance business is one of the top home and auto insurance groups in Canada and the national leader in group insurance and affinity marketing. Our Life and Health business is the number one provider of critical illness insurance and direct life and health insurance in Canada.

At TD Insurance, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment. With a Canada-wide workforce of over 4,000 employees and offices in Atlantic Canada, Quebec, Ontario and Alberta, our company is always growing and can help you to grow. TD Insurance offers a stable and dynamic work environment where talent is appreciated and professional development is taken seriously. More than just a job, we offer rewarding careers.

The TD Insurance Analytics and Modelling team has the mandate to provide business intelligence using advanced analytical techniques such as machine learning and artificial intelligence (AI) models.  This group is responsible for doing in-depth analysis to better understand claim payments, client or advisor behaviours, product design and a lot more.  This group is also responsible to develop, maintain and calibrate all models used within TD Insurance, including but not limited to loss cost models and customer behaviour models.

Within this team, the Advanced Performance Analytics function is dedicated to provide modeling and analytical support to TD Insurance product offering and to our Customer Advice Center (CAC) to increase its operational excellence.
 


Job Description


Key accountabilities of Data Engineer, CAC Analytics:
- Develop, construct, test and maintain the key architectures of Analytics and Modelling database, 
- Identify methods to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality
- Research and deploy sophisticated analytics programs, machine learning and statistical methods
- Gather and analyze information or data on current and future trends of best practices
- Work autonomously and accountable for acting as a lead within a specialized business management function and may provide work direction to others
- Provide seasoned specialized knowledge, advice and/or guidance to various stakeholders and team members
- Undertake and complete a variety of complex projects and initiatives requiring specialist knowledge and/or the integration of cross functional processes within own area of expertise
- Oversee and/or independently perform tasks from end to end
 


Job Requirements

This position requires a combination of dedication and attention to detail, on one hand, and quick learning, creativity, and non-standard thinking; on the other hand. It also requires ability to work as a team, communication, and presentation skills. 

A successful candidate is expected to have:
4+ years of relevant working experience
Sound knowledge in data modelling, architech and data deployment
A university degree in quantitative discipline (Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Science or related field); An advanced degree is an asset
Proficiency in programing such as SQL, Python/R, Scala, Spark etc., in the context of data manipulation, data mining, statistical analysis, and predictive modelling;
Proved to be a quick learner, strong problem-solving skills, ability to independently identify and solve problems in an effective and timely manner;
Strong communication skills (both written and oral), ability to effectively present technical, business, and project management subjects to multiple stakeholders.
Sound knowledge in industry best practices in predictive modelling, including machine learning algorithms (Asset)
Frontend knowledge such as React or Vue (Good to have) 


Inclusiveness


At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve.  If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Our large, Fortune Technology client is ranked as one of the best companies to work with, in the world. The client fosters progressive culture, creativity, and a flexible work environment. They use cutting-edge technologies to keep themselves ahead of the curve. Diversity in all aspects is respected. Integrity, experience, honesty, people, humanity, and passion for excellence are some other adjectives that define this global technology leader.




As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for developing best practices and making architectural decisions to rapidly improve critical data processing & analytics pipelines. You will tackle hard problems to improve the platform’s reliability, resiliency, and scalability. 




We are looking for someone who thrives on autonomy and has experience driving long-term projects to completion. You are detail and quality oriented, and excited about the prospects of having a big impact with data. Our tech stack includes Airflow, Hive, EMR, PySpark, Presto, Jenkins, Snowflake, Datadog and various AWS services. 

 


 Qualifications 



5+ years of relevant industry experience in big data systems, data processing and SQL data warehouses 

At least 3+ years of experience on working with large Hadoop projects and building scalable applications using PySpark by leveraging Spark DataFrame and Spark SQL api. 

At least 2+ years of experience in optimizing Spark applications, spark memory management, and e2e spark process optimization. 

Strong overall programming skills, able to write modular, maintainable code, preferably Python & SQL 

Fundamental knowledge of distributed data processing systems, storage mechanisms, and compression techniques. 

Experience building code-driven infrastructure on public cloud platforms, preferably AWS 

Understanding of SQL, dimensional modeling, and analytical data warehouses, like Snowflake, Redshift 

Knowledge of Data Modeling techniques and high volume ETL/ELT design. 

Familiar with workflow management tools, like Airflow and Oozie 

Experience with CI and code management tools like Git, Jenkins 

Familiar with BI tools, like Power BI, Looker, Qlikview 

Problem solver with excellent written and interpersonal skills; ability to make sound, complex decisions in a fast-paced, technical environment 

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field, or equivalent training, fellowship, or work experience 






Responsibilities 



You will be tasked with modernizing and expanding a critical set of existing systems 

You will need a product-focused mindset. It is essential for you to understand business requirements and architect systems that will scale and extend to accommodate those needs 

Break down complex problems, document technical solutions and sequence work to make fast, iterative improvements 

Build and scale data infrastructure that powers batch and real-time data processing of billions of records 

Develop CI/CD ETL pipelines using Jenkins for deployment and automation testing. 

Take ownership of ETL pipelines, own data quality for your areas, and ensure SLAs are met. 

Interface with data engineers, data scientists, product managers and all data stakeholders to understand their needs and promote best practices 


 


Good to have: 



Any Certification in Spark 

Good Understanding of AWS EMR ecosystem and deploying spark applications on EMR.

Position: Senior Systems Engineer



Area of Expertise: 
IT Cloud Integration and Advisory


Location: 
Based in Ottawa, ON, however, we are open to fully remote workers within Canada.


Start: 
As soon as possible


Salary Range:
 $90,000 to $110,000 + Benefits


Type:
 Full-time


COVID Vaccination:
 Required (subject to duty to accommodate)

 


The Opportunity


Working with IC 360 and its clients is an exciting, challenging and rewarding opportunity. If you want to grow your experience and deploy technology with purpose, this is the place to do it.

 

You will work as a staff consultant with many external clients on deploying the very best modern technology, with an awesome team of peers to help everyone get their best work done. We work hard, have fun and deliver critical solutions to our clients. We only work with clients that value technology and invest in doing things right. It means you get to deploy the very best solutions.

 

At IC 360, we see the way technology is changing and we are adapting to it. Work with us and you will be able to adapt your skillset to focus less on infrastructure as it continues to be simplified, and more on the strategic use of apps, data, automation and analytics.

 

The ever-changing world of technology is going through a dramatic shift and we want forward-looking members on our team along for the ride.

 

The ideal applicant should possess the abilities listed below:


Strong communications in English, both written and verbal

Excellent interpersonal skills

Innovative problem-solving

Analytical mindset

Desire to work as a consultant with various clients and projects

Desire to continuously learn and develop


 


The Role


As a Senior Systems Engineer, you will take a lead role in designing, configuring and deploying solutions using the latest technology available, such as the Microsoft Cloud solutions to solve business challenges and ensure continuity of projects. You will also collaborate with clients, advising them on using information technology to achieve their company goals or solve challenges.

 

Work on technology will go beyond infrastructure, and as the transition to the cloud stabilizes, we will increasingly focus on the strategic use of applications, automation, data management and reporting to deliver value from modern technology.

 


Responsibilities


The Employee is to generally provide consulting and other services in the areas of cloud technology architecture and implementation. Specifically, the Employee will:


Deliver assigned project work and support customer IT environments under IC 360 service agreements

Provide project leadership in the integration and consolidation of enterprise technology solutions and platforms

Assist in the configuration of IT Cloud technologies, specifically but not limited to Microsoft Office 365, Azure and AWS

Configure the underlying technologies required to enable cloud services such as: o Networking – Switching, Routing, Firewalls

Virtual infrastructure – VM Configuration and Storage Access and Control

Windows and Linux Servers

Develop technology standards within IC 360 to allow for the efficient implementation of technical platforms for clients

Provide clients with advice on technical architecture and assist in planning client technology solutions

Lead the development and implementation of application security management plans for applications accessed by the client and external personnel

Provide direction and guidance to project teams and suppliers who are designing, developing, enhancing and maintaining business-critical information systems and data warehouse projects

Provide direction, advice, and recommendations on specific aspects of the application enabling server and software infrastructure configurations and operational improvements

Provide advice and recommendations concerning financial aspects of asset and cost management

Provide technical advice in the process of selecting systems or applications hardware and software solutions

Write documentation for applications and platforms

Conduct research on technology solutions and new technologies when required

Work with third parties in support of client technology deployments

Assist in the development and writing of business cases and assessment reports through the provision of technical content

Assist in the preparation and presentation of tactical and strategic plans for the development and integration of technology systems

Conduct troubleshooting and analysis of technical systems to determine the root cause of outages and systems issues

Respond to front-line and escalated tickets from Managed Services clients

Act as a Technical Account Manager with large Managed Services clients where 3rd party contractors are providing front-line helpdesk services

Perform such other duties as may be required


 


Requirements



A post-secondary degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related discipline 

Have a working knowledge of IT Infrastructure including networking, storage, servers, and industry-standard applications.

Expert in deploying and configuring Microsoft 365 and Azure

Expert in debugging hardware, software, and network problems

Practical knowledge of several operating systems and databases

Customer-focused approach


 


About Us


IC 360 Solutions is a company built to integrate the best technology on the market to small and medium-sized Canadian organizations. We work with many clients on various types of business technology challenges. Companies work with us because we bring a team of experts to focus on optimizing their use of technology to best solve business problems. Our focus is entirely on providing real results with technology.





COVID-19 Policy


Subject to human rights legislation, IC 360 requires the successful candidate to be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment and as a part of its legal obligation under the Occupational Health and Safety Act. Proof of vaccination will be required at a later date along with reasonable proof of the existence of a protected ground under human rights legislation, if applicable.




IC 360 Solutions is working remotely until the pandemic is over.

To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.



 Job Category 
Sales
 Job Details 




Role Description



Also known as a " Pre -Sales Engineer" or "Sales Consultant," the Solution Engineer is responsible for presenting product offerings and architecture in the best light to prospects and customers, to evoke confidence in company’s technology infrastructure, and to remove all technical objections in the sales cycle. To accomplish this, the Solution Engineer must have a strong desire to leverage their technical and/or sales skills, including the ability to solicit business requirements, develop a technical sales strategy, configure and effectively demonstrate the solutions that address these requirements and provide business value. Our Core Solution Engineers work across different product offerings (Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, etc...) to help our clients find the best Solutions for their business.



Your Impact




Understand the customer's needs, and establish Salesforce's product as the best solution that solves the customer's challenges

Build and present customized demos of Salesforce products

Convey deep understanding of the customer's technology as it pertains to Salesforce's solutions

Participate in all appropriate product, sales, and procedural trainings and certifications to acquire and maintain the knowledge necessary to be effective in the position

Attain quarterly and annual objectives assigned by management

Respond effectively to RFPs

Ability to travel based on territory alignment and region




Minimum Qualifications




Bachelor's Degree Required

Ability to work as part of a team to solve technical problems in varied political environments

Solid oral, written, presentation, collaboration and interpersonal communication skills




Preferred Qualifications




Salesforce Certifications

Previous experience as a solution/sales engineer for a technology company or related experience

Knowledge of related applications, relational database and web technology

Basic programming experience in HTML and other web based technologies




About Salesforce



Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. The company was founded on three disruptive ideas-a new technology model in cloud computing, a pay-as-you-go business model and a new integrated corporate philanthropy model. These founding principles have taken our company to great heights, including being named one of Forbes World's Most Innovative Company five years in a row and one of Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For eight years in a row. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, and this level of growth equals incredible opportunities to grow a career at Salesforce. Together, with our whole Ohana (Hawaiian for "family") made up of our employees, customers, partners and communities, we are working to improve the state of the world.

job_title: Data Pipeline Engineer (Java/Golang/C#) (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
description:
About Agoda


Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.


About Agoda


Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enabling our customers to experience the world.


Get to Know Our Team 


The Data department oversees all of Agoda’s data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company’s culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward.


The Opportunity 


As data engineer, you will work on distributed systems spanning multiple data centers, thousands of servers and hundreds of billions of messages a day. Ensuring data quality, data integrity and data accuracy is a core part of our identity. Design for new scalable system which data is increasing day by day, including auditing and monitoring systems. You will be eager to solve problems that come from managing and making sense of large amounts of data. Some of the things you’ll get to work on include schema registry, real-time data-ingestion, cross data center replication, enrichment, storage and analytics of the data flow.

We are a small passionate team and we are looking for exceptional individuals to be a part of designing, building, deploying (and probably debugging) our Data Pipeline.


In This Role, You’ll Get to 




You will build, administer and scale data pipelines that process hundreds of billions of messages a day spanning over multiple data centers

You will develop and expand upon existing frameworks that is used by Teams throughout Agoda to produce messages to the data pipeline

You will build and manage data ingestion into multiple systems (Hadoop, ElasticSearch, other Distributed Systems)

You will build tools that monitor high data accuracy SLAs for the data pipeline

You will explore available new technologies that improve upon our quality of data, processes and data flow

You will develop quality software through design review, code reviews and test driven development




What You’ll Need To Succeed




Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science / Information Systems / Computer Engineering or related field

2 plus years of industry experience, preferred at a tech company

An experienced Java Developer

Good knowledge of data architecture principles

Have operational experience debugging production issues

An experienced coder, who can stand your ground with experience building systems with purpose that are flexible, well-tested, maintainable and scale

You’re detail oriented considering every outcome of a particular decision

You can communicate in technical English with fluidity, both verbal and written

Ability to work under pressure




It’s Great If You Have 




More than one programming language (Golang, Java, Scala, Python, C#, etc.)

Good understanding of how Kafka works

Kafka Administrator Experience

Understands Concepts relating to Schema Registry and Schema Evolution

Experience working with Serialization Formats either with ProtocolBuffers, Avro or Thrift

Experience with data ingestion from Kafka into Hadoop, ElasticSearch, other Distributed Systems

Strong systems administration skills in Linux

Worked on or contributed to Open Source Project 




Equal Opportunity Employer 


Agoda prides ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.

TD Description



Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.com



Department Overview



TD Insurance is part of TD Bank Group, one of Canada’s largest financial institutions. TD Insurance helps protect clients from the ‘accidents of life’ with a wide range of products including credit protection, life, health, travel, home and auto insurance. With more than three million clients, TD Insurance authorized products and services are available online, over the phone, and through a network of more than 1,000 TD Canada Trust branches.

In Canada, we have two lines of business, General Insurance and Life and Health. Our General Insurance business is one of the top home and auto insurance groups in Canada and the national leader in group insurance and affinity marketing. Our Life and Health business is the number one provider of critical illness insurance and direct life and health insurance in Canada.

At TD Insurance, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment. With a Canada-wide workforce of over 4,000 employees and offices in Atlantic Canada, Quebec, Ontario and Alberta, our company is always growing and can help you to grow. TD Insurance offers a stable and dynamic work environment where talent is appreciated and professional development is taken seriously. More than just a job, we offer rewarding careers.

The TD Insurance Analytics and Modelling team has the mandate to provide business intelligence using advanced analytical techniques such as machine learning and artificial intelligence (AI) models. This group is responsible for doing in-depth analysis to better understand claim payments, client or advisor behaviours, product design and a lot more. This group is also responsible to develop, maintain and calibrate all models used within TD Insurance, including but not limited to loss cost models and customer behaviour models.

Within this team, the Advanced Performance Analytics function is dedicated to provide modeling and analytical support to TD Insurance product offering and to our Customer Advice Center (CAC) to increase its operational excellence.



Job Description



Key accountabilities of Data Engineer, CAC Analytics:


 Develop, construct, test and maintain the key architectures of Analytics and Modelling database,

 Identify methods to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality

 Research and deploy sophisticated analytics programs, machine learning and statistical methods

 Gather and analyze information or data on current and future trends of best practices

 Work autonomously and accountable for acting as a lead within a specialized business management function and may provide work direction to others

 Provide seasoned specialized knowledge, advice and/or guidance to various stakeholders and team members

 Undertake and complete a variety of complex projects and initiatives requiring specialist knowledge and/or the integration of cross functional processes within own area of expertise

 Oversee and/or independently perform tasks from end to end




Job Requirements



This position requires a combination of dedication and attention to detail, on one hand, and quick learning, creativity, and non-standard thinking; on the other hand. It also requires ability to work as a team, communication, and presentation skills.



A Successful Candidate Is Expected To Have



4+ years of relevant working experience

Sound knowledge in data modelling, architech and data deployment

A university degree in quantitative discipline (Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Science or related field); An advanced degree is an asset

Proficiency in programing such as SQL, Python/R, Scala, Spark etc., in the context of data manipulation, data mining, statistical analysis, and predictive modelling;

Proved to be a quick learner, strong problem-solving skills, ability to independently identify and solve problems in an effective and timely manner;

Strong communication skills (both written and oral), ability to effectively present technical, business, and project management subjects to multiple stakeholders.

Sound knowledge in industry best practices in predictive modelling, including machine learning algorithms (Asset)

Frontend knowledge such as React or Vue (Good to have)


Inclusiveness


At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.

job_title: Senior Cloud Engineer, Scotia Digital (Vancouver Hub)
description:
Requisition ID: 145028

At Scotiabank Digital Factory, the reach and opportunity of a global organization meets the passion and drive of a startup. Reinvention starts here—and it starts with you.

We believe that the pathway to success is paved with user feedback, so we’re constantly asking our customers how they want to bank. When we find an opportunity to make things people will love, we assemble teams of specialists to collaborate in Digital Factories in Canada, Chile, Mexico, Peru, and Colombia. We work fast, and we work smart. Join us to create meaningful experiences and build the bank of tomorrow for our customers around the world.

If you’d like to learn more about our Digital Banking career opportunities, explore our Communities of Practice, or hear from our leaders, check out our Technology at Scotia career page.

Scotiabank has embarked on the journey to modernize both development practices and tools. One of the main areas of transformation is the public cloud and the various platform technologies that support both development and operations on the cloud. The aim is to provide a streamlined process and framework which will allow the development teams to focus on building business logic. We are looking to build our development team with influencer, makers, creators, and industry leaders who will drive us forward.


The Role


The role of the Senior Cloud Engineer operates within the Cloud Platform Engineering team. This valuable member of the team will be responsible for creating platform components and services for the broad enterprise use.


Is this role right for you? 



Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems, and knowledge.

Key accountabilities include design, development and maintenance of cloud platforms, services, and components to enable safe enterprise-wide use of public cloud offerings

Technical ownership/leadership of a component of a larger product.

Designing, implementing, and refactoring code (typically Go, Python).

Ensuring software, programs and applications are developed and/or configured to meet high availability, integrity and reliability, security, and compliance requirements.

Working with other engineers and architects on breaking-down, scoping and estimating tasks.

Working with application teams for successful onboarding onto the Platform

Participating in planning and retrospective sessions, attending stand-ups, etc.

Be able to build and operate the highly available and scalable software and infrastructure.




What You Will Bring To Succeed




At least 3+ years of hands-on technical working experience with Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) and Google Cloud Platform (GCP)

At least 3+ years of hands-on technical working experience with development languages (Go, Python)

At least 3+ years of hands-on technical working experience with container-based virtualization technologies (Docker)

At least 3+ years of hands-on technical working experience in the use of CI/CD Tools 

At least 3+ years of hands-on technical working experience with config management tools and Scripting Languages (Ansible, Bash, Groovy)

Superior oral and written communication skills

Expertise and understanding of Cloud Native Platforms, particularly Kubernetes, and associated technologies (e.g., Istio, Envoy, Anthos, Kustomize).

Experience working with monitoring tools such as Dynatrace, Prometheus, Grafana, etc.

Knowledge of software design patterns, and/or security considerations 

Focus on scalable, enterprise-level software system design (both on code and infrastructure levels)


Location(s): Canada : British Columbia : Vancouver

Our Exciting Opportunity: 


We are now looking for a Developer to maintain products (units, nodes, networks, systems and solutions). Your role will include all development activities such as: requirement analysis, system design, architecture design, hardware design, software design, integration, verification, simulations, tools design, Product Lifecycle Management support and product documentation. Our focus is on Lean and Agile ways of working. We organize in cross functional development teams in which continuous improvement, innovation and knowledge sharing is part of the daily work.


You will: 


Drive strategic technical leadership

Perform continuous analysis and requirement handling.

Develop and test high quality products

Perform trouble shooting and customer support

Drive continuous improvements of products and processes

Develop competence in technical domain


To be successful in the role you must have:


Education: (Recruiter to supply educational requirements)

Min years of experience: (Recruiter to supply)

Domain experience: (Recruiter to supply area of expertise – e.g.: Cloud, BSS, OSS etc.)

Product development knowledge and Product Lifecycle Management knowledge

Business understanding

Working with people and networking

Innovating, adapting and responding to change

Delivering results and meeting customer expectations

Planning and Organizing


Additional Requirements: 
(Recruiter to supply or delete category)


What´s in it for you? 


Here at Ericsson, our culture is built on over a century of courageous decisions. With us, you will no longer be dreaming of what the future holds – you will be redefining it. You won’t develop for the status quo but will build what replaces it. Joining us is a way to move your career in any direction you want; with hundreds of career opportunities in locations all over the world, in a place where co-creation and collaboration are embedded into the walls. You will find yourself in a speak-up environment where empathy and humanness serve as cornerstones for how we work, and where work-life balance is a priority. Welcome to an inclusive, global company where your opportunity to make an impact is endless.


What happens once you apply? 


To prepare yourself for next steps, please explore here: https://www.ericsson.com/en/careers/job-opportunities/hiring-process


COVID STATEMENT


The health, safety and well-being of our employees is our priority. Successful applicants will be required to disclose their vaccination status prior to employment. Except for those positions designated as 100% remote, successful applicants who did not provide the required proof of vaccination will be required to test weekly and wear masks at all Ericsson and customer facilities. This includes employees with medical or religious exemptions with testing as an accommodation.  Compliance with government and customer requirements regarding vaccination may preclude unvaccinated applicants from employment for a particular job.

Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we nurture it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team.

Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, learn more. If you need assistance or to request an accommodation due to a disability, please contact Ericsson at hr.direct.mana@ericsson.com.

Le Renard
 est une petite entreprise de service-conseil spécialisée en développement logiciel. Nous sommes experts dans l'optimisation de logiciels de gestion d’entreprise, la personnalisation d'ERP et la transformation numérique pour des entreprises québécoises dans le secteur industriel, manufacturier et de la construction.




Nous sommes présentement à la recherche d’un 

développeur
 
pour se joindre à notre équipe de programmation.





En rejoignant l’équipe de Le Renard, vous serez responsable de:



Développer et programmer des évolutions sur les logiciels de nos clients (Applications client/serveur, applications web, applications mobiles) selon les user stories et tickets élaborés par le Product Owner;

Développer de nouveaux logiciels et modules à partir de zéro

Créer de rapports et de formulaires provenant de différentes bases de données.

Analyser et élaborer la conception technique du code et des structures de données;

Contribuer aux estimations de temps des « user stories »;

Préparer la planification technique et conceptuelle avant de commencer la programmation;

Concevoir, programmer, exécuter les scénarios de test

Participer au UX et UI au besoin;

Fournir un support fonctionnel aux clients au besoin;

Maintenir à jour la traçabilité/documentation des tâches effectuées et du temps attribué pour chacun des projets en cours;

Participer au partage de connaissance et à l’amélioration continue de l’équipe;






Pourquoi postuler chez Le Renard?



Projets variés et stimulants au sein de plusieurs entreprises québécoises.

Possibilité de télé-travail à 100% (possibilité de travailler au bureau selon votre préférence)

Horaire de travail flexible et équilibre travail-vie personnelle

Banque de congés de maladies transformable en vacances si non-utilisé durant l’année

Semaine de travail flexible entre 35 et 40 heures

Temps consacré à la formation et au développement des connaissance mensuellement

Activités d'équipe trimestrielles

Assurances collectives « à la carte » avec contribution de l’employeur (possibilité d’y ajouter les assurances dentaires selon vos besoins)

Programme d’aide aux employés (Ligne 24/7 à des questions légales, financières, psychologiques)

Programme de reconnaissance de l’ancienneté

Programme de référencement






Ce que nous recherchons:



Baccalauréat en informatique/programmation logiciel/TI ou combinaison DEC + années d’expérience jugée pertinente au poste;

2 ans d’expérience en développement logiciel;

Expérience en C# (Framework .Net et .Net Core) et/ou Java

Expérience en SQL

Intérêt en expérience usager et UI

Un « Fit » avec nos valeurs d’entreprises :

Quelqu’un qui sait s’adapter

Quelqu’un qui est professionnel

Quelqu’un qui vise toujours plus haut

Quelqu’un qui croit que tout le monde est important

Quelqu’un d’audacieux et créatif





*Veuillez prendre note que le masculin est utilisé pour alléger le texte et ce sans préjudice pour la forme féminine. Bienvenue à tous!




Pour en apprendre plus sur l'entreprise visitez notre site web : renardsolutions.ca

RÉSUMÉ DU POSTE

Nous sommes présentement à la recherche d’une personne technique ayant un intérêt pour le développement de site web transactionnel. Sous la responsabilité du Directeur commerce électronique, le Développeur Front End sera appelé à travailler en étroite collaboration avec l’équipe de UI/UX et l’équipe de développeurs Back End. Vous aurez un impact significatif sur l’évolution du site web.




REJOINDRE NOTRE CLIENT C’EST :





Être alimenté par une multitude de beaux projets

Faire partie d’une entreprise québécoise en pleine transformation et en pleine croissance

Avoir un horaire flexible

Possibilité de télétravail (2 jours en télétravail et 3 jours au bureau)

Avoir des assurances collectives

Avoir 4 jours de congés personnels par année en plus de vos jours de vacances

Avoir 1 jour de congé lors de votre anniversaire (oui, tu as bien lu!)

Travailler avec des supers collègues passionnés dans leur expertise où collaboration et travail d’équipe règnent





PRINCIPALES RESPONSABILITÉS





Responsable du développement du site web ainsi que du suivi de la feuille de route

technologique

Collaborer avec les développeurs Back End pour la mise en place des différentes solutions technologiques

Tester et optimiser les sites web, le code et les ressources pour une vitesse et une évolutivité maximale sur plusieurs appareils et navigateurs

Examiner activement les performances du site web/de l'application

Effectuer toutes autres tâches connexes





EXIGENCES ET COMPÉTENCES RECHERCHÉES





Diplôme collégial ou universitaire en informatique

5 ans d’expérience dans le développement Front End

Expertise dans HTML5 et CSS/Saas

Maîtrise de JavaScript ES6 et OOP

Expérience dans React et Vue.js

Expérience dans les solutions e-commerce

Expérience au niveau de l’accessibilité web et du SEO

Expérience avec différents APIs (GMaps, YouTube, etc.)

Expérience avec Dynamics 365 (un atout).

Expérience avec Wordpress et Microsoft Commerce (un atout).





Poste temps plein, permanent

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Computer Games
description:
We are looking for a talented, self-motivated Data Engineer with broad technical skills to dive deep into large amounts of data and the desire to influence key decisions with data-driven analysis and insights. The position collaborates closely with the Marketing & Commercial Analytics team to implement data strategies for marketing, develop complex ETL pipelines and support dashboards that promote deeper understanding of our games.

The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in developing and establishing scalable, efficient, automated processes for large scale data analyses and possess excellent problem solving ability dealing with huge volumes of game data. The position will also stay apprised of latest trends and research on all aspects of data engineering and analytics. You will work with leaders from the Marketing, Commercial and Studios organization by providing them with data to understand campaign and commercial performance across multiple channels and territories.



Responsibilities




 As a Data Engineer you will be involved in the entire development life cycle from brainstorming ideas to implementing elegant solutions to derive data insights 

 You will gather requirements, model and design solutions to support reporting analytics and exploratory analysis 

 You will design, build, and launch efficient, scalable and reliable data pipelines to move and transform data 

 You will work with analysts, understand requirements, develop technical specifications for ETLs, including documentation 

 You will be responsible to support production code to produce comprehensive and accurate data artifacts. 

 You will oversee the process of adoption of new technologies and applications we use to collect, integrate, analyze, and deliver relevant analytical solutions. 

 You will guide communications between our users and studio engineers to provide scalable end-to-end solutions. 

 You will promote strategies to improve our data modeling, quality and architecture 

 You will work with big data solutions, data modeling, understand the ETL pipelines and dashboard tools. 

 You will be engaged in every step of the development life cycle, from collecting requirements, communicating to users, design, development and testing the products. 

 Explore data and suggest new opportunities to measure and assess the performance of our marketing and commercial actions 




Qualifications




 4+ years relevant industry experience in data engineering role who has Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field. 

 Proficiency in writing SQL queries and knowledge of cloud-based databases like Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery or other big data solutions. 

 Experience in data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing. 

 Experience with at least one of the programming languages like Python or Java 

 Experience with business intelligence tools like Power BI, Looker, Tableau or similar BI tools. 

 Experience working with unstructured datasets 

 Experience in the physical and logical design of database architecture for relational databases, data warehouses and data lakes. 

 Knowledge of latest data pipeline tools such as Airflow. 

 Developing APIs and integrating with 3rd party APIs 

 Summarize technical details to non-technical audience 

 Comfortable working with a multi-functional team, both locally and remote, understanding the perspectives of each partner. 

 Experience working in an agile development environment and familiar with Process Management tools such as JIRA, Target process, Trello or similar

About AppDirect



Become a digital, global citizen and enable the new generation of digital entrepreneurs around the world. AppDirect offers a subscription commerce platform to sell any product, through any channel, on any device - as a service. We power millions of subscriptions worldwide for organizations. We do this by our values-driven culture - one that enables you to Be Seen, Be Yourself, and Do Your Best Work.



About You



We are looking to hire a skilled and ambitious Kafka Tech Lead in the Data & Analytics team. We love entrepreneurial spirit and someone that has a “Data
 as a Product”
 mindset. Are you highly technical, with a strong drive to learn? Do you strive to connect data to business outcomes? Then this might be the opportunity for you!


What You’ll Do and How You’ll Make an Impact



Lead operating Kafka platform in our infrastructure 

Coach and drive teams adopting Kafka and Avro schema best practices

Modernize our Kafka platform to enable streaming data for business, engineers and customers

Help guide teams to migrate services from RabbitMQ to Kafka platform

Work with Engineering and Architecture teams to develop new organizational standards

Accelerate efficiency by enabling internal stakeholders with self-served data solutions

Research solutions to complex problems and drive proof-of-concepts

Author and maintain knowledge base through high-quality documentation

Deliver quality solutions/process through CICD and automation




What You’ll Need




Experience in building Kafka stream processing architectures

Experience in CI/CD, Kubernetes, DevOps principles, Docker and containerization, frameworks, and tools

Expertise in Kafka topics, brokers, KSQL, KStream and Kafka Control Center.

Hand-on experience working on Avro schema using Schema Registry and Kafka Connect.

Experience with developing in modern programming language (e.g., Scala, Java, SQL, Python)

Exposure to some of the following technologies: Apache Spark, Flink, AWS, Azure, Docker, Kubernetes, CDC

Experience automating, producing and consuming data in real time from event driven microservices using streaming platforms like Kafka

Proven experience building data pipelines and data solutions aligned to Business Architecture, operational and analytics use cases.

Good knowledge and understanding of data structures and experience handling large data sets

Comfortable in code reviewing other engineers' code and driving/reviewing technical designs..

Ability to self-manage, think critically, handle multiple tasks and/or projects and deliver solutions autonomously

Ability to clearly communicate complex ideas to a technical audience


At AppDirect/AppSmart, we believe that innovation thrives in an environment that houses diversity of excellence, experience and thought. Strong communication skills to technical, functional, and development team

Canadian Federal Government Security Clearance – Enhanced Reliability Status or higher

Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise




Experience/understanding of Payroll systems including process and data flows and dependencies

Experience/understanding of PeopleSoft ERP

Experience/understanding of federal public sector client, culture and business practices

Strong communication and presentation skills to technical, functional and Dev team

Discipline, diligence, and follow-up on multiple on-going activities and priorities

Experience/understanding of databases (DB2 or Oracle) and PeopleSoft

Experience in planning of complex activities, then collaborating and leading execution

Ability to work rapidly under pressure to gather information, provide a solution, and co-ordinate teams / guide the solution to completion

Experience/understanding of federal / Provincial public sector client, culture and business practices



Must have the ability to work in Canada without sponsorship.

IBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants that design, build, and run foundational systems and services that is the backbone of the world's economy. IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter businesses by reimagining and reinventing through technology, with its outcome-focused methodologies, industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence.

job_title: Data Pipeline Engineer (Java/Golang/C#) (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
description:
About Agoda


Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.


About Agoda


Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enabling our customers to experience the world.


Get to Know Our Team 


The Data department oversees all of Agoda’s data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company’s culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward.


The Opportunity 


As data engineer, you will work on distributed systems spanning multiple data centers, thousands of servers and hundreds of billions of messages a day. Ensuring data quality, data integrity and data accuracy is a core part of our identity. Design for new scalable system which data is increasing day by day, including auditing and monitoring systems. You will be eager to solve problems that come from managing and making sense of large amounts of data. Some of the things you’ll get to work on include schema registry, real-time data-ingestion, cross data center replication, enrichment, storage and analytics of the data flow.

We are a small passionate team and we are looking for exceptional individuals to be a part of designing, building, deploying (and probably debugging) our Data Pipeline.


In This Role, You’ll Get to 




You will build, administer and scale data pipelines that process hundreds of billions of messages a day spanning over multiple data centers

You will develop and expand upon existing frameworks that is used by Teams throughout Agoda to produce messages to the data pipeline

You will build and manage data ingestion into multiple systems (Hadoop, ElasticSearch, other Distributed Systems)

You will build tools that monitor high data accuracy SLAs for the data pipeline

You will explore available new technologies that improve upon our quality of data, processes and data flow

You will develop quality software through design review, code reviews and test driven development




What You’ll Need To Succeed




Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science / Information Systems / Computer Engineering or related field

2 plus years of industry experience, preferred at a tech company

An experienced Java Developer

Good knowledge of data architecture principles

Have operational experience debugging production issues

An experienced coder, who can stand your ground with experience building systems with purpose that are flexible, well-tested, maintainable and scale

You’re detail oriented considering every outcome of a particular decision

You can communicate in technical English with fluidity, both verbal and written

Ability to work under pressure




It’s Great If You Have 




More than one programming language (Golang, Java, Scala, Python, C#, etc.)

Good understanding of how Kafka works

Kafka Administrator Experience

Understands Concepts relating to Schema Registry and Schema Evolution

Experience working with Serialization Formats either with ProtocolBuffers, Avro or Thrift

Experience with data ingestion from Kafka into Hadoop, ElasticSearch, other Distributed Systems

Strong systems administration skills in Linux

Worked on or contributed to Open Source Project 




Equal Opportunity Employer

We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.

We are in the process of democratizing capital by developing a cryptocurrency based Universal Basic Income, and open marketplace, in an attempt to create a stable borderless economy without out capital gatekeepers.




Currently Sovereign Prime is a volunteer organization that offers equity based compensation. The program will give interns the opportunity to work on a meaningful project.




Eligibility

Equity!

job_title: VMware Cloud Disaster Recovery: Member of Technical Staff Engineer, Filesystem Team - Opportunity for Working Remotely
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
The Elevator Pitch: Why will you enjoy this new opportunity?


Do you see yourself at VMware doing innovative and impactful work that will shift you into the next steps of your career? Then come join the VCDR Team at VMware. VMware's Cloud-based Disaster Recovery (VCDR) offers an easy-to-use SaaS solution to provide DR capability for vSphere-based Software Defined Data Centers (SDDC). VCDR is architected to work well with other VMware Cloud solutions, such as VMware Cloud on AWS, Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud Platform.

VCDR is an exciting new area of investment of VMware, and we are looking to grow our already exceptional product and team. As a part of this team, you'll have the opportunity to work with other world class innovators and deliver a highly scalable, enterprise class, easy-to-use Data Protection Solution as a SaaS offering across multiple cloud providers. You'll take ownership of meaningful, big-picture projects and springboard an impactful career. We have a very collaborative culture, and you'll interact with industry thought leaders at one of our world-class campuses and enjoy participating in networking, community service, and career development events.

The Scale-out Cloud File System (SCFS) team within VCDR is responsible for building a scalable, distributed file system in the cloud for our disaster recovery SaaS offering. SCFS enables the efficient storage of backups of the protected virtual machines in cloud storage and allows virtual machines to be recovered very quickly without a time-consuming data rehydration process.
Success in the Role: What are the performance goals over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing? 


You will be a major contributor to development of our distributed Scale-out Cloud File system and build features in C/Python at a rapid pace without compromising product quality. In this role you will also be defining performance workloads, debug the bottlenecks and work on performance optimizations in the file system with proficiency in synchronisation and multithreading aspects. You will be collaborating with and building relationships across engineering teams and driving the growth of the team.
What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis? 


As part of SCFS development team, you will enjoy solving complex problems, drive performance charter and help build the cloud file system.



You will be responsible for the design, development, testing, delivery, and support of the Scale-out Cloud File System for VMware Cloud Disaster Recovery. 

You will engage with various teams within VMware to collect requirements for new features, and design and develop them. 

You will work closely with the VMware Cloud team to integrate new features and capabilities. 

You will participate in design and code reviews across the team. 

You will participate in performance analysis and optimizations.




What is the leadership like for this role? What is the structure and culture of the team like?


The VMware Cloud Disaster Recovery(VCDR) organization that you will join is a critical component of VMware multi-cloud strategy and part of Cloud Infrastructure Business Group(CIBG). You will join one of the teams with brightest minds in the industry, and our engineering global team is spread throughout VMware offices in various cities of USA and India. You will report to a File system leadership and work closely with the rest of the organization. The team culture is one based on building trust, on-going development through coaching, and giving back to the community through service learning. We trust each other to get the job done right and operate in a fast pace mode.

Engineering and Technology

Manager and Professional

 2022-03-07

We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. VMware will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. VMware encourages applicants of all ages. Vmware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.

Help us boldly shape retail in Canada

Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class Owned Brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast. We are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Canadian Tire and its group of companies.

The Data Science, Applied AI & Data Products/ Operations team at Canadian Tire Corporation designs, develops, and automates customer-facing data products and services. These products and services enable and power customer-focused analytical solutions that add business value. The diverse and dynamic team consists of data scientists, engineers, developers, and analysts united by a common goal to enhance customer and brand experience across the corporation. The team utilizes the latest data technologies and advanced analytical techniques to build best in class product and services.
To help define where and how we work, CTC has introduced Hybrid Workplace Personas. While each role fits into a different persona category, this may evolve as employees progress in their career or business needs change. The Data Engineer position is categorized as a Connector, which means that the incumbent will be working with a variety of colleagues and partners to achieve business outcomes that require a mixed use of virtual and CTC campus presence.
Reporting to the Data Engineering Manager, the Junior Data Engineer will play a key role in the continued build-out of automated data pipelines. An ideal candidate works with an ‘automate first’ mindset and continuously strives to work more efficiently. You are collaborative, analytically savvy, strategically astute, and capable of delivering in a fast paced and innovative market.
The Junior Data Engineer will be exposed to a variety of tasks, covering a range of responsibilities across a full analytical project lifecycle. This may include but is not limited to the following: business requirements assessment, solution design (R&D), solution development, ETL pipeline development and documentation, production operations, and post model deployment assessment.
What you’ll do
- Develop and optimize existing and new data products
- Design and implement data pipelines to monitor, validate model assumptions and performance adhering to best-in-class coding standards
- Develop and optimize existing and new data pipelines to standardize and automate
- Approach problems with an entrepreneurial mindset
- Work on ad-hoc projects that leverage multiple internal / external sources of data such as sales, inventory, cost, digital analytics, loyalty, driving patterns, etc.
- Work with IT and business stakeholders to influence decision making with data / data products

What you bring
- Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience: degrees in disciplines such as Engineering, Science, Mathematics/Statistics, Computer Science are preferred.
- More than 1 year of experience (including internship) in data domain or experience working with large datasets agnostic of any industry
- Strong knowledge of SQL to perform complex data analysis is necessary, additional experience with Python / Spark or other languages to transform and process data
- Excellent knowledge / experience in building machine learning and mathematical models
- Working knowledge/experience in data technologies and analytical platforms / tools (Big Data Foundation/Hadoop, Azure, GCP, Big Query, Power BI, Data Studio, Airflow, Snowflake, etc.)
- Experience with data intelligence/visualization platforms such as Looker, Google Data Studio, Tableau or other similar tools is a plus
- Strong business acumen, including modelling and strategic business case development experience
- Have a grasp of statistics, one or multiple programming languages, understanding of databases and solid foundation of relevant technical skills
- Experience in translating business requirements into technical specifications
- Ability to communicate with people at all levels of the organization in a professional and competent manner


About Canadian Tire Corporation

As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies. To learn more follow us on LinkedIn.

CTC is committed to the fight against COVID-19 and being there for Canadians. In support of this, we have adopted a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy to protect the health and well-being of our employees. Employees will be required either to be fully vaccinated or undergo regular COVID-19 testing in order to access the workplace until further notice.
