Position Title: 
Enterprise Architect


 


Our very reputable Insurance Client based in Winnipeg Manitoba is looking for an Enterprise Architect to join their team for a full-time role. The ideal candidate must be willing to live or relocate to Manitoba. 


 


This role will be helping to lead an enterprise-wide Cloud (Azzure) migration journey from it's initial phases to delivery. 


 




SUMMARY OF RESPONSIBILITIES AND SCOPE 




 



Reporting to the Director, Enterprise Architecture, the Enterprise Architect is an advisor to the business, supporting business strategy and planning with a focus on the three-five-year roadmap. This role will be leading an enterprise-wide Cloud Migration journey. 



 



The Enterprise Architect is responsible for establishing the technology strategy and roadmap that enables a portfolio to support current and future business capabilities. This is achieved by working with business owners and Lean Portfolio Management to manage the enterprise portfolio, business epics and technology enablers, linking how change opportunities bring the corporation closer to the five-year ambition.



 



The Enterprise Architect:



· Makes decisions that have a major impact on the Corporation’s ability to attain its strategic directions while maintaining a rationalized portfolio that achieves synergy across the enterprise.



· 
Provides direction to individual work units on what are acceptable tactical objectives and plans how to move from tactical to the strategic architectural objectives.


· 
Works closely with leaders of the corporation to modernize and optimize lines of business and address and respond to market disruptors.


· 
Is responsible for monitoring and adopting technology innovations into the corporation’s technical footprint.

 

The Enterprise Architect needs to keep abreast of technology developments that affect systems, particularly those that are strategic in terms of corporate goals and direction. The position needs to understand how peer companies and agencies are leveraging new technologies, so that the Corporation can be positioned to be a “fast follower”.

 


 NATURE
 
AND
 
SCOPE



 



Enterprise Architecture 70%



· Collaborates with Lean Portfolio Management to provide a high-level vision of enterprise solutions and development initiatives.



· 
Reviews, develops, and implements architecture policies and principles.


· 
Builds and maintains a high-level enterprise model of systems, capabilities, and underlying technologies, current and future, that can be the basis for business and IT architecture direction that guides portfolio management.


· 
Assists the Agile Program Management Office (APMO) and Lean-Agile Centre of Excellence (LACE) to identify and design development value streams.


· 
Supports the value streams with adherence to the budget guardrails for retiring solutions (horizon 0).


· 
Participates in the strategy for building and maintaining the architectural runway via Enabler Epics.


· 
Understands and communicates Strategic Themes, and other business drivers for architecture, to System and Solution Architects and non-technical stakeholders.


· 
Drives architectural initiatives via enabler epics in the Portfolio Kanban system and participates in their analysis where applicable.


· 
Influences modelling, design, and coding practices.


· 
Promotes Continuous Delivery Pipeline and DevOps capabilities.


· 
Collects, generates, and analyzes innovative ideas and technologies to use across the business.


· 
Facilitates the reuse of code, components, and proven patterns.


· 
Ensures the implementation of each capability is designed for reuse and is only built once across the enterprise, where possible.


· 
Synchronizes the following disciplines across Solutions whenever applicable:


· 
System and data security and quality


· 
Production infrastructure


· 
Solution user experience (Lean UX)


· 
Non-functional Requirements (NFRs)


· 
Advises senior leaders, business, solution, system and data architects in accomplishing the overall objectives of the Enterprise Architecture.


· 
Communicates vision and leads technical staff in creating components of the Enterprise Architecture.

 


Research and Strategy 15%



· Supports the selection and use of technology, including identifying and monitoring new technologies that may offer opportunities in the future, researching and prototyping through a proof of concept engagement with business partners, understanding the applicability and scope, and assessing the maturity of innovative new technologies.



· 
Works closely with the Business, Solution and System Architects to ensure that individual program and product strategies align with business and technical objectives and satisfy business vision i.e. emerging solutions to local problems are consistent with the overall enterprise strategy.


· 
Develops and maintains plans for infrastructure, working with System Architects to assess the health of the technology, set principles, set in place epic enablers to address health issues and establish roadmaps.


· 
Works closely with the Business, Solution and System Architects to provide oversight to change initiatives, enabling channels of communication for coordination of work between solution and development value streams.


· 
Responsible for building the technical foundation needed to support business epics into the architectural runway delivering enablers just in time to support emerging business capabilities ensuring a continuous delivery pipeline is maintained and does not inhibit delivery velocity.

 


Architecture Matrix Leadership 15%



· Provides leadership to architects (system, data, business, security) on a matrix basis. Provides mentorship, feedback, and direction on approach and work solutions.



· 
Participates in the selection process, as required, and provides input on performance of matrix reporting resources.


· 
Participates in planning and budgeting for special projects and improvement initiatives.


Supports the implementation of new policies and procedures and corporate strategic initiatives 

Identifies training and development needs, ensuring technical expertise of the unit is maintained.

Participates on committees, cross-functional teams, and in meetings and other ad-hoc working groups established to address customer-service issues and initiatives at strategic and operational levels.



 




QUALIFICATIONS




1. Education:



· Degree in Computer Science or related discipline.



· SAFe Architect Certification or commitment to complete within 12 months.



 



2. Experience:



· Seven years of experience in information technology covering a wide range of technologies and disciplines, including:



· 
Five as an architect


· 
Three as a lead architect


· 
Experience of business transformation using lean/six sigma principles is an asset.

 


Technical Knowledge and Skills:



Working knowledge of application development using a variety of technologies including client/server and relational database technology.

Working knowledge of technology deployment using a variety of technologies including networking and platforms.


· Experience in large-scale, enterprise-wide, end-to-end Cloud migration 


· 
Advanced analytical skills, with the ability to problem solve and recommend solutions to enhance operations to improve service delivery.


· 
Advanced oral and written communication skills, with the ability to clearly convey complex information in a concise and straightforward manner, including formal presentations for management and technical staff.


· 
Interpersonal skills with ability to build relationships with business partners.


· 
Working knowledge of project management techniques.


· 
Ability to work in an environment that requires multiple on-going activities, which have tight deadlines and a degree of risk.


· 
Ability to work effectively in a team environment and provide leadership and influence the performance of others.


· 
Ability to solve problems and find creative solutions that meet business needs while maintaining the best interests of the corporation.


· 
Intermediate knowledge of applicable software (Microsoft Office, Project, Visio, SQL, and data analysis / management toolsets, Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook applications).


· 
Working knowledge of insurance corporate systems is an asset.

About the role


The mission of the Success team is to make our customers and partners successful while improving our Enterprise-grade conversational platform. Our product is highly technical and, as a result, so is our Success team. Our customer base is growing quickly and we’re looking for ambitious developers to kickstart their careers by becoming product specialists. You will have the opportunity to work with and support many new, leading-edge technologies that solve real customer challenges.





Responsibilities



Working with Global 2000 companies to implement the Botpress solutions for their unique environments

Be the platform expert, knowing all the ins and outs of Botpress, and guide customers to build great conversational AI experiences

Diving deeply into complex technical puzzles and working collaboratively to understand and resolve customer issues

Be the champion of our customers by providing real-time feedback to internal teams about product performance and customer needs

Be a driver of innovation within the success team, the company and with our customers, by looking for better ways to do the work we do, improve the tools we use and how we raise the bar on the service we deliver to our Global 2000 customers

Contribute to product documentation, customer knowledge base, and best practices guides






Requirements



1+ years of professional software development experience

Excellent troubleshooting skills and a passionate problem solver

Strong written and verbal communication skills in English 

Experienced with: Javascript, PostgreSQL, Docker

A deep interest in Conversational AI, voice- and chat-based user experiences

Well-organized, excellent work ethic, pays attention to detail, and self-starting

Ability to thrive in a fast-paced startup and passionate about improving technical abilities

Upbeat, passionate, and unparalleled customer focus






Benefits & Culture



You will join a team of ambitious individuals passionate about speed of execution, data-driven decisions, and, obviously, chatbots.

You will contribute to the growth of one of the most popular AI chatbot dev tool in the world.

Top-tier health benefits and access to telemedicine for you and your family.

Flexibility to work remotely

3 weeks vacation per year + 2 weeks off for Christmas and New Year.

You get a laptop and top software to perform your best work.

Competitive compensation, because that matters as well.






About Botpress


Botpress is a VC-backed, fast-growing Canadian startup building open developer tools to understand text and automate complex conversations. We believe that the future of human-computer interactions will be in big part conversational, which will allow businesses to deliver services and software to customers with unparalleled customer experience and personalization. Botpress is the standard, reliable stack developers will use to build mind-blowing conversational applications.





Why join Botpress


Apart from joining an awesome team of talented, fast-moving and cutting edge developers, you’ll be working with/on:


A popular open-source project built for developers

A modern stack used by hundreds of thousands of developers

A product used by startups, schools, nonprofits and Fortune 500 companies

A backend runtime built for performance and deployment simplicity

A frontend application that devs like just as much as VS Code

A machine learning pipeline that evolves every single week

A data-science problem that has not been solved yet

A cloud infrastructure that can serve billions of API calls

A developer community with thousands of members

A company crazy enough to compete directly with Google and Microsoft

A workplace that is distributed and remote-first

A group of like-minded investors and advisors that has funded, built and scaled similar companies such as Elastic, Mongo, Snyk, Influx, Algolia, Twilio and Databricks.






Additional info



Seniority level: Entry level

Employment type: Full-time

Job function: Customer Service, Information Technology, Engineering

Industries: Computer Software, Information Technology and Services









Recruitment Process




 
Short screening with HR

Online screening test

Take at-home test (troubleshooting) 

Technical Interview (With the Head of Customer Success, Nadine, and a Success Engineer, David)

Final Interview (Nadine & a Success Engineer, Sebastien)

With nearly 1,900 employees in more than 25 countries, EXFO is no. 1 worldwide in fiber optic test solutions and has the largest active assurance deployment. Our broad portfolio of intelligent hardware and software solutions enable our customer’s network transformations related to fiber, 5G, virtualization and big data analytics. As part of a multi-disciplinary development team embracing the DevSecOps culture, you will contribute to the direction of our cloud solution in terms of architecture, infrastructure and technology landscape.

Technical Skills

Knowledge of one of the dominant Cloud platforms

Knowledge of mobile application development

Good knowledge of design patterns

Mastery of CI/CD and X-as-Code concepts and practices

Knowledge of BDD, TDD, (DDD an asset)

Knowledge of SOLID principles


 

Required skills


Systems approach

Excellent communication skills

Requirements

Relevant experience: 5 years of experience in mobile applications development

Language requirement: French, English


 

Education: Bachelor's degree in computer or software engineering

Any combination of relevant education/experience will be considered.

 

What we offer:


Flexible working hours 

Multi-site & Multidisciplinary teams 

Dynamic and collaborative work environment 

Modern Workspace 

AGILE work methodology 

Variety of social and sports activities 

Social Community Involvement 

Free parking 

Terminals for electric cars 

Easy access to public transport 

Bike path nearby 

Onsite Cafeteria Services 

Competitive vacation policy and holiday time off 

Annual Bonus Program 

RRSP Program and Group Insurance 


 

 


EXFO is an equal opportunity employer.

description:
Job Description




Job Responsibilities



Strengthen and optimize our development environment and workflows by improving automation, code quality and processes while reducing overall build times

Create, maintain, improve, and evolve our Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery processes for new and existing services to reduce manual/repetitive tasks

Architect robust technical design solutions with a focus on quality, scalability, real-time processing, and availability

Work collaboratively with several development teams throughout the company and around the globe to help deliver end-to-end products and features that support our latest Automated Driving and Active Safety programs/features

Ensure continuous operation of delivered services and framework by quickly fixing issues and preventing future failures

Travel as required




Additional Job Description




Required Skills and Experience



3+ years of professional experience in software integration, CI/CD and/or DevOps with experience in tooling, infrastructure solutions and automated testing

Experience working within both Windows and Linux platforms

Experience with virtualization and container-based solutions (ie., Docker, Kubernetes)

Prior software development experience, preferably in C/C++ with exposure to bash, python and windows batch

Experience with CMake build configurations

Experience with GNU gcc (and derived compiler toolchain)

Strong knowledge of Jenkins, pipelines and use of GIT-based review management tools

Experience providing guidance, leadership, and mentoring to team members

Ability to independently investigate issues based on limited information, demonstrating high level of analytical ability to resolve complex problems

Creative, disciplined, strong sense of responsibility, delivery, and schedule commitment

Strong leadership and interpersonal communication skills




Preferred Skills And Experience




Strong understanding of major automotive vehicle systems such as Advanced Driver-Assistance (ADAS), Motion Control, Automotive Network, and Powertrain

Experience with Automotive Communication Protocols (Ethernet/CAN/LIN)

Experience with SAFe methodologies

Experience in working with distributed teams situated globally

Experience with the QNX OS and build toolchain QCC

Experience with Adaptive AUTOSAR service-based vehicle platform

Experience with Unit Test tools e.g. (CppUTest, Google Test etc) and respective Jenkins plugins



About GM



Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.


Why Join Us


We aspire to be the most inclusive company in the world. We believe we all must make a choice every day - individually and collectively - to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Our Work Appropriately philosophy supports our foundation of inclusion and provides employees the flexibility to work where they can have the greatest impact on achieving our goals, dependent on role needs. Every day, we want every employee, no matter their background, ethnicity, preferences, or location, to feel they belong to one General Motors team.


Diversity Information


General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteeropportunities.

We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.


Equal Employment Opportunity Statement


Accommodation is available for applicants with disabilities. Should you be contacted by General Motors of Canada, please advise if you require accommodation. General Motors of Canada values diversity and is an equal opportunity employer.

description:
ENTERPRISE OFFENSIVE SECURITY ENGINEER



EA Security


The EA Security team protects EA by reducing our exposure to security risks by raising awareness and providing a measured, proportionate set of security and risk management controls, services and solutions.

EA is looking for a security engineer to join EA's offensive security program (a.k.a. Red Team). You will help us identify threat vectors before they can be exploited in our systems, services, cloud infrastructure or applications. We're a Red Team that can find the worst of the worst, knows what's most likely to be attractive to attackers, and we're driven to make things better.

You will report to the Enterprise Red Team Director to help build an offensive security-driven application security program that scales enterprise-wide with a focus on automation and best-practices.



What You'll Do




Find and exploit security vulnerabilities for defensive purposes to help identify risks and drive mitigations

Build automation to scale penetration testing and to test threat detection and response capabilities

Develop, pilot and operate flexible and creative security testing automation (incl. tooling for CI/CD)

Collaborate with engineers across EA to identify automation gaps and rapid prototyping of new ideas

Support classic red team assessments, adversarial emulation campaigns and penetration tests of EA's systems to discover and document high risk vulnerabilities

Support incident response activities when necessary

Influence leadership to prioritize and execute remediation plans




What You'll Need




4+ years' experience in penetration testing and/or red team operations

4+ years programming experience in at least one of the following: Golang, Python, Java, C#, C/C++..

Working knowledge of DevSecOps and CI/CD pipelines and related tooling (Gitlab, Github, Jenkins,…)

Application Analysis (fuzzing, static analysis, app scanning)

Familiarity with reviewing source code for security vulnerabilities and related tooling (Code QL, semgrep,…)

Advanced knowledge in application security, network security, authentication protocols

Proficiency in one or more operating systems: Linux, Windows, Mac OS

Experience with tooling such as Metasploit, Burp, ZAP, Sliver, Cobalt Strike,…

Web and Database Penetration Testing

Nous sommes à la recherche d’un 
développeur full-stack
 qui participera grandement à effectuer le support et la maintenance pour les projets existants (mise à jour, optimisations, ajouts de fonctionnalités) et la construction de projets web. Le candidat idéal possède un minimum de 2 ans d'expérience en développement web. Ce que nous apprécions particulièrement est la capacité de trouver des solutions uniques, la débrouillardise et l’autonomie.




Akufen opère en mode 100% télétravail 





Responsabilités



Programmation de projets web dynamiques

Assurer l'optimisation et la performance du code

Faire des mises à jour, la maintenance et effectuer le support pour les projets existants

Effectuer les déploiements (mises en ligne) et assurer la maintenance des serveurs

Participer aux analyses et aux estimations

Collaborer quotidiennement avec les autres développeurs ainsi que les équipes conseil






Compétences



Expertises en HTML5 / CSS / Javascript / Ajax

Bonne connaissance de CMS open source (Wordpress, Craft - un atout)

Connaissance d’API/Outil (exemple : Google Maps, YouTube, Mailchimp, etc.)

PHP (5.6 & 7.x) / SQL

Mongo DB (atout)

Bonnes notions de MVC / Programmation orientée objet (ou autre design pattern similaire)

Bonne connaissance de SASS/LESS

Connaissance des outils de développement (Webpack, NPM, Yarn - un atout)

Bonne expérience avec des outils de gestions des sources (Git ou équivalent)

Bonne expérience avec le système d'exploitation GNU / Linux






Profil recherché



Team player

Autonomie / Débrouillardise / Proactivité

Capacité à travailler sur plusieurs projets simultanément

Avoir une expérience de minimum 2 ans en agence ou dans un poste similaire






Akufen c'est...



Des projets guidés par la qualité, l’innovation et la performance

Une passion pour les marques, la culture et le numérique

Une approche collaborative et engagée

Une ambiance vivante animée par une équipe accueillante et motivée... même en remote





Nous communiquerons uniquement avec les candidat(e)s retenu(e)s en entrevue.

Description:* o Develop high-level system requirements, based upon the end user needs and/or stated requirements. o Analyse and decompose systems-level requirements and allocate requirements and design margin across sub-system elements. o Advocate for design to cost, design for test, and design for manufacture approaches throughout the organization for effective productization of commercial space systems. o Develop and ensure proper documentation of technical and interface requirements. o Develop and ensure proper documentation of high-level system and subsystem design. o Develop verification and test plans. o Understand and assess design issues, determine appropriate resolutions, and work with the team to address. o Troubleshoot system behaviour anomalies, determine root cause, and the appropriate technical resolution. o Review, analyse and interpret telemetry from deployed system with context and understanding of the system development life cycle.

Skills:* systems engineering, test plan, electronics, requirements analysis, requirement writing, DOORS, safety critical, mission critical, matlab, simulink, V&V

Top Skills Details:* systems engineering,test plan,electronics,requirements analysis,requirement writing

Additional Skills & Qualifications:* 1) 4+ years in a systems engineering role - systems engineering, project engineering are required &/or manufacturing engineering experience prior to being a full-time systems engineer - gone through a large scale product development where the product was in development for a minimum of 1-2 years 2) 4+ years of experience with a project that involved electronics, mechatronics, software, etc. 3) Minimum 4+ years experience in creating, writing & reading requirements for complex systems (from multidisciplinary project) - translating from a customer spec into an engineering requirement. Then go into lower tier sub system requirements where they define what the product must do based on the concept of operations 4) Minimum 2+ years as a lead on a project or subsystem (work package) so that they are able to take ownership and thrive. NICE TO HAVES:

Familiarity with mission-critical software, Matlab/Simulink, and computer-aided design tools would also be a benefit.

Excellent verbal, written communication skills are essential to this position.

Degree in Aerospace, Mechanical, Electrical, Computer Systems Engineering, Applied Mathematics, or equivalent experience

Or someone who has proven experience working as a Systems Engineer without Masters Degree

Need to have a passion for space

Experience Level:* Expert Level ***DISCLAIMER: Candidates will be required to relocate to the Greater Toronto Area***

About AppDirect



Become a digital, global citizen and enable the new generation of digital entrepreneurs around the world. AppDirect offers a subscription commerce platform to sell any product, through any channel, on any device - as a service. We power millions of subscriptions worldwide for organizations. We do this by our values-driven culture - one that enables you to Be Seen, Be Yourself, and Do Your Best Work.



About You



We are looking to hire a skilled and ambitious Data Engineering Tech Lead in the Data & Analytics team. We love entrepreneurial spirit and someone that has a “Data
 as a Product”
 mindset. Are you highly technical, with a strong drive to learn? Do you strive to connect data to business outcomes? Then this might be the opportunity for you!


What You’ll Do and How You’ll Make an Impact



Lead efforts enabling the team and our Cloud Data Pipelines to scale

Coach members of the team about industry-leading tools and techniques

Modernize our Cloud Data Pipeline strategy to enable the business, engineers and customers

Collaborate with our reporting team to build insightful dashboards

Work with Engineering and Architecture teams to develop new organizational standards

Migrate current batch ETL to new streaming data pipelines

Improve efficiency by enabling internal stakeholders with self-served data solutions

Research solutions to complex problems and drive proof-of-concepts

Author and maintain knowledge base through high-quality documentation

Deliver quality solutions/process through CICD and automation




What You’ll Need




Experience with developing in modern programming language (e.g., Scala, Java, SQL, Python.

Exposure to some of the following technologies: Apache Spark & Flink, AWS & Azure, Docker & Kubernetes, CDC

Understanding of Data Schemas (e.g. SQL, JSON, Avro, Protobuf)

Experience automating, producing and consuming data in real time from event driven microservices using streaming platforms like Kafka

Proven experience building data pipelines and data solutions aligned to Business Architecture, operational and analytics use cases.

Good knowledge and understanding of data structures and experience handling large data sets


At AppDirect/AppSmart, we believe that innovation thrives in an environment that houses diversity of excellence, experience and thought. We respect each AppDirector as their own fingerprint; unique with no one alike. We foster an environment of inclusion without regard to race, religion, age, sexual orientation, or gender identity enabling AppDirectors to embrace their uniqueness to do their best work. As such, we strongly encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities, and/or people with intersectional identities.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.



 Job Category 
Sales
 Job Details 


Were looking for an experienced Backend Software Engineer to join our fast-growing Demo Engineering organization.

Demo Engineering is a product development team that empowers our company to articulate Slacks vision and product value to our largest prospects, customers, and conference attendees. We build internal tools that enable various teams at Slack to create transformative product demos, quickly and easily. Simply put, we make the experience of creating Slack demos simpler, more pleasant, and more productive.

We build our products using reliable tools that our team knows and trusts, including Java, PHP/Hack, and MySQL. Expertise in these areas is a huge plus, but having familiarity with other common web languages (such as Python or Ruby) and other relational databases are fine substitutes.

Slack has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture. We look for people who are curious, inventive, and work to be a little better every single day. In our work together we aim to be smart, humble, hardworking and, above all, collaborative. If this sounds like a good fit for you, why not say hello?



What You Will Be Doing




You'll brainstorm with the Manager of Demo Engineering and fellow Demo Engineers to conceptualize and build new features for our growing internal user base

You'll increase sales success by improving demo quality and our ability to innovate

You'll actively own team features or systems and define their long-term health

You'll collaborate with fellow Demo Engineers to spec, write, test, and deploy code

You'll review code, have your code reviewed, and assist in triaging bugs

You'll work cross-functionally to solve challenges and ensure that upcoming Slack features are demo-ready

You'll improve our standards, tooling, and processes




What You Should Have



If you don't meet 100% of these requirements, don't worry. Your desire to learn and your ability to work in a diverse, collaborative environment is just as important to us.


Experience building web applications professionally for 2+ years

Experience with functional or imperative programming languages -- e.g. Java, PHP, Python, Ruby, Go, or C

You can lead technical architecture discussions and help drive technical decisions within your team

Experience writing understandable, testable code with an eye towards maintainability

You possess strong computer science fundamentals: data structures, algorithms, programming languages, distributed systems, and information retrieval

A love for building new products and problem-solving

You are a strong communicator; explaining complex technical concepts to others is no problem for you

Self-­awareness, a collaborative approach, and empathy

You have a bachelors degree or related field, equivalent training, fellowship, or work experience




Bonus Points If You Have




Knowledge of Slack APIs

Experience with MySQL

Experience with RabbitMQ

Experience with AWS product suite (EC2, Elastic Beanstalk, S3, Route 53)

Prior DevOps experience



 Accommodations 


If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .

 .

Salesforce welcomes all.

The overall experience of 8+ Years.

Strong experience in Pyspark, SQL.

Strong experience in Python.

QA background, good experience in testing, and willingness to do hands-on work.

Knowledge of SAS is advantageous.

Strong Communication skills & Stakeholder management skills.

Background in Finance / Risk domain is advantageous / preferred.

industries: Wholesale Building Materials, Software Development, and Strategic Management Services
description:
As a 
Full Stack Engineer
, you will be working for a family-owned Canada-based company recognised as one of North America’s most sophisticated metal recyclers, specialising in scrap metal by-products recovery and recycling. This client has evolved into a successful and multifaceted company with a global footprint.




Salary Range:
 $90,000 - 110,000 CAD/year


Permanent Full-time


REMOTE 
or
 HYBRID






As an Full Stack Engineer
 
you will:


Demonstrate great skill in creativity and innovation, ability to thrive in a high-pressure environment, and possess excellent communication skills. Ultimately, a top-notch senior developer should have extensive experience in software development, be able to keep up to date with deadlines, and have strong analytical skills.




You will be responsible for the following duties:


Working with system design specifications, develops detailed specifications for software programming

Working knowledge of object-oriented design and development skills

Successful track record of developing quality software products and shipping production ready software

Good understanding of Web Services protocols such as 
REST
 and 
API
 design for extensibility and portability

Experience with 
Scrum/Agile
 development methodologies

Automate tasks through appropriate tools and scripting

Collaborate on various activities related to projects within the framework of 
Agile
 and 
DevOps
 cultures

Review code and architecture to ensure compliance with company development standards and industry best practices

Involved in the maintenance and enhancement of existing operational application systems

Mentor and coach developer team members, and helps them to understand broader objectives






What we are looking for someone with:



5+ years of experience as a developer


Extensive knowledge
 of 
software development
 and its technologies


Strong knowledge
 of
 JavaScript, REST API, Angular, Python, .net and SQL.


Knowledge of
 C#


Experience with either 
Maximo, Open ERP, Odoo ERP, D365, SalesForce
, or similar including integration experience


D365 integration experience is an asset


Strong knowledge of user interfaces

Experience in leadership or mentoring junior candidates


Strong knowledge of HTML and web frameworks







What is in it for you:


Opportunity to join a dynamic company in their mission to reshape the manufacturing space and provide quality solutions for their diverse clients. Opportunity to work 
remote or hybrid
.

Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.




Working Arrangement


Hybrid



Job Description




The Opportunity


Responsible for design and implementation of global cloud network architectures.

This job description does not represent a comprehensive listing of job duties that are required of the employee performing this role. We reserve the right to change duties or assign additional duties at any time with or without notice.


People Leader Role:
 No



What We Offer



The opportunity to work at a large-scale global organization with a heavy focus on enterprise cloud technologies, automation, and acceleration of growth.



Must Have



Cloud network engineering hands on experience as a consumer of major cloud providers such as Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services or Google Cloud Platform.

Deep technical understanding of Microsoft Azure core cloud networking fundamentals and network security.

Advanced understanding and experience in large-scale global network infrastructures, topologies, load balancers, routing, and protocols.



Highly Desired



Infrastructure as code experience with tools such as Terraform, GitHub, Bash, Python, Perl, PowerShell, others.

Automation of network configuration.

Experience in establishing connectivity with business-to-business cloud and software as a service providers.

Experience in working with global network and internet service providers and co-located datacenter facilities, firewalls, WAN, MPLS, Express Routes.



Individual Accountabilities




Design, implementation, and support of global cloud network infrastructure based predominantly on Microsoft Azure.

Takes part in global projects, representing the cloud network engineering team.

Review and contribute to code for cloud network automation.

Selects, upgrades, and integrates new technologies; maintains existing technologies.

Leads and participates in the development of processes and documentation for new areas of work or knowledge.

Reviews and optimizes utilization and bandwidth across multiple geographically dispersed global networks and takes proactive action to address capacity, underutilization, and constraints.

Works with peer teams and business units on cloud platforms using SaaS, PaaS, and IaaS use cases.

Provides technical expertise in cloud network architecture to assist in business & technology initiatives.

Works with peer network engineering and operations teams globally to review services, design, and configurations. Contributes to maintain service levels and avoid disruptions.

Leads complex troubleshooting when required to resolve critical or escalated technical issues of impacted cloud infrastructure.

Actively engages in platform automation and orchestration from technical and process perspectives.

Participates in risk and security audits. Contributes to remediation efforts.

Proactively formulates and manages processes, defining how a reporting solution can use the platform, identify risks and issues.

Supports teams with uninterrupted service as they transition from legacy ways of working to adopt new best practices, frameworks, and technologies.




Job Requirements



Experience designing, implementing, and maintaining global cloud platforms.

Familiarity with agile and DevOps principles, test-driven development, continuous integration, and other approaches to accelerate the delivery of new features and software defined networks.

Attends advanced training sessions and is certified on multiple domains of expertise.

Constantly learns from both success and failure.

Mentors associate engineers and seeks coaching from experts.

Demonstrates all core skills, and good interpersonal skills for the role.

Good working and background knowledge of area of practice.

Participates in functional demos in new technologies and features.

Understands the corporate climate & culture.

Strong knowledge of the business.

Experiments with emerging technologies to help accelerate growth and optimize cloud platforms.

BA/BS degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience.

Good organizational and problem-solving abilities that enable you to manage through creative abrasion.

Good verbal and written communication; able to effectively articulate technical vision, possibilities, and outcomes.



Decision Authorities



Able to achieve most tasks using own judgement.

Can lead smaller groups where required.

Good analytical skills, copes with complex situations through deliberate analysis and planning.



Every career at Manulife/John Hancock provides the opportunity to learn new skills and move your career forward. Ready to make an impact somewhere? What are you waiting for? Apply today.





About John Hancock And Manulife



John Hancock is a unit of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States, and Manulife globally, including Canada, Asia and Europe. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.1 trillion) as of June 30, 2021. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as MFC on the TSX, NYSE, and PSE, and under 945 on the SEHK. Manulife can be found at manulife.com .

One of the largest life insurers in the United States, John Hancock supports more than 10 million Americans with a broad range of financial products, including life insurance , annuities , investments , 401(k) plans , and education savings plans . Additional information about John Hancock may be found at johnhancock.com .

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
At Kinaxis, who we are is grounded in our common belief that people matter. Each one of us plays an important part in accomplishing our work, building our culture and making a global impact.

Every day, we’re empowered to work together to help our customers make fast, confident planning decisions. This is how we create a better planet – for each other, for our customers and for generations to come. Our cloud-based platform RapidResponse ensures that the products we need – everything from medicine and cars, to day-to-day items like toothpaste – make it to market and into our hands when we need them with minimal ecological footprint.

We make the world better, and you can too.


Software Test Developer, Algorithms




About The Team



The Business Algorithms team at Kinaxis creates customized solutions to optimize supply chains. Ever wonder how the hundreds of parts in your new smart phone come together from different suppliers all over the world? Kinaxis solves problems like that every day.

Our customers have terabytes of data that needs to be analyzed for the largest supply chains imaginable. Our algorithms move the global economy-- in seconds, not hours, or days.

It’s Big Data with an impact; Data Science on the front lines.

The Algorithms team works in a dynamic environment where real life supply chain challenges are being translated into complex algorithms that are coded, tested and released to world-wide known manufactures. Developers and Test engineers are working together to achieve high quality supply chain solutions, develop Next Generation frameworks to address testing complexity, and interact with Product Managers and customers on a daily basis.

We believe in the DevOps culture – we serve our own tools, frameworks, infrastructure. Automation is certainly at the top of our priority list.


Who you are



You thrive on delivering a quality product to customers and care deeply about testing best practices and efficient test strategies.

You enjoy complex logic/algorithms, working with Big Data.

You are driven by customer success, love to participate in customer-facing projects.

You prefer a fast-paced agile work environment and take pride in finding product defects.

You approach testing with creative ideas and innovative techniques.

You collaborate with Software Developers and Product Managers, and your passion is to identify and solve product gaps.

You’re a strong believer in Continuous Integration, and the DevOps mindset

You communicate fluidly, at the level of your audience, and seek to understand and be understood.

You like working in teams, mentoring, and sharing neat things you come across.



What you will do 




Technical




Design, develop, and support automated tests and corresponding infrastructure enhancements

Analyze, scope, review, and estimate test development activities

Develop test strategies and plans




Customer Facing




Learn Supply Chain business challenges and contribute to testing relevant Use Cases / Business Processes.

Participate in requirements elaboration and review product specifications.

Translate requirements into Test Strategies and Test Cases

Interact with Rapid Response customers directly and indirectly through Product Managers.




Process Oriented




Improve processes and efficiency of the team, always look for opportunities to strengthen the team.

Share your knowledge and mentor less experienced team members.




Team Player




Be part of the amazing, collaborative, and supportive Business Algorithms Team that is practicing true Agile where testers and developers share the same objectives.



What we are looking for 




Required




4+ years of experience in software test development and automation functions.

A degree in engineering and/or applied science.

Strong programming and scripting languages experience (Python, C#, .Net). 

Exceptionally strong analytical skills and experience working with complex data

Proficiency in requirements elaboration and test plans creation.

Ability to search for and structure information regarding complex processes / functionality.

The ability to ‘think outside of the box’ is crucial in this fast-paced environment 

Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills

Adaptable and flexible to changing priorities

Self-starter with strong initiative and results orientation




Definite Assets




Exposure to manufacturing/fulfillment/BI/Workforce Management/financial business requirements/practices. 

Knowledge of C++/Java

Familiarity with Jenkins CI/CD and release pipelines.

Knowledge and experience in relational database design and usage.

Experience working in agile development environment.



What we have to offer



Challenging Work - We love solving highly complex problems. And as the global leaders in our industry, we never stop innovating—our work is never “done. That’s because across our teams and in all roles, every employee is empowered to bring their best ideas forward and to jump in and solve the problems they’re passionate about.

Great People - We take our work seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously! It’s in our DNA to celebrate, laugh, and have fun. We are stronger, together, when we are open, honest, and above all, real. Every person is valued here and plays an important role in our shared success.

Global Impact - As a global team spanning continents, boundaries, and cultures, every day we are inspired by the impact our work has on our colleagues, our customers, our communities, and the world at large.

 Diversity, Equity and Inclusion - Diversity, equity and inclusion are more than words to us. They are the guiding principles for building a culture where we celebrate each others’ differences, continuously strive for equality and recognize that inclusion makes us stronger as individuals, a company and a global citizen. 


For more information, visit the Kinaxis web site at www.kinaxis.com or the company’s blog at http://blog.kinaxis.com/ .

Kinaxis strongly encourages diverse candidates to apply to our welcoming community. We strive to make our website and application process accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact Human Resources at accommodations@kinaxis.com . This contact information is for accessibility requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.

Address



VIRTUAL(R)59 - HomeRes - ON - BMO



Job Family Group



Technology

Understands that the success of a developer is to understand the core business processes of the business unit and business requirements as well as the architecture patterns and technology strategy (e.g., Transformation, SmartCore, DevOps). Conceive and write detailed software implementations/code while ensuring that their code/configurations adhere to the security, logging, error handling, and performance standards and non-functional requirements. Writes, configures, and integrates code to create the software that aligns with architecture patterns and technology strategy. Understands the implications of various components (including technology strategy & architecture) to the overall design of a program, system, or eco-system. Evaluates new technologies for fit with the program/system/eco-system and the associated upstream and downstream impacts on process, data, risk (e.g., security). Works toward the objective of defect free software. Ensures that systems functionally meet requirements, align with architecture and promote the development of common assets. Supports the resolution of production issues and problems. Makes recommendations to improve BMO processes & systems.



Become an expert on BMO’s Lending business plans and organization and work closely with other technology teams and our business partners to deliver changes that fulfil requirements and follow long term strategy.

Assesses impact of design decisions to the computer solution/product/service being developed (i.e. performance, schedule, budget, downstream component/system impact, quality, etc.) and recommends alternate/creative solutions for mitigation/optimization if required.

Recommends and implements solutions based on analysis of issues and implications for the business.

Identifies emerging issues and trends to inform decision-making.

Leads and implements initiatives as required to deliver business objectives.

Conducts independent analysis and assessment to resolve strategic issues.

Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders and ensures alignment.

Monitors and tracks performance, and addresses any issues.

Leads/conducts detailed code-reviews and provides feedback in a constructive manner.

Decomposes business requirements and translates them into detailed design specifications and code.

Interacts with key business & technology stakeholders to define, analyze, and deliver requirements that reflect the needs of both the business and end-customers.

Assesses the costs and benefits for different solutions and recommend/decide on appropriate designs.

Designs solutions, writes code, performs unit testing, develops appropriate artefacts / documentation, and facilitates final delivery.

Supports production issues, includes independently completing root-cause analysis and diagnosis.

Devises new algorithms and data structures for target environment and platform attributes in alignment with architectural patterns.

Builds solutions that are supportable, scalable and achieve our aspiration of common assets.

Recommends or automates approaches to streamline and integrate technological processes and/or systems to improve operational efficiency and effectiveness.

Supports the management of specific project deliverables & outcomes.

Identifies opportunities to strengthen the development capability, such as: sharing expertise to promote technical development, mentoring employees, building communities of practice and networks.

Stays abreast of industry technical and business trends through participation in professional associations, practice communities & individual learning.

Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus.

Provides specialized consulting, analytical and technical support.

Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.

Works independently and regularly handles non-routine situations.

Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed. Qualifications:

Have 5-10 years of experience with IBM mainframe technologies such as; PL1, CICS, COBOL, TSO, DB2, JCL, z/OS Connect

Knowledge or related experience working in a mainframe development or production environment supporting lending, credit, or investment applications.

Knowledge of software development practices, concepts, and technology obtained through formal training and/or work experience.

Knowledge of required programming languages and can code with little oversight.

Knowledge of technical/business environment and processes.

Understand functional aspects and technical behavior of the underlying operating system, development environment, and deployment practices.

Have facility with and understanding of the ecosystem that code operates in.

Deep knowledge and technical proficiency gained through extensive education and business experience.

Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.

Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.

Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth.

Influence skills - In-depth.

Data driven decision making - In-depth.



We’re here to help


At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en.

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

My one of the enterprise clients in financial sector is seeking a number of Java Developers to join their team. The successful candidates will be an experienced Java Developer with strong experience in Java technology, TDD, AWS, Agile, React, Angular and financial environment. 
If interested, please apply through the link below or send your most recent resume to reshmig@corgta.com.


Responsibilities:
•	Lead the development of applications using enterprise Java technology and object-oriented methodologies
•	Work within and across Agile teams to design, develop, test, implement and support technical solutions across a full stack of development tools and technologies
•	Continuously improve software engineering practices
•	Mentor and elevate junior engineers within the business

Basic Qualifications: 
•	Bachelor’s or Diploma
•	At least 6 years of experience in Application Development using Java

Preferred Qualifications:
•	8 years+ of experience in Application Development using Java
•	Experience with Test Driven Development
•	Experience working in an Agile environment
•	Experience with AWS
•	Familiarity of front-end technology and frameworks such as React or Angular

job_title: Team Lead Cloud Engineer, Scotia Digital (Vancouver Hub)
description:
Requisition ID: 145032

At Scotiabank Digital Factory, the reach and opportunity of a global organization meets the passion and drive of a startup. Reinvention starts here—and it starts with you.

We believe that the pathway to success is paved with user feedback, so we’re constantly asking our customers how they want to bank. When we find an opportunity to make things people will love, we assemble teams of specialists to collaborate in Digital Factories in Canada, Chile, Mexico, Peru, and Colombia. We work fast, and we work smart. Join us to create meaningful experiences and build the bank of tomorrow for our customers around the world.

If you’d like to learn more about our Digital Banking career opportunities, explore our Communities of Practice, or hear from our leaders, check out our Technology at Scotia career page.

The role of the Team Lead - Cloud Engineering operates within the Cloud Platform Engineering team. This valuable member of the team will be responsible for leading a team of engineers to drive platform and services creation for the broad enterprise use.


Is this role right for you? 



Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems, and knowledge.

Key accountabilities include leading design, development and maintenance activities of services, and components for cloud platforms in order to enable safe enterprise-wide use of public cloud offerings

Technical ownership/leadership of a component of a larger product.

Designing, implementing, and refactoring code (typically Go, Python).

Ensuring software, programs and applications are developed and/or configured to meet high availability, integrity and reliability, security, and compliance requirements.

Leading meetings with other engineers, delilvery elaads and architects on breaking-down, scoping and estimating tasks.

Working with application teams for successful onboarding onto the Platform

Leading planning sessions, driving stand-ups, etc.

Be able to build and operate the highly available and scalable software and infrastructure.




What You Will Bring To Succeed




At least 5+ years of hands-on technical working experience with Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) and/or Google Cloud Platform (GCP)

At least 4+ years of hands-on technical working experience with development languages (Go, Python)

At least 4+ years of hands-on technical working experience with container-based virtualization technologies (Docker)

At least 5+ years of hands-on technical working experience in the use of CI/CD Tools 

Superior oral and written communication skills

Expertise and understanding of Cloud Native Platforms, particularly Kubernetes, and associated technologies (e.g., Istio, Envoy, Anthos, Kustomize).

Experience working with monitoring tools such as Dynatrace, Prometheus, Grafana, etc.

Knowledge of software design patterns, and/or security considerations 

Focus on scalable, enterprise-level software system design (both on code and infrastructure levels)


Location(s): Canada : British Columbia : Vancouver

Description:* o Develop high-level system requirements, based upon the end user needs and/or stated requirements. o Analyse and decompose systems-level requirements and allocate requirements and design margin across sub-system elements. o Advocate for design to cost, design for test, and design for manufacture approaches throughout the organization for effective productization of commercial space systems. o Develop and ensure proper documentation of technical and interface requirements. o Develop and ensure proper documentation of high-level system and subsystem design. o Develop verification and test plans. o Understand and assess design issues, determine appropriate resolutions, and work with the team to address. o Troubleshoot system behaviour anomalies, determine root cause, and the appropriate technical resolution. o Review, analyse and interpret telemetry from deployed system with context and understanding of the system development life cycle.

Skills:* systems engineering, test plan, electronics, requirements analysis, requirement writing, DOORS, safety critical, mission critical, matlab, simulink, V&V

Top Skills Details:* systems engineering,test plan,electronics,requirements analysis,requirement writing

Additional Skills & Qualifications:* 1) 4+ years in a systems engineering role - systems engineering, project engineering are required &/or manufacturing engineering experience prior to being a full-time systems engineer - gone through a large scale product development where the product was in development for a minimum of 1-2 years 2) 4+ years of experience with a project that involved electronics, mechatronics, software, etc. 3) Minimum 4+ years experience in creating, writing & reading requirements for complex systems (from multidisciplinary project) - translating from a customer spec into an engineering requirement. Then go into lower tier sub system requirements where they define what the product must do based on the concept of operations 4) Minimum 2+ years as a lead on a project or subsystem (work package) so that they are able to take ownership and thrive. NICE TO HAVES:

Familiarity with mission-critical software, Matlab/Simulink, and computer-aided design tools would also be a benefit.

Excellent verbal, written communication skills are essential to this position.

Degree in Aerospace, Mechanical, Electrical, Computer Systems Engineering, Applied Mathematics, or equivalent experience

Or someone who has proven experience working as a Systems Engineer without Masters Degree

Need to have a passion for space

Experience Level:* Expert Level ***DISCLAIMER: Candidates will be required to relocate to the Greater Toronto Area***

La description:* o Élaborer des exigences système de haut niveau, en fonction des besoins de l'utilisateur final et/ou des exigences énoncées. o Analyser et décomposer les exigences au niveau des systèmes et répartir les exigences et la marge de conception entre les éléments du sous-système. o Défendre les approches de conception au coût, de conception pour les tests et de conception pour la fabrication dans toute l'organisation pour une productisation efficace des systèmes spatiaux commerciaux. o Développer et assurer une documentation appropriée des exigences techniques et d'interface. o Développer et assurer une documentation appropriée de la conception de haut niveau du système et du sous-système. o Élaborer des plans de vérification et de test. o Comprendre et évaluer les problèmes de conception, déterminer les solutions appropriées et travailler avec l'équipe pour les résoudre. o Dépanner les anomalies de comportement du système, déterminer la cause profonde et la résolution technique appropriée. o Examiner, analyser et interpréter la télémétrie du système déployé avec le contexte et la compréhension du cycle de vie du développement du système.

Compétences:* ingénierie des systèmes, plan de test, électronique, analyse des exigences, rédaction des exigences, DOORS, sécurité critique, mission critique, matlab, simulink, V&V

Détails des principales compétences :* ingénierie système,plan de test,électronique,analyse des besoins,rédaction des besoins

Compétences et qualifications supplémentaires :* 1) 4 ans et plus dans un poste d'ingénieur système - l'ingénierie des systèmes, l'ingénierie de projet sont requises et/ou une expérience en ingénierie de fabrication avant d'être ingénieur système à temps plein - passé par un développement de produit à grande échelle où le produit était en développement depuis au moins 1-2 ans 2) 4+ années d'expérience avec un projet impliquant l'électronique, la mécatronique, les logiciels, etc. 3) Minimum de 4 ans d'expérience dans la création, la rédaction et la lecture d'exigences pour des systèmes complexes (à partir d'un projet multidisciplinaire) - la traduction d'une spécification client en une exigence d'ingénierie. Ensuite, passez aux exigences du sous-système de niveau inférieur où ils définissent ce que le produit doit faire en fonction du concept d'opérations 4) Minimum 2 ans et plus en tant que responsable d'un projet ou d'un sous-système (lot de travaux) afin qu'ils puissent s'approprier et prospérer.

BON À AVOIR :*

Une connaissance des logiciels critiques, de Matlab/Simulink et des outils de conception assistée par ordinateur serait également un avantage.

D'excellentes compétences en communication verbale et écrite sont essentielles pour ce poste.

Diplôme en aérospatiale, mécanique, électricité, génie des systèmes informatiques, mathématiques appliquées ou expérience équivalente

Ou quelqu'un qui a une expérience avérée en tant qu'ingénieur système sans maîtrise

Besoin d'avoir une passion pour l'espace

Niveau d'expérience:* Niveau expert ***AVIS DE NON-RESPONSABILITÉ : Les candidats devront déménager dans la région du Grand Toronto*** Personnel Placement Agency Permit Number: AP-2000486 / Numéro du permis d'agence de placement de personnel : AP-2000486

job_title: C++ Software Engineer / Tech-Driven Quant Fund / (All experience levels)
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
Title:
 C++ Software Engineer


Client:
 Tech-driven Quant Fund


Salary:
 Up to $240,000 + market-leading bonus + sign on bonus


Location:
 Montreal (Option to work from home or hybrid)





Keywords:
 C++, Real-Time, Low Latency, Distributed, Finance, Trading, Linux





OVERVIEW





My client, a leading fund run by industry-leading quants, systematic traders and computer scientists are looking for C++ engineers from all backgrounds to join an already top-tier development team and work on designing and building their bespoke, heavily distributed multithreaded trading applications.





RESPONSIBILITES -


• Design & develop real-time software for low-latency trading platforms.

• Collaborate closely with quant researchers and peers to ensure global consistency and maximize re-use of software components.





SKILLS/EXPERIENCE -





• Knowledge of modern C++ on Linux - There is zero legacy tech at this firm!

• Proficiency in data structures, algorithms and computer architecture.

• Python and/or scripting experience considered a plus.





PERKS:





• Software Engineers are treated as the company's #1 asset

• Low attrition rate; people working there love what they do!

• Very friendly, tight-knit environment

• Greenfield projects

• Flat structure, with a clear progression route






Prior finance knowledge is not required for more junior candidates.

description:
Job Summary





Job description:



If you want to help build thriving businesses and guide our clients from now to NEXT, keep reading to see how your ability to solve complex problems can make digital transformation a reality for clients.



Primary Responsibilities



The Data Engineer will collaborate within a team of technologists to produce enterprise scale solutions for our clients’ needs. They will combine your technical expertise and problem-solving passion to work closely with clients, turning complex ideas into end-to-end solutions that transform our clients’ business. They will translate client requirements to system design and develop a solution that delivers business value



Requirements



2+ years in a data engineering role

SQL/PSQL and ETL experience.

GCP experience or similar Cloud Platforms

Experience with workflow orchestration tools

Exposure to data platforms involving implementation of end to end data pipelines

Good communication and willingness to work as a team



Nice To Have



Experience with data modeling, table design, and mapping business needs to data structure using traditional and NoSQL methods.

Python scripting experience

Experience with Google dataflow, cloud storage, Airflow, Stream Analytics, and Event Hubs

Job 56978

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Job Summary




DESCRIPTION


Fulfillment by Amazon (FBA) is an Amazon service for our sellers that offers our Amazon fulfillment centers as a service similar to how EC2 provides infrastructure. Allowing sellers to only pay for what they use, let us create a seamless experience for sellers to leverage our world-class facilities. 71% of sellers who use FBA report more than a 20% increase in unit sales after joining FBA.

In a very real way, we are changing lives with the work we do. Our FBA employees wake up every day thinking about how to enable our sellers to be successful on our platform. Enabling seller success allows us to provide Amazon customers with unparalleled selection and pricing. FBA is a win for sellers and a win for customers.

What is Fulfillment by Amazon (FBA)?

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IAi4fPb_kp4&t=2s

The Fulfillment by Amazon (FBA) team

https://vimeo.com/80948105

The Amazon FBA Inbound Quality Team is looking for a System Dev Engineer who will join the team which supports to reduce operational load on SDEs, raise the bar on operational excellence, automate issue resolution, and proactively mitigate the failures.

Your problem resolving skill will benefit customers directly, insuring Amazon able to meet all its commitments to our customers. Primary responsibilities include troubleshooting, diagnosing and fixing production software issues, developing monitoring solutions, performing software maintenance and configuration, implementing the fix for internally developed code (Perl, Ruby, C/C++, JAVA), performing SQL queries, updating, tracking and resolving technical challenges, build and develop tools which will automate daily operational activities. Responsibilities also include working alongside development on Amazon Corporate and Divisional Software projects, updating/enhancing our current software, automation of support processes and documentation of our systems.

Your solutions will impact our customers directly! This job requires you to constantly hit the ground running and your ability to learn quickly and work on disparate and overlapping tasks will define your success. High Impact production issues often require coordination between multiple Development, Operations and IT Support groups, so you get to experience a breadth of impact with various groups.

The ideal candidate must be detail oriented, have superior verbal and written communication skills, strong organizational skills, able to juggle multiple tasks at once, able to work independently and can maintain professionalism under pressure. You must be able to identify problems before they happen and implement solutions that detect and prevent outages. You must be able to accurately prioritize projects, make sound judgments, work to improve the customer experience, and get the right things done.




Basic Qualifications




 B.S. in Computer Science or a related field.

 2 or more years' overall development/technical support experience.

 Object oriented development experience in C++ and/or Java.

 Experience in UNIX/Linux operating system.

 Experience in database architecture and perform SQL queries.




Preferred Qualifications

529713BR


Introduction


As an Application Developer, you will lead IBM into the future by translating system requirements into the design and development of customized systems in an agile environment. The success of IBM is in your hands as you transform vital business needs into code and drive innovation. Your work will power IBM and its clients globally, collaborating and integrating code into enterprise systems. You will have access to the latest education, tools and technology, and a limitless career path with the world’s technology leader. Come to IBM and make a global impact!


Your Role and Responsibilities


As an Application Developer, you will lead IBM into the future by translating system requirements into the design and development of customized systems in an agile environment. The success of IBM is in your hands as you transform vital business needs into code and drive innovation. Your work will power IBM and its clients globally, collaborating and integrating code into enterprise systems. You will have access to the latest education, tools and technology, and a limitless career path with the world’s technology leader. Come to IBM and make a global impact!

Position Overview

We are looking for Full Stack Python Developers for our new EPS (Expertus Payment Services) Cloud platform. Your role will be to develop and maintain the platform as business needs. You will have to use your skills to achieve innovative solutions by evolving in the ever-growing world of finance, all based on a Cloud Infrastructure.

This platform specializes in end-to-end digital payments, to help clients address the aging payments infrastructures used by banks, credit unions, regulatory agencies and large corporations. It strengthens IBM's portfolio as an end-to-end payments platform solution provider, further advancing IBM's hybrid cloud and AI strategy.


Main Responsibilities




Analyse business needs

Participate in the design and development of solutions according to business needs

Create and update APIs

Create and update batch back-end processing

Create and update static web pages

Maintain the proper functioning of the application

Document the technical choices and the various functionalities carried out

Write effective tests to ensure the stability of the application

Work within a multidisciplinary team.




Required Technical and Professional Expertise




Energy, commitment and motivation

Organization and rigor

Passion to learn new technologies

Experience in back-end and front-end development

Demonstrate innovation in the solutions developed

Programming languages: Python, HTML, CSS, JavaScript

A clear credit check is a requirement for this role




Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise




Deployment cycle: Jenkins, Git

Databases: SQL & NoSQL

University degree or College/CEGEP graduate in Computer sciences

Bilingualism: French and English



Must have the ability to work in Canada without sponsorship.


About Business Unit


IBM Consulting is IBM’s consulting and global professional services business, with market leading capabilities in business and technology transformation. With deep expertise in many industries, we offer strategy, experience, technology, and operations services to many of the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Our people are focused on accelerating our clients’ businesses through the power of collaboration. We believe in the power of technology responsibly used to help people, partners and the planet.

This role requires you to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to your start date. Full vaccination refers to receiving dosage of COVID-19 vaccines that provide full protection in accordance with Canada Public Health and WHO guidance (full series of a 2 dose vaccine plus 14 days or a one dose vaccine plus 14 days from the last dose). Proof of vaccination status will be required. Booster vaccination requirements may be required. If you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical or religious reasons, we offer accommodations in accordance with applicable law.


Your Life @ IBM


Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.


About IBM


IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.


Location Statement


This role will involve working with technology that is covered by Export Regulations sanctions. If you are a Foreign National from any of the following US sanctioned countries (Cuba, Iran, North Korea, and Syria) on a work permit, you are not eligible for employment in this position.


Being You @ IBM


IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics.
