Introduction


**Can work out of either office locations: Ottawa. Fredericton or Markham**

Software Developers at IBM are the backbone of our strategic initiatives to design, code, test, and provide industry-leading solutions that make the world run today - planes and trains take off on time, bank transactions complete in the blink of an eye and the world remains safe because of the work our software developers do. Whether you are working on projects internally or for a client, software development is critical to the success of IBM and our clients worldwide. At IBM, you will use the latest software development tools, techniques and approaches and work with leading minds in the industry to build solutions you can be proud of.


Your Role and Responsibilities




Work as a developer of an Agile Scrum team, participate in ongoing Sprint activity to deliver on assigned Story development work. 

Write high-quality UI code for data-intensive applications using Javascript, HTML, and CSS- Review pull requests and provide constructive feedback to team members

Collaborate with designers and offering managers to validate, design, and deliver application capabilities and features

Proactively manage work load to deliver code in a timely manner 

Respond to customer feedback on data quality, investigate and identify issues. 

Recommend and implement remediation. 



**Can work out of either office locations: Ottawa. Fredericton or Markham**


Required Technical and Professional Expertise




Familiar with programming languages – JavaScript and related test automation frameworks such as Jest and React Testing Library 

Experience with web UI technologies - Semantic HTML, CSS, SASS, React,

Experience with web development tools - webpack, Babel 




Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise




Experience with design thinking and UI/UX design 

Understand network security and security threat intelligence 

Familiar with with CD/CI development methodology for cloud application development 

Experience with technologies - Storybook, Next.js, React Context, i18next, TypeScript, Node.js, Express, Express OpenAPI, Socket.io, CouchDB, Redis



Must have the ability to work in Canada without sponsorship.


About Business Unit


IBM’s Cloud and Cognitive software business is committed to bringing the power of IBM’s Cloud and Watson/AI technologies to life for our clients and ecosystem partners around the world. IBM provides you with the most comprehensive and consistent approach to development, security and operations across hybrid environments—with complete software solutions for business and IT operations, development, data science, security, and management. Our experts and software capabilities help organizations develop applications once and deploy them anywhere, integrate security across the breadth of their IT estate, and automate operations with management visibility. With IBM, you also have access to new skills and methods, governance and management approaches, and a deep ecosystem of industry experts and partners.

This role requires you to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to your start date. Full vaccination refers to receiving dosage of COVID-19 vaccines that provide full protection in accordance with Canada Public Health and WHO guidance (full series of a 2 dose vaccine plus 14 days or a one dose vaccine plus 14 days from the last dose). Proof of vaccination status will be required. Booster vaccination requirements may be required. If you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical or religious reasons, we offer accommodations in accordance with applicable law.


Your Life @ IBM


Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.


About IBM


IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.


Location Statement


This role will involve working with technology that is covered by Export Regulations sanctions. If you are a Foreign National from any of the following US sanctioned countries (Cuba, Iran, North Korea, and Syria) on a work permit, you are not eligible for employment in this position.


Being You @ IBM


IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Automate everything automatable to reduce manual processes and innovate operational value streams.

3+ years of experience as a Cloud Systems Engineer

ID#2957

New Value Solutions is a national IT consulting company with offices in Vancouver, Seattle, Toronto and two recently opened in Italy. We provide IT Staff Augmentation, IT Project Delivery, IT Sustainment and Management Consulting services. Our clients are situated across Canada, US and Italy.

Summary

 
GPU Software’s Metal Ecosystem team is looking for graphics software engineers to join us in deep technical collaborations with the world’s leading game developers. We represent the voice of the game developer ecosystem back into Apple and help provide input to the direction of future Apple products. We work hands on with game makers and 3rd party game engine developers. We work together with the GPU Software team and game developers to identify features and optimizations.  We help developers discover what’s possible.  Are you ready to join us as we engineer the future of gaming on Metal?


Apple’s GPU Software Metal Ecosystem team acts as the primary interface to highly impactful GPU developers across Rendering, Graphics, Gaming and GPU Compute, across all of Apple's innovative products including iPhone, iPad, Apple TV, Mac, and Apple Watch. 


Metal 2 provides near-direct access to the graphics processing unit (GPU), enabling you to improve the graphics and compute potential of apps on iOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS. Building upon an efficient low-overhead architecture with pre-compiled shaders, fine-grained resource control, and multithreading support, Metal 2 further boosts performance by enabling the GPU to take more control of the rendering pipeline. Moving beyond just graphics, Metal 2's deep support for GPU-accelerated machine learning and improved developer tools make it even easier to debug, optimize, and deploy Metal apps. On Mac, Metal 2 adds support for virtual reality (VR) rendering and external GPUs, and provides new APIs and optimizations to help developers adapt these new technologies within their apps.

 

Key Qualifications

 
Understanding of at least one GPU APIs (OpenGL, DirectX, Vulkan, Metal, GNM, CUDA and OpenCL) 

Knowledge of computer-graphics techniques, game development, or the computer-graphics industry

Outstanding written and oral communication skills

Strong programming skills and knowledge of C/C++

Knowledge of GPU hardware architectures, and coding for iOS and macOS a major plus

 

Description

 
GPU Software’s Metal Ecosystem team is looking for engineers to join us, working together with the world’s leading developers across games, and content creation. We represent the voice of the graphics software ecosystem back into Apple and have the potential to influence the direction of future Apple products. We work directly with game makers, game engine providers, professional production applications, renderers and other meaningful graphics applications. We work together with the GPU Software team to identify features and optimizations for Apple and directly with external developers to identify optimizations for the application. Are you ready to join us as we work across the ecosystem with the rendering community to change the game through deep technical collaborations?


Responsibilities:

Partner with external developers to analyze developers products and identify performance improvements, feature suggestions, memory usage, API usage feedback and mentorship with clear agreed upon goals on how to improve their applications.


Collaborate in person or virtually with engineers in real time with source code access using Apple’s developer tools and deep knowledge of our architecture along with the developer’s knowledge of their application.


Improve the developer and customer experience through engineering engagements on all Apple products with a GPU from Watch to Mac Pro.


Define your goals and timeline to align with the external developers and work together to deliver.


Act as the de facto specialist in Metal to the developer, including but not limited to providing informative workshops, direct contributions to source code, insight into actionable improvements and workflows.


Regularly collaborate with internal teams outside of GPU Software to highlight opportunities with developers and drive improvements to the platform.

 

Education & Experience

 
Technical BS/MS degree/Equivalent Experience

description:
This role is for candidates with valid work authorization in Canada. The client will not provide sponsorship.




Job Posting Title: IT Technical Support Consultant, IT Application Support 

Contract : 6 Months (Strong possible extension)

Location: Toronto, ON




Reporting to the Lead Project Management, the IT Technical Support Consultant is responsible for supporting legacy applications that are developed in .net, Java, visual basics and also off the shelf products such as Bentley ProjectWise/MicroStation, and Esri ArcGIS. The technical support consultant will also play a critical role in assisting the project teams with designing and specifying technical solutions for strategic IT projects, considering business requirements, IT standards, security, integration and infrastructure. We are looking for technical support resource who have passion in the IT industry and looking for product SME experience as well as experience of designing and delivering cutting edge enterprise scale IT system using Java/J2EE applications in Websphere platforms.




RESPONSIBILITIES 

·        Support the day-to-day operations of IT systems such as legacy and off the shelf products.

·        Research and identify industry trends (relative to scope of responsibility), leveraging ideas to improve or better align IT systems and services.

·        Develop and implement plans to support IT Applications.

·        Proactively identify problems and opportunities for improvement of IT service and infrastructure systems or processes, including architecture advancement, service level improvement, cost efficiency and customer demand management.

·        Work in partnership with IT Client Consultant in determining technical options / solutions to meet business needs. 

·        Provide Application Services and solutions to support IT&S project delivery (Project Management).

·        Troubleshoot and maintain IT assets to improve reliability, including capacity, response to incidents and issues resolution 

·        Ensure application and software currency by scheduling patching and updating.

·        Maintain strong vendor relationships for their support in defect fixing, troubleshooting, and enhancements.

·        Monitor the usage of software licenses and ensure sufficient licenses are available for the business user communities.

·        Identify opportunities to optimize the efficiency of IT Application Services (Service Management).

·        Implement target state solution architectures, perform development assessment and gap analysis. 

·        Understand application, data, integration and infrastructure architectures to enable solutions.

·        Ability to work with people of diverse backgrounds with different job responsibilities, from business users, IT technical, project and security teams, to vendors.

·        Write technical documents to capture application components, operating processes and technical details.

·        Develop Technical solutions considering reliability, availability, capacity, performance and security requirements.

·        Work with IT security teams and vendors to ensure security standards & compliance of the products and solutions that are being implemented.

·        Design and development - Perform and coordinate complicated application programming and scripting activities. Design application technical infrastructure using standard databases, programming languages, utilities, and testing approaches.

·        Planning and Coordination - Participate in the technical design, development, and integration of cross functional, multi-platform application systems. Effectively interact with team members, end users, business analysts, and technical resources to gather requirements and prepare design specifications





Experience


·        Undergraduate degree/diploma in Computer Science / Engineering, or other relevant professional designation 

·        Over 5 years of progressive experience in supporting IT applications 

·        Preferable experience in supporting Esri ArcGIS 

·        Preferable experience in Bentley’s MicroStation and ProjectWise

·        Preferable experience in Oracle OFSC 

·        5+ years of experience in programming languages:

·        Experience in many of the following technologies: Java,J2EE, .NET, ETL, Data Modeling, Data Warehousing, Javascript/JQuery, HTML5, Spring MVC, EJB 3, SQL, Web Services, JMS, Spring Integration, Quartz scheduler, Ant, Maven 

·        Experience in diagnosing complex problems and providing detailed analysis and recommendations

·        Minimum of 5 (five) years’ experience and demonstrated ability to work with large volumes of data, SQL scripting, or other data mining skills.

·        3+ years experience with Windows and Linux platform.

·        2+ years working with relational databases (MySQL, Oracle, etc.). While not expected to be a database administrator, the candidate should feel comfortable planning out schemas and designs that the code will interface with

·        3+ years experience with Scripting (Power, Shell, etc.) 

·        Hands-on experience and troubleshooting RESTful API and interface specifications (Swagger, RAML, SOAP) 

·        Troubleshooting experience working with security gateways and protocols (JWT, Oauth2.0, SSL Certificates)

·        Knowledge of Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL)

·        Strong interpersonal and excellent written and verbal communication skills 

·        Experience with using Remedy Ticketing System (nice to have)

·        Interested in and passionate with new cutting-edge IT technology

·        Self-motivated and quick learner

• Lead technical team for multiple data ingestion and data integration projects from on-premise Netezza Datawarehouse, Hadoop based Big data environment, Kafka to the AWS EMR - S3 and Hive.

• Provide solution approach and build data pipeline to ingest data on AWS S3 / Hive database.

As a Senior 
Data Engineer, 
you will be responsible for creating data-driven solutions to solve operational goals; including reporting, systems integration, data warehousing and making legacy data real-time enabled.

description:
Job ID:
 135918 


Required Travel
 :Minimal 


Managerial - No
 


Location:
 :Canada-Toronto, Eglinton Ave E (AM) 





Who are we?






*This is a full-time job*





If you’re a smartphone user then you are part of an ever more connected and digital world. At Amdocs, we are leading the digital revolution into the future. From virtualized telecommunications networks, Big Data and Internet of Things to mobile financial services, billing and operational support systems, we are continually evolving our business to help you become more connected. We make sure that when you watch a video on YouTube, message friends on Snapchat or send your images on Instagram, you get great service anytime, anywhere, and on any device. We are at the heart of the telecommunications industry working with giants such as AT&T, Vodafone, Telstra and Telefonica, helping them create an amazing new world for you where technology is being used in amazing new ways every single day.





Vindicia 
is seeking an outgoing, curious, and disciplined Software Engineer In Test to work in a fast paced development environment. You are a thorough, articulate, and accomplished problem solver, capable of troubleshooting complex software application defects. Your attention to detail is second to none.





In one sentence





You will prioritize test execution, hands on validation and certification of the software readiness.





What will your job look like?





As a Software Engineer In Test, you will:


Interface with developers and product managers to develop robust test scripts and bug reports assessing quality

Design, implement, review, and maintain automated test cases, test tools, automated regression, and data-driven tests

Develop, modify, and execute software test strategies

Perform white box and black box testing to ensure the highest level of product quality

Participate in troubleshooting and triaging of issues with internal teams to drive towards root cause identification and resolution

Create and manage bug reports, ensuring they are clearly communicated to the team and addressed in a timely, thorough, and satisfactory manner

Participate in product design reviews






All you need is...






Must Have:



Extensive experience with 
Object-Oriented language 
such as
 
Java, Python, Perl, Linux and/or Unix derivatives

BS in Engineering/similar degree or equivalent work experience


Familiarity with databases
. The ideal candidate should be able to generate complex database queries using Oracle or Postgres


3-5 years developing automated tests, procedures, and plans


Experience automating functional
 UI, SOAP, and RESTful web services



Thorough knowledge
 of 
Software Development Life Cycle and QA processes


Strong analytical skills

Excellent interpersonal and communication skills






Nice to have:



Python, C#, PHP or .NET experience

Payments industry experience






Why you will love this job:



Get the chance to work with the industry's most ground-breaking testing technologies and help customers shift into the new testing realities of the digitized world!

Get the opportunity to work in a growing organization, with ever growing opportunities for personal growth and one of the highest scores of employee engagement in Amdocs!

We offer a wide range of stellar benefits including health, dental, vision, and life insurance as well as paid time off, sick time, and parental leave!







Amdocs is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workforce

description:
Job description


Staffmax is hiring a Senior Software Engineer for one of their client in Canada. this is fulltime remote opportunity.


Responsibilities



Job Duties



Develop highly interactive, user friendly, and feature rich applications.

Work directly with Product Managers, Product Owners, User Experience, Quality Engineers, Principal Engineers, and Operations teammates to define, create, enhance, maintain, and deploy applications.

Constantly use best practices by building APIs, creating and maintaining unit tests, applying modern frameworks and design patterns, actively reducing technical debt, and continuously delivering by merging/releasing consistently to the mainline branch.

Complete complex tasks with minimal amount of oversight or supervision.

Occasionally plan, design, and estimate software engineering efforts.

Lead design and architecture discussions with other engineering teammates.

Guide and contribute towards evolving the application architecture.

Help others to learn and grow in their skills.



Our Technical Stack



Angular

TypeScript

C#

Ruby

Git, TFS

MS SQL, MySQL, NoSQL

Linux, Windows

Kubernetes, Amazon Web Services, and Serverless



Qualifications/Requirements


• 6 or more years professional software development experience in Ruby or TypeScript.

• 4 or more years professional software development experience in MS SQL or MySQL.

• Experience in a collaborative team environment delivering scalable, secure, and highly available SaaS applications

• Experience working in a continuous integration environment.

• Ability to write high-quality, modular, maintainable, and secure code.

• Experience with testing best practices, including unit and integration tests.

• Ability to work well within a team environment and be self-starting and self-sufficient.

• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent training or experience.


Desired Characteristics


• Experience with processing payments in a high-volume environment.

• Experience with payment facilitation integration (stripe / world pay).

• Experience with message broker software (ie RabbitMQ).

• Experience with .net core

• Experience with serverless computing

• Experience with docker / kubernetes

• Thrives in a collaborative team environment.

• Experience with RESTful APIs and HTTP protocols.

• Exhibits a deep respect for the craft, and values building software sustainably by using modern techniques and industry best practices.

• Experience breaking monoliths into domain specific micro services.

• Experience with object-oriented design, ability to apply software patterns, and consuming event-driven applications using REST APIs within a microservice architecture.

• Ability to communicate clearly and collaborate effectively with other teammates of different software disciplines and technical skill sets.

476107BR


Introduction


As an Application Developer, you will lead IBM into the future by translating system requirements into the design and development of customized systems in an agile environment. The success of IBM is in your hands as you transform vital business needs into code and drive innovation. Your work will power IBM and its clients globally, collaborating and integrating code into enterprise systems. You will have access to the latest education, tools and technology, and a limitless career path with the world’s technology leader. Come to IBM and make a global impact!


Your Role and Responsibilities


The Adobe Experience Manager Senior Developer will perform technical design, development and configuration of web content management solutions using Adobe Experience Manager. The Senior Developer is responsible for managing a team, reviewing and understanding the client's business requirements and for translating those requirements into Adobe Experience Manager implementation specifications. They are also responsible for managing work effort of team. Specific tasks typically include: build and maintain web applications using Adobe’s Experience Manager CMS to include basic site architecture, custom components, workflow development, and Digital Asset Management; design and code, and integrate application business layer with external application components; write standards-compliant code including testing/debugging in multiple browsers and platforms; work with visual and UX designers to translate visual concepts into functional online experiences, microsites, HTML emails, and other digital media; integrate search technologies and web analytics with Adobe Experience Manager; and provide technical expertise and ownership of technical solutions.


Required Technical and Professional Expertise




Bachelor’s Degree

At least 3-5 years experience in Java-based web application design and development

At least 3-5 years experience in Adobe Experience Manager application development and implementation

Knowledge/experience with Adobe Experience Manager building blocks including templates, components, dialogs, widgets, and bundles

Knowledge/experience in Java Content Repository API, Sling web framework, Apache Felix OSGi framework, DAM, and workflows

Expert proficiency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript and responsive web design

Experience with source control systems, Maven, web services and SQL




Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise


Bachelor’s Degree



React, Angular and Graph QL

Experience with build/continuous integration tools such as Maven

Familiarity with Adobe Sites, Assets, Analytics and Adobe Target



Must have the ability to work in Canada without sponsorship.


About Business Unit


IBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants that design, build, and run foundational systems and services that is the backbone of the world's economy. IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter businesses by reimagining and reinventing through technology, with its outcome-focused methodologies, industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence.

This role requires you to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to your start date. Full vaccination refers to receiving dosage of COVID-19 vaccines that provide full protection in accordance with Canada Public Health and WHO guidance (full series of a 2 dose vaccine plus 14 days or a one dose vaccine plus 14 days from the last dose). Proof of vaccination status will be required. Booster vaccination requirements may be required. If you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical or religious reasons, we offer accommodations in accordance with applicable law.


Your Life @ IBM


Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.


About IBM


IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.


Location Statement


For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.


Being You @ IBM


IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Job Title: SOC Security engineer



Location: Toronto, Ontario



 



Role duties:


• Monitoring client security infrastructure, identifying and reporting Real Time attacks and vulnerabilities on the client network.

• Identification of incidents and subsequent analysis and investigation to determine their severity and the response required.

• Ensure that incidents are correctly reported and documented in accordance with government policy and procedures.

• Be prepared to provide a Technical Escalation Point during security incidents, establishing the extent of an attack, the business impacts, and advising on how best to contain the incident along with advice on systems hardening and mitigation measures to prevent a reoccurrence.

• Maintain a keen understanding of evolving threats and vulnerabilities to ensure the security of the client network.

• As required update Protective Monitoring/SOC documentation, processes and procedures and ensure currency.

• Provide on job training to develop junior members of the SOC team.

 





Skills and experience:


• Strong experience of SIEM, Firewall, Cyber, ArcSight, LogRhythm, RSA

• Strong security knowledge

• Experience of leading a team








About LTTS


L&T Technology Services Limited (LTTS) is a global leader in Engineering and R&D (ER&D) services. With 719 patents filed for 57 of the Global Top 100 ER&D spenders, LTTS lives and breathes engineering. Our innovations speak for themselves – World’s 1st Autonomous Welding Robot, Solar ‘Connectivity’ Drone, and the Smartest Campus in the World, to name a few.







With 62 Innovation and R&D design centers globally, company specialize in disruptive technology spaces such as 5G, Artificial Intelligence, Collaborative Robots, Digital Factory, and Autonomous Transport.








Click here to learn more about LTTS-


https://www.ltts.com/


 






Explore LTTS Career opportunities


https://jobs.ltts.com/go/AMERICA/4637210/


 









Why work with LTTS?


“Forbes” rated LTTS among the best employers in the country. Deep rooted in the company culture is the desire to harness the power of engineering to make lives better. LTTS is an open culture where collaboration lets the creative ideas thrive. We are an equal opportunities employer that covets and appreciates illustrious talent. LTTS is familial with concerns for the health and well-being of the employees and with regular medical check-up, yoga sessions, celebrations, sports and cultural activities form an important part of the work life at L&T Technology Services.








#youaresafewithus



 








As we face the storm of Pandemic wave together, we are doubling down on employee support initiatives across our campuses, offices and project sites. Among them are special quarantine facilities, medical advice helplines, and counselling.








Benefits:



Paid time off

Referral program

Relocation assistance

401(k)

Dental & Vision insurance

Disability insurance

Health insurance

Life insurance

Pet Insurance









If you are interested in further exploring this position, please send me your updated resume at divya.nair@ltts.com.

Do What You Love. Love What You Do.


At Workday, we help the world’s largest organizations adapt to what’s next by bringing finance, HR, and planning into a single enterprise cloud. We work hard, and we’re serious about what we do. But we like to have fun, too. We put people first, celebrate diversity, drive innovation, and do good in the communities where we live and work.


About The Team


Are you interested in writing software that brightens the day of millions of people around the globe? Our team, as part of Workday’s Media Cloud, builds tools and product experiences that help our customers unlock the power of media, enabling teams at companies like Amazon, Netflix, and Sony to communicate, learn, and inspire!

We’re looking for skilled and driven engineers to join us in Victoria, BC to contribute to the systems and end-user experiences for uploading, encoding, and streaming media at scale. You’ll have an opportunity to work with a phenomenal multi-cultural team and various experts, to ship clean code and further an environment of learning and innovation.

Workday values are central to what we do, as a result you’ll enjoy a healthy work-life balance, access to a professional development budget and programs, and opportunities to innovate with regular hackathons and ongoing customer research!


About The Role



Design and develop software and cloud-based infrastructure for an enterprise video service supporting media upload, processing, and playback at scale

Deliver user focused, high quality and performant features while adeptly navigating and reducing complexity, making every effort to minimize risk

Contribute to process and tooling improvements including systems for continuous integration and automated testing

Actively participate on an Agile Scrum team that delivers on commitments and responds to feedback in collaboration with product, design, quality, and other technical specialists

Own items from inception to delivery and seek to measure and understand how internal/external customers are using our products/services

Engage with the larger engineering community at Workday through collaborative learning and mentorship, sharing your interests and expertise with others




About You


Basic Qualifications


3+ years of demonstrated ability with one or more major programming languages, especially Python or JavaScript

2+ years of industry experience delivering web-based applications to production

Experience communicating technical ideas across contexts and audiences that encourages dialogue, promotes shared understanding, and facilitate desired outcomes

Experience participating in production support issues or equivalent on-call activities




Other Qualifications



Developed with multimedia or streaming video technologies

Experience in delivering cloud-based web applications in AWS

Experience with test automation frameworks, build pipelines, continuous integration, deployment, and monitoring utilities

An independent, inquisitive, and self-motivated approach to learning

Current eligibility to work in Canada




Are you being referred to one of our roles? If so, ask your connection at Workday about our Employee Referral process!

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Financial Services

description:
** OPEN TO ANYONE IN CANADA OR THE USA ** 





About Knock Knock 





Knock Knock Games is on a mission to make it possible for anyone to make their own game on the blockchain as NFT, and work with the Creator Community to build a universe of games and experiences with the playable Vy NFT.





Vy Worlds
 is a Web3 gaming platform designed for the next billion blockchain gamers. Vy Worlds feature 
Vy
 NFT characters and exist within the 
Vy Verse
. We believe that User Generated Content (UGC) is already an important part of the gaming market (think ROBLOX, Minecraft, Fortnite’s Creator Mode) and is poised to become an essential part of the crypto gaming ecosystem in the future.

 

Our platform, Vy Worlds, makes it simple to make games, simple to play games, and simple to share games.





Simple to make games: Our game creation editor is no-code and is being designed so that anyone can create their own game.

Simple to play: We build games where people spend their time. Using web technology, we can be on a wider variety of platforms, including our own web platform.

Simple to share: Games like Minecraft and ROBLOX are complicated to set up and play with friends. For our platform, it only takes a web link to start playing with friends, no installs or setup are required. We want our platform to feel like a social network where players can invite friends and follow creators/players they like.






﻿Our Values: 






Keep teams small and move fast.

Be an owner: take ownership of your work.

Be weird: have a unique perspective.

Community first: work with the community to create something great together.


 

Job Objective

We are looking for a talented Senior Gameplay Engineer who can help take Vy Worlds to the next level. You will be joining a small team of engineers focused on making a frictionless, User-Generated Content (UGC) focused, NFT powered game into fruition. The game is currently in Alpha with multiple playable game modes and a creator mode. 

 


What You Will Do: 



Help launch a new NFT-focused game in early 2022. 

Primary objectives for this role: 

Build and own the development of a number of core gameplay features for the Vy Worlds platform.

Ideate, direct, and polish the look and feel of the game. 

Secondary objective: If you are interested in blockchain development, there will be opportunities to learn and grow with us for this project.

Work with the team to ensure cohesion between all features in the game.


 

 


What You Need to Succeed:



Key Skill: are you able to the below, or excited to learn how to do the following?




Deep experience with game development on console/PC or mobile. We are building a game building platform like ROBLOX for web3, so we need serious technical chops on the team to build out the game building tools and the game modes themselves.



Desire to learn new technologies and work on a variety of systems at a time.


We are a fast-moving startup, so we need people who want to ship features without a lot of hand-holding from leadership.

Strong communication skills, both technical and non-technical, as part of your job will be working closely with other departments to implement changes needed in the game. 

Strong problem solving skills: you able to work with all members of the team to communicate ideas, foresee future problems and brainstorm actionable solutions. 





Perks: Unlimited vacation, fully remote, Work-From-Home subsidy, monthly socials, insurance coverage.




Location: Remote in the USA OR Toronto, Canada

job_title: Software Development Engineer II, FEX (Fulfillment Execution)
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Job Summary




DESCRIPTION


Have you ever ordered a product on Amazon and when that box with the smile arrived, wondered how it got to you so fast? Did you ever think about where it came from? If solving complex problems while delighting customers is your passion, the Amazon Supply Chain Optimization organization is for you.

Watch this video to learn more about our organization, SCOT: http://bit.ly/amazon-scot

The Vancouver-based Fulfillment Execution (FEX) team, part of the SCOT Fulfillment Optimization group, owns systems responsible for executing customer orders by managing shipment life cycle from planning to fulfillment, orchestrating billions of worldwide shipments for Amazon. We build solutions that are central to the order and fulfillment pipelines and to the supply chain systems’ operation and impact core front-end customer facing functionality. In order to delight our customers, we rely on complex software systems which have to scale to meet Amazon's growing business needs.

As a Software Developer/Engineer on the FEX team, you will be responsible for creating and maintaining this large, complex software system. You will develop highly available, business impacting services at the core of Amazon's fulfillment engine. You will be empowered to think big, invent on behalf of our customers, and find elegant solutions to hard problems. You will also work closely with a diverse group of stakeholders from World-wide Operations, Finance, Fulfilled-By-Amazon, and internal technical teams to define business opportunities and then drive end-to-end solutions. The world is changing fast and this is a dynamic role where you will be able to learn as much as you contribute.

Successful candidates will be strong developers who can prioritize well, communicate clearly, and have a consistent track record of delivery. You should enjoy working closely with your peers in a group of very smart and talented engineers. We have a team culture that encourages innovation, requires operational excellence, and expects developers and management alike to take a high level of ownership for the product vision, technical architecture and project delivery.




Basic Qualifications




 Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related technical discipline

 2+ years professional software design and development experience

 Proficiency with at least one Object Oriented language (e.g. Java, C++, C#).

 Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design, data structures, automated testing, algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis




Preferred Qualifications




 Development experience on cloud-scale, fault-tolerant distributed and service-oriented systems that have been successfully delivered to customers

 Ability to own all stages of development process: design, testing, implementation, operational support

 Solid programming skills with object oriented design and testing

 Experience in building and driving adoption of new tools

 Excellent verbal and written communication skills

 Agile, Scrum, Kanban, Lean software development experience

 Experience with an e-commerce, transportation, or big data company


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.



Company
 - Amazon Dev Centre Canada ULC

description:
At Kinaxis, who we are is grounded in our common belief that people matter. Each one of us plays an important part in accomplishing our work, building our culture and making a global impact.

Every day, we’re empowered to work together to help our customers make fast, confident planning decisions. This is how we create a better planet – for each other, for our customers and for generations to come. Our cloud-based platform RapidResponse ensures that the products we need – everything from medicine and cars, to day-to-day items like toothpaste – make it to market and into our hands when we need them with minimal ecological footprint.

We make the world better, and you can too.


Software Test Developer, Algorithms




About The Team



The Business Algorithms team at Kinaxis creates customized solutions to optimize supply chains. Ever wonder how the hundreds of parts in your new smart phone come together from different suppliers all over the world? Kinaxis solves problems like that every day.

Our customers have terabytes of data that needs to be analyzed for the largest supply chains imaginable. Our algorithms move the global economy-- in seconds, not hours, or days.

It’s Big Data with an impact; Data Science on the front lines.

The Algorithms team works in a dynamic environment where real life supply chain challenges are being translated into complex algorithms that are coded, tested and released to world-wide known manufactures. Developers and Test engineers are working together to achieve high quality supply chain solutions, develop Next Generation frameworks to address testing complexity, and interact with Product Managers and customers on a daily basis.

We believe in the DevOps culture – we serve our own tools, frameworks, infrastructure. Automation is certainly at the top of our priority list.


Who you are



You thrive on delivering a quality product to customers and care deeply about testing best practices and efficient test strategies.

You enjoy complex logic/algorithms, working with Big Data.

You are driven by customer success, love to participate in customer-facing projects.

You prefer a fast-paced agile work environment and take pride in finding product defects.

You approach testing with creative ideas and innovative techniques.

You collaborate with Software Developers and Product Managers, and your passion is to identify and solve product gaps.

You’re a strong believer in Continuous Integration, and the DevOps mindset

You communicate fluidly, at the level of your audience, and seek to understand and be understood.

You like working in teams, mentoring, and sharing neat things you come across.



What you will do 




Technical




Design, develop, and support automated tests and corresponding infrastructure enhancements

Analyze, scope, review, and estimate test development activities

Develop test strategies and plans




Customer Facing




Learn Supply Chain business challenges and contribute to testing relevant Use Cases / Business Processes.

Participate in requirements elaboration and review product specifications.

Translate requirements into Test Strategies and Test Cases

Interact with Rapid Response customers directly and indirectly through Product Managers.




Process Oriented




Improve processes and efficiency of the team, always look for opportunities to strengthen the team.

Share your knowledge and mentor less experienced team members.




Team Player




Be part of the amazing, collaborative, and supportive Business Algorithms Team that is practicing true Agile where testers and developers share the same objectives.



What we are looking for 




Required




4+ years of experience in software test development and automation functions.

A degree in engineering and/or applied science.

Strong programming and scripting languages experience (Python, C#, .Net). 

Exceptionally strong analytical skills and experience working with complex data

Proficiency in requirements elaboration and test plans creation.

Ability to search for and structure information regarding complex processes / functionality.

The ability to ‘think outside of the box’ is crucial in this fast-paced environment 

Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills

Adaptable and flexible to changing priorities

Self-starter with strong initiative and results orientation




Definite Assets




Exposure to manufacturing/fulfillment/BI/Workforce Management/financial business requirements/practices. 

Knowledge of C++/Java

Familiarity with Jenkins CI/CD and release pipelines.

Knowledge and experience in relational database design and usage.

Experience working in agile development environment.



What we have to offer



Challenging Work - We love solving highly complex problems. And as the global leaders in our industry, we never stop innovating—our work is never “done. That’s because across our teams and in all roles, every employee is empowered to bring their best ideas forward and to jump in and solve the problems they’re passionate about.

Great People - We take our work seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously! It’s in our DNA to celebrate, laugh, and have fun. We are stronger, together, when we are open, honest, and above all, real. Every person is valued here and plays an important role in our shared success.

Global Impact - As a global team spanning continents, boundaries, and cultures, every day we are inspired by the impact our work has on our colleagues, our customers, our communities, and the world at large.

 Diversity, Equity and Inclusion - Diversity, equity and inclusion are more than words to us. They are the guiding principles for building a culture where we celebrate each others’ differences, continuously strive for equality and recognize that inclusion makes us stronger as individuals, a company and a global citizen. 


For more information, visit the Kinaxis web site at www.kinaxis.com or the company’s blog at http://blog.kinaxis.com/ .

Kinaxis strongly encourages diverse candidates to apply to our welcoming community. We strive to make our website and application process accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact Human Resources at accommodations@kinaxis.com . This contact information is for accessibility requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.

1. 负责交易相关后台开发维护工作，参与后台系统设计开发

 

Responsible for the development and maintenance of the transaction-related backend

 

platform, and engage in the design and development of the backend system

 

2. 负责高并发、低延迟系统的设计、开发和性能调优

 

Responsible for the design, development and performance tuning of high concurrency and

 

low latency system.

 

3. 参与产品设计讨论并完成高质量的设计和编码

 

Participate and contribute in product design. Complete the design and coding with good

 

quality

 

4. 对现有系统提出优化建议

 

Provide valid suggestions for systems optimization

 

职位要求

Job Requirements:

1. 熟练掌握Golang（java/c++开发者有意愿转go也可），熟悉Linux常用操作，对 shell

 

awk有一定了解；了解PHP、Python或Nodejs等至少一种脚本语言

 

Proﬁcient in Golang (Experience with java/c++ and willing to switch to Go is acceptable),

 

familiar with Linux operations, have basic understanding of SHELL, AWK

understand at

least one scripting language such as PHP, Python or Nodejs

 

2. 熟悉常用的中间件如MySQL、Redis、Kafka、etcd、ES等，熟悉Http、tcp、分布式

 

事务等

 

Familiar with common middleware such as MySQL, Redis, Kafka, etcd, ES, etc., Competent

 

in Http, tcp, distributed transactions, and etc.

 

3. 具备一定的架构能力，对代码质量、编码规范有追求；有服务化、开放平台

 

OpenAPI开发设计经验者优先

 

Demonstrated some architect capability, and ambitious for code quality and coding standards;

 

Experience in service-oriented and OpenAPI development and design is preferred

 

4. 具备良好的业务理解和分析能力，踏实靠谱，学习能力强，有独立解决问题的能力

 

Good business acumen and analytical skills , accountable and reliable, strong learning ability,

 

and excellent problem-solving skills.

 

5. 良好沟通表达能力，有较强的责任心，具有良好的主动推进能力和团队合作精神

 

Good communication and presentation skills, strong sense of responsibility, self-motivated

 

and strong team collaboration.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing, and Software Development
description:
Job Description



The compiler team within the Software and Advanced Technology Group at Intel has an opportunity available for a Compiler Engineer. This is a great opportunity to on work on cutting-edge technologies to design, develop, debug, test compiler software and programming languages. You will be working on advanced compiler optimizations and features specific for Intel Architectures, parallelization and vectorization through compilers, new programming languages support. As an engineer in this role, you will have an opportunity to work and collaborate with hardware engineering teams, external partners and be a member of communities developing compilers, participate in language and standard groups.



An Ideal Candidate Would Exhibit Behavioral Skills That Indicate




Strong communication skills, including an ability to break down complex issues into concise and accurate summaries




Qualifications



You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.



Minimum Qualifications




Bachelor's degree with 3+ years of experience or a Master's degree in the above fields with 2+ years of experience, or PhD. degree in in Computer Engineering, Computer Science or Electrical Engineering or Electronics engineer in or Physics or Mathematics or SW Engineering or Scientific computing or Mechanical engineering or Mechatronics or related technical discipline.

2+ years of experience in C/C++, object-oriented programming

6+ months of experience working on compiler development such as LLVM or GCC or similar tools.




Preferred Qualifications




Knowledge of x86 instruction set architecture and Advanced Vector Extensions (AVX)

Experience with vectorization and parallel programming models such as OpenMP and/or SYCL and/or GPU programming



Inside this Business Group


Enable amazing computing experiences with Intel Software continues to shape the way people think about computing – across CPU, GPU, and FPGA architectures. Get your hands on new technology and collaborate with some of the smartest people in the business. Our developers and software engineers work in all software layers, across multiple operating systems and platforms to enable cutting-edge solutions. Ready to solve some of the most complex software challenges? Explore an impactful and innovative career in Software.

Intel is committed to a culture of accessibility. Intel provides accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. Find information and request accommodation here

491431BR


Introduction


IBM's Watson Health Cúram Solution team is now searching for Java/J2EE Technical consultants to join our team!

We live in a moment of remarkable change and opportunity. Discover what you can make of this moment and apply now to explore this opportunity with us.

In this role in the Watson Health Cúram team, you will support clients implement the Cúram Social Platform Management (SPM). You will join a dynamic team that works with customers to meet their business objectives while embracing emerging and cutting-edge technologies, new standards and solving complex problems.

You will continue to develop expertise in the technical aspects of IBM Watson Health SPM solutions and work closely, at project sites, with clients, systems integration partners and delivery teams.

Cúram SPM Solutions offer full life-cycle support for managing health and social programs from needs to outcomes. By designing around the client, Cúram SPM solutions empower organizations to collaborate around client needs, providing citizens with easier access to governmental services and offering more effective ways to achieve desired health and social goals..

To learn more about what we are doing, check us out …

https://www.ibm.com/watson/health/government/

https://www.ibm.com/watson/health/social-program-management/release-v7.0/index.html



Must be flexible to travel to client project sites.




Your Role and Responsibilities




Create functional and technical designs as well as solution prototypes, to support SPM configurations and extensions such as workflow, rules and/or integrations, while adhering to W3C and accessibility guidelines

Demonstrate problem solving expertise through investigation and resolution of issues such as situations where actual test results do not match expected test results.

Work closely with client and partner staff on matters related to the Cúram SPM technical architecture and communicate effectively (both written and verbal)

Establish and maintain positive and effective working relationships with fellow employees, System Integration partners and clients, to promote IBM WH as a trusted partner.

Maintain industry standard version controls.

Facilitate requirements and fit/gap workshops with client staff on technical topics and non-functional requirements.

Develop, code and unit test Cúram extensions in a J2EE environment, using application services like Web Design System, WebSphere or WebLogic, and DBs like Oracle and DB2.

Working within multiple delivery approaches, e.g. Agile, Waterfall, Hybrid, Devops, etc 




Required Technical and Professional Expertise




Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science/Information technology related domains.

At least 5 to 8 years’ hands on experience in application design/development/unit testing processes.

At least 5 years’ experience in Java /JEE/ J2EE development. Willingness to ramp up to hands-on Cúram design and development practice. Understand and employ deployment architecture for Cúram SPM.

Experience working with the Integrated Development Environment such as Eclipse, Eclipse based IDE products such as IBM RSA or similar.

At least 2-year experience working with relational databases (DB2 or Oracle) and SQL.

Knowledge of Application Servers like WebSphere or WebLogic, WebSphere Liberty.

Knowledge of Webservers such as Tom

Knowledge of JMS/Messaging, Webservice (SOAP/REST).

Experience in working with web technologies such as HTML, CSS, jQuery, JavaScript and XML.

Knowledge and experience working in flavors of UNIX/NT Operating Systems.

Experience working in different SDLC life cycle methodologies such as Agile, Waterfall.

Good understanding of a standard deployment model for a typical n-tier enterprise Java/J2EE web application.

Must be eligible to obtain Government of Canada security clearance




Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise




1 to 2 years of experience in IBM Cúram Social Program, development, design, and build deployments.

Excellent communication & documentation skills to articulate the solution.

Experience in implementation of ERP or commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) package software or similar is a plus.

Knowledge of deploying enterprise applications on app servers such as WebSphere/WebLogic is preferable.

Experience in modern UI/UX design and user research practices, tools, languages is a plus.

Experience with UML (Class, Sequence, Domain Model) and various design patterns

Experience in working with ReactJS & Redux.

Experience in Defect logging, tracking and monitoring using Bugzilla, JIRA and ALM/Quality Center

Experience in White Box and Black Box Testing, which includes Functional, Regression, Integration, End to End, Load, System Testing, Performance testing

Experience in developing SOAP and REST based web services

Expertise in automation using Selenium WebDriver with Java/Python and HP UFT

Knowledgeable of DevOps and CI/CD automation tools such as Jenkins, Git, Github, Azure DevOps, Pipelines, Infrastructure automation tools like Chef or Puppet or Ansible, Ansible Tower.

Knowledge on AWS/Azure/Jenkins CI-CD Pipelines

Knowledge of scripting with one or more: YAML, JSON, PowerShell, BASH or Python

Knowledge of Docker and Kubernetes container orchestration and management platforms e.g., Redhat OpenShift, IBM Kubernetes Services, AKS, IBM Cloud Services or equivalent implementation is a must.

Familiarity with the logging and monitoring tools such as Log4j, ELK, Splunk is a plus

Knowledge of analytics and Data Science is a plus.

Experience working as Cloud and DevOps consultant for an IT professional services firm or similar background.



Must have the ability to work in Canada without sponsorship.


About Business Unit


IBM’s Cloud and Cognitive software business is committed to bringing the power of IBM’s Cloud and Watson/AI technologies to life for our clients and ecosystem partners around the world. IBM provides you with the most comprehensive and consistent approach to development, security and operations across hybrid environments—with complete software solutions for business and IT operations, development, data science, security, and management. Our experts and software capabilities help organizations develop applications once and deploy them anywhere, integrate security across the breadth of their IT estate, and automate operations with management visibility. With IBM, you also have access to new skills and methods, governance and management approaches, and a deep ecosystem of industry experts and partners.

This role requires you to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to your start date. Full vaccination refers to receiving dosage of COVID-19 vaccines that provide full protection in accordance with Canada Public Health and WHO guidance (full series of a 2 dose vaccine plus 14 days or a one dose vaccine plus 14 days from the last dose). Proof of vaccination status will be required. Booster vaccination requirements may be required. If you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical or religious reasons, we offer accommodations in accordance with applicable law.


Your Life @ IBM


Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.


About IBM


IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.


Location Statement


This role will involve working with technology that is covered by Export Regulations sanctions. If you are a Foreign National from any of the following US sanctioned countries (Cuba, Iran, North Korea, and Syria) on a work permit, you are not eligible for employment in this position.


Being You @ IBM


IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Senior Software Developer
, IT (Contract) - will collaborate closely with system analysts, infrastructure analyst and business analyst to not only build incredible Farmer-Member facing products, but also developer-facing tools.








 KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES





1. User Interface/User Experience/Front End Development:




• Experience with modern web technologies such as 
JavaScript, ReactJS,
 or others

• Build reusable components with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for use across large-scale properties and documenting them in style guides.

• Create websites, landing pages, and web applications that are responsive, performant, and accessible that engage audiences using dynamic and complex interactions.

• Develop Content Management workflows and functionality that allow other teams to deploy content quickly across languages.

• Strong knowledge in software and infrastructure security, accessibility, and responsive design

• Interacts and engages with consumers/users and involves technical support teams in understanding the needs of the consumer/user, availing insights that ultimately lead to an increased positive impact on user experience.

• Work together with backend developers in building features and efficiencies for the realization of the anticipated products.




2. Technical Experiences




• Excellent understanding of Object-Oriented principles, Design Patterns, Domain-Driven design, and software development best practices

• Perform full-stack development and maintain custom-developed software programs for both front and back-end for desktop, client/server, and/or web environment

• Experience with back-end languages such as PHP, Python, NodeJS, or others

• Work with cloud technologies and implementation of platform features within the cloud

• Write clean code that is maintainable and extensible.

• Build reusable code and libraries for future use.

• API design & implementation experience

• Proficiency with SQL and databases, SQL Server preferred







QUALIFICATIONS Education:

Minimum of 5-10 years’ experience in Information Technology





Technical Skills





• 
React or React Native, 
Java, Node.js, PHP, Python.


• SAPUI5
 (Preferred)

• RESTful API, XML, JSON and Postman API Platform

• SQL Server, MySQL

• Azure Cloud Services, Microsoft Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 REST API, Microsoft Graph APIs and Power Platform

• CMS (Content Management System)

• SSH File Transfer Protocol (SFTP) server

• JIRA, GitHub, Bitbucket Competencies

industries: Computer Hardware Manufacturing, Software Development, and Computers and Electronics Manufacturing
description:
About Our Client:






Our clients are manufacturers of computer electronics systems for business. They have been around for a few decades and have employees globally. They are looking for software developers with good development skills in C# / .net.






Scope of Work:






Design and implement robust software solutions to support our client’s manufacturing facilities

Participate in the full software development life cycle

Plan, design and co-ordinate the development using object oriented programming techniques.

Collect and document requirements and develop logical and physical specifications.

Maintain legacy applications

Maintain software build systems

Assess, test, troubleshoot, document, upgrade and develop maintenance procedures for applications.

Coordinate the development of software and integrated information systems, process control software and / or embedded software control systems.






Success Profile






Expert level knowledge of C# / .Net and Microservices architecture

3 to 5 years of software development life cycle experience with a good mix of front and back end development experience

Experience with databases such as SQL or NoSQL, MySQL and Elasticsearch

Experience with web front-end and framework such as Angular or React preferred

OOP principles, software architecture design, debugging and performance tuning skills

Successfully completed LinkedIn assessment for C#

Able to successfully pass our client's initial C# assessment during pre-screening






Why Work for Our Clients:



 



Competitive compensation and benefits

Extended Health Benefits

Opportunity to work on exciting projects

Hybrid work environment
