industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Banking, and Financial Services
description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com



Job Description




What you'll be doing


You’ll be joining CIBC’s Capital Markets Technology Application Engineering Group and be at the heart of CIBC’s digital transformation, successfully delivering complex, enterprise-scale cloud based applications involving multiple back-end systems. As a 
Sr 
 
Java Developer
 , you will build, implement and maintain , flexible and modular solutions that enhance the client experience across lines of businesses. You’ll assist with the planning and strategy for the technical design, development and integration of these applications.



How You'll Succeed




Programming Skills - Develop code and test computer programs for straightforward assignments. Review, analyze, and modify programming systems, including encoding, testing, and debugging. 

Systems Implementation - Participate in the technical design, development, and integration of cross functional, multi-platform application systems. 

Planning and Coordination - Effectively interact with team members, end users, business analysts, and technical resources to gather requirements and prepare design specifications as instructed by senior team members. 




Who You Are




You can demonstrate experience with: 5+ years’ working software development experience. This role requires Java (Java EE/Java SE) development ability. Also, having good knowledge of GoLang would be desirable. Ideally you are familiar with Containerization (Docker), Azure Cloud, Kubernetes (or Red Hat OpenShift), Web Services/API, Web Security, Networking and Unix. This role will function as a subject matter expert (SME) to other developers, in addition to hands-on coding. 

Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard. 

You embrace and champion change. You'll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best. 

You’re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends. 

You're driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision. 

Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability. 




What CIBC Offers



At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:


 Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

 Connect : Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

 Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, and individual development planning

 Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan




What You Need To Know




 CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com 

 You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit 

 CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation. 



Job Location


Toronto-22 Front St., 3rd


Employment Type


Regular


Weekly Hours


37.5

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Marketing Services, and Software Development
description:
The team:

The Digital Business Solution (DBS) team is responsible for the support, evolution and implementation of new business solutions across the company. As part of a major digital transformation, we own a portfolio of projects and initiatives covering a large variety of applications and fields of expertise (ERP, CRM, custom made applications, Business Intelligence, etc.).

As part of our growing activity, we are looking to expand our Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM and Power Platform team. As an experienced CRM Software Developer, you will contribute to the development and deployment of new modules to support our activity.

What your day will look like:


Develop, update and fix software in DevOps environments

Participate in operations and development activities managed with Jira tool

Prepare and execute integration and functional testing

Provide level of efforts and estimated completion dates

Execute support and troubleshooting activities in test and production environments



About you:


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent work experience

Minimum 3 years of experience in Dynamics CRM development (2013/2016/365 Online)

Experience building Logic and/or PowerApps in Microsoft Azure environment 

Strong background in application development

Ability to understand flow of information and business processes

Fluent in English (written & oral)



Great if you have:


Experience with Power Platform Canvas Apps

Experience with C#/.NET and ADX Studio

Experience with SQL server data modelling and tools

Experience with ERP (Dynamics AX/365) systems

Experience with Agile methodology

Experience in migration and integration tools

Experience in multinational business environment



Let’s talk perks!


Attractive compensation package

Training Tuition Reimbursement Program

Subsidized meals in our amazing Bistro (Les Cordons Bleus)/ Virtual cooking classes

Work-life balance with a flexible working schedule

Free, unlimited coffee

Private, free parking for all employees

Onsite fitness facility with personal trainer/ Virtual exercise classes



Would you like to know what it looks like to work at Genetec? Click on the following link to find out for yourself! Genetec Culture

Thank you for your application, but please note that only qualified candidates will be contacted. Head-hunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumés/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers.

Our team, Global Partner Engineering & Tech, is looking for impact-focused, entrepreneurial engineers ready to bring their ideas and make a difference. We apply our engineering skills and business savvy to solve challenges at the intersection of business and innovation in many of today’s most exciting industries and products. These include Facebook Watch, Marketplace, Instagram Shopping, Oculus, Portal, Games, Workplace, AI and many more. We are engineers, and we write scalable, high performance code across Facebook's products to ship new solutions that address partners’ opportunities and challenges. We also design and deliver technical solutions critical to our partners’ success. In doing so, we help partners realize the full value of working with the Facebook family of apps focusing on helping them grow their business with us while reducing the effort and investment to leverage our platforms. As a Partner Engineer, you will get the opportunity to see the business impact of the solutions you build with our partners. You will get to learn and build on different tech stacks and languages. You will use your entrepreneurial passion and the freedom that the role provides to create your own opportunities and choose how you make an impact. In short, it’s like being the engineering lead in a startup. Role Types:We have a few different role types available in Partner Engineering depending on your interests and skill sets as follows: Partner Engineer: This role includes a combination of partner-facing time to understand their technical and business needs and then code solutions to address those needs. That coding output can be in the form of APIs, product integrations or tools to help partners and Facebook achieve mutually beneficial outcomes.Systems & Tools Engineer: This role is primarily coding on internal systems & tools to help us operate more efficiently in Partnerships and deliver more value to our partners. There is a range of projects including partner management systems and tools, video/news/music content management systems, API/platform management and much more.-------Notre équipe, Global Partner Engineering & Tech, est à la recherche d'ingénieurs axés sur l'impact et l'esprit d'entreprise, prêts à apporter leurs idées et à faire la différence. Nous appliquons nos compétences en ingénierie et notre sens des affaires pour résoudre des problèmes à l'intersection des affaires et de l'innovation dans de nombreux secteurs et produits comptant parmi les plus passionnants du moment. Il s'agit notamment de Facebook Watch, Marketplace, Instagram Shopping, Oculus, Portal, Jeux, Workplace, IA et bien d'autres. Nous sommes des ingénieurs, et nous écrivons du code évolutif et performant sur l'ensemble des produits Facebook pour expédier de nouvelles solutions qui répondent aux opportunités et aux défis des partenaires. Nous concevons et fournissons également des solutions techniques essentielles à la réussite de nos partenaires. Ce faisant, nous aidons nos partenaires à tirer le meilleur parti de leur collaboration avec la famille d'applications Facebook en les aidant à développer leurs activités avec nous tout en réduisant les efforts et les investissements nécessaires pour exploiter nos plateformes. En tant qu'ingénieur partenaire, vous aurez l'occasion de voir l'impact commercial des solutions que vous construisez avec nos partenaires. Vous aurez l'occasion d'apprendre et de construire sur différentes piles technologiques et différents langages. Vous utiliserez votre passion pour l'entrepreneuriat et la liberté que vous offre ce poste pour créer vos propres opportunités et choisir la manière dont vous aurez un impact. En bref, c'est comme être l'ingénieur en chef d'une startup. Types de postes :Nous avons plusieurs types de postes disponibles dans l'ingénierie des associés/associées, en fonction de vos intérêts et de vos compétences : Ingénieur associé/associée : Ce poste consiste à passer du temps avec les associés/associées pour comprendre leurs besoins techniques et commerciaux, puis à coder des solutions pour répondre à ces besoins. Ce codage peut prendre la forme d'API, d'intégrations de produits ou d'outils pour aider les partenaires et Facebook à atteindre des résultats mutuellement bénéfiques.Ingénieur des systèmes et outils : Ce poste consiste principalement à coder des systèmes et des outils internes pour nous aider à fonctionner plus efficacement dans les partenariats et à offrir plus de valeur à nos partenaires. Il existe une gamme de projets comprenant des systèmes et des outils de gestion des partenaires, des systèmes de gestion du contenu vidéo/nouvelles/musique, la gestion des API/plateformes et bien plus encore.

Partner Engineer | Ingénieur associé/associée Responsibilities:



Deeply understand Facebook apps and products (e.g., Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, Messenger, Oculus, Portal, Workplace, video, games, payments) and their underlying implementation | Comprendre en profondeur les applications et produits Facebook (par exemple, Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, Messenger, Oculus, Portal, Workplace, vidéo, jeux, paiements) et leur mise en œuvre sous-jacente

Write and ship reliable, scalable, and efficient code | Rédiger et expédier du code fiable, évolutif et efficace

Be a subject matter expert in relevant project/product and technology areas. Build and improve solutions in collaboration with engineering, product, and cross functional partners | Être un expert en la matière dans les domaines pertinents du projet/produit et de la technologie. Construire et améliorer des solutions en collaboration avec l'ingénierie, le produit et les associés/associées transversaux/transversales

Identify and surface insights using metrics on product usage to increase adoption and provide new solutions that address the needs of our partners | Identifier et faire émerger des idées en utilisant des statistiques sur l'utilisation du produit pour augmenter l'adoption et fournir de nouvelles solutions qui répondent aux besoins de nos partenaires

Use broad range of technical and soft skills to build productive relationships with our partners, and independently resolve complex technical and business needs while contributing to partner documentation | Utiliser un large éventail de compétences techniques et non techniques pour établir des relations productives avec nos associés/associées, et résoudre de manière indépendante des besoins techniques et commerciaux complexes tout en contribuant à la documentation des associés/associées

Use expertise and product insight to deliver high-quality project/integration/partner engagements, while influencing product roadmap to meet the business needs | Utiliser l'expertise et la connaissance des produits pour fournir des engagements de qualité en matière de projets, d'intégration et de partenariat, tout en influençant la feuille de route des produits pour répondre aux besoins de l'entreprise

Guide workflow changes, and gain consensus from stakeholders while driving toward solutions | Guider les changements de flux de travail et obtenir le consensus des parties prenantes tout en recherchant des solutions

Respond and maintain effective communication with industry partners and internal stakeholders | Répondre et maintenir une communication efficace avec les partenaires industriels et les parties prenantes internes

Work with partners to develop a long- term strategic plan, grounded on business objectives, and manage partners during integrations with Facebook’s platform products and ensure value creation | Travailler avec les partenaires pour développer un plan stratégique à long terme, fondé sur les objectifs commerciaux, et gérer les partenaires pendant les intégrations avec les produits de la plateforme Facebook et assurer la création de valeur

Represent Facebook and our products, APIs and tools in partner meetings and industry events including F8 | Représenter Facebook et ses produits, les API et outils lors de réunions d’associés/associées et d'événements industriels, notamment le F8

Understand organizational structure and cross functional team dynamics and is able to get support from those teams as needed | Comprendre la structure organisationnelle et la dynamique des équipes interfonctionnelles et être capable d'obtenir le soutien de ces équipes si nécessaire

Build and manage strong working relationships with technical counterparts. Mentor and share knowledge with peers, creating positive atmosphere amongst team | Construire et gérer de solides relations de travail avec les homologues techniques. Assurer le mentorat et partager les connaissances avec ses pairs, en créant une atmosphère positive au sein de l'équipe

Willingness to travel approximately 20% of the time | Volonté de voyager environ 20 % du temps



Minimum Qualifications:



4+ years of experience as a software engineer building and shipping products or equivalent experience | Plus de 4 ans d'expérience en tant qu'ingénieur logiciel pour la création et la livraison de produits ou une expérience équivalente

B.A./B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science or equivalent degree or experience | B.A./B.S. ou M.S. en informatique ou diplôme ou expérience équivalente

Experience with open source languages such as PHP, Python, Ruby, Objective-C/C++, Swift, Java, Kotlin or C# | Expérience des langages open source tels que PHP, Python, Ruby, Objective-C/C++, Swift, Java, Kotlin ou C#

Knowledge of the Web technology stack (for example HTTP, HTML, JavaScript, CSS) | Connaissance de la pile technologique Web (par exemple HTTP, HTML, JavaScript, CSS)

Experience with software design and architecture | Expérience en matière de conception et d'architecture de logiciels

Experience communicating technical concepts to non-technical audiences | Expérience en matière de communication de concepts techniques à des publics non techniques



Preferred Qualifications:



Experience with REST APIs and developer platforms | Expérience des API REST et des plateformes de développement

Experience working on multi-person code bases including open source or personal projects | Expérience de travail sur des bases de code multi-personnes, y compris des projets open source ou personnels

Experience with open source contributions (especially as part of larger projects) | Expérience des contributions open source (notamment dans le cadre de projets plus importants)

Experience contributing to developer and platform documentation | Expérience en matière de contribution à la documentation des développeurs et des plateformes

Client/partner-facing and/or experience communicating to an audience is preferred | L’expérience en matière de contact avec les clients/partenaires et/ou de communication avec un public est préférable

Experience working with cloud computing platforms such as AWS, GCP | Expérience en matière de travail avec des plateformes d’informatique en nuage telles que AWS, GCP

We are seeking a Senior Java Developer with hands-on Guidewire Policy Centre experience

Work Experience- 3-10 Years - 

﻿Strong Java server-side programming experience with strong understanding of object-oriented design and programming

Strong Configuration experience


Responsibilities: • Provides fixes and enhancements to Guidewire Policy Centre


• Partner with client business teams to understand business objectives and integration requirements

• Estimate the effort required to build necessary integration programs

• Work with the configuration/functional analyst to design/develop solutions

• Develop custom integration points to connect Guidewire applications with other internal and external.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Computer Games
description:
Job Summary



At Maxis, we're looking for a software engineer to work on cloud web services that help us bring exciting new features to life. You will work with an experienced team that has collectively built Maxis games for more than two decades. You will work with multiple backend engineers, prototyping and shipping features that expand the infrastructure supporting The Sims franchise. You will report to a Development Director for the backend services team and the bulk of your work will be done in Kubernetes, Helm, and Terraform; configure and deploy our services to a Kubernetes cluster that runs on the Google Cloud Platform.


As a Backend Software Engineer at Maxis, you will



Develop responsive, resilient, massively scalable, and globally available web services that support millions of players

Creatively blend security best practices and original techniques to keep user data secure and prevent cheating

Apply and improve service deployment and troubleshooting strategies that maximize uptime

Guide the design and implementation of infrastructure configuration and deployment strategies

Demonstrate excellent technical problem-solving skills while responding to the changing requirements of the game development process

Work with the backend team to author and review technical design documents for new features, and the cloud infrastructure configuration needed to support those features

Support a great player experience for The Sims players by participating in live service support, incident troubleshooting, and resolution




Qualifications



Please note that you do not need to satisfy all requirements to be considered. We encourage you to apply if you can meet most of the requirements and are comfortable having an open conversation about your qualifications.


You have a Bachelor/Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related field.

You have 3+ years of job experience in a hands-on coding, DevOps, or infrastructure configuration role

You've shipped and supported scalable web services hosted in the cloud

You've deployed web services using Kubernetes and containerization

You've owned large systems and features from design to deployment, including live service support

You develop infrastructure for products that release new updates with zero downtime

You have experience with load testing, troubleshooting, and optimizing the performance of web services

You're willing to support a great player experience by participating in live service support and incident troubleshooting and resolution

You have experience with CI/CD pipeline technology like Gitlab CI

You're willing to iterate quickly and develop multiple short-lived prototypes

You have excellent written and verbal communication skills

You have a desire to teach and learn from your peers



Pluses



You have experience with Google Cloud Platform, including Google Kubernetes Engine, or Google Cloud Spanner

You have experience using Helm for managing kubernetes applications

You've shipped web services that scale to millions of daily users

You have experience developing services that support mobile applications

You've worked in the games industry before

You've built software with Java, Kotlin, Go, or the Spring Boot Framework

You've worked on large teams using version control tools like git

You have experience with distributed streaming technologies like Kafka

You have experience working in large data-driven services

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
About HashiCorp



At HashiCorp, we’re building a generation-defining infrastructure software company, powered by our core principles and a growing team of talented, committed professionals working together to help organizations seamlessly transition to and operate in the cloud. Founded in 2012 and headquartered in San Francisco, 85 percent of our employees work remotely, strategically distributed around the globe. From our inception we built the company with a remote-first approach because we believe talent has no boundaries.

Product Security Engineer

HashiCorp is a fast-growing startup that solves development, operations, and security challenges in infrastructure so organizations can focus on business-critical tasks. Our open source software is used by millions of users to provision, secure, connect, and run any infrastructure for any application. The Global 2000 uses our enterprise software to accelerate application delivery and drive innovation through software.

We are looking for Product Security Engineers to help scale our product security function, which works closely with engineering & product management to ensure that security is appropriately addressed across the HashiCorp suite of cloud and self-managed products. This role will report to our Director of Product Security.

Security at HashiCorp is a remote team. While prior experience working remotely isn't required, we are looking for team members who perform well given a high level of independence and autonomy.



In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Include




Contribute to secure architecture and design of HashiCorp products.

Work across various product and engineering teams to prioritize security features and bugs, and ensure implementation and mitigations.

Monitor threats and vulnerabilities impacting HashiCorp products and services; triage reported vulnerabilities, identify mitigations and assess/communicate associated risk.

Plan & execute security assessments (dynamic testing, static testing, code review, etc) and threat modeling of HashiCorp’s products, services, and associated cloud infrastructure.

Build and implement security solutions across the product life-cycle, such as standalone security tools, CI/CD pipeline integrations, product security features/fixes, etc.

Act as SME on multiple information security areas (e.g. security architecture, application security, threat modeling etc.)

Assist in execution of 3rd-party audits, penetration tests, and bug bounty programs.

Contribute to the creation and delivery of security training.

Research emerging attack vectors and techniques.


We are looking for talented self-starters with 4+ years of security experience. We will consider experienced engineers with less security-specific experience but the desire to learn!


You may be a good fit if you have knowledge and experience around:



Product / service architectures in modern cloud environments (IaaS, SaaS, PaaS).

Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, and/or Google Cloud Platform (GCP).

Modern engineering practices, processes, and tools, particularly related to the Go programming language and ecosystem.

Secure development practices, and integration into broader engineering activities.

Secure operations practices, specifically wrt. cloud environments.

Application and infrastructure security testing methodologies and tools.

Security design / architecture and threat modeling.

Vulnerabilities (old and new), and options for defense / mitigation.

Product vulnerability management lifecycle.

Security audits, penetration tests, and/or bug bounty programs.

Cryptography and cryptographic libraries.


HashiCorp embraces diversity and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We believe the more inclusive we are, the better our company will be. Interested, and think you might be a fit? Apply today!

HashiCorp embraces diversity and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We believe the more inclusive we are, the better our company will be.

For more information regarding how HashiCorp collects, uses, and manages personal information, please review our Privacy Policy.

Course Hero 
is scaling!

We are looking for a Staff ML Software Engineer who can help us build an end-to-end platform for scaling machine learning (ML) experiments, ML microservices deployment, and configuration management of ML models. You&CloseCurlyQuote;ll be a part of the Machine Learning Product Engineering team at Course Hero and collaborate cross-functionally to ship ML products that personalize learning experiences for students and help educators create unique course content. The scalable ML systems you build will enable our product designers to bring intelligent data products to the Course Hero platform.

A Course Hero Staff ML Engineer is a technical leader who provides mentorship for team members, drives execution on key projects, and participates in the continuous improvement of our software systems. We expect you to thrive in a fast-paced, high-growth environment, and adapt to ever-changing business needs. You can view these videos to learn more about our engineering culture, and our company mission.


Here are some ways you&CloseCurlyQuote;ll make an impact:



Architect, create, and maintain a scalable platform for training, deploying, and monitoring ML models, microservices, and APIs in modern containerized cloud environments.

Automate various steps in ML workflow, from model training, inference, and deployment. 

Build prototypes/web apps to rapidly experiment on various versions of ML algorithms and DNN architectures for optimized content recommendations to our customers.

Partner with ML engineers, data scientists/engineers, and product engineering teams to understand business needs, find the right solution to a problem, and ship products.




Are you our next Staff ML Platform Engineer?



You have 8 years of experience working as a software engineer, with 2-3 years on a Machine Learning focused product or infrastructure.

You have 3-5 years of experience writing Python code in production 

Demonstrated knowledge of SQL/NoSQL databases, RESTful APIs, and docker-containerized microservice-based architectures.

Experience with the AWS ecosystem including ML frameworks like Athena, S3, EMR Spark, Sagemaker, Tensorflow.

Experience with Docker, Kubernetes or similar orchestration and configuration management




Nice to have:



Exposure to a variety of machine learning algorithms (both supervised and unsupervised) and/or experience working with ML teams in the past

BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Math

Passionate about education




Benefits & Perks!



Competitive salary and stock options

Full medical coverage (medical, dental, vision)

401(k) program with match

Education Reimbursement

Quarterly team events and outings (Sporting Events, Escape Rooms, Go-Kart Racing, Karaoke, Bowling and much more!)

Free lunches twice a week, on-site cafe discount, plus an endless snack and drink supply

Onsite gym – Pacific Shores Center – Classes – Pool – Spa – Rock Wall - Massages!

Commuter benefits, shuttle service from Redwood City, and cell-phone allowance

10K Local Move Program to move within 10 miles of our office

16 weeks of paid leave for maternity or paternity

8 hours per quarter paid time for volunteering for a cause of your choice

Front row seat to Master Educator lectures – check out videos on our LinkedIn Career Page




Equal Employment Opportunity Statement (EEO)


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and  inclusion within our company.  We will consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender  identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status,  veteran status, or  ability status. We will ensure that individuals who are differently abled are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment as provided to other applicants or employees. Please contact us to request accommodation.


About Us:


Course Hero is on a mission to help students graduate, confident and prepared. The online learning platform offers over 60 million course-specific study resources created by and for students and educators, as well as 24/7 tutor help. More than 65,000 verified college educators use Course Hero to collaborate with other faculty and share resources to hone new strategies for instruction. Everyday, students, educators and tutors help more than 20 million students make every study hour count.

We have an awesome team and a truly engaging culture. We are customer-focused, collaborative, responsible, gritty, and we love to learn. Our bold mission is to help students graduate confident and prepared!

We are not the only ones that think we&CloseCurlyQuote;re onto something big. Course Hero has been recognized as one of the 
2021 Top 100 Best Places to Work in the Bay Area

, 

Top 50 Best Paying Companies in the Bay Area

, 

Top 100 Most Transparent Companies
, and in the 
Top 50 Most Transformational Companies in Education Technology
. Read up on some of our recent 
news coverage

,
 
blog

,
 and learn more 
about us
 to see what it is like to work with our team.

Join us on our mission!

description:
About HashiCorp



At HashiCorp, we’re building a generation-defining infrastructure software company, powered by our core principles and a growing team of talented, committed professionals working together to help organizations seamlessly transition to and operate in the cloud. Founded in 2012 and headquartered in San Francisco, 85 percent of our employees work remotely, strategically distributed around the globe. From our inception we built the company with a remote-first approach because we believe talent has no boundaries.

Product Security Engineer

HashiCorp is a fast-growing startup that solves development, operations, and security challenges in infrastructure so organizations can focus on business-critical tasks. Our open source software is used by millions of users to provision, secure, connect, and run any infrastructure for any application. The Global 2000 uses our enterprise software to accelerate application delivery and drive innovation through software.

We are looking for Product Security Engineers to help scale our product security function, which works closely with engineering & product management to ensure that security is appropriately addressed across the HashiCorp suite of cloud and self-managed products. This role will report to our Director of Product Security.

Security at HashiCorp is a remote team. While prior experience working remotely isn't required, we are looking for team members who perform well given a high level of independence and autonomy.



In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Include




Contribute to secure architecture and design of HashiCorp products.

Work across various product and engineering teams to prioritize security features and bugs, and ensure implementation and mitigations.

Monitor threats and vulnerabilities impacting HashiCorp products and services; triage reported vulnerabilities, identify mitigations and assess/communicate associated risk.

Plan & execute security assessments (dynamic testing, static testing, code review, etc) and threat modeling of HashiCorp’s products, services, and associated cloud infrastructure.

Build and implement security solutions across the product life-cycle, such as standalone security tools, CI/CD pipeline integrations, product security features/fixes, etc.

Act as SME on multiple information security areas (e.g. security architecture, application security, threat modeling etc.)

Assist in execution of 3rd-party audits, penetration tests, and bug bounty programs.

Contribute to the creation and delivery of security training.

Research emerging attack vectors and techniques.


We are looking for talented self-starters with 4+ years of security experience. We will consider experienced engineers with less security-specific experience but the desire to learn!


You may be a good fit if you have knowledge and experience around:



Product / service architectures in modern cloud environments (IaaS, SaaS, PaaS).

Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, and/or Google Cloud Platform (GCP).

Modern engineering practices, processes, and tools, particularly related to the Go programming language and ecosystem.

Secure development practices, and integration into broader engineering activities.

Secure operations practices, specifically wrt. cloud environments.

Application and infrastructure security testing methodologies and tools.

Security design / architecture and threat modeling.

Vulnerabilities (old and new), and options for defense / mitigation.

Product vulnerability management lifecycle.

Security audits, penetration tests, and/or bug bounty programs.

Cryptography and cryptographic libraries.


HashiCorp embraces diversity and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We believe the more inclusive we are, the better our company will be. Interested, and think you might be a fit? Apply today!

HashiCorp embraces diversity and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We believe the more inclusive we are, the better our company will be.

For more information regarding how HashiCorp collects, uses, and manages personal information, please review our Privacy Policy.

Who Is Recruiting From Scratch



Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. description:
Company Description



Since we first opened our doors in 2009, the world of commerce has evolved immensely – and so has Square. After enabling anyone to take a payment and never miss a sale, we saw sellers stymied by disparate, outmoded products and tools that wouldn’t work together. So we expanded into software and started building integrated, omnichannel solutions – to help sellers sell online, manage inventory, run a busy kitchen, book appointments, engage loyal buyers, and hire and pay staff. And across it all, we’ve embedded financial services tools at the point of sale, so merchants can access a business loan and manage their cash flow all in one place.

Today, we’re a partner to sellers of all sizes – large, enterprise-scale businesses with complex commerce operations, sellers just starting out, as well as merchants who began selling with Square and have grown larger over time. As our sellers scale, so do our solutions. We all grow together.

There is a massive opportunity in front of us. We’re building a business that is big, meaningful, and lasting. And we are helping sellers around the world do the same.



Job Description



Mobile Test Engineering team develops frameworks, infrastructure, and tooling to ensure that mobile tests are fast, reliable, and easy to create. We strive to automate testing as much as possible so that the need for manual QA testing is minimal and ensure that the quality of existing tests are higher.

We're looking for folks who are excited to solve problems and find solutions that empower hundreds of mobile developers to ship high-quality code faster. You will be part of a team who partners closely with other mobile platform teams to support the entire mobile development lifecycle as well as all the mobile product engineering teams. This is a high force multiplier, cross-functional team aiming to enhance the development experience for all mobile developers within Square.



You Will




 Develop and maintain frameworks for high level testing capabilities.

Develop tooling and metrics to understand what is being tested and how it is tested.

Maintain and optimize the infrastructure to run tests both locally and on CI.

Create and evangelize processes to help enforce test quality.

Own the success of your team's projects, and deliver quantifiable results.

Work with world-class, experienced, and dedicated engineers.




Qualifications




Have at least 3+ years of experience working in the iOS ecosystem.

Be proficient in Objective-C or Swift for development (we use both).

Enjoy working on mobile apps at all levels – from networking up to user interfaces and whatever's in between.

Respond to customer feedback to improve our frameworks and tools.

Have an eagerness to share your ideas, and openness to those of others.

Quickly and easily articulate issues and what needs to be done to resolve them




Additional Information



We’re working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace. Block is a proud equal opportunity employer. We work hard to evaluate all employees and job applicants consistently, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.

We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible. 

Want to learn more about what we’re doing to build a workplace that is fair and square? Check out our I+D page. 



Additionally, we consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment on our team, and always assess candidates on an individualized basis.


Perks


We want you to be well and thrive. Our global benefits package includes:


Healthcare coverage

Retirement Plans

Employee Stock Purchase Program

Wellness perks

Paid parental leave

Paid time off

Learning and Development resources



Block, Inc. (NYSE: SQ) is a global technology company with a focus on financial services. Made up of Square, Cash App, Spiral, TIDAL, and TBD54566975, we build tools to help more people access the economy. Square helps sellers run and grow their businesses with its integrated ecosystem of commerce solutions, business software, and banking services. With Cash App, anyone can easily send, spend, or invest their money in stocks or Bitcoin. Spiral (formerly Square Crypto) builds and funds free, open-source Bitcoin projects. Artists use TIDAL to help them succeed as entrepreneurs and connect more deeply with fans. TBD54566975 is building an open developer platform to make it easier to access Bitcoin and other blockchain technologies without having to go through an institution.

Job Title: 
Sr Serverside Developer (Java OR PHP)

Vancouver, Canada


Type: 
Long Term Contract / Full time Permanent


 


Key Responsibilities:


• Design and develop applications, system-to-system interfaces and complete software solutions

• Implement solutions that meet performance, scaling and security goals

• Instrument services to provide insight into performance and emerging issues

• Manage servers across multiple environments and regions, deploy updates, migrate databases and build scalability and robustness solutions

• Guide architectural decisions and technical implementation topics

• Analyze requirements and estimate efforts, timeline, dependencies and risks

• Participate in design and code reviews

• Contribute to enhance the development process

Required Skills:

• Minimum of 6 years’ experience in the development of cloud or server-side products, within a professional software development organization

• Strong Experience in Java/PHP

• Strong zeal to learn PHP and start working ASAP

• Experience in the development of custom software solutions (as opposed to deployment of off-the-shelf solutions only)

• Experience in developing Microservices

• Strong problem solving and analytical skills

• Solid software design knowledge – you should know how to create software that is extensible, reusable and meets desired architectural objectives

• Good foundation in software design concepts, design patterns, algorithms and data structures

• Practical experience with source control systems, task and requirements management systems

• A degree in Computer Science, or similar, or equivalent experience

• Excellent communication skills, both oral and written

• Available to work in the PST timezone (remote work and work-from home is acceptable, especially in the short term; later, frequent local interaction preferred)

 


Preferred Optional Skills:


• At least 5 years’ overall relevant professional experience

• Experience with building and managing software packages or server images

• Expertise related to public clouds like Microsoft Azure or Amazon AWS and their tools

• Experience working with cloud-based server environments

• Experience in managing Linux-based infrastructure

• Experience in designing, and implementing scalable and resilient RESTful API services

• Experience in writing documentation and creating design diagrams

• Experience in managing servers, networks, and infrastructure with broad knowledge of the following: networking, servers, virtualization, security, availability, resiliency, redundancy, alerting, and monitoring

• Experience in C#, C++, Python or Scala

• Familiarity with “Infrastructure as Code” tools such as Terraform, CloudFormation, Azure Resource Manager

• Familiarity with databases, such as Redis, Cassandra, MySQL or PostgreSQL

• Understanding of Service Discovery, Inter-Service Communication, Service Deployment and Service Orchestration frameworks

• Good knowledge and experience with Kubernetes, Docker, Jenkins

• Experience with test automation and test frameworks

• Solid practitioner of the Agile/Scrum development process, ideally with test-driven development, DevOps and continuous integration/deployment (CI/CD)

• Familiarity with DevOps tools such as Packer, Vagrant, Vault or Consul

Do What You Love. Love What You Do.


At Workday, we help the world’s largest organizations adapt to what’s next by bringing finance, HR, and planning into a single enterprise cloud. We work hard, and we’re serious about what we do. But we like to have fun, too. We put people first, celebrate diversity, drive innovation, and do good in the communities where we live and work.


About The Team


Welcome to Workday Extended Workforce Technology (XWT). Workday XWT is a multi-functional team of highly skilled individuals collaborating to design and develop innovative solutions to the industries most complex problems, improving the way workforce works! We are a passionate and diverse team of driven individuals who excel at problem solving using multiple programming languages and technologies. Currently we are developing a next generation identity platform responsible for an individual's identity throughout Workday.

Workday is a company that puts its employees first. We believe in recruiting the best talent, treating them well, and empowering them to solve problems. We are a hardworking group who love to have fun while challenging ourselves each and every day!


About The Role


Are you looking to join a fast paced forward-looking team working with innovative new technologies to solve the next generation of complex problems? Are you driven, self-sufficient, and eager to learn new things while having fun? If so, this role might be for you!

Our team values innovation, collaboration, and ownership. You will design and implement features and components in a team oriented environment. You will collaborate with product management to break down high-level product vision into manageable pieces for development. Development work will primarily be in programming languages such as Scala, Java, and Kotlin. You will also actively participate in knowledge sharing via mentoring, code reviews, building design documents, and/or giving technical talks. We are open to hiring either a Software Development Engineer or Senior Software Development Engineer depending on experience and skills of the selected candidate.


About You


You are a backend developer passionate about developing high quality, scalable enterprise solutions. You are not afraid to ask clarifying questions when things are ambiguous. You are disciplined, methodical, and minimalist in constructing layered software components that can be embedded within larger frameworks or applications. You have a deep understanding about software design and system architecture. You are interested in system security and digital identity. You have proven the ability to build complex systems using industry standards in identity, authentication and web services. You are looking to learn from others while mentoring more junior developers.

Basic Qualifications for Software Engineer (P3):


Bachelor's degree in computer science or related fields, or equivalent experience

Ability to speak and write in English fluently

Experience using a source control system like Git, SVN or Mercurial

3+ years of experience programming in Scala, Java, or Kotlin



Basic Qualifications for Senior Software Engineer (P4):


1+ years of experience in a technical leadership role

5+ years of experience programming in Scala, Java, or Kotlin



Other Qualifications for Software Engineer (P3):


Enjoys working in a collaborative environment

Experience developing and maintaining a large web application

Experience with REST API design and security

Experience working on complex software problems

Experience with Jenkins CI/CD



Other Qualifications for Senior Software Engineer (P4):


Experience designing and coordinating medium to large scale projects

Experience with relational database technologies (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL, or SQL Server)

Experience deploying and maintaining production quality services to AWS

Experience developing web applications using standard web authentication and authorization protocols

Scala experience is a plus

Workday is an equal opportunity employer. Candidates who are not vaccinated due to a sincerely held religious belief, medical reasons, or other legally-protected reason should contact accommodations@workday.com to explore what, if any, reasonable accommodations or exemptions Workday is able to offer.

Workday is an Equal Opportunity Employer including individuals with disabilities and protected veterans.

Introduction


At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.


Your Role and Responsibilities




Preferred Location for this role: Fredericton, Ottawa or Markham***



The global cost of cyber-crime is expected to reach over 2 trillion dollars by 2019. At IBM® Security, our mission is to protect our clients from various attacks including malware, identity thief, fraud etc. IBM® Security delivers an integrated system of analytics, real-time defenses and proven experts, so come make a difference & build a career.

We are looking for a Security Intelligence Software & Cloud Orchestration Developer (DevOps) to join our team.


In This Role




You will provide platform and infrastructure support to internal and external customers

You will work with product owners to implement new components, and new features in existing components

You will help your team find and resolve technical debt using agile development practices

You will help your team support and run your services in production in a DevOps-oriented fashion

You will be an early adopter of new product offerings and help innovate 'what's next'



This role will involve working with technology that is covered by Export Regulations sanctions. If you are a Foreign National from any of the following US sanctioned countries (Cuba, Iran, North Korea, and Syria) on a work permit, you are not eligible for employment in this position.


Required Technical and Professional Expertise




English Fluent (verbal and written)

1 year working within Agile Development methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, etc)

1 years experience developing commercial software using Python and/or Java

1 years experience working with UNIX/Linux operating systems

1 years experience writing unit and integration tests

1 years experience working directly with end customers 




Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise




Experience with cloud infrastructure and orchestration technologies such as Kubernetes, Openshfit, Kafka, AWS, Azure, Ansible, Chef, Puppet

Knowledge of secure software engineering and best practices.

Basic experience working with a broad range of Java technologies (e.g., JMS, JNI, JDBC, …)

Basic experience working with GIT

Basic scripting experience using an exhibited language such as Perl and/or Python (additional scripting language knowledge a plus)

Demonstrated understanding of networking protocols and principles

Experience developing commercial software using Javascript/Javascript Frameworks

Basic experience working with security log analysis, application log analysis, and general log management best practices

Relational database concepts

Interest in Cloud computing, Internet of Things, Internet/Network Security



Must have the ability to work in Canada without sponsorship.


About Business Unit


IBM’s Cloud and Cognitive software business is committed to bringing the power of IBM’s Cloud and Watson/AI technologies to life for our clients and ecosystem partners around the world. IBM provides you with the most comprehensive and consistent approach to development, security and operations across hybrid environments—with complete software solutions for business and IT operations, development, data science, security, and management. Our experts and software capabilities help organizations develop applications once and deploy them anywhere, integrate security across the breadth of their IT estate, and automate operations with management visibility. With IBM, you also have access to new skills and methods, governance and management approaches, and a deep ecosystem of industry experts and partners.

This role requires you to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to your start date. Full vaccination refers to receiving dosage of COVID-19 vaccines that provide full protection in accordance with Canada Public Health and WHO guidance (full series of a 2 dose vaccine plus 14 days or a one dose vaccine plus 14 days from the last dose). Proof of vaccination status will be required. Booster vaccination requirements may be required. If you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical or religious reasons, we offer accommodations in accordance with applicable law.


Your Life @ IBM


What matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?

Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.

Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.


About IBM


IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.


Location Statement


This role will involve working with technology that is covered by Export Regulations sanctions. If you are a Foreign National from any of the following US sanctioned countries (Cuba, Iran, North Korea, and Syria) on a work permit, you are not eligible for employment in this position.


Being You @ IBM


IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

description:

We are pleased to offer you a new contract opportunity for you to consider:

ETL Developer


Start: ASAP

Estimated length: 9+ months

Location: Onsite or REMOTE



Please Note: This will be an onsite or remote position


Advantages


You will have an opportunity to work with a leading employer in the local market.


Responsibilities



 Technical requirements documentation

 Data model/star schema

 Data-marts and semantic layers implemented in HAP

 ETL scripts




Qualifications

 Proven expertise with a minimum of three (3) years' experience working on



projects that have a data focus (collection, aggregation, and transformation of

data)


 Demonstrated familiarity with TimeXtender ETL (formerly Discovery Hub)

 Demonstrated experience with dimensional data modeling and relational



databases


 Demonstrated experience translating business requirements into data assets and



solutions

structures

products

considered an asset


Summary


Do you have this experience? If you answer YES, then please apply IMMEDIATELY to so we can then discuss your experience and interest in this opportunity!

Randstad Technologies

Canada's largest provider of IT Staffing Solutions, offering hundreds of permanent and contract opportunities across all roles, levels and platforms. Our Web-based tools help you see and apply for jobs matched automatically to your skills and preferences. When you're ready to interview we meet with you in person to help you build the technology career path you've always wanted. Visit www.randstad.ca to get started!

Do What You Love. Love What You Do.


At Workday, we help the world’s largest organizations adapt to what’s next by bringing finance, HR, and planning into a single enterprise cloud. We work hard, and we’re serious about what we do. But we like to have fun, too. We put people first, celebrate diversity, drive innovation, and do good in the communities where we live and work.


About The Team


At Workday, the Media Cloud Team supports a variety of Workday applications by building systems for uploading, encoding, and streaming media across the globe at scale. We seek skilled and passionate engineers who proudly craft quality code and effectively collaborate with the team and various partners.

You will join our team in Victoria, BC and Vancouver, BC to help drive and build best in class user experiences within Workday’s Media Cloud platform.

The software you write will have a real impact on over 22 million people (and growing!). Our customers include Amazon, Netflix, Patagonia, Sony, Toyota, and many more outstanding companies around the world.


About The Role



Design and develop software and cloud-based infrastructure for an enterprise video service supporting media upload, processing, and playback at scale

Contribute to technical requirements, architecture, and help drive UX / design direction

Innovate on new products and features that scale to millions of users

Deliver reliable software through continuous integration, automated testing, and in-depth code reviews

Responding to process and tooling improvements

Work on an Agile Scrum team, collaborate with product managers, design, quality assurance and peer teams to deliver on shared commitments




About You


Basic Qualifications


2 years’ experience with one or more general purpose programming languages including but not limited to: Java, Kotlin, Python, JavaScript

Knowledge in frequently used design patterns, Familiarity to Cloud architectural patterns, general knowledge in software engineering methodologies




Other Qualifications



Strong problem-solving skills, highly focused in writing testable and scalable code

Eager to learn, pragmatic and self-motivated approach to career growth

Positive demeanor with strong collaboration & interpersonal skills. 

Current eligibility to work in Canada




Are you being referred to one of our roles? If so, ask your connection at Workday about our Employee Referral process!

What is the opportunity?

As a Full Stack Developer in DevOps team, you will be part of the team that works on developing next generation applications serving all segments of RBC Technology and Operations. You will work with internal clients and product owners on building various products that will help boost the developer productivity.

What will you do?

Work on internal facing applications targeted towards developers across the organization

Help design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve applications

Integrate with third party APIs and create scalable apps

Partner with other teams to understand user needs and contribute in delivering solutions to solve complex business problems

Create and maintain technical systems documentation and write concise, well-organized code and sensible tests

What do you need to succeed?

Must have

Minimum 1 year of development experience with React, Java, micro services architecture, Spring Framework (MVC, Security, JPA, Boot), Maven, SQL, Python

Knowledge of developing distributed cloud applications (Cloud Foundry, Kubernetes)

Hands on experience designing, developing, testing and troubleshooting RESTful API and interface specifications (Swagger)

Experience with multi-threading, scaling, concurrency, caching, queuing, and distributed data storage

Experience with message brokers (Rabbitmq, Kafka etc.) and NoSQL databases (Mongodb, Elastic etc.)

Nice to have

Understanding of DevOps principals and CI/CD best practices

Experience working with docker and kubernetes

Interest and ability to work with new tools and languages

Experience working in agile environment

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Defense and Space Manufacturing, and Software Development
description:
With a priority on maintaining the safety of our employees, customers and communities, MDA has implemented a mandatory vaccination policy for employees and visitors. Please speak to a recruiter for more details.**




Company Overview



For those who dream of advancing our space in the Universe and on Earth, we’ll take you there.

Serving the world from our Canadian home and our global offices, MDA is an international space mission partner and robotics & space operations, satellite systems and Geointelligence pioneer with a 50-year story of firsts on and above the Earth. Today, we're leading the charge towards viable Moon colonies, enhanced Earth observation, communication in a hyper-connected world, and more.

We’re fueled by a pioneering spirit that carries us beyond. And together we enable highly skilled people to continually push boundaries and tackle big challenges requiring solutions that endure and inspire.

Are you ready to launch the next stage of your career in the new space economy? We would love to hear from you!



Job Responsibilities



MDA is currently seeking a Senior Engineer/Member Technical Staff to carry out systems engineering work for the Mobile Servicing System, the next-generation Canadarm3, and related projects. The successful applicant will play an important role in the following:


Develop high-level system requirements, based upon the end user needs and/or stated requirements

Analyse and decompose systems-level requirements and allocate requirements and design margin across sub-system elements

Advocate for design to cost, design for test, and design for manufacture approaches throughout the organization for effective productization of commercial space systems

Develop and ensure proper documentation of technical and interface requirements

Develop and ensure proper documentation of high-level system and subsystem design

Develop verification and test plans

Understand and assess design issues, determine appropriate resolutions, and work with the team to address

Troubleshoot system behaviour anomalies, determine root cause, and the appropriate technical resolution.

Review, analyse, and interpret telemetry from deployed system with context and understanding of the system development life cycle




Job Qualifications And Experience




Interested candidates must possess a Master’s degree in Aerospace, Mechanical, Electrical, Computer Systems Engineering, Applied Mathematics, or the equivalent.

Five (5+) years of experience in systems engineering, manufacturing engineering, and/or project engineering are required. 

Knowledge of the MSS system and its operation, and/or knowledge of robotic systems, flight verification and validation, and operations analysis would be an asset. 

Familiarity with mission-critical software, Matlab/Simulink, and computer-aided design tools would also be a benefit.


Successful candidates must obtain and hold security clearance at the reliability status level, and pass security assessment for the Controlled Goods Program (CGP) and ITAR.

We’re a dream team of purpose-driven, collaborative and passionate people, and we are constantly looking for others to join #TeamMDA to ignite new and innovative approaches to problem-solving that push us forward to improve life on and above Earth. If you’re excited to expand our place in space and driven to inspire the next generation, we’ll take you there.

We have entered a new era of exploration and development, and MDA welcomes all who yearn to suit up and be part of it. An equal opportunity employer prizing diversity, integrity and collaboration, we are committed to growing MDA’s and Canada’s leadership in this next golden age.

MDA provides competitive compensation and benefits packages for its employees at all locations. As a team member of MDA, you and your qualified dependents are eligible to participate in a benefit plan that ensures a comprehensive level of protection through competitive health care including; extended healthcare and flexible drug plans, dental and vision benefits, disability income protection, life insurance, group retirement savings plans; and an employee and family assistance program.

MDA is an equal opportunity employer prizing diversity and inclusion. We are committed to treating all employees and applicants for employment with respect and dignity. If you require assistance and/or reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please feel free to notify us.

#MDA

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
About The Job



Toptal developers work with speed and efficiency to deliver the highest quality of work. We are looking for someone who is passionate about their client’s business, and ready to work on exciting projects with Fortune 500 companies and Silicon Valley startups, with great rates and zero hassles. If you are looking for a place to advance your career, enhance your skill set, and build connections around the globe, Toptal is right for you.



About Toptal



Toptal is an exclusive network of top freelancers from around the world. Fortune 500 companies and Silicon Valley startups hire Toptal for their most important projects. Toptal is one of the fastest-growing fully remote networks and empowers freelance software developers, designers, finance experts, product managers, and project managers worldwide to grow and excel in their freelance careers.

Toptal clients vary in sizes and industries, from enterprise organizations and big tech companies to Silicon Valley startups and renowned universities. Once you enter the network, our matchers will contact you with project opportunities that fit your expertise and preferences. We have experts in over 120 countries who get to work remotely on projects that meet their career ambitions.



About The Role



We’re always looking for exceptional Back-end developers to help us reach the next level! At Toptal, you will have the opportunity to develop new features and improve the quality of the existing codebase. Some of your main responsibilities will include: (1) write elegant, efficient, and testable code that is easy to maintain and debug, (2) cover code with tests and perform manual testing of features, while reviewing the work of colleagues, and (3) work on the infrastructure part of the project, collaborating with infrastructure Engineers. You will research, implement, test, and help other teams integrate new tools, and maintain some microservices that are in use across the whole Engineering departments. Most of our work is in Ruby, but we are not limited to it; we also develop and support Elixir, Node.js solutions, we work with ElasticSearch and Kafka, and we are into Docker, Kubernetes, and others.



Requirements




 English language proficiency

 3+ years of professional experience in software development

 Solid experience with Ruby on Rails or/and Go is a strong advantage

 Project management skills

 A keen attention to detail

 Experience with system architecture or leading a software team is a strong advantage

 Full-time availability is a strong advantage


If you’re interested in pursuing an engaging career working on full-time freelance jobs for exclusive clients, take the next step by clicking apply and filling out the short form to get started.

#RemoteJobBackEnd

About The Job:


The Sama R&D team is focused on delivering integrated solutions solving the most complex Machine Learning problems for over 25% of the Fortune 50. We use advanced practices to build scalable, secure, and efficient solutions covering multiple aspects of Machine Learning and AI, from data ingestion to annotation and building and operating Machine Learning models. 

As a Software Developer, you will work with our team of talented Scientists, Researchers, and over 3,000 of our Annotation Agents in Africa to advance the Sama annotation platform, empowering our customers and Annotators to rapidly and accurately identify and extract features in images, videos, and Lidar systems. With a commitment to your customer and driven by a mission to expand opportunities for low-income populations, you will use your outstanding development skills to deliver compelling solutions in an incremental, lean, and self-driven environment.

Our ideal candidate also has a strong interest in Machine Learning, especially from a Software Engineering perspective. As part of our AI team, you will play a key role in productizing and improving our Machine Learning pipelines, making our advanced annotation platform smarter and more scalable. 





Key Responsibilities:



You will be a key player in building and improving our automated training and deployment platform.

You will own the design, implementation, and maintenance of the components of our internal Machine Learning platform, including data pipelines, tools, and deployment infrastructure.

Through proper implementation and delivery, you will work collaboratively with Product Management and ML Developers to deliver the best products and solutions to our customers.






Minimum Qualifications:



3+ years of industry experience in Software Development

Expertise with Cloud Infrastructure (AWS, GCP, Azure)

Proficiency in Python or another back-end language (Go, Scala, Java, etc.)

Knowledge of Docker and Kubernetes

Proficiency with CI/CD pipelines

Comfortability working with a distributed team






 Preferred Qualifications:



Industry experience in productizing and deploying machine learning models at scale

Graduate degree in Software Engineering, Machine Learning, Computer Vision, Image Processing, or a related field

Bonus: Experience with deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or Pytorch






About Sama:


25% of the Fortune 50 trust Sama to deliver secure, high-quality training data and validation for the technology teams driving humanity forward. From self-driving cars to smart hardware, Sama fuels AI. Founded over a decade ago, we’re experts in image, video, and sensor data annotation and validation for machine learning algorithms in industries including automotive, navigation, AR/VR, biotech, agriculture, manufacturing, and e-commerce. Our staff are driven by a mission to expand opportunity for low-income people through the digital economy, and our social business model has helped lift over 50,000 people out of poverty.


Featured in Forbes: How Ethical Is Your AI?

Sama Honored on Inc. Magazine’s Annual List of America’s Fastest-Growing Private Companies — the Inc. 5000






Our Culture:


Sama is quite unique. We are a technology company with a social mission. People that thrive in a high-growth environment, love working on the bleeding edge of technology, and really care about having a positive impact on the world are a great fit for the Sama culture. Our core values are grit, integrity, humanity, and GTD (Get Things Done).





Our Benefits:


Sama offers competitive compensation commensurate with experience and a full benefits package, including: medical, dental, and vision insurance, long-term disability insurance, life, and AD&D insurance, employer-matching Group RRSP, generous holiday, and vacation policies, sabbaticals, a monthly fitness stipend, and professional development opportunities.





At Sama, we take pride in being a diverse and equal opportunity employer.

EXFO develops smarter network test, monitoring and analytics solutions for the world’s leading telecommunications service providers, network equipment manufacturers and webscale companies—and we love what we do! With nearly 1,900 employees in more than 25 countries, EXFO is no. 1 worldwide in fiber optic test solutions and has the largest active assurance deployment. Our broad portfolio of intelligent hardware and software solutions enable our customer’s network transformations related to fiber, 5G, virtualization and big data analytics. We’re always looking for top talent to help us lead the way in a thriving industry with boundless opportunities.

 

We are looking for a Software Developer for our Cloud Software Services group to design and implement the next generation of our SaaS product as well as Mobile and Embedded applications. This position offers the opportunity to design new solutions as part of an autonomous and product-oriented team. The multidisciplinary team is empowered to innovate and implement innovative and scalable solutions.

 

Your Role

Your primary contribution will include the creation and design of our next generation Cloud and Mobile solutions. As part of a multi-disciplinary development team embracing the DevSecOps culture, you will contribute to the direction of our cloud solution in terms of architecture, infrastructure and technology landscape.




What we are looking for 

Technical Skills


Proficiency in at least one mainstream programming language

Mastery of OO practices

Knowledge of one of the dominant Cloud platforms

Knowledge of mobile application development

Good knowledge of design patterns

Mastery of CI/CD and X-as-Code concepts and practices

Knowledge of BDD, TDD, (DDD an asset)

Knowledge of SOLID principles


 

Required skills


Systems approach

Excellent communication skills

Requirements

Relevant experience: 5 years of experience in mobile applications development

Language requirement: French, English


 

Education: Bachelor's degree in computer or software engineering

Any combination of relevant education/experience will be considered.

 

What we offer:


Flexible working hours 

Multi-site & Multidisciplinary teams 

Dynamic and collaborative work environment 

Modern Workspace 

AGILE work methodology 

Variety of social and sports activities 

Social Community Involvement 

Free parking 

Terminals for electric cars 

Easy access to public transport 

Bike path nearby 

Onsite Cafeteria Services 

Competitive vacation policy and holiday time off 

Annual Bonus Program 

RRSP Program and Group Insurance 


 

 


EXFO is an equal opportunity employer.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting and Information Services
description:
Multiple permanent Atlassian (Jira/Confluence) Developer roles working with a growing technology company in a hybrid work model in Toronto or Montreal


Multiple permanent Atlassian Developer roles

Growing organization with global clients

Hybrid work model, suitable for someone located in Montreal or Toronto






What & Why:


This is a great time to join this organization as they look to grow their Atlassian support team. You will own the administration and support of JIRA and Confluence to meet users needs. You will be responsible for requirements gathering, implementing business process workflows in JIRA and Confluence and promoting best practices while advising teams on how to get the most out of the Atlassian tool suite.





Who:


Our client is a successful multi-national technology company that has been ranked on various “best place to work” lists. The company has a dynamic culture and a very people-oriented business approach. The people at this company are diverse and values based. This role will need to sit in Montreal or Toronto as it will be in the office in a hybrid model, ~2 days a week.





You:


You will bring the following education, skills and experience to the role:


5+ years of experience in the area of systems engineering

4+ years experience working with Linux, J2EE applications, databases/SQL, web applications, SOA/web services and mobile platforms

4+ years experience architecting, installing, configuring, and customizing Atlassian tools

3+ years experience with Jira, Confluence, and BitBucket

3+ years of experience developing custom plugins and integrations with Jira

3+ years of experience with Git

Strong Knowledge of Atlassian Cloud, Atlassian server and Data Center versions

Demonstrable experience with doing cloud and server migrations, as well as competitor migrations to the three different Atlassian platforms

Two Atlassian certifications or demonstrable experience to pass the exams






Next Steps:


If the sound of this opportunity excites you, and you’re confident that it’s a good fit for your experience and career goals, then we’d love to hear from you! Please send your updated resume to us by applying to this posting and one of our awesome team of recruiters will be in touch.
