We are looking for a passionate developer in reporting, business intelligence and data visualization!

Reporting to the Manager, Application & Database Operations, the Business Intelligence Developer will support & enhance existing BI projects and participate in net-new initiatives to drive new capabilities while improving the enterprise capability in reporting and analytics.

The BI Developer has knowledge or experience implementing analytics solutions and common services such as Data Governance and Data Quality in hybrid data architectures (cloud and on-premise).This position will occasionally be called on to advise and support database applications such as system-to-system integrations or as an advisor to data migration / data cleansing efforts.



Responsibilities



Be a courageous safety leader, adhere to and sponsor safety and environmental rules and procedures

Participate in project planning sessions with multiple partners to analyze business requirements and outline the proposed solution

Develop technical specifications based on business requirements

Participate in design reviews, contribute to the design recommendations and incorporate the security requirements

Provide input to information data and flow

Understand and follow System Development Life Cycle methodology

Adhere to I/S control policies throughout design, development, and testing

Document the detailed application specifications

Translate technical specifications into application modules

Perform unit and integration testing



Qualifications



Computer Science degree or equivalent education and experience

Confirmed experience in building and deploying reports to either on-premise and/or cloud implementations of Power BI.

Excellent SQL skills for extracting data from relational databases and designing & implementing data marts using SSIS to extract, transform, and load (ETL)business-critical information into SQL Server databases from disparate sources

Hands-on experience building data analytical capabilities by using OLAP, SSIS, SSAS and Cubes

Deep level understanding in writing MDX / DAX for design and reporting purposes

Solid skills with the Microsoft technology stack (SSAS, SSRS, SQL Server, TSQL, MDX, DAX, Power BI, Power Pivot, Power Query)

Ability to create multi-dimensional and tabular models.

Creative and innovative problem-solver applying the best techniques that address data architecture, extraction, transformation, movement, storage, integration and governance of data.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills in both technical and non-technical scenarios.

Knowledge of or experience with ML enabled Data Management, Data Lakes and, IOT Integration and Analytics projects considered an asset.

Successful candidates must be fully vaccinated against infection by COVID-19. Candidates who are unable to be vaccinated due to a personal characteristic protected under applicable human rights legislation may request to be exempt from this requirement. We will do our best to accommodate those who are unable to be vaccinated.



About Teck



At Teck, we value diversity. Our teams work collaboratively and respect each person's unique perspective and contribution.

We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for the position; however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

Teck is a diversified resource company committed to responsible mining and mineral development with major business units focused on copper, steelmaking coal, zinc and energy. Headquartered in Vancouver, Canada, its shares are listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbols TECK.A and TECK.B and the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol TECK.

The pursuit of sustainability guides Teck's approach to business. Teck is building partnerships and capacity to confront sustainability challenges within the regions in which it operates and at the global level. In 2018, Teck was named to the Dow Jones Sustainability World Index (DJSI) for the ninth straight year, indicating that Teck's sustainability practices rank in the top 10 per cent of the world's 2,500 largest public companies in the S&P Global Broad Market Index.

Learn more about Teck at www.teck.com or follow @TeckResources

Your application to this posting is deemed to be your consent to the collection, use and necessary disclosure of personal information for the purposes of recruitment. Teck respects the privacy of all applicants and the confidentiality of personal information.

job_title: Développeur Angular Sénior - IBM iX, services-conseils IBM
description:
530633BR


Introduction


Menez IBM vers l'avenir en traduisant les exigences systèmes dans la conception et l'élaboration de systèmes personnalisés dans un environnement agile. Le succès d'IBM est entre vos mains au fur et à mesure que vous transformez les besoins d'affaires essentiels en code et que vous stimulez l'innovation. Votre travail fortifiera mondialement IBM et ses clients, par la collaboration et l'intégration de code dans les systèmes d'entreprise. Vous aurez accès à la formation, aux outils et aux technologies les plus récents, et à un cheminement de carrière illimité avec le chef de file mondial de la technologie. Venez chez IBM et ayez un impact à l'échelle planétaire!

Votre rôle et vos responsabilités

Nous sommes à un tournant de l'histoire où l'impact de la technologie sur les entreprises est suffisamment important pour transformer l'ensemble de leur mode de fonctionnement. La convergence des nouvelles technologies exponentielles telles que l'IA, le cloud, la mobilité, l'automatisation, l'internet des objets, la blockchain et la 5G ont le pouvoir de changer les modèles d'entreprise, de réinventer les processus et de réimaginer la façon dont nous travaillons tous.

IBM Consulting a pour vocation d'aider ses clients à gérer l'ampleur des changements nécessaires pour rester en tête et à innover sans relâche. Nous établissons des relations solides avec nos clients et créons ensemble des solutions à l'intersection de la stratégie, de l'expérience, de la technologie et des opérations. Nous agissons en tant qu'agents du changement : nous donnons aux clients les moyens d'élaborer une stratégie et de mettre en œuvre leur vision, ce qui leur permet d'évoluer à grande échelle avec rapidité et clarté.

Chez IBM iX au sein du groupe de transformation de la clientèle et de l'expérience d'IBM Consulting, nous sommes des pionniers réalistes, soucieux d'imaginer et de créer des solutions numériques de bout en bout axées sur le client final. Nous appliquons une conception centrée sur l'humain et des méthodologies agiles pour repenser la manière dont nos clients travaillent et s'engagent auprès de leurs clients, et pour donner rapidement vie à ces solutions numériques axées sur l'expérience. Voulez-vous faire partie de l'équipe qui définit l'avenir de l'expérience des supporters des équipes sportives professionnelles ? Que diriez-vous d'aider les institutions de services financiers à se transformer à l'ère de la transformation avec l'accélération de l'innovation numérique stimulée par le changement de comportement des clients dû à la pandémie ? Et qu'en est-il de l'aide apportée aux compagnies pétrolières et gazières pour améliorer la sécurité et la productivité des travailleurs sur le terrain ? C'est votre chance de faire partie d'une équipe où tout ce que nous faisons a un impact mesurable à grande échelle.


Tâches Et Responsabilités


En tant que Développeur-maître Angular Sénior chez IBM iX (sous IBM Consulting), vous êtes un membre de l'équipe qui permet de concrétiser la conception du produit de notre client dans les délais impartis et de manière sécurisée, fiable, réutilisable et évolutive. Grâce à votre expérience agile au sein d'organisations centrées sur le produit, vous êtes l'un des membres de l'équipe travaillant aux côtés d'une équipe de livraison pour assurer la fourniture réussie d'applications web et mobiles et d'autres expériences numériques de première mise sur le marché.Vos responsabilités en tant que Développeur-maître Sénior sont les suivantes :



Gérer le développement complet de logiciels pour nos clients, de la conception au déploiement, dans le cadre de leur transformation numérique, en assurant l'alignement sur l'architecture actuelle et en développement.

Participer aux réunions quotidiennes de la mêlée et fournir une orientation technique aux autres membres de l'équipe.

Collaborer avec les parties prenantes et les concepteurs d'architecture pour s'assurer que la solution est conforme aux exigences et à la stratégie. Participer à l'examen et à la sélection des technologies (langages / cadres et bibliothèques).

Appliquer les modèles de conception, les normes de codage et les meilleures pratiques pour produire un code sûr, fiable, réutilisable et évolutif.

Identifier, trier et analyser les causes profondes des problèmes spécifiques au développement.

Intégrer des implémentations d'interface utilisateur avec des API sécurisées et non sécurisées.

Travailler avec les parties prenantes internes et clientes pour définir et clarifier les exigences fonctionnelles et non fonctionnelles.

Aide à l'estimation et à l'effort requis pour construire les composants clés

Préparer, documenter et présenter la conception et la documentation technique

Exercer un leadership technique grâce à son expertise en la matière et à sa connaissance du domaine

Contribuer à l'amélioration des processus, en signalant tous les problèmes et en contribuant activement à leur résolution

Animer des réunions et des séances de travail régulières avec les membres de l'équipe de développement et les différentes unités commerciales afin de traiter les questions en cours qui nécessitent une compréhension ou une analyse plus approfondie

Contribuer à l'élaboration du cadre architectural et de la conception



Votre profil



Vous apprenez rapidement et vous vous adaptez : vous pouvez vous familiariser avec de nouvelles technologies rapidement, de manière approfondie et avec confiance, en vous appuyant sur des concepts que vous comprenez déjà.

Vous avez un style de travail interactif : vous vous épanouissez en travaillant à la fois en équipe et individuellement lorsque cela est nécessaire, y compris avec des équipes mondiales et extraterritoriales pour la mise en œuvre.

Vous êtes un communicateur hors pair : vous avez fait preuve d'excellence dans la communication et la présentation d'informations complexes à des parties prenantes tant techniques que non techniques.

Vous êtes un gourou de l'estimation des tâches : vous pouvez rapidement évaluer l'effort relatif d'une tâche de développement, en tenant compte des ambiguïtés et de la complexité, en vous appuyant sur votre vaste expérience professionnelle antérieure.

Vous avez le sens de l'initiative et un grand souci du détail : vous effectuez des examens de code de qualité par des pairs et vous avez des exigences élevées et un grand souci de la réussite et de la satisfaction des clients. 

Nous recrutons dans les villes principales du pays. Les candidats retenus pour un poste à Montréal, QC, doivent être parfaitement bilingues en anglais et en français. 



Expertise professionnelle et technique requise


Qualifications Requises


Les candidats retenus seront en mesure de démontrer les caractéristiques suivantes :



Diplôme de Bachelor dans un des domaines suivants : informatique, ingénierie, MIS ou domaine connexe.

3-5 ans d' expérience dans la technologie ou dans un domaine connexe , avec une expérience pertinente dans les projets numériques centrés sur l'utilisateur. 

Expérience des technologies dedéveloppement web, notamment HTML, CSS, JavaScript, ainsi que de l'utilisation d'un ou plusieurs des outils Angular, React, Vue.

Expérience des technologies multiplateformes telles que Flutter, ReactNative, NativeScript.

Expérience avec un des deux systèmes NodeJS et Java

Familiarité avec l'intégration et la prise en charge de fonctionnalités fournies par des SDK ou des bibliothèques externes (par exemple, push, analytique, CMS).

Maîtrise de l'utilisation d'un système de gestion du code source tel que Git, ainsi qu'une connaissance pratique des pratiques devops (par exemple, l'intégration/livraison continue).

Compréhension des modèles de conception, de l'optimisation, de la sécurité des API et des meilleures pratiques de codage sécurisé.

Expérience dans la création de solutions pour le web responsable et mobile

Compréhension du cycle de vie du développement logiciel et des principes de mise en œuvre agile

Connaissance des systèmes de conteneurs comme Docker et de l'orchestration de conteneurs comme Kubernetes

Maîtrise des outils de gestion des projets agiles (par exemple, Confluence et Jira).

Une parfaite maîtrise de l'anglais.



Expertise professionnelle et technique privilégié


Qualifications Supplémentaires




Maîtrise ou l'équivalent;

Maîtrise du français




Ce que nous offrons




Une culture d'entreprise axée sur le travail d'équipe, qui met l'accent sur le bien-être et l'inclusion des employés, avec des commentaires constructifs et des possibilités d'apprentissage continu, y compris le développement des compétences en matière de gestion par l'intermédiaire de la Leadership Academy d'IBM

Rémunération compétitive, avantages sociaux complets et conditions de travail flexibles. Nous continuons à développer nos avantages et nos programmes, offrant ainsi un soutien, des conseils et une couverture parmi les meilleurs pour un personnel diversifié

Un tout nouveau bureau IBM situé au cœur du centre-ville de Toronto, au 16 York Street (ouverture en décembre 2021)




La méthode IBM



En Tant Qu'IBMers


Chez IBM , nos méthodes de travail définissent qui nous sommes et nous permettent d'atteindre notre objectif.



 Nous établissons un lien de confiance

 Nous collaborons pour réussir

 Nous évoluons avec une inlassable curiosité

 Nous innovons dans un but précis

 Nous livrons avec impact

 nous encourageons la diversité des perspectives (voir plus ci-dessous)




La diversité chez IBM


Chez IBM, nous encourageons la diversité des perspectives et nous nous engageons à apporter un large éventail de points de vue, d'expériences et de compétences à notre travail afin de favoriser un environnement véritablement inclusif. Nous encourageons fortement les candidatures de tous les candidats qualifiés qui représentent toute la diversité des communautés à travers le Canada. Cela inclut, sans s'y limiter, les peuples autochtones, les personnes issues de communautés noires et raciales diverses, les personnes handicapées, les personnes issues de communautés sexuées et sexuellement diverses et/ou les personnes ayant des identités transgenres. IBM est fier d'être un employeur offrant l'égalité des chances et s'engage également à respecter toutes les pratiques d'emploi équitables concernant la citoyenneté et le statut d'immigration.

Doit avoir la capacité de travailler au Canada sans parrainage.

A propos de l'unité commerciale

IBM Services est une équipe de conseillers d'affaires, de stratégie et de technologie qui conçoivent, construisent, et exploitent des systèmes de base et des services qui constituent l'épine dorsale de l'économie mondiale. IBM Services fait équipe avec les plus grandes entreprises du monde dans plus de 170 pays afin de bâtir des affaires plus intelligentes en repensant et en réinventant par la technologie, avec ses méthodologies axées sur les résultats, son portefeuille de pointe et son expertise en recherche et en activités de calibre mondial qui mènent à une innovation axée sur les résultats et à une excellence durable.

Votre vie chez IBM

Envie d'en savoir plus? Prêt à résoudre certains des défis parmi les plus uniques au monde? Et prêt à façonner l'avenir de millions de personnes?

Si c'est le cas, il est alors temps de vous joindre à nous, d'exprimer votre individualité, de laisser le champ libre à votre curiosité et d'explorer de nouvelles possibilités.

Chaque IBMiste (ou IBMiste potentiel comme vous) dispose d'une voix, trace son propre chemin et propose son expertise en vue d'aider à cocréer et à enrichir notre histoire. Ensemble, nous avons le pouvoir d'apporter des changements significatifs, de modifier la structure de nos clients, de la société et d'IBM elle-même, d'avoir un effet vraiment positif et de faire de ce monde un meilleur endroit pour tous.

Le moment est venu de définir votre carrière.

À propos d'IBM

La plus grande invention d'IBM, c'est l'IBMiste. Nous sommes convaincus que la mise en application de l'intelligence, de la raison et de la science nous permet d'améliorer l'activité économique, la société et la condition humaine, en donnant vie à la puissance d'un nuage hybride ouvert et d'une stratégie d'IA pour nos clients et nos partenaires du monde entier.

Ayant réinventé sans relâche depuis 1911, nous ne sommes pas seulement l'une des plus grandes entreprises au monde, nous sommes aussi l'un des plus grands employeurs en TI et en services-conseils, avec de nombreuses entreprises du classement Fortune 50 s'appuyant sur IBM Cloud pour gérer leur entreprise.

Chez IBM, nous sommes fiers d'avoir été parmi les premiers à adopter l'intelligence artificielle, l'informatique quantique et la chaîne de blocs. C'est le moment de vous joindre à nous et de devenir un innovateur technologique responsable et une force au service du bien dans le monde.

Énoncé du lieu de travail

Pour obtenir de l’information supplémentaire sur les critères d’emplacement, veuillez contacter le recruteur après avoir soumis votre demande.

Vous et IBM

IBM s'engage à créer un milieu diversifié et est fière de souscrire au principe de l'égalité d'accès à l'emploi. Tous les candidats qualifiés seront pris en considération pour un emploi sans égard à la race, à la couleur, à la religion, ausexe, à l'identité ou à l'expression de genre, à l'orientation sexuelle, à l'origine nationale, à la génétique, à la grossesse, aux handicaps, à l'âge, au statut de vétéran ou à d'autres caractéristiques. IBM s'engage également à se conformer à toutes lespratiques équitables en matière d'emploi à l'égard du statut de citoyen et d'immigrant.

description:
Description:
  Are you passionate about DevOps and building the practice through automation and engineering excellence? If so, please read on!
  We are looking for a highly competent and highly motivated individual with automation experience in AWS, to be part of our Service Delivery team to help lead the design, implementation, and adoption of the technical building blocks that power our engineering organization’s next generation of CI/CD. 
  Our Service Delivery team is responsible for paving the infrastructure path enabling our entire engineering organization to build features quickly and reliably across our organization. Our focus is to build and support CI/CD pipelines, and automating solutions. We build and manage capabilities to ensure Realtor.com’s applications are delivered accurately, reliably and with speed.  We use both open source and vendor based technologies to provide developers with the best possible CI/CD platforms and services. 
  Duties and Responsibilities:
  Develop, support and maintain CI/CD frameworks to make it easier for developers to build and deploy their code into the AWS Cloud
  Train, evangelize, and mentor our engineering teams to raise the bar, increase DevOps maturity, and our ability to execute on the company’s goals. You will embrace continuous learning and foster this objective in others
  Coordinate closely with the development teams, ensuring that they have the tools, know-how, and processes to achieve their goals
  Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to application development, deployment and operations
  Ensure that the goals of performance, security, resilience, cost optimization, and operational efficiency are an integral part of all of our projects.
 
  Requirements:
  Education, Skills and Experience:
  3+ years of strong programming and automation experience – you believe you can automate everything
  2+ years of experience in scripting languages such as Python, NodeJS or Bash etc. 
  3+ years of experience working with AWS services(EC2, ECS, VPC, ELB, S3, CloudFormation, RDS, SQS, etc.)
  2+ years of experience with Kubernetes (can be on premise, EKS, AKS, or GKE)
  Experience with Infrastructure as Code and writing Cloudformation templates
  Fluent with git at the command line
  Familiarity with build & release automation tools and methodologies such as Jenkins 
  Demonstrated ability to identify and solve problems within and across teams
  Experience working in an iterative based development environment using Agile/SCRUM or Kanban
  Self-starter with ability to lead processes and projects
  Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field or equivalent experience is preferred
  Bonus points if you:
  Have experience with CircleCI
  Familiar with AWS : API Gateway, SQS, SNS
  Have experience writing Jenkins pipeline as code in Groovy
  Familiarity with Splunk, Artifactory, HashiCorp Vault 
  Familiarity with scanning tools such SonarQube, Checkmarx, Synopsys Hub ***/hr max bill rate

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.



 Job Category 
Products and Technology
 Job Details 


The Monitoring Infrastructure team in the Observability & Performance group at Slack develops platforms and tools which produce telemetry, provide insights, and improves observability in Slack production services with a focus on performance and reliability. We develop management tools for distributed applications and infrastructure, maintain datasets for performance and system analytics, and build interfaces and backend systems to answer questions and infer behavioral patterns about our users and systems. Our toolset is varied, we work with open-source observability/monitoring technologies like Elasticsearch and Prometheus, or cloud providers such as AWS, and develop software using a combination of Go, Python, or Java.

As part of the Monitoring Infrastructure team, you will be focused on our log pipelines and work closely with other teams in engineering, product development, and customer experience to provide valuable insights to drive decisions and ensure a positive user experience for our Slack customers. You will also help build and maintain distributed services in an environment that processes millions of data points per second with the ability to self-heal and scale up or down to meet demand. We are an inclusive team with deep empathy for our colleagues and customers.

Slack has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture we look for people who are curious, inventive, and work to be a little better every single day. In our work together we aim to be smart, humble, hardworking, and, above all, collaborative. If this sounds like a good fit for you, why not say hello?



About The Role



This is a remote senior engineering position based in the United States or Canada.



What You Will Be Doing




Build, maintain, and ensure timely delivery of our high-volume event log pipelines.

Create libraries, tools, and automation to help ensure that critical event data gets to the right place.

Encouraging a culture of Observability at Slack - help suss out problem areas and consult on improving visibility into our systems.

Prototyping tooling interfaces or building new features for engineering use cases.

Improving auto-remediation in our logging infrastructure to avoid recurring failures.

Teaching engineers or customer experience agents how to use our tools to introspect their systems.

Participating in the Monitoring Infrastructure on-call rotation, triaging, and addressing production issues as they arise.




What You Should Have




You are a strong communicator. Explaining complex technical concepts to designers, support, and other engineers is no problem for you.

You enjoy helping onboard new team members, mentoring, and teaching others.

You live for unit tests, code review, design documentation, debugging, and solving problems.

You have a deep curiosity about how things work under the hood.

You are motivated by helping others succeed. When things break and they will you are eager and able to help fix things. You like thinking of ways to improve efficiency or bring delight to your coworkers.

You care about improving the performance of systems through data-informed decisions.

You also know that the internet is a scary place and understand security concepts deeply and can put them into action to protect us and our users.




Minimum




Qualifications:



Firm grasp of computer science fundamentals: data structures, algorithms, programming languages, distributed systems, and information retrieval.

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field, or equivalent training, fellowship, or work experience




Preferred




Experience with functional or imperative programming languages -- e.g., PHP, Python, Go, C, or Java (used without frameworks).

Experience with creating interfaces, tooling, or automation to help define a path for engineers to self-service.

Experience deploying, operating, and debugging server software on Linux at scale




Bonus Points




Passionate about data visualization, graphing, and maximizing signal versus noise.

Experience with Elasticsearch, Logstash, and Kibana.

Solid competency with Prometheus, OpenTracing, or any other widely-used monitoring/visibility platform.

Prior experience with or knowledge of large scale, high volume distributed systems, distributed databases, and data pipelines.

Experience with containerization frameworks such as Kubernetes.

Experience using deployment automation/configuration management, especially Terraform or Chef.

Experience with AWS and other virtualized environments.

Experience with message queue services, such as Kafka.



For Colorado-based roles: Minimum annual salary of $142,000. You may also be entitled to receive a bonus, restricted stock units, and benefits. 



 Accommodations 


If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .


 Posting Statement 


At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.


Salesforce.com
 and 
Salesforce.org
 are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. 
Salesforce.com
 and 
Salesforce.org
 do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. 
Salesforce.com
 and 
Salesforce.org
 will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with 
Salesforce.com
 or

 .

Salesforce welcomes all.

Summary

 
Be a part of the team that delivers an outstanding reading and listening experience to millions of Apple users every day. Does crafting new features that bring together software, hardware and services for your users excite you? 


The Apple Books team is looking for a passionate engineer to help us bring the next generation of book and audiobook experiences to iOS, macOS and watchOS.

 

Key Qualifications

 
Excellent problem solving skills

Knowledgable in software architecture design, coding and debugging

Strong grasp of Swift, knowledge of SwiftUI, Objective-C or JavaScript a plus

Strong ability to write performant and accurate multi-threaded code

Ability to communicate optimally, both written and verbal, with multi-functional teams

Passion for quality and attention to detail

Ability to independently learn new technologies

 

Description

 
At Apple we don’t just build products. We build the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of our people and their ideas that encourage the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it. 


As an engineer on the Apple Books team, your primary responsibility will be high-level UI development, but you'll often find yourself working at different levels of the stack in order to pull off challenging features. You should feel comfortable moving fluidly from network programming to framework and application development. You'll be maintaining and improving not just the Books app, but also its supporting frameworks and system services. You'll also be responsible for debugging and delivering the best possible application performance and adopting the best testing practices to help you find and fix bugs early. 


As the face of the Apple Books app running on iOS, macOS and watchOS, every engineer on our team can have an enormous impact on the product we ship. We promote innovation and new technology to further improve our creative output. Multifaceted, inquisitive people and inspiring, innovative technologies are the norm here. 


We're looking for a dedicated and passionate person to join our amazing team, if you feel this is you, we'd love to hear from you.

 
Role Number: 200325598

Company Description


Technicolor Production Services is the division with Technicolor which contain Technicolor’s world leading Visual effects and Animation brands such as MPC, The Mill, and Mikros.

Technicolor’s brands have worked on the spectacular scenes and tiny details that make movies, advertising campaigns and Animation movies truly mind-blowing. We’re the people behind the effects in countless blockbuster films like The Lion King, The Spongebob Movie: Sponge on the Run and advertising campaigns for clients such as Samsung, Audi, Nike and Apple. We are constantly looking for the best talent in the world, enthusiastic people that come in everyday to be a part of some of the best work in the industry. Technicolor’s artists are wildly creative, uber talented and passionate about the possibilities of VFX, Experiential, Animation and Technology. When you join the team, you’ll be working with and learning from the most skilled people in the business.


Description



Job Description


We are looking for a Senior DevOps-minded engineer to join our team based in our Montreal office. You will help design, build and deliver reliable solutions that are supporting technologies which underpin our visual effects production network. Working with our global Software and Systems Engineering teams, you will help to improve the speed, reliability, and security of our production infrastructure.

MPC has been a global leader in visual effects for over 25 years, delivering some of the most technically challenging and widely recognized movies in production today. This opportunity allows you to deliver technology and services to our global teams in Systems and Production.

In this dynamic and fast changing environment, we need creative thinkers and pragmatic problem solvers who have the ability to communicate ideas, collaborate, and take initiative. Building solutions that will ensure a successful delivery of technology used to create the next award winning imagery in the visual effects industry.


Primary Responsibilities



Champion of best development and automation practices

Design, architect and build tools, workflows and technologies to help us manage our existing Systems infrastructure, both on-prem and in the cloud

Manage initiatives and execute tasks in collaboration with local and remote team members

Work with and mentor more junior members of the team to help resolve issues and solve problems



Qualifications



Skills and Experience



Proven experience in a DevOps and software development role

BS or MS in Computer Science or related technical field

Knowledge of Python, or any other scripting language

Experience with DevOps stack from implementation to maintenance

Linux system administration knowledge

Experience building and maintaining CI/CD pipelines

Experience building and maintaining system configuration automation and building test automation

Experience administrating and supporting infrastructure for high load and large number of users and tasks

Experience with source control, in particular Git, and associated best practices

Experience in using and building tools that integrate with Jira

Understanding of Agile and Scrum methodologies

Ability to work in a flexible and changing environment



Desired Additional Skills



Experience with networking, firewall, web technologies and security protocols

Experience with building monitoring and reporting infrastructure

Experience with container technology



Personal Attributes



A passion to automate everything

Extremely organized with good communication and documentation skills

Excellent attention to detail, and ability to analyze complex problems and workflows

Deadline orientated with ability to prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment



Additional Information


Please click here to review our privacy notices for job applicants.

If you require assistance applying, please reach out to talent@thefocus.com and we'll be happy to assist.


TECHNICOLOR IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER


Technicolor complies and prohibits against discrimination on the basis of race, religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, medical condition (including genetic characteristics), mental and/or physical disability or handicap, marital status, sex, age, veteran status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, gender identity, political party preference, political belief, socioeconomic status, familial status, registered domestic partner status, military service, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions and any other characteristic or activity protected by federal, state/provincial or local law.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.



 Job Category 
Products and Technology
 Job Details 



Please note, this role is can be 100% remote in Canada or the US.*


The Salesforce Mobile Field Service Applications team has immediate opportunities for extremely dedicated senior engineers who are passionate about software development. This is a hands-on role developing a cutting edge mobile iOS/Android application to meet the business needs of our clients. You should have a passion for innovation, and be a hard-working, results-oriented software engineer who can communicate effectively and work with a team of developers in large-scale enterprise-class software. For this particular role, we are looking for engineers with experience in C++ who would work on the shared cross platform engine that powers the Field Service Mobile apps and is developed in C++.

You will be working with a team of extraordinary engineers, designers and product managers to build the breakthrough features for our mobile iOS/Android application and SDK that our customers will love, adopt, and use, while keeping our trusted platform stable and scalable.



Required Skills/Experience




C++ development experience is a must

Experience building and delivering highly scalable, reliable, and complex software systems timely and on budget

A commitment to writing quality code including writing 
Unit and functional test automation
Knowledge of professional software engineering best practices for the software creation process, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, continuous integration, build processes, testing, and operations

Ability to take a project from scoping requirements through launch

An eagerness to learn new things and to help others do the same

Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams, and project management to understand requirements, describe software product features, and technical designs

Strong customer relations/customer management skills

4+ years professional software development experience

2+ years professional experience with C++

Open Source Contributions are a plus



Desired Skills




Experience building SDKs for iOS or for Android and cross platform development with C++

Experience with Agile development methodology (e.g., Scrum, Kanban)

Master's degree in computer science or equivalent experience

C++ experience building high scale systems is desirable.



 Accommodations 


If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .


 Posting Statement

job_title: Senior Angular Developer - IBM iX, IBM Consulting
description:
530633BR


Introduction


As an Application Developer, you will lead IBM into the future by translating system requirements into the design and development of customized systems in an agile environment. The success of IBM is in your hands as you transform vital business needs into code and drive innovation. Your work will power IBM and its clients globally, collaborating and integrating code into enterprise systems. You will have access to the latest education, tools and technology, and a limitless career path with the world’s technology leader. Come to IBM and make a global impact!


Your Role and Responsibilities


We are at a tipping point in history where the impact of technology on business is significant enough to transform the whole way that business operates. The convergence of new exponential technologies such as AI, cloud, mobility, automation, IoT, blockchain, and 5G have the power to change business models, reinvent processes, and reimagine the way we all work.

At IBM Consulting, we help clients navigate the scale of change needed to stay ahead and relentlessly innovate along the way. We build strong relationships with clients and co-create solutions at the intersection of strategy, experience, technology, and operations. We act as change agents: empowering clients to both strategize and execute their vision, which allows them to evolve at scale with both speed and clarity.

At IBM iX, the customer and experience transformation group of IBM Consulting, we are renegades and realists who focus on envisioning and creating end-to-end digital solutions that are focused on the end customer. We embody human-centric design and agile methodologies to rethink the way our clients work and engage with their customers and rapidly bring these experience-led digital solutions to life. Do you want to part of the team that is defining the future of fan experience for professional sports teams? How about helping financial services institutions transform in the age of disruption with the acceleration in digital innovation spurred by changing customer behaviour due to the pandemic? And what about helping oil & gas companies improve worker safety and productivity in the field? This is your chance to be a part of a team where everything we do drives measurable impact at scale.


Role & Responsibilities


As a Senior Frontend Angular Developer at IBM iX (under IBM Consulting), you are a team player that enables our client's product vision to come to fruition on time and in a secure, reliable, reusable, and scalable way. With your agile experience working in product-centric organizations, you are a team player working alongside a delivery team to ensure the successful delivery of web and mobile apps and other first-to-market digital experiences. Your responsibilities as a Senior Frontend Developer are as follows:



Managing the complete software development for our clients from concept to deployment in the context of their digital transformation, ensuring alignment to both current and developing architecture

Contribute to daily scrum meetings and providing technical direction to other team members

Collaborate with business stakeholders and architects to ensure solution aligns to requirements and strategy. Participate in the vetting and selection of technology (languages / framework / libraries)

Apply design patterns, coding standards, and best practices to produce secure, reliable, reusable and scalable code

Identify, triage, and perform root causes analysis on development-specific issues

Integrate UI implementations with secure and unsecure APIs

Work with internal and client stakeholders to define and clarify functional and non-functional requirements

Aid in the estimation and effort requirement to build key components

Prepare, document and present technical design and specification material

Exercise technical leadership through subject-matter expertise and domain knowledge

Contribute to process improvements, voicing any concerns and actively contribute to their resolution

Facilitate regular meetings and working sessions with development team members and different business units to address ongoing issues that require further understanding or analysis

Aid in the development of architectural framework and design



Who You Are



You're a quick and adaptive learner: you can pick up new technologies quickly, thoroughly, and confidently, based on concepts you already understand

You have an interactive work style: you thrive when working both in teams and individually when needed, including global and offshore teams for delivery

You're an outstanding communicator: you have demonstrated excellence in communicating and presenting complex information to both technical and non-technical stakeholders

You're a task estimation guru: you can quickly size a development task's relative effort, taking into consideration ambiguities and complexity by drawing from your extensive previous work experience

You have ownership and a strong attention to detail: you perform quality peer code reviews and have high standards and strong dedication to client success and satisfaction 

You’re keen on technology trends: you’re a magnet for learning and keeping up with the latest and greatest business and technology trends, and apply this to your work

You inspire: you mentor and lead junior developers on your delivery team(s)

We are hiring in major cities across Canada. Candidates considered for a Montreal, QC position must be fluently bilingual in both English and French.




Required Technical and Professional Expertise



Successful candidates will be able to demonstrate the following characteristics:




Bachelor's degree in one of the following areas: computer science, engineering, MIS or related field

3-5 years of experience in technology or related field, with relevant experience in user-centric digital engagements 

Experience with web development technologies including HTML, CSS, JavaScript as well as experience with one or more of Angular, React, Vue

Familiarity with cross platform technologies such as Flutter, ReactNative, NativeScript

Familiarity with integrating and supporting features provided by external SDKs or libraries (e.g. push, analytics, CMS)

Proficient in usage of source code management such as Git, as well as working knowledge of devops practices (e.g. continuous integration/delivery)

Understanding of design patterns, optimization, security and secure coding best practices

Experience in creation of solutions for responsive web and mobile

Understanding of the software development lifecycle & agile delivery principles

Proficient in agile delivery management tools (e.g. Confluence and Jira)

Fluent in English




Bonus Qualifications


Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise



Masters degree or equivalent

Fluent in French



Must have the ability to work in Canada without sponsorship.


About Business Unit


IBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants that design, build, and run foundational systems and services that is the backbone of the world's economy. IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter businesses by reimagining and reinventing through technology, with its outcome-focused methodologies, industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence.

This role requires you to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to your start date. Full vaccination refers to receiving dosage of COVID-19 vaccines that provide full protection in accordance with Canada Public Health and WHO guidance (full series of a 2 dose vaccine plus 14 days or a one dose vaccine plus 14 days from the last dose). Proof of vaccination status will be required. Booster vaccination requirements may be required. If you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical or religious reasons, we offer accommodations in accordance with applicable law.


Your Life @ IBM


Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.


About IBM


IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.


Location Statement


For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.


Being You @ IBM


IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
On behalf of our client in the Banking Sector, PROCOM is looking for a Business Intelligence (BI) Developer.



Business Intelligence (BI) Developer – Job Description





Responsible for detailed technical design, development, documentation of specifications and support application users according to business units’ requirements

Work closely with business and internal partners to understand strategic objectives, recommend and implement BI solutions

Demonstrate the ability to lead projects (e.g., Windows-based information management applications) from requirements to deployment with minimal supervision, to support of overall business/function strategy in line with enterprise standards & policies.

Conduct ad-hoc data analysis and provide technical support and enhancements for applications that are consumed by business users.

Operate in a collaborative and cooperative environment, Agile POD, and must possess the strong interpersonal skills necessary to work effectively with colleagues at various levels of the organization

Prioritize and manage own workload to deliver quality results and meet assigned timelines





Business Intelligence (BI) Developer – Mandatory Skills





MS Access Application development - 5 years

VBA for form, chart, module, class, and automation - 5 years

PowerBI and DotNet - 5 years

Business intelligence Developer Experience - 5 years

Communication skills - Excellent





Business Intelligence (BI) Developer – Nice To Have Skills





Banking experience

Lending product experience

Agile experience

Previous business banking or Credit product application development experience would be an asset




Business Intelligence (BI) Developer - Assignment Start Date


ASAP – 6 months to start


Business Intelligence (BI) Developer - Assignment Location


Toronto, ON – Work Remotely

Passionné.e de la donnée mais prisonnier.ère de ton quotidien?


Tu es passionné.e d'ETL, fan d’entrepôt de données, enthousiaste de l’expérience client et de la dynamique d’équipe et tu aimes la diversité dans tes mandats? Libère-toi et joins-toi à notre équipe comme développeur BI. Partenaire Gold Microsoft (certification Data Analytics), nous ne faisons que du BI depuis 30 ans et nous avons une diversité de clients qui garantit que tu ne t’ennuieras jamais au sein de notre équipe d’experts!





Tu as les clés pour t’évader, si tu excelles à



effectuer l’analyse des composants à développer à partir de l’analyse d’affaires effectuée et de l’architecture

développer des packages SSIS, écrire du code pour la tâche de script et la gestion des erreurs, gérer les processus de déploiement

écrire des requêtes SQL moyennement complexe à complexe

créer et planifier des jobs avec l’agent SQL Server

analyser et optimiser la performance SQL des différentes requêtes qui accèdent aux bases de données

écrire la documentation technique sur les composants développés

monitorer et au besoin reprendre les processus de chargement de données en partageant cette tâche avec les autres développeurs ETL






Tu peux retrouver ta liberté si



tu as le sens du service à la clientèle

tu es autonome

tu respectes tes engagements

tu as une bonne capacité d’analyse

tu as un esprit d’équipe

tu aimes bâtir sur le long terme

tu aimes apprendre

tu communiques facilement

tu aimes la diversité et le changement dans ton quotidien






Syntell en deux mots


Nous sommes une équipe de passionnés de la donnée et de nos clients! Nous livrons des produits et des services de grande qualité, tout en cherchant à garantir un avenir meilleur pour notre équipe. La collaboration entre tous les membres de notre équipe favorise le développement du plein potentiel de chacun. Notre organisation privilégie une gestion ouverte, participative et basée sur la confiance et où l’atteinte des résultats se fait par le travail d’équipe et la coopération.





Compétences recherchées






Compétences générales
 :


DEC en informatique ou autre formation pertinente

3 à 5 ans d’expérience dans le rôle de développeur ETL






Compétences techniques :



Maîtrise du langage SQL et des bases de données SQL Server (MS SQL Server 2016/2019)

Expérience dans l’analyse de performance et dans l’optimisation de requêtes SQL et dans le design de cube

Forte connaissance d’ETL, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS (SQL Server Integration/Reporting Services)

Expérience de programmation avec des langages MDXConnaissance de Team Foundation Version Control (TFVC)

Connaissance de l’approche « Kimball » ou « Data Vault » (atout)

Connaissance de C#/VB/PowerShell (atout)

Connaissance des BD Microsoft Azure (atout)

Expérience en analyse d'affaires (atout)

Connaissance de Power BI (atout)






Avantages sociaux



Rémunération compétitive

Horaire flexible

Remboursement d'activités de formation et perfectionnement

Assurance des frais médicaux et paramédicaux, assurance vie et invalidité longue durée et compte santé

Télétravail





Le succès de notre organisation repose sur l’énorme talent et la complémentarité de notre équipe. Nous avons confiance qu’ensemble, nous pouvons tout accomplir. C’est pourquoi le bien-être de nos collègues ainsi que leur développement font partie de nos priorités.

Si tu es enthousiaste et passionné.e de ton domaine d’expertise, nous serons enchantés de recevoir ta candidature. 


Fais-nous parvenir ton CV dès aujourd’hui à : emplois@syntell.com



Nous te remercions de ton intérêt!

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
About BeyondTrust



BeyondTrust is the worldwide leader in Privileged Access Management (PAM), empowering organizations to secure and manage their entire universe of privileges. Our integrated products and platform offer the industry's most advanced PAM solution, enabling organizations to quickly shrink their attack surface across traditional, cloud, and hybrid environments.

Learn more at www.beyondtrust.com.



Job Summary



As an Software Engineer in our Software Engineering department, you will collaborate with our Engineering and Technical Support teams. We are looking for a passionate and motivated Engineer who enjoys the challenge of solving tough problems in a dynamic environment. This individual thrives at problem-solving, getting to the root cause within a software or the environment in which it runs, and is motivated by doing what is right for our products and our customers.



In This Role, You Will




Work directly with the Engineering and Support departments to investigate, troubleshoot and triage complex, code-related technical issues, gather product feedback, implement code fixes and build patches.

Attempt re-create customer reported defects with the help of QA Engineers

Join calls with Support Engineers to help with advanced troubleshooting efforts

Create and update knowledge base and frequently asked questions articles

Create hotfixes across various product versions

Continually maintain detailed tracking of work activities in AzDo

Maintain a Development environment

Participate in developing new processes


What is Required?


2+ Years’ experience in software development

Track record of developing high-quality code in C++ 11 and higher

Experience working in a cross-functional team to deliver software

Able to communicate, collaborate and work ineffectively in a distributed team

Experience in Object-Oriented Programming

Knowledge of Windows APIs

Familiarity with software build tools, issue tracking, Git and Visual Studio

Experience writing multi-threaded code

Great troubleshooting skills


What isn’t required but would be AWESOME?


Familiarity with gtest/gmock, C++ templates, Windows Services, Active Directory, LDAP, COM, ADSI, Windows Device Drivers, Smart Cards, WHQL testing, SQL, and PostgreSQL, ATL, Windows IOCP

Experience with client/server architectures, RPC, IPC, and Named Pipes

Experience in software development in C# / .NET

Experience in developing security software

Secure coding practices, and knowledge of operating system security architecture

Experience in developing enterprise software

Familiarity with Agile methodologies

Experience using Visualization Environments using VMWare Workstation and ESX


Who are you?


You love to find problems in other people’s code and fix them

You have unwavering personal integrity and work ethic

You are flexible! You are a team player and excel individually as the situation dictates.

You don’t shy away from customer demands.

You ask, “how we can, not why we can’t”.

You are passionate, optimistic, and energetic.

You have an insatiable thirst for knowledge and improvement and the desire to grow in your role and with the company!

You always work for the best interest of the team.

You are proactive; a tenacious self-starter to the core.

You graciously give and receive feedback.



A Note on Covid-19


It’s paramount that you feel safe and secure throughout our hiring process and, if successful, as you onboard into the business. In response to the current Covid-19 pandemic, whilst the majority of our offices remain open, we are recommending that our employees work from home where possible. All of our interviews are taking place virtually over Microsoft Teams or Zoom and we are onboarding all-new global hires on a remote basis.

We understand that the world of work is evolving and we are a company that prides itself on our adaptability and ability to provide an inclusive and flexible environment that embraces all team members regardless of whether they are based in one of our offices or at home.


BeyondTrust is an EEO/AA/Disability/Vets Employer and an equal opportunity employer, offering a competitive salary with excellent benefits. We welcome all candidate applications who meet the minimum qualifications listed above.


What truly makes BeyondTrust special are the people – people who keep the culture strong and make working here exciting, rewarding, and ultimately fun!

Search @beyondtrust and #beyondtrustlife on Twitter and LinkedIn to find out more.

Company Description


Technicolor Production Services is the division with Technicolor which contain Technicolor’s world leading Visual effects and Animation brands such as MPC, The Mill, and Mikros.

Technicolor’s brands have worked on the spectacular scenes and tiny details that make movies, advertising campaigns and Animation movies truly mind-blowing. We’re the people behind the effects in countless blockbuster films like The Lion King, The Spongebob Movie: Sponge on the Run and advertising campaigns for clients such as Samsung, Audi, Nike and Apple. We are constantly looking for the best talent in the world, enthusiastic people that come in everyday to be a part of some of the best work in the industry. Technicolor’s artists are wildly creative, uber talented and passionate about the possibilities of VFX, Experiential, Animation and Technology. When you join the team, you’ll be working with and learning from the most skilled people in the business.


Job Description



About The Team and Our Work


Our status as a world-class VFX facility has been achieved through the development of industry-leading software which empowers our artists to create stunning imagery. We have curated a considerable portfolio of off-the-shelf and in-house software to meet these unique requirements, and continue to evolve and improve our technology as new needs emerge. The Core Engineering team operates within a larger R&D division to provide the business critical infrastructure that enables multiple projects with thousands of shots to be simultaneously completed across the globe efficiently and to the highest quality.

A blend of globally distributed software, systems and operations experts, we are responsible for building and maintaining key infrastructure and services in collaboration with site-local engineering teams and other specialized development teams. With users in all areas of the company, our solution (the Core Platform) is based on a distributed micro-services environment providing capabilities in areas such as compute, storage, sync, and digital asset management. Development and operational support spans the stack from operating system through to desktop/web application front-ends.

In recognition of the flexibility, scalability and maturity of the Core Platform that has been created by the team for MPC, we have been tasked with establishing the Core Platform elsewhere, making it available to other business units that are part of Technicolor’s portfolio.


About The Role


The Compute team is responsible for overseeing implementation of the global Technicolor FEV compute initiatives, around the various on-prem and in-cloud compute resources and their use. Compute developers are responsible for the implementation of projects and products that solve the global render and compute problem, providing exceptional business value.

The Core Platform has a broad scope and diverse user group. While there is some expectation of the role to work across multiple aspects of the platform (building features, fixing bugs, general enhancements), some developers do specialise and focus on specific subject areas. This may happen immediately, or after some time having gained familiarity with many areas of the platform.


Your Responsibilities


In this role, your responsibilities will include;


Work with your colleagues to fix bugs, develop features, and define new services from start to finish.

Responsible for implementing several concurrent, high visibility projects in a fast-paced environment that may cross multiple business unit and/or divisions but focus on show delivery for Technicolor FEV.

Communicate tasks, challenges and workflows across a globally distributed team.

Advocate for professional standards of development.

Troubleshoot problems across different levels of the stack, and in production environments.

Take responsibility for code quality, always leaving projects in better state than before you started work.

Contribute to maintaining an authoritative source of documentation.

Evangelise use of the Core Platform within MPC and other Technicolor business units.

Take initiative to improve the developer experience in small or large ways.

Provide some level of operational support for the platform as required.



About You



Qualifications


To succeed in the role, the following experience and competencies are required;


Production-level experience using Python for web/desktop applications, service backends or development infrastructure.

SQL and general database knowledge for query writing and optimisation.

Degree, or equivalent, in a computer science or related engineering subject.

Experienced in managing large, complex projects in a high-tech development environment.

Experience using development best practices.

Familiarity with source control, in particular Git, and associated best practices.

Comfortable working in a primarily Linux based development and runtime environment.

Solid knowledge of testing principles, in particular TDD and/or BDD.

Proven problem-solving skills around technical, product and business requests.

Be able to consider a technical solution from different perspectives, including algorithms, complexity, correctness, maintainability.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Be self-motivated and demonstrate strong organisational skills.


Previous experience in the VFX industry is not required to be successful in this role.


Nice to Have


The following are not essential to be successful in the role, however prior experience or the desire to grow in these areas will be of benefit;


ReactJS exposure or any similar framework is an added advantage.

Knowledge of the various components used to develop micro-service frameworks (such as uWSGI, NGINX, RabbitMQ and Flask).

Knowledge in k8/Kubernetes and Docker is an added advantage.

Understanding of CI/CD best practices and advocate for their use and improvement.

Tractor knowledge is an added advantage.

Cloud experience.

Cross-platform development on Windows and OS X.

Knowledge of Python packages and frameworks such as Flask, PyQt, PyMySQL, etc.

Experience of Agile and lean methodologies, and an interest in process improvement in these areas.

Comfortable working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment where requirements change.

Able to present technical concepts to a broad audience with varying level of technical understanding.

An awareness of security and keeping content secure.



Additional Information


Please click here to review our privacy notices for job applicants.

If you require assistance applying, please reach out to tcstalent@technicolor.com and we'll be happy to assist.


TECHNICOLOR IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER


Technicolor complies and prohibits against discrimination on the basis of race, religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, medical condition (including genetic characteristics), mental and/or physical disability or handicap, marital status, sex, age, veteran status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, gender identity, political party preference, political belief, socioeconomic status, familial status, registered domestic partner status, military service, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions and any other characteristic or activity protected by federal, state/provincial or local law.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting and Financial Services
description:
Vous serez membre d’un Squad qui a comme objectif d’innover et de développer de nouvelles façons d’intégrer des données et des sources de données à nos actifs, ainsi que de rendre disponibles les données pour nos clients et consommateurs. Nous avons pris le virage DevOps, et nous avons l’ambition d’accélérer notre transformation dans les prochaines années. Pour ce faire, on a besoin de toi, de ton attitude et de ton talent.







• Agir en tant qu’expert de référence dans tous les aspects d
’intégration technique et des flux de donnée
s.

• Design des solutions d’intégrations et de consommations de données au moyen d’ETL, d’API et/ou de Streaming Kafka incluant la portion de surveillance des applications (AppDynamics, Datadog, etc.).

• Accompagner les équipes de support applicatif et d’exploitation TI dans le diagnostic et la résolution de problèmes opérationnelles.

• Contribuer à l’automatisation des processus d’intégration continue, de mise à l’essai automatisée et de déploiement continu.

• Interagir avec les différentes parties prenantes afin de comprendre les besoins d’affaires. Responsable des éléments techniques et ‘NFR’ du ‘backlog’. Collaboration avec le/la gestionnaire de produit (‘PO’).

• Donner de la visibilité sur la dette technique.

• Proposer des interventions et correctifs permanents dans une perspective d’amélioration continue.

• Maintenir la connaissance technique des écosystèmes SOA, API, DataPower, Kafka et MQ, incluant les points d’intégration internes et externes (avec les applications consommatrices).

• Supporter les équipes d’architecture, de conception et de développement dans leurs activités de livraison de solutions.

• Participer activement à la planification 12 mois des projets de maintenance et d’évolution.

• Faire un suivi périodique des projets en mode réalisation.

• Travailler en collaboration avec l’architecte d’entreprise et concepteurs afin de créer le design de haut niveau d’une solution d’intégration de bout en bout en définissant les interfaces et le flux de données requis entre les applications et les activités liées aux processus organisationnels afin de soutenir les applications.

• Créer un inventaire de toutes les interactions inter-applications, les interfaces et les services en se fondant sur les diagrammes des activités et du flux de données.

• Définir les méthodes d’intégration à utiliser.

• Soutenir l’architecte de données dans la modélisation du flux de données entre les applications.

• Soutenir l’architecte de la sécurité dans l’établissement d’un modèle sécuritaire à utiliser pour l’intégration.

• Travailler en collaboration avec les directeurs de programme afin de s’assurer que la solution d’intégration est conforme au programme et aux cibles de l’architecture d’entreprise.





Profil recherché


Si tu te démarques par ton désir d’innover, ta curiosité, ton pragmatisme ainsi que ta capacité d’apprentissage et d’adaptation, tu es sans doute le membre que nous cherchons pour compléter notre équipe! Les données sont au cœur de notre organisation et la qualité de celles-ci permet de bien orienter les décisions d'affaires de l'organisation, mais aussi celles de nos clients pour leur avenir. Si tu as envie de partager ton expérience en données, si tu veux avoir un impact important et être au cœur du changement, tu es la personne parfaite pour nous!





Qualifications


• 10 années ou plus d'expérience pertinente.

• Baccalauréat ou maîtrise en informatique, génie logiciel ou l’équivalent.

• Bilinguisme (français/anglais).

• Expérience dans le rôle d’architecte et/ou concepteur senior dans la livraison de projets.

• Aptitudes naturelles de leader, d’influenceur, d’innovateur et de communicateur de grande envergure et dans une grande organisation.

• Maîtriser les concepts, technologies et solutions d’un écosystème moderne: Architecture par domaine, Micro-services, API, streaming, technologies Cloud, Flux de données temps-réel, Orchestration, « Straight Through Processing », de sécurité d’accès, élasticité, PaaS, Cloud, DevOps, etc.

• Connaissances des outils de développement logiciel en mode agile, de gestion du code source et DevOps (Jenkins, git-Bitbucket, Nexus, Docker, etc.).

• Connaissance des langages Java / Python.

• Expérience sur les technologies Unix/Linux, OpenShift, WebSphere, DataPower, Kafka et MQ.

• Expérience en développement sur les outils/technologies API Connect, WAS, RESTFul, Swagger, YAML, JSON, SOAP et XML.

• Expérience sur les technologies DevOps Jenkins et UrbanCode.

• Expérience dans la rédaction de documents techniques.

• Être disponible sur appel par rotation (24/7).

• Expérience de développement au sein d'équipes suivant les meilleures pratiques DevOps et d'intégration en continu.

Axcient is a global IT company headquartered in Denver, Colorado. Axcient delivers essential business continuity and disaster recovery (BCDR) solutions that are easy for Managed Service Providers (MSPs) to deploy and manage. The rise of cybersecurity threats like phishing and ransomware have made BCDR solutions more important than ever to safeguard data and keep companies secure and productive. MSPs rely on Axcient to address these complex challenges with BCDR solutions that are simple, comprehensive, and profitable. Today, join our amazing team that is dedicated to a big idea - Curing Data Loss!


Our Core Values:


Take it, Own it 
Take action and be accountable


Be Agile 
Prioritize, execute, evaluate, and iterate


Reject Mediocrity 
Don’t accept average results


Do the Right Thing 
Act with integrity


Team to Win 
Commit to collaborate



Summary


The Windows Cloud Engineer will join a small team in charge of maintaining and building out our Windows and VMWare environments in our private cloud. You will regularly collaborate with multiple departments worldwide to both maintain our current environment and engineer new solutions to fit our business needs.

Key Responsibilities


Monitor status of existing Windows and VMware environments

Act as an escalation point to our Technical Support Teams

Troubleshoot and resolve issues with our VMware Development environment

Assist in maintaining our Microsoft SCCM Environment

Maintain and create Power-Shell scripts

Create and Maintain documentation



Who You Are

We are looking for an independent worker that loves to dig into problems to find root causes.


Extensive experience with VMware in clustered environments.

Extensive experience with large Windows server environments.

Experience with SCCM patching, deployments and configurations.

Strong understanding of PowerShell scripting.

Independent worker that enjoys solving problems as a team.

Experience with backup products is a plus.

Experience with Linux environments is a plus.

Experience with AWS, Oracle Cloud, and GCP is a plus.

Bachelors degree preferred



The estimated salary range for this position is $75,000 to $85,000. Actual compensation may vary and will be based on a candidate’s qualifications, skills, and competencies.


Benefits include:

Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance (with an option for Axcient to pay 100% of your coverage)

Life and Disability Insurance

Flexible Spending Account and Health Saving Account Options

401K

Flex Friday (Every Other Friday Off) 

Flexible PTO

Flexible Work Location

Tuition Reimbursement



Check us out on !


At Axcient, we’re more than the sum of our parts. We value our unique team members, and our company thrives when we support and celebrate our differences.
