Position
 
Description:
 

We believe Solutions Engineers at Okta are involved in all stages of the customer’s development lifecycle and are experienced using presentations, email, phone and social media to connect with customers. We are looking for great teammates that can build sales presentations, product demonstrations, and educate customers (everyone from developers to product managers to C-level executives) on the best ways to cloud security technology. We believe in Okta’s Solutions Engineers empathize with customers and quickly discern their true technical needs by asking detailed and clarifying questions and presenting solutions that target those needs. You have the rare combination of technical savviness and business insight and you’re looking for a career where you can utilize both. As a Solutions Engineer at Okta, you will hone each of these skills by advising a diverse set of customers on what is possible using Okta’s Identity Platform.





Job Duties and Responsibilities:



Support the sales team in helping customers understand what they can achieve with Okta

Understand customer requirements and communicate the business value of solving technology problems using cloud technology

Execute the delivery of POCs for customers that have more complex use cases, collaborating with other Okta engineering teams as needed

Craft technical content to show customers how to implement specific use cases or standard methodologies for new technologies

Prepare demos and proof of concepts to demonstrate various use cases for Okta’s Platform

Distill and communicate customer needs and product feedback to Product Management, Engineering, Marketing and Sales






Required Skills
:


5+ years pre-sales engineering experience.

Bilingual (French and English is a Must) 

A passion to serve the customer, which has played out in some customer-facing role like consulting or support, ideally solutions engineering.

An ability to quickly communicate complex ideas around a technical topic, ideally on the fly at a whiteboard.

Experience with at least one standard network security protocol. (eg. OAuth, OAuth2, SAML, LDAP)

We are looking for someone with hands-on experience in one or more of the following areas: web (JavaScript, HTML, frontend frameworks) development, mobile (iOS, Android) development, backend (Java, C#, Node.js, Python, PHP, Ruby) development, IP-based real-time communications

An understanding of core security concerns within a typical application. (password hashing, SSL/TLS, encryption at rest, XSS, XSRF)

You are an elite communicator.

Confident dispensing knowledge to a highly skilled and experienced audience.

Typically 10-25% travel.

Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, MIS or a comparable field is preferred.

Role: OPERATIONS WINDOWS SRE - (220000DU)



Location: Toronto, CA






Who are we?


The SRE Operations team at CX Marketing Eloqua are the core responsible for ensuring our production platform stays online, performant and up to date. As senior technologists, we manage our on-prem hardware infrastructure from SAN storage, to Hypervisor to OS and application, as well as planning and executing on our migration to OCI Cloud Infrastructure. 

Our team is dedicated to the continuous improvement of both systems and processes related to delivering the Eloqua application to our customers.

 


Who are we looking for?


We have a global team spanning 4 different geographical sites in North America and India. We are looking for a highly technical member who will plan and execute critical state-of-the-art infrastructure build and improvement projects for the CX Marketing Eloqua application.

If you are looking for a place where you can bring in your creativity and use the latest tools and frameworks look no further 

 


Job Responsibilities 


Following are the essential responsibilities of this role. It is a constantly evolving role with increased responsibilities as the business evolves


Work on varied projects within the CX Marketing Eloqua SRE team.

Work closely with the team in India and North America (Canada and US).

Work on our Legacy and Cloud infrastructure stack and make continual improvements for increased throughput and optimal use of resources.

Troubleshoot escalated issues related to server build consistency, performance, and best practices for key components.

Mentor junior members of the team and interns in technical aspects.

Plan for and execute regular maintenance including OS patching, image updating and deployment of images in legacy and cloud environments.

Work on migrating Eloqua to the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure using tools like terraform/terragrunt, helm, etc.


 


Our stack and philosophy


Chef, terraform/terragrunt, Hyper-V, IIS, Kafka, Gitlab, Docker, Teamcity, Sensu, Grafana, Prometheus, ELK stack, WebLogic, PowerShell, Ruby/Javascript, RabbitMQ, Systemd, Active Directory, PowerMTA, Windows/Linux, Data Visualization technologies etc..

Our Product stack is on both Windows and Linux, and we develop on Macs. Expertise in both platforms is essential for success.

Scale is our current passion and our backlog of exciting projects are tremendous

While Ruby is our current favorite for most of the development (specifically Chef), it doesn't matter if you are a star programmer in any of the following - Java, C++/C#, Javascript, Python - we will be happy to talk to you too

We are obviously big on databases - Microsoft as well as Oracle. Comfort in SQL is all we are looking for in these positions. Of course, deep knowledge of Oracle databases is an added plus.

Our philosophy is to make the life of our developers, testers and cloud team and eventually our customers as easy as possible.

This would probably be your once in a lifetime opportunity to be part of a startup kind of culture with the benefits of the backing of one of the most reputed and largest companies around.

 


Skill-sets needed:


While we know that not everyone can be a master at everything, we are looking for people with interest and basic understanding of the following

 


Windows 
– Everyone has done windows sometime or other. You will be doing more. Need to know Windows Services layer, APIs and probably done some sort of batch scripting on Windows servers

 


Active Directory
 – Do you know FSMO roles? Familiar with replication, USNs, Kerberos? We use AD in our server infrastructure for almost everything, so knowing how to make it work well is critical

 


Networking
 – We deal with very many networking challenges in our day-to-day work. While we do not expect you to be a network administrator, understanding of the basic concepts of networking is a must have.

 


Chef/Ansible
– Have you done Chef or Ansible? By that what we mean is you have written scripts using these tools, not just used them. If not, how about
 CFEngine, Saltstack, or Puppet?


 


PowerShell
 – Knowing PowerShell scripting is highly valuable in an environment heavily using Windows Server, SQL Server and Active Directory.

 


Linux
 – Need system level knowledge of Linux. Starting from understanding of Kernel architecture, process management and configuring a linux system?

 


Docker and Containers
 – Being able to build and deploy images is a critical part of our operations. We expect all our stack to be containerized in the next several months. Have you heard about this technology and does it interest you?

 


Shell/Perl/Regex
 – Knowing Shell scripting or Perl would show us that you have solid system administration automation experience. 

 


PowerShell
 – Knowing PowerShell scripting is highly valuable in an environment heavily using Windows Server, SQL Server and Active Directory.

 


Agile/Scrums/Kanban/JIRA
 – The SRE team does agile. We have 2 week sprints while managing the day-to-day ad-hoc operational needs.

 


Git
 – You are more than just a Git user. Would you know how to branch, merge, squash, stash, and patch?

 


CI Systems
 – We are big on 
Teamcity
. If you are not, don’t worry, how about 
Jenkins/Buildbot/Electric Commander/Hudson/Circle
 or any other popular ones? Again, we are looking for someone who has modeled workflows in a CI system and has in depth administration knowledge or at least understanding of the concepts. We leverage these systems along with app deployment teams to execute regular and ad-hoc jobs

 


Databases / SQL
 – Being at Oracle developing enterprise systems, we need you to have a pretty good understanding of databases. We prefer Microsoft SQL Server and Oracle Database. If your understanding of how these databases work is minimal, we would at least want you to be familiar with SQL syntax from basic (INSERT/SELECT) to intermediate ( JOIN/UNION/SCHEMA/STREAM/etc)

 


Email
 – Email functionality is a core feature of our service. Understanding of SMTP, IMAP as well as best practices using SPF, DKIM, DMARC is beneficial.

 


Communication skills
 – Perhaps this is one of the most important skills that is often overlooked. Our team currently is spread across potentially 6 geographical locations and effective oral and written communication is what’s really going to make it successful. SRE @ Oracle requires people skills in supporting several people around the world and gone are the days when you are a reclusive programmer

Key Responsibilities




Apart from the regular consulting/ architecting/ roadmap definitions/design and implementations, be able to assist in creating proposals that address current and evolving client requirements.

Function as technical lead.

Ability to supervise staff and plan/assign work on project engagements. Leads project quality assurance activities, including technical QA reviews.

Establish relationships with client technical counterparts.

Participates in client meetings related to development efforts.

Prepares, maintains and submits activity/progress reports and time recording/management reports in accordance with published procedures.

Keeps project managers informed of activities, alerting of any issues promptly.

Understands that travel and/or flexible working hours may be required for project implementation depending on customer requirements.

Should be prepared to pick up products/solutions from the portfolio of service offering and expand to other areas of security

Should be able to map functional requirements to technical requirements for highly complex project




Essential Requirements




BE/BTech in Computer Science OR Information Technology.

Should have at least 6 - 10years of Software Engineering experience working on large-scale consulting and implementation/installation using some of the leading security products.

Should have been actively involved in API based 3rd party implementations

Should have a deep understanding of SOAP and REST APIs. This is a key and mandatory requirement

Good knowledge of LDAP and AD is very essential

Should be extremely passionate about programming with one of the programming languages like J2EE Technologies: Java (JDK 1.8/1.7/1.6/1.5), Spring Boot, Spring Security, Spring Retry, XML, XML Parsers (SAX, DOM), JSP, JSF, WSDL, WADL, Struts 2.0, SOAP, REST Services and Multithreading, Docker

UI technologies: HTML5, Angular JS, Google, JQuery, CSS, JSON, Ajax

Application/Web Servers: Wildfly, Websphere, Weblogic, Tomcat 7.x

Apache Java Tools: Maven, Log4J.

O/R Mapping Tools: Hibernate 3.x, MyBatis

O/S Platforms: Windows, UNIX.

Databases: Oracle, Mongo DB

The ideal candidate should have experience in integrating disparate security products. This is good to have but not mandatory.

Focus on Customer-centric solutions, implement and deliver in short intervals.

Work independently and effectively within and across teams.


We have a long track record, in delivering industry-leading solutions to the largest operators around the globe. These operators have challenges that preclude traditional approaches. We understand their needs, we understand their constraints, and we apply creative software and services solutions to solving these problems.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing, and Software Development
description:
Worker Sub-Type



Regular



Job Description



BlackBerry® QNX® is a trusted supplier of safe and secure operating systems, hypervisors, frameworks and development tools, and provides expert support and services for building the world’s most critical embedded systems. We are the embedded experts. BlackBerry QNX was born in embedded, and provides time-tested and trusted foundation software, including our deterministic microkernel real-time operating system (RTOS), safety-certified products, middleware and security solutions, all purpose-built for embedded systems.

BlackBerry QNX software is trusted by more than 68% of the Electric Vehicle market by volume, 23 of the top 25 EV manufacturers and is running in more than 195 million vehicles globally.  Our foundation products have been pre-certified to ISO 26262 ASIL D and we offer a broad range of board support packages, professional services, AUTOSAR adaptive support and middleware solutions – from acoustic management, to digital cockpits to advanced driving assistance (ADAS) - to accelerate development and help OEMs meet Start of Production (SOP) dates.

Our Engineering Services Development Group is seeking a skilled individual for network driver development for the QNX operating system. The candidate would be assisting customers and partners with integrating network devices with the QNX OS network manager. This includes developing new hardware drivers from vendor documentation, extending existing driver functionality, developing additional PHY management code, and developing ethernet switch managers. The candidate would also be responsible for estimating the scope of the development projects to support sales management. The main scope of responsibility would be driver code development but also includes performance and optimization analysis and support for developed drivers.

The ideal candidate is an intelligent enthusiastic individual with proven experience in embedded network driver development.



Responsibilities




Develop and maintain network drivers

Interact with hardware vendors for required documentation and support questions

Provide project estimates for requirements, design, implementation and testing.

Provide clear communication with development team members, technical leads and management on project status, risks and approaches

Conduct design reviews, code reviews and unit test with technical peers

Identify, analyze and resolve potentially complex problems and issues with existing driver implementations

Liaise with customers regarding product performance, problems, and system design.




Essential Skills And Qualifications




Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent

4+ years of Software Development experience.

Experience with relevant programming languages (C).

Knowledge and experience in some of the following; MDIO, PTP (Precision Time Protocol), networking stacks, IPv4, IPv6, network provisioning and debugging, network protocol analysis




Additional Assets




Experience in embedded and real-time systems development.

Experience with performance, memory, and post-mortem analysis.

Experience with safety systems.

Knowledge of POSIX based operating system

Experience in low-level Assembly and register-level programming.

Strong problem solving and debugging skills.

Excellent communication skills including verbal, written, and interpersonal.

High degree of motivation and ability to work both independently and in a team.




Scheduled Weekly Hours



40

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting and Software Development
description:
Clio is more than just a tech company–we are a global leader that is transforming the legal experience for all by bettering the lives of legal professionals while increasing access to justice.

We are currently seeking a 
Senior 
 
IT Systems Developer
 to join our rapidly growing IT team. This isn’t a typical IT role - our team is driven by process improvement, efficiency automation, and creative custom solutions. This role is available to candidates across Canada, excluding Quebec.


What your team does:


The IT team’s mission is foundational to how we get work done at Clio, our team has a meaningful and lasting impact. We’re focused on facilitating the best possible experience for our Clio talent, providing the right tools at the right time to further Clio’s mission of changing the practice of law, for good. We’re driven by automation and love building our own solutions when we can’t find an existing one that fits.


A day in your life might look like:



 Identify opportunities for automation throughout the company and implement solutions that accelerate the ability of Clions all over the globe. 

 Maintain and improve our IAM policies and strategies in Okta, with an eye to context aware and zero-trust solutions. 

 Mentor and pair with other members of the IT department. 

 Deploy infrastructure for our internal services using tools such as Terraform and Kubernetes. 

 Take ownership of technical direction and deliverables for your domain. 

 Continually grow and strive to push technical boundaries. 




What you may have:



 Experience with endpoint configuration and orchestration tools such as Munki, Jamf, Kandji, and InTune (bonus points if you have experience in tools such as Chef or Puppet). 

 Experience in at least two of the following: 


 Ruby 

 Python 

 Bash/Shell 

 Golang 


 Familiarity with common SaaS environments such as Google Workspace, Okta, Slack, etc. 

 Comfortable working with REST and GraphQL APIs. 

 Experience as an administrator for identity platforms such as Okta or OneLogin. 

 Fundamental understanding of core IAM concepts such as SSO, SAML, OIDC, HRIS as a source. 

 Very comfortable working in the terminal and utilizing version control such as Git. 




Serious bonus points if you have:



 Experience with using Aruba Central based network equipment. 




Diversity, Inclusion, Belonging and Equity (DIBE) & Accessibility 


Our team shows up as their authentic selves, and are united by our mission. We are dedicated to diversity, equity and inclusion . We pride ourselves in building and fostering an environment where our teams feel included, valued, and enabled to do the best work of their careers, wherever they choose to log in from. We believe that different perspectives, skills, backgrounds, and experiences result in higher-performing teams and better innovation. We are committed to equal employment and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

Clio provides accessibility accommodations during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Learn more about our culture at clio.com/careers


About Clio


At Clio, we are on a mission to transform the legal experience for all. As the world's leading provider of cloud-based legal software, we provide lawyers with low-barrier, affordable solutions to manage and grow their firms more effectively, more profitably, and with better client experiences. Through the cloud, we believe that we can help create a more inclusive legal community and a more equitable legal system.

We are an award-winning team that has been recognized as one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies , Canada’s Most Admired Cultures and has topped Fast Company’s list of Most Innovative Companies . In line with our mission, we’ve been up to some big things, including becoming a multi-product company, launching a $1 million COVID-19 Legal Relief Initiative , and most recently, securing a US$110M Series E funding round and a USD $1.6B valuation.

This is a historic moment in the growth of legal technology! As the first legal practice management unicorn globally, and one of only a handful of Canadian unicorns, this is only the beginning. If you’ve ever wanted to do the best work of your career, while having a meaningful impact in the lives of others, then Clio is the place for you.

Position Summary:* Actalent is a global leader in engineering services and is a subsidiary of the Allegis Group, North America’s largest privately-held human capital solutions company. Actalent is continuing to build a software division and strengthen its engineering capabilities in Montreal. We operate out of a new engineering facility in Ville Saint-Laurent and have a very collaborative and cohesive work environment. Actalent‘s hiring package for full-time position includes a comprehensive medical benefits package, training and development program, personal and sick days, etc. This position is focused on software and algorithm development of ADAS functionalities using camera systems. In this role, you will work in an agile development team to create ADAS functions and features for customer projects. As an agile software developer, you will be expected to perform the following tasks:.

Perform software development and requirements engineering according to the V-model.

Analyze customer requirements and create related subsystem and module requirements.

Create design documentation in both text and model-based formats.

Implement logic for new features and/or modify existing logic to realize the design.

Perform reviews for requirements, designs, and implementations, as well as support other team members with theirs.

Follow the defined software development processes, while proactively pushing to improve and streamline all areas of the process.

Support module testing for assigned software components.

Work closely with Requirements Owners / Project Managers to develop quality test cases.

Analyze and document test data and results.

Support validation on system / vehicle level as well as customer validation trips.

Communicate with other Software Developers globally to share knowledge and lessons learned.

Required Skills and Experience:*

Bachelors Degree in Electronics, Electrical Engineering, Instrumentation, Computer Science or related

Strong programming skills in C++ (2+ years experience)

Desired Skills and Experience:*

1+ years of experience working in automotive companies (Tier 1 or OEMs)

Experience with computer vision, image processing and machine learning

Familiarity with image stitching as part of ADAS environment

Familiarity with development environments such as MATLAB

Prior experience in automotive software development

Experience working in feature teams using Agile / SCRUM methodologies

Experience in using continuous integration SW development workflows

Experience in software debugging on embedded target.

Familiar with unit test frameworks like GoogleTest, Cantata++, …

Experience in working w/ vehicle network messages (CAN, Flexray, Ethernet)

Familiarity with automotive processes like ASpice, ISO26262

Experience in requirements engineering (e.g. w/ Rational Doors)

Rapid prototyping and scripting using Python, etc.

Introduction


At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.


Your Role and Responsibilities



Introduction


As a Technical Architect, you will lead IBM into the future by shaping and innovating Salesforce and digital solutions that reinvent the way our clients do business. The success of IBM is in your hands as you transform vital business needs into solutions and drive innovation. Your work will power IBM and its clients globally, collaborating and integrating code into enterprise systems. You will have access to the latest education, tools and technology, and a limitless career path with the world’s technology leader. Come to IBM and make a global impact!


Your Role and Responsibilities




 Create and envision solutions that transform the way our clients conduct business

 Scope and estimate Salesforce and digital user-centric solution

 Provides advanced technical and/or business consultative services during both the pre-sales and delivery cycles

 Effectively collaborates with business consultants, project team and client resources to determine technical and functional requirements

 Designs and develops customer solutions in Lightning, VisualForce, Apex, D/HTML, CSS, JavaScript, AJAX and other technologies

 Effectively facilitates Technical Process Review sessions and technical UAT’s




Required Technical and Professional Expertise




 Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field

 5 years of prior experience in a consultative role building Salesforce-based solution

 Good knowledge of object-oriented concepts and development experience with design patterns including MVC and MVC framework

 Good knowledge in integration-based project in enterprise context (examples: SOAP, REST API, data strategy, 3rd party integration)

 Attained Platform Developer I certification AND (Application Architect or Data Architecture & Management or Integration Architecture Designer) certifications

 Knowledge of Agile development practices

 Ability to travel up to 50%




Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise




 Platform Developer II and any other Domain Specialization certifications

 Certified Technical Architect is a great addition

 French language



Must have the ability to work in Canada without sponsorship.


About Business Unit


IBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants that design, build, and run foundational systems and services that is the backbone of the world's economy. IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter businesses by reimagining and reinventing through technology, with its outcome-focused methodologies, industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence.

This role requires you to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to your start date. Full vaccination refers to receiving dosage of COVID-19 vaccines that provide full protection in accordance with Canada Public Health and WHO guidance (full series of a 2 dose vaccine plus 14 days or a one dose vaccine plus 14 days from the last dose). Proof of vaccination status will be required. Booster vaccination requirements may be required. If you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical or religious reasons, we offer accommodations in accordance with applicable law.


Your Life @ IBM


Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.


About IBM


IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.


Location Statement

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Strategic Management Services
description:
Our client is seeking a Quality Assurance Tester to work within our clients Front Office development team on key reporting/dashboarding project within one of our Agile development teams.




The primary focus for this role is manual testing with a secondary focus on writing automated test cases & the execution automated test cases. The automation work is a distance second in the priority stack. Our manual testing is mainly comprised on manual black-box application testing, data validation testing (e.g. data quality/completeness/timeliness) and lastly leveraging application logging to verify functionality and performance of client-applications and backend services.





Please note this job is based in Vancouver






Responsibilities:



Drive the end-to-end testing process and prioritize tasks accordingly to meet project delivery timelines

Create test plans and record detailed metric to track progress outcomes

Perform regression tests, develop new and maintain existing test cases both manual and automated

Analyze the results of tests and test coverage to determine the quality of the solution

Maintain existing and create new automated test cases









Required Skills and Experience



Bachelor in Computer Science or equivalent

3+ years hands-on test automation experience using Test automation tools like Ranorex or similar tools

Hands-on experience with IDE development tools

Proficient experience with SQL, XML and web services tools as well as understanding HTML

Experience with setting up robust test environments and configurations (Windows)

Experience with Continuous Integration and related tools (TeamCity)

Software development experience in an Object Oriented environment , C# .NET

PL-SQL, T-SQL or SnowSQL queries to interrogate databases to validate data.
job_function: Information Technology, Quality Assurance, and Project Management

description:
Address



100 King Street West



Job Family Group



Technology

Understands that the success of a developer is to understand the core business processes of the business unit and business requirements as well as the architecture patterns and technology strategy (e.g., Transformation, SmartCore, DevOps). Conceive and write detailed software implementations/code while ensuring that their code/configurations adhere to the security, logging, error handling, and performance standards and non-functional requirements. Writes, configures, and integrates code to create the software that aligns with architecture patterns and technology strategy. Understands the implications of various components (including technology strategy & architecture) to the overall design of a program, system, or eco-system. Evaluates new technologies for fit with the program/system/eco-system and the associated upstream and downstream impacts on process, data, risk (e.g., security). Works toward the objective of defect free software. Ensures that systems functionally meet requirements, align with architecture and promote the development of common assets. Supports the resolution of production issues and problems. Makes recommendations to improve BMO processes & systems.

Assesses impact of design decisions to the computer solution/product/service being developed (i.e. performance, schedule, budget, downstream component/system impact, quality, etc.) and recommends alternate/creative solutions for mitigation/optimization if required.

Recommends and implements solutions based on analysis of issues and implications for the business.

Identifies emerging issues and trends to inform decision-making.

Leads and implements initiatives as required to deliver business objectives.

Conducts independent analysis and assessment to resolve strategic issues.

Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders and ensures alignment.

Monitors and tracks performance, and addresses any issues.

Leads/conducts detailed code-reviews and provides feedback in a constructive manner.

Decomposes business requirements and translates them into detailed design specifications and code.

Interacts with key business & technology stakeholders to define, analyze, and deliver requirements that reflect the needs of both the business and end-customers.

Assesses the costs and benefits for different solutions and recommend/decide on appropriate designs.

Designs solutions, writes code, performs unit testing, develops appropriate artefacts / documentation, and facilitates final delivery.

Supports production issues, includes independently completing root-cause analysis and diagnosis.

Devises new algorithms and data structures for target environment and platform attributes in alignment with architectural patterns.

Builds solutions that are supportable, scalable and achieve our aspiration of common assets.

Recommends or automates approaches to streamline and integrate technological processes and/or systems to improve operational efficiency and effectiveness.

Supports the management of specific project deliverables & outcomes.

Identifies opportunities to strengthen the development capability, such as: sharing expertise to promote technical development, mentoring employees, building communities of practice and networks.

Stays abreast of industry technical and business trends through participation in professional associations, practice communities & individual learning.

Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus.

Provides specialized consulting, analytical and technical support.

Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.

Works independently and regularly handles non-routine situations.

Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.



Qualifications



Typically between 5 - 7 years of relevant experience and/or certification in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

Advanced level of knowledge in domain.

Knowledge of software development practices, concepts, and technology obtained through formal training and/or work experience.

Knowledge of required programming languages and can code with little oversight.

Knowledge of technical/business environment and processes.

Understand functional aspects and technical behavior of the underlying operating system, development environment, and deployment practices.

Have facility with and understanding of the ecosystem that code operates in.

Deep knowledge and technical proficiency gained through extensive education and business experience.

Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.

Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.

Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth.

Influence skills - In-depth.

Data driven decision making - In-depth.

Candidate should have 8- 10 years of experience on application development using the below technologies

Core Java

Restful Web Services

Messaging services like JMS, MQ

Tomcat / IIS

Experience on Oracle DB and PL/SQL

Devops tools like Bit Bucket / JIRA /Confluence

Should have prior LEAD experience


We’re here to help


At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en.

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

532056BR


Introduction


At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.


Your Role and Responsibilities



Introduction


As a Technical Architect, you will lead IBM into the future by shaping and innovating Salesforce and digital solutions that reinvent the way our clients do business. The success of IBM is in your hands as you transform vital business needs into solutions and drive innovation. Your work will power IBM and its clients globally, collaborating and integrating code into enterprise systems. You will have access to the latest education, tools and technology, and a limitless career path with the world’s technology leader. Come to IBM and make a global impact!


Your Role and Responsibilities




 Create and envision solutions that transform the way our clients conduct business

 Scope and estimate Salesforce and digital user-centric solution

 Provides advanced technical and/or business consultative services during both the pre-sales and delivery cycles

 Effectively collaborates with business consultants, project team and client resources to determine technical and functional requirements

 Designs and develops customer solutions in Lightning, VisualForce, Apex, D/HTML, CSS, JavaScript, AJAX and other technologies

 Effectively facilitates Technical Process Review sessions and technical UAT’s




Required Technical and Professional Expertise




 Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field

 5 years of prior experience in a consultative role building Salesforce-based solution

 Good knowledge of object-oriented concepts and development experience with design patterns including MVC and MVC framework

 Good knowledge in integration-based project in enterprise context (examples: SOAP, REST API, data strategy, 3rd party integration)

 Attained Platform Developer I certification AND (Application Architect or Data Architecture & Management or Integration Architecture Designer) certifications

 Knowledge of Agile development practices

 Ability to travel up to 50%




Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise




 Platform Developer II and any other Domain Specialization certifications

 Certified Technical Architect is a great addition

 French language



Must have the ability to work in Canada without sponsorship.


About Business Unit


IBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants that design, build, and run foundational systems and services that is the backbone of the world's economy. IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter businesses by reimagining and reinventing through technology, with its outcome-focused methodologies, industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence.

This role requires you to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to your start date. Full vaccination refers to receiving dosage of COVID-19 vaccines that provide full protection in accordance with Canada Public Health and WHO guidance (full series of a 2 dose vaccine plus 14 days or a one dose vaccine plus 14 days from the last dose). Proof of vaccination status will be required. Booster vaccination requirements may be required. If you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical or religious reasons, we offer accommodations in accordance with applicable law.


Your Life @ IBM


Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.


About IBM


IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.


Location Statement


For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.


Being You @ IBM


IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Summary

 
Do you want to push the limits of the best Augmented Reality platform in the world? Apple's Technology Development Group (TDG) delivers algorithms that drive revolutionary Apple products, including the augmented reality (AR) platform ARKit to create ground-breaking new products. In this position, you will have the opportunity to be part of our extraordinary team of computer vision and deep learning researchers and engineers to discover and build solutions to previously-unsolved challenges and push the state of the art in AR algorithms that will change the way people experience the world!


Apple is looking for a driven and dedicated AR & VR software engineer to join our team. As a member of the Technology Development Group (Algorithm Dev), you have the unique and rewarding opportunity to work on upcoming releases of Apple products that delights and inspires millions of people every day! We invite you to contribute to our current Augmented Reality platform and craft the future of Apple! 


To succeed within this role, you should have shown experience in several of the following areas:

 

Key Qualifications

 
Excellent communication and teamwork skills

Excellent software engineering and coding skills for both CPU and GPU

Proficiency in C/C++, Python. 

Experience in Objective-C is a plus

Excellent system level problem solving and debugging skills 

Experience in CI tools and infrastructure, e.g Jenkins, Splunk

Experience in 3D rendering is a plus

Good understanding of challenges related to virtual reality is a plus

 

Description

 
The Algorithms organization in Apple’s Technology Development Group (TDG) is looking for a skilled software engineer, with a strong background in system level programming and debugging. In this role, you will perform integration of computer vision algorithms for ambitious real-world problems in Virtual and Augmented Reality.

 

Education & Experience

 
BS in computer science or equivalent

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Computer Hardware Manufacturing, and Software Development
description:
5G Layer 3 CU (Central Unit) Senior Developer 


Dell provides the technology that transforms the way we all work and live. But we are more than a technology company — we are a people company. We inspire, challenge, and respect every one of our over 100,000 employees. We also provide them with unparalleled growth and development opportunities. We can’t wait for you to discover this for yourself as a Layer 3 Developer on our 5G team in Ottawa, in a once in a career opportunity to be part of building something from scratch and shepherding it into the marketplace. We are also according to Glass Door the best place in Canada to work ! https://dell.to/3npEqq5

We’re excited to announce that we’re continuing to build our new 5G wireless O-RAN team from scratch and we’re looking for talented embedded software developers to take part. The Central Unit (CU) team has multiple openings for key roles in a new high-powered Ottawa R&D team. If you enjoy working on a new product, new software, new team, deep desire to learn and collaborate with others, then we want to hear from you.

The successful candidate would be involved with:


Implement and test key Layer 3 features, algorithms and integrate them with the DU and RU and other features in the CU 

LEAN Agile environment, implementing features in C++

Fixing defects in a timely manner

Working with other team members and software architects to determine the high level and detailed designs of the CU components.

Part of a scrum team responsible for the continuous integration (CI) and continuous delivery (CD) of the CU components.

Identifying, developing, executing, monitoring, and maintaining automated tests in Python

Work closely with the other development teams to ensure completeness, quality, and performance of the CU functionality

As a Senior Developer you may have additional team leadership responsibilities.



Must have Qualifications:


An excellent attitude and desire to work in a collaborative team environment where everybody in the scrum team owns the deliverables and quality.

C++ proficiency

3 to 10+ years’ experience working on carrier grade telecommunications products. 

The candidate will know what 99.9999% means.



Preferred Qualifications:


Experience working with wireless technologies, 4G, 5G, and particularly CU

Experience and knowledge with 3GPP, ORAN protocols, RRC, SDAP, PDCP

Experience working in a startup type environment would be an asset

Experience with Wireshark, gdb, and the Atlassian toolset




Here’s our story; now tell us yours


Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.

What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.

We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today.

You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here.

Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Dell encourages applicants of all ages. Read the full Equal Employment Opportunity Policy here.

Dell Canada Inc. (“Dell”) is committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve, and creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach her/his potential. We welcome applications from: women, Aboriginal persons, persons with disabilities, ethnic minorities, visible minorities, and others who may contribute to diversification.

As part of our commitment to accessibility for all persons with disabilities, Dell will, upon the request of the applicant, provide accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure equal access to applicants with disabilities.  (full time position)





The Opportunity 



 


Our Client being one of Canada’s leading conservation organizations, is looking for a technically savvy, energetic and dedicated individual to join their Information Systems team as a Web Application Developer.




In this position, you will be responsible for the development, support, and maintenance of mobile-friendly web applications that support their strategic business plans & goals.

Design, code, test and debug complex solutions consisting of new software and enhancements to existing applications and systems.

Demonstrate comprehensive knowledge of database and API structure and contribute to decisions on how each should be modified.

Act as a conduit between IT and other departments to facilitate business solutions success, integrating solutions for the greater benefit of the organization.

Work with managers to design solutions that achieve business goals.

Design, implement and support solutions with the utmost in information technology security in mind.

Conduct quarterly / monthly audits of software solutions should be executed in conjunction with the infrastructure team to ensure compliance with all regulatory guidelines.



 



Requirements

At least 3 years progressive experience building web-based applications in .NET.

Extensive experience working in full stack web application development.

Experience working in a complex agile development environment on critical systems.

Experience presenting highly complex solutions to decision makers.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
Overview



At Perficient you’ll deliver mission-critical technology and business solutions to Fortune 500 companies and some of the most recognized brands on the planet. And you’ll do it with cutting-edge technologies, thanks to our close partnerships with the world’s biggest vendors. Our network of offices across North America, as well as locations in India and China, will give you the opportunity to spread your wings, too.

We’re proud to be publicly recognized as a “Top Workplace” year after year. This is due, in no small part, to our entrepreneurial attitude and collaborative spirit that sets us apart and keeps our colleagues impassioned, driven, and fulfilled.

We are a leading-edge digital consultancy where team members build their careers solving complex and interesting business problems for great brands and clients. Clients love us because we fuse strategy, creative and technology into data-driven solutions – and we bring the full weight of a tech-savvy consulting firm to support our best-of-breed digital consultancy.

Our national Commerce Practice team is comprised of passionate and capable strategists, architects, project managers, business analysts, developers, and infrastructure specialists who specialize in the designing and implementing of industry leading eCommerce platforms. We deliver on the promise of a unified commerce experience, through strategic discussion aligned to business needs. We use an agnostic approach with a deep portfolio of options to address all levels of digital maturity. We are experts on the leading Commerce and Order Management platforms including HCL Commerce, Adobe Commerce (Magento), Optimizely, Znode, InRiver PIM, and IBM Sterling OMS.

Perficient currently has a career opportunity for a 
Sterling OMS Developer
 in our National Commerce Practice in the United States and/or Canada.



Job Overview



As a Senior Technical Consultant-
Sterling OMS Developer
 you will participate in all aspects of the software development lifecycle which includes estimating, technical design, implementation, documentation, testing, deployment and support of application developed for our clients. As a member working in a team environment you will work with solution architects and developers on interpretation/translation of wireframes and creative designs into functional requirements, and subsequently into technical design.



Responsibilities




 Participate in technical planning & requirements gathering phases including estimate, develop, test, manage projects, architect and deliver. 

 Develop code to meet functional and technical requirements. 

 Perform IBM OMS configuration, development, unit testing and support. 

 Develop and maintain effective working relationships with team members. 

 Demonstrate the ability to adapt and work with team members of various experience level. 




Qualifications




 Passionate coder with 4-7 years of application development experience with IBM Sterling Order Management platform. 

 Sterling Call Center and Web Store development experience is preferred! 

 Client facing or consulting experience highly preferred. 

 Skilled problem solvers with the desire and proven ability to create innovative solutions. 

 Flexible and adaptable attitude, disciplined to manage multiple responsibilities and adjust to varied environments. 

 Future technology leaders- dynamic individuals energized by fast paced personal and professional growth. 

 Phenomenal communicators who can explain and present concepts to technical and non-technical audiences alike, including high level decision makers. 

 Bachelor’s Degree in MIS, Computer Science, Math, Engineering or comparable major. 

 Solid foundation in Computer Science, with strong competencies in data structures, algorithms and software design. 

 Knowledge and experience in developing software using agile methodologies. 

 Proficient in authoring, editing and presenting technical documents. 

 Ability to communicate effectively via multiple channels (verbal, written, etc.) with technical and non-technical staff. 


Perficient full-time employees receive complete and competitive benefits. We offer a collaborative work environment, competitive compensation, generous work/life opportunities and an outstanding benefits package that includes paid time off plus holidays. In addition, all colleagues are eligible for a number of rewards and recognition programs including billable bonus opportunities. Encouraging a healthy work/life balance and providing our colleagues great benefits are just part of what makes Perficient a great place to work.

This is a full-time position with Perficient. This position is only available to those interested in salaried staff employment opportunities. At Perficient, we offer a full competitive base salary a full benefits package including medical, dental and vision, a 401(k) with matching contributions, 3 weeks of paid time off, and 10 paid holidays per year.



Who We Are



Perficient is a leading global digital consultancy. We imagine, create, engineer, and run digital transformation solutions that help our clients exceed customers’ expectations, outpace competition, and grow their business. With unparalleled strategy, creative, and technology capabilities, our colleagues bring big thinking and innovative ideas, along with a practical approach to help our clients – the world’s largest enterprises and biggest brands succeed.



What We Believe



At Perficient, we promise to challenge, champion, and celebrate our people. You will experience a unique and collaborative culture that values every voice. Join our team, and you’ll become part of something truly special.

We believe in developing a workforce that is as diverse and inclusive as the clients we work with. We’re committed to actively listening, learning, and acting to further advance our organization, our communities, and our future leaders… and we’re not done yet.

Perficient, Inc. proudly provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a protected veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. Perficient, Inc. complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training. Perficient, Inc. expressly prohibits any form of unlawful employee harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or covered veterans. Improper interference with the ability of Perficient, Inc. employees to perform their expected job duties is absolutely not tolerated.



Disability Accommodations



Perficient is committed to providing a barrier-free employment process with reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability, please contact us.

 Are you legally authorized to work in the United States?

 Will you now, or in the future, require sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g. H-1B visa status)?

Who We Are




Job Description


MasterClass is transforming online education by enabling anyone in the world to learn from the very best. We are deconstructing what makes an actor able to cry on demand, how an athlete defies gravity, and what it takes to write a bestseller. Our online learning content is available to students anywhere anytime, which supports our mission to ignite the greatness in others.

We are a quickly growing VC-funded startup based in San Francisco. We have created online classes taught by famous masters— Wayne Gretzky, Gordon Ramsay, Serena Williams, Neil deGrasse Tyson, Sara Blakely, David Sedaris, Bobbi Brown, Timbaland, Anna Wintour and many more to come.

Since launching in 2015, we have been growing our team. Apply now to find out more about what we are doing behind the scenes.



What We Are Looking For




Self-motivated leader with a passion for application security engineering

Strong leader who can bring stakeholders together on challenging security initiatives

Innovative problem solver, able to navigate through ambiguity

Grounded in solid software engineering practices



Responsibilities of the role: 
(3 must haves)


Contribute to defining the security roadmap with stakeholders and drive it forward 

Manage bug bounty, penetration testing, threat modeling, and other major security programs 

Play a key role in establishing our security engineering team




Requirements




10+ years of relevant software engineering experience, building mission-critical, scalable, highly-available systems 

Strong understanding of secure coding practices

Proficiency in modern web technologies such as Ruby/Rails, Postgres, Redis, and Kafka

Experience developing large-scale distributed systems hosted on cloud platforms, such as AWS, GCP, Azure, or IBM Cloud

Strong experience with zero-trust practices, modeling authentication and authorization architectures

Familiarity with security controls, including ISO/SOC, NIST 800-53, and vulnerability databases such as Mitre’s CVEs

Experience in managing a successful bug-bounty program, penetration testing, and threat modeling



At MasterClass, we believe we put our best work forward when our employees bring together ideas that are diverse in thought. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law. In addition, MasterClass will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you have a disability or special need, we would like to know how we can better accommodate you.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Description



Le ou la gestionnaire du développement logiciel chez UKG dirigera une équipe de développement logiciel expérimentée au sein du groupe Moteurs de planification et de prévisions. Ce groupe développe et maintient des applications logicielles sur la base de méthodes mathématiques et analytiques avancées (recherche opérationnelle) afin de résoudre des problèmes complexes dans le domaine de la prise de décisions. Le ou la gestionnaire du développement logiciel veille à ce que les produits logiciels soient livrés dans les délais impartis et avec une excellente qualité. Il ou elle fera partie de notre équipe internationale de gestion de l’ingénierie au sein d’UKG Dimensions, notre dernière plateforme SaaS/Google Cloud.


 Soutenir le processus de développement logiciel Agile (Scrum)

 Responsable de l’efficacité de l’équipe de projet et de son évolution vers une autogestion complète par le biais de l’accompagnement et de la collaboration avec l’équipe Scrum

 Travailler en étroite collaboration avec d’autres gestionnaires et directeurs afin de planifier et de livrer des projets de développement logiciel de haute qualité dans les délais impartis et d’assurer une responsabilité collective de l’excellence technique des solutions

 Collaborer avec d’autres équipes au sein de l’organisation responsable de la qualité et travailler de manière transversale avec d’autres parties prenantes clés dans le bureau de développement, de gestion des produits et de gestion des projets Haut degré de gestion matricielle et capacité à influencer les autres

 Établir des meilleures pratiques en matière de développement logiciel

 Comprendre les implications techniques des problèmes/obstacles et définir l’orientation de manière efficace

 Collaborer activement avec d’autres équipes dans différentes régions géographiques afin d’assurer la réussite de l’entreprise et d’éliminer les obstacles

 Capacité à naviguer dans une grande organisation et des processus complexes tout en améliorant les processus


Exigences


 Baccalauréat en ingénierie / informatique ou une expérience équivalente

 Bon niveau de bilinguisme français/anglais

 Plus de 5 ans d’expérience dans un rôle de gestion dans le domaine du développement logiciel, une exp/rience de l’assurance qualité, ainsi que dans la gestion d’équipes distantes/extraterritoriales son des atouts

 Expérience dans la gestion du développement d’applications Web

 Plus de 5 ans d’expérience pratique dans le développement logiciel

 Expérience dans un environnement Agile (Scrum) exigée

 Capable de résoudre des problèmes et situations divers, complexes et ambigus

 Une expérience dans le domaine de l’architecture infonuagique multicouche serait un atout

 Une connaissance/expérience dans la recherche opérationnelle, machine learning ou des domaines connexes serait un atout


Profil de l'entreprise

À UKG, notre priorité, ce sont les gens. UKG combine la force et l’innovation d’Ultimate Software et de Kronos en réunissant deux cultures primées axées sur les employés. Nos employés forment un groupe extraordinaire de gens talentueux, énergiques et innovants qui ont à cœur bien plus que le travail. Nous nous efforçons de créer une culture d’appartenance et une expérience pour les employés qui les responsabilisent. UKG compte plus de 13 000 employés dans le monde et est reconnue pour sa culture organisationnelle inclusive. Êtes-vous prêt.e à être inspiré.e? Apprenez-en plus au www.ukg.com/careers.

Égalité d'accès à l'emploi


Employeur souscrivant au principe de l'égalité d'accès à l'emploi


Ultimate Kronos Group est fier d’être un employeur souscrivant au principe de l'égalité d'accès à l'emploi et s’engage à maintenir un milieu de travail diversifié et inclusif. Tous les candidats qualifiés seront pris en considération pour un emploi sans égard à la race, à la couleur, à la religion, au sexe, à l’âge, au handicap, à l’état matrimonial, à la situation familiale, à l’orientation sexuelle, à la grossesse, à l’information génétique, à l’identité de genre, à l’expression de genre, à l’origine nationale, à l’ascendance, au statut de citoyen, au statut d’ancien combattant et à tout autre statut protégé par les lois fédérales, provinciales ou locales contre la discrimination.


Accommodement aux handicaps


UKG s’engage à fournir un accommodement aux personnes handicapées durant le processus de candidature et d’entrevue. Si vous avez besoin d’un accommodement durant le processus de candidature et d’entrevue, veuillez communiquer avec nous à

Poste : 
 développeur Full Stack


Lieu de travail :
 Montréal


Salaire :
 120 000 $ à 140 000 $ par an

Notre excellent client souhaite embaucher un 
développeur Full Stack
 pour se joindre à son équipe en croissance. Vous travaillerez avec le directeur de la technologie et les développeurs pour établir la feuille de route, les objectifs et les pratiques exemplaires à mettre en œuvre. Vous serez également un participant actif dans le développement de base de leur plate-forme et fonctionnalités de base!


Exigences



 Plus de 10 ans d’expérience professionnelle dans le domaine du développement de logiciels

 Bonne connaissance de Node.js, React.js, TypeScript et d’autres technologies Web, pourrait être PHP au lieu de NodeJS

 Expérience des technologies sans serveur telles que Firebase/GCP et AWS Lambda

 Expertise avérée dans la conception de schémas de bases de données utilisant SQL et/ou NoSQL, la mise en cache et l’optimisation des requêtes

 Intérêt clé pour la construction de CI/CD robustes et évolutifs, d’infrastructures de test et de pipelines de données

 Expérience de diverses technologies de commerce électronique, comme Shopify et Amazon




Avantages



 Plan d’options d’achat d’actions des employés qui valorise la propriété

 Prestations d’assurance collective

 3 semaines de vacances à partir de la première année

 Conciliation travail-vie personnelle

 Télétravail et plus encore



Veuillez envoyer votre CV en format Word à l’adresse suivante : alarica.paul@quantum-qtr.com .


RECOMMANDEZ UNE PERSONNE EMBAUCHÉE POUR UN POSTE PERMANENT ET GAGNEZ 1 000 $ ! 
 Pour plus d’informations, cliquez ici . Des conditions s’appliquent.


NOS PORTES VIRTUELLES SONT OUVERTES!
 En plus, vous passerez les entrevues à domicile grâce à différentes applications Web! Alors, contactez-nous dès aujourd’hui pour relever votre prochain défi professionnel.

description:
Front-End JavaScript Developers needed for Long Term Contract convert to PERM at Global Company. Skills needed: HTML, CSS, React, Vue, or Angular, RESTful APIs.







Roles:

2 x of: Front End Agile Web Developer (JavaScript, React/Vue, HTML/CSS, APIs)

1 x Of: Senior Technology Lead – You will OWN and RUN Front End Tech.

Type: Permanent

Location: Ontario Area OR Any Canada for Senior Professionals

Level 18 Months+ Or 5+ years for Senior

Key Skills Front End Development / Javascript / Solid IT Skills / Passion for development









What you'll do:




Join Agile team developing and maintaining web sites for leading financial industry company.

Develop single page applications in React or Vue

Produce RESTful API applications in Node.js which adhere to specifications defined in Swagger 2.0/OpenAPI

Utilize microservice-style backend applications to retrieve and process complex datasets

Create visually stunning client-side rendered charts and graphs

Use Web Content Accessibility Guidelines to produce applications that make content accessible to all users

Mentor and learn from developers of all levels.

Partner with amazing design team bring vision to reality

passion for building intuitive, performant, and secure web experiences to create the next generation of industry leading web sites







Skills:



· Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field

· 2+ years Or 5+ years for Senior - application development experience

· developing responsive applications for mobile, tablet, and desktop

· For Tech Lead .NET C# Skills is needed with Overall Responsibility for the Technology







Applicable experience using the following technologies:

· JavaScript, HTML, CSS – Essential

· jQuery, Bootstrap, LESS. SASS

· React, Vue, or Angular

· Node.js - nice to have

· Web Accessibility (WCAG 2.1 AA)

· NPM, Gulp, Continuous Integration Tools

· Centralized version control system like Git or Subversion

· RESTful APIs with Swagger/OpenAPI specifications

· work in an Agile Development environment









following experience is encouraged:



· working with containers

· using tools such as GitHub, Jira, Confluence, Jenkins, Artifactory, Consul, and Docker

· Continuous Integration and automated testing

job_function: Finance, Information Technology, and Project Management

industries: Financial Services, Investment Banking, and Investment Management
description:
We Offer




To work with some of the best professionals in the business - for a firm that values individual intellect as much as teamwork

State-of-the-art offices that are designed to maximize collaboration

Flexible working arrangements

Enriching challenges that provide opportunity for constant learning and advancement

An environment which is leveraging technology to its highest potential




Team Profile



Institutional Securities Technology (IST) develops and oversees the overall technology strategy and bespoke technology solutions to drive and enable the institutional businesses and enterprise-wide functions. Our clients include Fixed Income, Equities, Commodities, Investment Banking, Research and Global Capital Markets.



Our Impact



Morgan Stanley Commodities delivers risk management solutions to our clients in global markets for Oil, Gas, Power, Metals, Agriculture and more. Commodities provide the materials to build and the fuels to energize the world we live in.

Our business is constantly changing – the world’s energy needs evolve; new sources of energy are developed, markets relating to climate change and carbon emissions are created. As this happens, new trading products, market data, risk management tools, regulatory concerns – all these things evolve and require technology solutions.

By joining the Commodities Technology team, you will have the opportunity to design and build the systems that support this fascinating business, front-to-back.

Our team is involved in all aspects of trading technology, from trade lifecycle to risk management, market data to physical and financial settlements. We work in a fully Agile environment, with close interaction with our users across the organization. As a result, team members usually build up a good understanding of the business.



Position Description



We are looking to grow our team in Montreal with energetic, motivated technologists who want to make a difference in a dynamic business environment. Working in Agile squads, you will experience and contribute to the full software development lifecycle. You can flex your analysis skills to understand the problem, design and code the solutions, and help to advance our DevOps journey with automated testing, deployments and monitoring. In addition, this is a potential leadership role. You will have training and support to help you being leader in the team/squad and managing deliveries to business.

All roles in Commodities Tech offer the opportunity to work directly with various senior stakeholders across Technology Division and their Business sponsors. As part of a global team, you will also collaborate with team members across regions. Partner with other engineering teams to understand technology offerings and how they can be applied and leveraged as part of our solutions.

In the Montreal office, you will be part of a large technology hub located in state-of-the-art offices designed for collaborative teamwork. We support flexible working and are passionate about offering enriching career opportunities.



To Be Successful In The Role, You Will Have




Opportunity to lead/manage a squad with growing platform

Experience of developing with core Java

Demonstrate good understanding of OO principles, design patterns, n-tier architecture

Understanding the SDLC (software development life cycle)

Relational database skills (SQL, Sybase, DB2, Oracle)

Experience in these technologies is helpful, but not essential: Python, Perl, Shell, C#, AngularJS, Scala

Comfortable developing on Linux

Good problem solving and communication skills as well as the ability to work effectively in a team

Knowledge/experience of Financial Services or Commodities is not necessary – you will be able to learn as you go.




About Us



Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. At Morgan Stanley Montreal, we are shaping the future of our global business and contributing to our local community. Our team works across numerous areas.

Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunities employer. We work to provide a supportive and inclusive environment where all individuals can maximize their full potential. Our skilled and creative workforce is comprised of individuals drawn from a broad cross section of the global communities in which we operate and who reflect a variety of backgrounds, talents, perspectives, and experiences. Our strong commitment to a culture of inclusion is evident through our constant focus on recruiting, developing, and advancing individuals based on their skills and talents.


All our positions are located in Montreal, Quebec. 


Knowledge of French and English is required.

Spotlight on our Montreal Technology Centre: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oo5GaXpCwKs


Video dated October 2019.


Build a career with impact. Visit morganstanley.com for more information.


Posting Date


Mar 7, 2022


Primary Location


Americas-Canada-Quebec-Montreal


Education Level


Bachelor's Degree


Job


Development


Employment Type


Full Time


Job Level


Associate
