L’entreprise souscrit au principe d’égalité d’accès à l’emploi et prendra en compte toutes les candidatures sans distinction de race, sexe, âge, couleur, religion, nationalité, statut de vétéran, handicap, orientation sexuelle, identité sexuelle, information génétique ou toute autre distinction protégée par la loi.

About Actalent:

Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

Depuis 1999, Digital Shape Technologies Inc. édite Webfolio®, un logiciel de gestion de portefeuilles entièrement intégré, multiactifs et en temps réel utilisé par des entreprises de renommée mondiale.




Nous sommes actuellement à la recherche d’un(e) développeur(euse) full-stack senior ayant une forte expérience dans le développement de solutions logicielles de hautes performances intégrées. Le(la) candidat(e) doit avoir de solides compétences en matière de recherche, d'analyse, et être en mesure de prendre en charge la conception de solutions techniques qui sauront satisfaire les besoins des clients. Il ou elle doit également avoir de solides compétences en Java, en conception de modèles de bases de données relationnelles, ainsi qu’être familiarisé(e) avec les divers protocoles de communication, tels que EJB, SOAP, REST, etc.





Vos principales responsabilités




 




Conception et développement de l'application cliente en SPA (Single Page Application) de notre logiciel Webfolio.

Participation à la rédaction de spécifications en lien avec l'application SPA.

Mise en place des normes et standards de codage pour l'application SPA (Best Practices).

Optimisation des solutions proposées.

Mise en place de processus de suivis de la qualité.

Rédaction de documentation pour les utilisateurs.






Exigences du poste



5 ans d’expérience sur des solutions distribuées reposants sur des socles techniques Java, J2EE, JBOSS, JMS, JDBC, etc.

Compétences dans la conception de modèles de données relationnelles sous MS SQL et/ou Oracle.

Expertise dans le développement d’applications financières, que ce soit dans le domaine comptable, de gestion de portefeuilles ou de solutions analytiques.

Connaissances approfondies des concepts fondamentaux de la modélisation objet.






Qualifications



Un baccalauréat ou une maîtrise en génie des systèmes informatiques ou en génie logiciel, ou une expérience équivalente.

Expérience de travail dans une institution financière serait un atout.

Des connaissances en finance de marché, notamment sur la valorisation, le grand livre, le P&L, l’analyse statistique, etc. serait un atout.

Bilingue français / anglais.






Seules les candidatures retenues seront contactées
.

Job Description


As part of Ubisoft's data engineering team, you will contribute in how video game data gets used within the company and how product decisions are made. As our games connect more and more players together, our data platform must run thousands of jobs and serve billions of data points in all areas of the company. You will lead an innovative team focused on building highly scalable and optimized data products and microservices, to support the work of many analysts, data scientists and engineers across the company.

More specifically, you will lead multiple teams in designing and implementing best-in-class technical designs and approaches. You will represent your teams and facilitate collaboration with partner and support teams, as well as product owners and architects. You will make sure that your teams are strong and healthy –including capabilities, happiness, resilience and growth.


What you'll do



Supervise and assess employees

Ensure that the technological vision is applied

Estimate the workload for planning in collaboration with team members

Prioritize and assign tasks to team members

Follow up on the evolution of the teams’ work with regards to programming-related deliverables

Challenge team members to ensure the relevance of technical decisions

Define and implement work methods that are best adapted to meet project needs for the general programming team (including team structure)

Determine compromises in terms of time, quality and resources based on client needs and the priorities set by the product managers

Coordinate tasks that involve several teams with the PMs from other working units and sectors 

 Foster collaboration and knowledge sharing among team members and teams on other projects

Communicate relevant information to the TG management team

Help select applicants to fill team positions

Support the career advancement of team members by suggesting development activities and interpersonal and technical skills training

Carry out all other related tasks




What You Bring



Qualifications



Bachelor’s degree in computer science or computer engineering and a certificate in project management or equivalent training

Minimum 7 years’ experience as a lead programmer supervising a programming team.




Minimum Requirements



Strong verbal and written communication

Experience in building and leading senior teams to reach their potential

Experience in OO programming paradigm and implementation using Java or similar

Experience with distributed systems and data processing technologies such as Hive, Spark, Flink and Storm

Strong desire to solve complex problems by providing simple and elegant solutions

Willingness to debate on the best approaches with the rest of the team

BS, MS, or PhD in Computer Science or equivalent work experience 




Preferred



Experience in development of RESTful webservices

Experience with cloud computing

Exposure to NoSQL data stores such as Cassandra and MongoDB

Exposure to the analytics, statistics and/or machine learning fields



A real live person will review your application. In this case, it’s our talent acquisition specialist Karin. As she learns more about you through your profile, get to know her through the video below.


About Us



Additional Information


Ubisoft’s 20,000 team members, working across more than 30 countries around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players’ lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their commitment and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin’s Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come.

Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves.

When you join Ubi MTL, you’ll discover a workplace that sparks inspiration and connection. We offer a collaborative space that provides career advancement, a host of learning opportunities, and meaningful benefits centred on well-being.

If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting edge technologies and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.


At Ubisoft, you can come as you are. We embrace diversity in all its forms. We’re committed to fostering a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Description



La façon dont nous travaillons est en train de changer et la technologie qui aide les entreprises à gérer leur main-d’œuvre doit être alignée sur ce changement. Les gestionnaires sont tenus de prendre de meilleures décisions, plus rapidement, et les employés attendent davantage de leurs outils en milieu de travail. Chez UKG, nous construisons des applications modernes de gestion de la main-d’œuvre qui dotent les responsables de moyens, améliorent l’expérience des employés et soutiennent la flexibilité.

UKG (Ultimate Kronos Group) est à la recherche d’un(e) développeur(euse) de logiciels pour se joindre à son équipe d’ingénierie de classe mondiale à Montréal pour sa dernière plateforme infonuagique : UKG Dimensions. Le(la) candidat(e) idéal(e) a une expérience pratique du développement de solutions infonuagiques de qualité. Vous jouerez un rôle clé dans le développement de notre offre SaaS, dans un environnement hautement collaboratif et agile. Le candidat retenu aura de l’expérience dans les méthodologies de test modernes et les processus exécutés tout au long du cycle de vie du développement logiciel et aura de l’expérience avec les pratiques infonuagiques. Ce candidat serait responsable de la qualité du produit en développant et en exécutant des stratégies de test pour assurer des versions de qualité.



Vos Responsabilités Quotidiennes




 Assurer la fonctionnalité et les performances appropriées d’une grande variété d’applications et de plateformes.

 Une capacité démontrée à effectuer des lancements de produits de qualité dans les délais prévus en utilisant des pratiques d’analyse des risques et de confinement des défauts, d’automatisation des tests et d’initiatives d’amélioration continue est essentielle à ce poste.

 Responsable et imputable de la qualité du produit pour le projet.

 Installation/configuration/maintenance des environnements de test automatisés dans un paramètre d’intégration continue.

 Maintenir et améliorer le laboratoire de test et l’infrastructure de test (y compris les outils, les scripts, etc.).

 Aider au déploiement et au dépannage des environnements de test.

 Collaborer avec d’autres membres de l’équipe d’AQ et tous les membres de l’équipe géographiquement dispersée pour assurer la mise en œuvre appropriée des exigences fonctionnelles.

 Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les développeurs pour reproduire et résoudre les bogues.

 Travailler dans une ambiance d’équipe pour effectuer des activités spéciales d’essai lorsque requis.

 Rester en contact avec la communauté des tests de logiciels et apporter les meilleures pratiques de l’industrie dans l’équipe.

 Améliorer continuellement la productivité et l’efficacité de nos efforts de tests automatisés à l’aide d’outils et de techniques innovants.

 Transformer la documentation manuelle des tests en scripts de tests automatisés, robustes et efficaces.

 Participer à l’élaboration de la documentation des tests, exécuter des tests et surveiller les résultats à l’aide des outils du cycle de vie des applications.

 Examiner les documents sur les exigences opérationnelles et fonctionnelles afin de créer la documentation de test appropriée.

 Capacité à décrire le comportement de l’interface utilisateur en termes de mise en œuvre technique correcte et de scénarios utilisateur client.


Exigences


 Baccalauréat en informatique ou diplôme connexe et plus de 4 ans d’expérience en assurance qualité logicielle (Java / Selenium) ou dans une autre discipline connexe avec implication directe dans les tests automatisés d’applications web.

 Solide compréhension des technologies web de Microsoft, Linux (Bash) et dans les technologies web de niveau N.

 Solide expérience dans les tests fonctionnels et les meilleures pratiques en matière de qualité logicielle.

 Solide expérience dans la gestion des défauts (création, suivi et validation du rapport de défauts).

 Exposition à Protractor, Javascript, Eclipse, Jenkins, Linux, JIRA, HP ALM, HTML5.

 Familier avec des technologies comme nginx, tomcat, postgresql, Jenkins

 Expérience avec les outils de contrôle de version (GIT, bitbucket).

 Connaissance pratique de Docker / Kubernetes / VM / Jenkins.

 Concentration sur les processus avec une grande attention aux détails et un bon suivi.

 Expérience avec des outils de test tels que xUnit, Selenium, mocking frameworks, etc.

 Capacité à écrire des requêtes SQL.

 Familiarité avec les outils utilisés pour automatiser le déploiement d’une solution logicielle d’entreprise sur le nuage, Concourse, Ansible, etc.

 Excellentes compétences en résolution de problèmes et en communication.

 Bonne expérience dans les outils de gestion des tests comme ALM, JIRA.

 Expérience avec Java, Python, etc. un atout


Profil de l'entreprise

À UKG, notre priorité, ce sont les gens. UKG combine la force et l’innovation d’Ultimate Software et de Kronos en réunissant deux cultures primées axées sur les employés. Nos employés forment un groupe extraordinaire de gens talentueux, énergiques et innovants qui ont à cœur bien plus que le travail. Nous nous efforçons de créer une culture d’appartenance et une expérience pour les employés qui les responsabilisent. UKG compte plus de 13 000 employés dans le monde et est reconnue pour sa culture organisationnelle inclusive. Êtes-vous prêt.e à être inspiré.e? Apprenez-en plus au www.ukg.com/careers.

Égalité d'accès à l'emploi


Employeur souscrivant au principe de l'égalité d'accès à l'emploi


Ultimate Kronos Group est fier d’être un employeur souscrivant au principe de l'égalité d'accès à l'emploi et s’engage à maintenir un milieu de travail diversifié et inclusif. Tous les candidats qualifiés seront pris en considération pour un emploi sans égard à la race, à la couleur, à la religion, au sexe, à l’âge, au handicap, à l’état matrimonial, à la situation familiale, à l’orientation sexuelle, à la grossesse, à l’information génétique, à l’identité de genre, à l’expression de genre, à l’origine nationale, à l’ascendance, au statut de citoyen, au statut d’ancien combattant et à tout autre statut protégé par les lois fédérales, provinciales ou locales contre la discrimination.


Accommodement aux handicaps


UKG s’engage à fournir un accommodement aux personnes handicapées durant le processus de candidature et d’entrevue. Si vous avez besoin d’un accommodement durant le processus de candidature et d’entrevue, veuillez communiquer avec nous à

CV et information : daniel.zapata@randstad.ca

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Rapid7 is a leading provider of security data and analytics solutions that enable organizations to implement an active, analytics-driven approach to cybersecurity. We combine our extensive experience in security data and analytics and deep insight into attacker behaviors and techniques to make sense of the wealth of data available to organizations about their IT environments and users. 



Our InsightIDR product helps identify and address key cybersecurity risks to our customers. We apply ML, threat intelligence, and BI to event sources, including desktops, servers, network switches, firewalls, cloud services, directory servers, DHCP servers, and SIEMs in order to distill hundreds or thousands of daily events per customer into the few real, high priority threats that need attention. Our systems ingest large amounts of data that need to be highly available and performant at all times. 



We are looking for a talented Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) with a deep interest in distributed systems, cloud computing and the architecture of large-scale systems. The SRE lead will ensure our InsightIDR services have the ultra-high reliability and uptime necessary to meet our customers' needs. As SRE, you will work closely with our engineering team and partner teams throughout Rapid7 to help solve extremely challenging problems at a massive scale.




Some Of The Technologies We Use Include




Java, Python, Cassandra, MySQL/RDS, Redis, ElasticSearch, Kafka, AWS (EC2, S3, CloudFormation, etc.), Zookeeper, Terraform, Jenkins, Artifactory, Chef, Puppet, Ansible



At Rapid7, we value intellectual curiosity, problem solving ability, initiative, and team spirit.




Responsibilities




Leading a new Site Reliability Engineering function within Engineering

Working closely with Engineering teams, Architecture, Infrastructure and Product teams to improve the lifecycle of the InsightIDR services - from inception, design, deployment, operations, monitoring, security, upgrade and maintenance

Supporting services before they go live through activities such as design, deployment, migration strategy, monitoring, and playbook reviews 

Maintaining services once they are live by measuring and monitoring availability, latency, and overall system health

Scaling systems through automation and driving service and infrastructure improvements

Troubleshooting production issues and liaising with relevant Engineering, product deployment, and platform teams for a resolution

Managing and participating in on-call support, and incident response follow-ups such as post-mortems

Mentoring and coaching team members




Skills And Expertise




Previous experience in a lead engineering role

5+ years of experience scaling SaaS services and infrastructure

Expert knowledge of developing, scaling, automating, and troubleshooting large-scale systems

Expert knowledge of deployment and monitoring frameworks

Ability to debug, optimize code and automate routine tasks

Advanced understanding of System Performance and tuning

Strong knowledge of NoSQL and SQL concepts

Strong knowledge of OOP languages such as Java 

Strong knowledge of scripting languages such as Python 

Extensive experience with database operation and optimization

Strong knowledge of RESTFul architectures

Understanding of Unix/Linux operating systems

Proficient in AWS services, including EC2, RDS, S3, streaming data, etc.

Systematic problem-solving approach

Excellent communication & influencing skills

Strong technical writing skills




About Rapid7




Rapid7 (Nasdaq: RPD) is advancing security with visibility, analytics, and automation delivered through our Insight cloud. Our solutions simplify the complex, allowing security teams to work more effectively with IT and development to reduce vulnerabilities, monitor for malicious behavior, investigate and shut down attacks, and automate routine tasks. Over 9,300 customers rely on Rapid7 technology, services, and research to improve security outcomes and securely advance their organization. For more information, visit our 
website
, check out our 
blog
, or follow us on 
LinkedIn
.

New Value Solutions, a national IT consulting company, is seeking a Site Reliability Engineer to help our client deploy, update and support, monitor and optimize highly scalable, fault-tolerant cloud and hybrid systems. The SRE will ensure the reliability and sustainability of business applications by optimizing, monitoring, and automating deployment, support, and sustainment activities.



Responsibilities




Oversee staff and consultants to organize on-call schedules, assign tasks and provide technical guidance to team members, participate in training and staff development, and provide feedback on the quality of work of team members

Provide oversight and guidance on application sustainability to software development teams from planning though implementation and operations

Maintain close relationships with DevOps teams, business users, architects, cloud operations and infrastructure teams

Work closely with release and QA leads to maintain awareness of production deployments to ensure the stability of supported systems

Make support metrics visible using tools such as VSTS dashboards and integrating metrics into reports and dashboards with tools such as Application Insights, SharePoint, Excel, or Power BI. 

Prioritize work to meet both short and long term goals and outcomes

Provide feedback, coach, and mentor team members to improve individual and team effectiveness

Communicate complex information clearly and concisely, to explain various business and technical information

Think critically through complex problems to formulate practical solutions

Create new, or re-establish collaborative, credible, high functioning teams.




Requirements




6+ years of experience in IT

4+ years of work experience with Agile methodologies and Cloud and DevOps environments

Strong knowledge of cloud monitoring and measurement tools for infrastructure, application, logging, APM, and user interface experience

Working knowledge of infrastructure configuration management and automation tools such as Chef, Puppet, Salt, Ansible, and Terraform

Working knowledge of Microsoft Visual Studio Team System and/or similar continuous integration and continuous deployment technologies such as Team Foundation Servicer, Jenkins CI, Github, and Artifactory specifically related to software build, unit testing and deployment

Working knowledge of Microsoft ARM templates and JSON scripting for automated deployments

Working knowledge of Microsoft ARM IaaS and PaaS architectures

Working knowledge of API architecture and hybrid cloud integration patterns

Working knowledge of networking protocols and technologies such as routing, DNS, network peering

Working knowledge of developing and monitoring SLOs and SLAs

Strong coding and scripting experience with languages such as C#, JavaScript, SQL, PowerShell and others

Experience with Microsoft Stack with technologies and frameworks such as .Net, C#, JavaScript, SQL, JQuery, Angular 6 and up, HTML, CSS, XUnit, NUnit, Entity Framework, TDD, Regis Cache, Git

Exposure to microservices is preferred


If you have this expertise, and are able to work in Canada, please submit your resume. While we thank all candidates in advance for their application, only those candidates who are shortlisted will be contacted.

ID#2729

New Value Solutions is a national IT consulting company with offices in Vancouver, Seattle, Toronto and two recently opened in Italy. We provide IT Staff Augmentation, IT Project Delivery, IT Sustainment and Management Consulting services. Our clients are situated across Canada, US and Italy.

We’re currently hiring Backend Software Engineers to help us build out the core of our products.






Responsibilities



Designing and developing all aspects of our products, including software architecture, deployment, and support.

Engaging with Buf's current and potential users in the Protobuf and gRPC ecosystems, to demo our products and gather user feedback.

Constant learning across a wide variety of technical areas, as needed, to solve emerging problems to bring our product to life.

Helping to identify and establish best-in-class engineering approaches and practices.






Requirements



At least two years of professional experience in Go.

A track record of architecting robust and reliable, production-grade distributed systems, ideally using Protobuf and/or gRPC.

The ability to move quickly while managing trade-offs of performance, reliability, security, and code quality.

A bachelors or master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Mathematics is strongly preferred.






Nice to Haves



Experience with one or more of the following: Kubernetes, Envoy, Postgres, GCP.

A track record of existing work within the Protobuf and gRPC communities.






Benefits



Opportunity to join the team in its early days, take on major responsibility, and make meaningful contributions.

Work as part of an international team coming together to solve real-world engineering problems - Buf employees come from all over the world.

Extremely competitive cash compensation and equity grants for all employees - we pay US-level salaries, regardless of which side of the border you are working on.

Professional downtown Toronto office for optimal collaboration. Generous budget for remote employees to travel to Toronto for in-person collaboration and team building.

Canadian immigration support available to all successful candidates and their families, including permanent residency sponsorship when eligible (Toronto office only).






Remote opportunities are available.






It’s an all-hands-on-deck situation - you’ll be able to have a large impact from day one.‍

Title : Service now developer



Location : Montreal, QC (Onsite after pandemic)






Job Description :



5+ With relevant SNOW architecture experience

Experience developing in ServiceNow (JavaScript, workflows, update sets)

Good knowledge of CMDB module including Discovery, Service Mapping, Asset management, Orchestration etc.

Strong background in software development, software architecture, data structures, algorithms, and SDLC models

Proficiency developing in one or more languages such as Java or C#

Experience with scripting languages such as Python, especially under Unix/Linux

Knowledge of database application concepts, SQL, query optimization

Our Aerospace client is currently seeking Software Developers to help deliver a naval training system. The successful candidate should have object oriented programming experience, C# preferred, within a windows environment.* The successful candidates will perform basic software and systems development tasks for complex systems or parts (units) of large complex systems developing knowledge of an increasing number of development tools, equipment and standards and technologies.

Description:* Our client is seeking multiple talented Embedded C++ Developers to participate in the design and development of their PCoIP Cloud Access Software. Currently, this company has over 3 million users in a range of different industries including education, finance, media, entertainment and healthcare. As part of an Agile development team, you will be responsible for the design, development and testing of software for all platforms supported by the product. To be successful in this role, you should have previous experience with low-level application development across several operating systems.

Responsibilities:*

Design, implement, maintain and support embedded firmware, kernel drivers, and application software.

Work within a Scrum team to design, implement and maintain application software and kernel drivers.

Create proposals for technical solutions, team processes and procedures, and driving them through to adoption and implementation.

Coach other developers with regards to code quality, security, maintainability and solution architecture.

Troubleshoot issues in the lab, utilizing debugging tools for application software and kernel drivers.

Requirements:*

Bachelors or Masters in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, or equivalent.

Minimum of 5 years of experience in C++ software development.

Excellent software design and programming skills in C++ as well as experience in a range of languages such as C, Java, Python and Objective-C.

Application development experience with two or more of: Linux, Windows, macOS.

Working knowledge of data compression algorithms.

Bonus Points:*

Knowledge and hands-on experience with kernel and device driver development (Linux and/or Windows)

Windows or Linux application development experience

Experience in one or more of the following: IP networking protocols, 802.1x, certificates, SCEP, USB, smart cards, authentication protocols, encryption

Experience with multi-threaded high-performance programming with in-depth knowledge of CPU architectures

Experience developing secure firmware or software in accordance to industry best practices (e.g.: OWASP, MSDL)

Hardware troubleshooting skills

Experience working directly with end customers

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting and Software Development
description:
Clio is more than just a tech company–we are a global leader that is transforming the legal experience for all by bettering the lives of legal professionals while increasing access to justice

We are currently seeking a 
Senior
 
 Cloud Engineer 
 to join our rapidly expanding team. This is a remote position. When our offices reopen this role can be performed from one of our Canadian offices, remotely across Canada, or a combination of both. Some exemptions may apply.


A day in the life might look like: 



 Building and supporting Clio's global cloud infrastructure. 

 Nurturing and evolving the development ecosystem at Clio by providing the tools, infrastructure, and services that our developers rely on to transform the practice of law, for good. 

 Recognizing opportunities for process improvement or automation and then writing clean, maintainable code in order to erase the manual task or nullify the pain point. 




You may be a fit for this role if:



 You are a self-starting and self-governing learner and worker who is adept at breaking down intractable problems into achievable pieces and iterating on them. 

 You are curious by nature and love to dig deep on problems, always asking “ Why?”. 

 You communicate in a clear and concise manner, regardless of medium (text, voice, and in-person). 

 You value curiosity and collaboration, and actively seek to build the context required to power your decisions. 

 You have a team-first mentality and will naturally step in to support co-workers when you perceive them to be in difficulty. 




What you may have:



This is not a check-list to be satisfied. If you have experience or interest in some of these areas, we’d love to hear from you and encourage you to apply.



 Experience writing clean, maintainable code in collaboration with other developers. 

 Experience building and administering Debian GNU/Linux hosts using automated image build and configuration management tools. 

 Experience building and deploying containerized services using an orchestration system. 

 Experience administering cloud resources on common cloud providers (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) using automated resource configuration and provisioning tools. 




Serious bonus points if you have:



 Experience managing hosts with Puppet. 

 Experience working with Docker and Kubernetes. 

 Experience developing with Ruby or GoLang. 

 Experience managing AWS resources with Terraform. 

 Experience scripting with BASH. 

 Experience administering any of: Elasticsearch, Kafka, MySQL, Redis. 




Diversity, Inclusion, Belonging and Equity (DIBE) & Accessibility 


Our team shows up as their authentic selves, and are united by our mission. We are dedicated to diversity, equity and inclusion . We pride ourselves in building and fostering an environment where our teams feel included, valued, and enabled to do the best work of their careers, wherever they choose to log in from. We believe that different perspectives, skills, backgrounds, and experiences result in higher-performing teams and better innovation. We are committed to equal employment and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

Clio provides accessibility accommodations during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Learn more about our culture at clio.com/careers


About Clio


At Clio, we are on a mission to transform the legal experience for all. As the world's leading provider of cloud-based legal software, we provide lawyers with low-barrier, affordable solutions to manage and grow their firms more effectively, more profitably, and with better client experiences. Through the cloud, we believe that we can help create a more inclusive legal community and a more equitable legal system.

We are an award-winning team that has been recognized as one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies , Canada’s Most Admired Cultures and has topped Fast Company’s list of Most Innovative Companies . In line with our mission, we’ve been up to some big things, including becoming a multi-product company , launching a $1 million COVID-19 Legal Relief Initiative , and most recently, securing a US$110M Series E funding round and a USD $1.6B valuation.

This is a historic moment in the growth of legal technology! As the first legal practice management unicorn globally, and one of only a handful of Canadian unicorns, this is only the beginning. If you’ve ever wanted to do the best work of your career, while having a meaningful impact in the lives of others, then Clio is the place for you.

Open to new graduates!* We are looking for a creative and experienced software developers to work as part of the core development team for modeling and simulation of civil and military avionic products and systems. Most of the development will be done using C++. This team member will be enthusiastic, creative, and eager to think outside the box when problem solving within a dynamic team environment.

Responsibilities:*

Analyze product feature requirements, workflows and usage from expert users, product owners or customers

Reviewing current systems

Presenting ideas for system improvements

Troubleshoot, test, and analyze technical problems and determine solutions

Research techniques and algorithms using state-of-the-art knowledge to create cool new features

Collaborate with product owners and architects to create cutting edge technologies

Help turn big ideas into cool new features.

Qualifications:*

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering preferred, open to Electrical and Mechanical degrees as long as the individual is showing interest to work in software.

Minimum of 1 to 5 years of professional software engineering experience or projects, working on multi-discipline teams.

Solid software engineering skills, including the ability to write maintainable and robust code in a popular object oriented language, particularly

C++.*

Expertise building distributed computing systems and service oriented architectures is an asset.

Autonomy, creativity and a good sense of initiative.

Team-working skills

description:
Clio is more than just a tech company–we are a global leader that is transforming the legal experience for all by bettering the lives of legal professionals while increasing access to justice .

We are currently seeking a new 
Senior Front End Engineer 
 to join our 
Lawyaw 
 development team 
. 
 This role is also available to candidates across Canada (excluding Quebec) and the United States (some exceptions may apply).


What your team does:


Acquired by Clio in 2021, Lawyaw is a SaaS platform focused on enabling the digitization of legal services. Our platform solves a foundational gap in the market by making it easy to incorporate programmable documents into digital workflows. Lawyaw currently powers over 1,000 law firms and are growing quickly, but we have so much more to build!

As a 
Senior Front End Engineer
 you are tasked with building and maintaining the front-end services, architecture and user interfaces that enables the products and features that thousands of lawyers and law firms will depend on to generate their legal documents and automate their legal workflows.

We're looking for people with a deep passion for building top-tier software that delights users. You have a deep empathy for the end user and can't help but fall in love with the problem to find the right solution. You are a no-ego doer who is comfortable dealing with change and a bias towards action.


What you’ll work on: 



Collaborate with stakeholders and designers to scope, evaluate and design the technical solutions to product problems and features;

Serve as a role model for our high engineering standards and bring consistency to our front-end codebases and development processes;

Build, maintain and iterate on our core product and features;

Be a steward of crafting great product experiences and putting yourself in the shoes of our users.




What you may have:



5+ years experience building and shipping top tier client-side web applications and user interfaces.

A deep understanding of web standards, accessibility, browser API's and rendering engines.

Experience in React or other popular front-end frameworks and toolsets.

Breadth and depth of knowledge on different data synchronization methods, can clearly communicate the tradeoffs between them and the types of problems that they are best suited for.

Proven ability to lead project initiatives from ideation to completion including rollout, documentation, monitoring and analytics.

Thrives in a fast paced, high growth environment.

Research, evaluate and synthesize technical information to design and develop and troubleshoot applications

 Recent grads (must have co-op previous co-op experience.

Job Description



As part of the Enterprise IT team for Distribution Business Unit, we are looking for a Salesforce Engineer who will be responsible for supporting, developing and enhancing our Salesforce applications.

The Salesforce Software Engineer will play a key role in strategic ongoing development and enhancement projects, related to support of the Salesforce.com CRM platform. This role collaborates with functional leaders from various business units to identify, define, and implement changes and enhancements that meet business requirements in a dynamic environment.


Assist in the development and enhancement of John Hancock’s existing Salesforce implementations via both native metadata configuration and custom development using Apex, Visualforce, Lightning Aura, Lightning web components and other external languages

Use Salesforce functionalities, as well as external tools as appropriate, to implement changes and new features

Work with Business teams to groom stories and consult with product owners on business requirements

Help to design, develop, test new Salesforce solutions and bug fix code.

Maintain lean documentation throughout the development process.

Actively participate in all Agile ceremonies (Sprint Planning, Daily Scrum, Retrospective, Reviews, etc…)

Participate in continuous delivery, optimization, monitoring, release management and support the end to end release process.

Evaluate new Salesforce releases and applications, participate in plans for their implementation, and remain current with Salesforce administration best practices

Log and track identified problems through to resolution

Collaborate with system administrators, consultants, other engineers, and analysts to uncover pain points with processes and identify optimization opportunities

Prototype and pilot new tools and features to help deliver faster, with less manual intervention

Promote agile principles and methodology, follow various engineering practices and approaches

Develop clean, maintainable, readable code that is scalable and secure. Participate in design and code reviews to ensure the same.

Design and develops pages, templates and components with which a content author interacts to build the desired user experience as communicated by the product owners

Promote and advance the use of site-wide style guides and template development

Resolve issues surrounding performance, response times, capacity and system limitations.




Experience And Education




Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or similar field.

3+ years Salesforce Administration, Release Management or Developer experience

3+ years of Enterprise development experience

Salesforce Development experience using Apex, Visualforce, Lightning Aura, LWC, SOQL.

Familiarity with multiple programming environments and tools (e.g.JAVA, JavaScript, CSS, JSON, HTML)

Exposure to SOAP or REST based web services

Salesforce Certified Administrator, Salesforce Certified Platform Developer credentials

Strong understanding of domain-driven design and application design patterns

Copado knowledge & hands-on experience

Mindset to design for processes that are efficient and solutions that are scalable.

Strong written and verbal communication skills

Ability to manage multiple cross-functional projects simultaneously

Exemplary interpersonal and refined relationship-building skills

Strong analytical thinking capabilities and creative problem-solving skills

Ability to understand new information and ideas and evaluate the impact on current processes

Familiarity with Agile methodology.

Willingness to work with team members; able to coach, participate in code reviews, share skills and methods




Nice To Have/Definite Edge




Familiarity with agile and DevOps principles, test-driven development, continuous integration, and other approaches to accelerate the delivery of new features

Consulting Experience with Salesforce.com implementations, upgrades, integrations and customizations

Direct experience with related Salesforce platform tools like Checkmarx, Docusign, Spanning, Mulesoft, Informatica

Financial Services Experience

Additional Salesforce certifications




Every career at Manulife/John Hancock provides the opportunity to learn new skills and move your career forward. Ready to make an impact somewhere? What are you waiting for? Apply today.





About John Hancock And Manulife



John Hancock is a unit of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States, and Manulife globally, including Canada, Asia and Europe. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.1 trillion) as of June 30, 2021. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as MFC on the TSX, NYSE, and PSE, and under 945 on the SEHK. Manulife can be found at manulife.com .

One of the largest life insurers in the United States, John Hancock supports more than 10 million Americans with a broad range of financial products, including life insurance , annuities , investments , 401(k) plans , and education savings plans . Additional information about John Hancock may be found at johnhancock.com .

CSC Generation is saving Retail. We acquire store and catalog based retailers, and transform them into high performing, “digital first” brands. In just four years, we’ve acquired and turned around brands including: Sur La Table, Z Gallerie, and One Kings Lane, saving over 2,000 jobs and reaching $1.7 billion in revenue.





Sur la Table
 needs the best DevOps Engineers to support our team’s mission of improving the tech stack of our portfolio companies. We manage existing websites, while building cross product components upgrading legacy infrastructure to use the latest and greatest. Scalability and automation are key components as we continue to grow our portfolio.




We work in cross-functional teams; developers, QA and DevOps specialists, as well as the Product team. The team strives to improve and develop portfolio websites and shared components that make them faster and more successful. We are collaborative with an emphasis on iteration and learning. We want someone who is excited to work with various tech in a fast-paced culture, wants to make an immediate impact, and is ready to rise to the challenge of a growing organization. You want every day to be a learning experience? Then keep reading!




We are open to candidates who want to work remotely 100% of the time.





As a Senior DevOps Engineer, you will collaborate with us to:



Build and extend with some of the tool chains we work with such as AWS (ie: Lambda, ElastiCache, CloudFront, CodePipeline, SSM), ansible, and shell scripts

Further enhance our release pipelines, monitoring, alerting and automated system recovery

Work to identify areas of the architecture without redundancy, and work to improve reliability

Develop tools, alarms, and systems to identify issues on front-ends and back-ends, as soon as they happen

Work with business stakeholders to develop uptime and SLA requirements, and work to get overall system uptime inline with engineering SLAs

Migrate off and replace legacy infrastructure

Work closely with and consult with our development teams

Mentor other members of the engineering team in performance, scalability, and engineering best practices






We are excited to have you join our team because you:



Have 7+ years of relevant work experience in a DevOps environment

Are proficient with AWS or other cloud-hosted services

Bring experience working with microservice based architectures

Bring experience working with CI/CD as well as monitoring and alerting tools

Have experience with our tech stack: AWS, ansible, and shell scripts

Believe in finding the best solution, not just one that works

Have attained an AWS Certification, or would like to be sponsored to take an exam for one






You are excited to join us because we offer:



Lots of greenfield work building new vertically integrated micro-SaaS solutions

Work with a competent, experienced engineering team

Ability to shape the DevOps culture

Strong comp package, benefits, and equity

Flexible/casual work environment, no suits or ties





CSC Generation provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

description:
For over 25 years, Comtech Satellite Network Technologies Corp. has been leading the modernization of ANSP networks. Our science and technology enhance society's well-being and create critical innovations that drive scientific advances for the future. We conduct groundbreaking research and development, design and manufacture leading-edge products, and deliver critical services for commercial and government customers. Comtech is committed to driving innovation today and for generations to come. Our company is not your average technology company, you will be working with the best and brightest. We pride ourselves in our team-oriented company culture, where we work at a fast pace, but with tremendous support. We are growing, giving our employees tremendous potential for growth in our brand new facility in Quebec. We provide stability to employees, where you can count on comprehensive benefits package that includes, medical, dental, eye care, and life insurance. Our employees work hard and for that dedication we also have a profit sharing plan and vested pension plan. Interested in learning more? See details below for responsibilities, skills and requirements of this position. Purpose This engineering position involves the design of embedded software for use in satellite and wireless systems. Responsibilities bull Develop embedded software based on C and GCC bull Develop or customize software for our clients to provide additional functionality, such as software updates, enhanced security, and optimization bull Actively participate in mid-level software architectural discussions bull Understanding project limitations and helping ensure expectations meet what is achievable bull Keep schedules, project requirements, specifications, and deliverables through cross-collaboration with Comtechrsquos team members and its clients bull Requirements, design, implementation and testing of software tasks as assigned bull Prepare technical procedures for assembly, testing, and operations bull Maintain code and documentation using revision control Review code developed by other engineers and provide feedback to ensure best practices (e.g., style guidelines, checking code in, accuracy, testability, and efficiency) bull Contribute to existing documentation or educational content and adapt content based on productprogram updates and user feedback bull Triage product or system issues and debugtrackresolve by analyzing the sources of issues and the impact on hardware, network, or service operations and quality bull Write product or system development code bull Other duties as assigned Skills bull Ability to communicate effectively with team members and clients in English or French bull Self-motivated and able to work independently with minimal supervision when required Interested and passionate about staying up to date with technology trends Requirements bull MS or BS in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science or a related field and 3-5 years of experience as an Embedded Software Engineer or related positions bull Programming experience with RTOS kernel device drivers level bull IP protocols stack knowledge bull Experience in embedded SW development for high-grade ARM processors

SOCs (Cortex A8972...) bull Strong knowledge of C language, GCC (C++ not required)

Comtech Telecommunications Corp. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

job_title: Entry Level Software Consultant - Professional Development Program (Spring 2022 Grads)
description:
Company Description


Dynatrace provides software intelligence to simplify cloud complexity and accelerate digital transformation. With automatic and intelligent observability at scale, our all-in-one platform delivers precise answers about the performance and security of applications, the underlying infrastructure, and the experience of all users to enable organizations to innovate faster, collaborate more efficiently, and deliver more value with dramatically less effort. That’s why many of the world’s largest organizations trust Dynatrace®️ to modernize and automate cloud operations, release better software faster, and deliver unrivaled digital experiences.

We take our Employer Brand and internal culture seriously. So much so, we are consistently recognized by reputable companies and brands like Business Insider, USA Today and Forbes. This year so far, Dynatrace scored a seat on Comparably’s award lists for Best Company Outlook, Best Company Global Culture, and Best Places to Work in Boston, to name a few. Dynatrace was also honored in the coveted Top Workplaces USA list in 2021. And we’re proud to be recognized on BuiltIn Boston’s 2021 'Best Large Companies to Work For' and 'Best Paying Companies.' We’ve got it made—won’t you join the #DynatraceLife?    


Job Description


Are you looking for a fast-paced environment where you get to blend your technical curiosity and experience with your passion for helping others (in this case, our customers) succeed in overcoming digital transformation challenges?  If so…we want to talk to you! We are looking for students/ recent graduates that will be available to start in Summer 2022. If you are ending your studies and would be available to start your career, don't hesitate to apply!

When you join us, you’ll start with our elite Professional Development Program-- a virtual 14-week training program. After which, you will become a Delivery Consultant working onsite with one of our customers.

Dynatrace Delivery Consultants are responsible for ensuring successful adoption of Dynatrace technologies throughout the software application lifecycle; they provide real-time analytics which help our customers proactively avoid performance issues and to rapidly diagnose and resolve problems should they occur.


Qualifications



Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related work experience. 

Knowledge of one or more web technology stacks such as: 

Web and application server technologies such as Apache, IIS, WebSphere, WebLogic and JBoss 

Server-side technologies such as Java Servlets and PHP 

Client-side technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Ajax 

The HTTP protocol and the RESTful architectural style 

Cloud/New Stack technologies such as OpenStack, OpenShift, AWS, Azure, and CloudFoundry 

Knowledge of networking, protocols, and architectures such as TCP/IP, HTTP, DNS, SSL, and BGP. 

Familiarity with database design, SQL, and data access practices. 

Exceptional corporate presentation and relationship-building skills. 




Additional Information


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

We offer competitive compensation, company-sponsored premium benefits, medical, dental, vacation/holidays, company matching 401(k) Plan, etc. Dynatrace is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, gender identity, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, physical abilities, age, sexual orientation, creed, disability status, veteran status, pregnancy, genetic status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If your disability makes it difficult for you to use this site, please contact recruiting@dynatrace.com. Dynatrace participates in E-Verify, participant information in English and Spanish. Right to work information in English and Spanish. EEO is the Law/EEO is the Law Supplement. To be considered for this position, please upload your resume/CV.

Dynatrace requires all US employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 two weeks prior to their start date, and to provide verification via the Clear app. Requests for exemptions, must be reviewed and approved prior to commencing employment. If this requirement is not met, your employment will not commence.


Note to Recruiters and Placement Agencies
: Dynatrace LLC (Dynatrace) does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward unsolicited agency resumes to our website or to any Dynatrace employee. Dynatrace will not pay fees to any third party agency or firm and will not be responsible for any agency fees associated with unsolicited resumes. Unsolicited resumes received will be considered property of Dynatrace.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Insurance, and Financial Services
description:
Il s’agit d’un poste de développeur Fullstack pour le projet ENI du secteur Gestion de patrimoine

Le candidat réalisera des tâches à n'importe quel niveau technique de la pile des différentes couches qui constituent une application informatique:


 Langages de développement de type front-end (React)

 Langage de développement de type back-end (Java)



Il devra :


 Comprendre les composantes techniques et l'architecture applicative, afin de coder les composantes d'interface utilisateur, de services API ou autres livrables logiciels.

 Être en mesure de débattre des choix techniques et de réviser les requêtes de déploiement (pull requests) des autres développeurs.

 Participer à la transition de conception aux programmeurs et assurer une compréhension claire & complète de celles-ci.

 Bâtir le cheminement et la séquence des événements dans la solution d'intégration à travers les applications.

 Aider à définir et à examiner les exigences techniques pour l'application, notamment ce qui concerne la sécurité, l'intégration, la performance, le monitoring et la qualité.

 Créer des conditions, des scénarios et des scripts pour les essais unitaires et développer ces tests.



Expérience requise:


 5 à 8 ans d’expérience en développement logiciel



Back END:


 Minimum de 3 ans en développement d’API-Rest avec Spring Boot.



Front END:


 Minimum de 1 à 2 ans en développement Frontend dont le développement de "Single Page Applications (SPA)" complexes notamment : Pages et composants en ReactJS (Function components, React Hooks, React Context); structuration des pages et navigation complexe avec React-Router.

 Développement de formulaires complexes avec des librairies comme Formik, Redux-Form ou React-hook-form.

 Appel d'API REST AxiosJs ou librairies similaires; gestion de l’internationalisation (I18n) et localisation avec react-Intl ou librairies similaires.



Connaissance de la Suite Atlassian (Jira), Jenkins, Maven, Git/BitBucket, Docker/Openshift/Kubernetes.

Bon esprit de collaboration et ouvert aux propositions d’amélioration.

Le (la) candidat(e) doit être en mesure de participer aux cérémonies Agile et autres rencontres qui se tiennent en français dans ce projet.

Dans le contexte actuel, le candidat sera en télé-travail jusqu'à ce que les directives d'entreprise changent. En temps normal, il y a possibilité de télé-travail (à convenir avec la ou le gestionnaire).

Your New Role:


The Full Stack Developer’s core responsibility is the design and testing using best practices of software development.





Operational Responsibilities:



Design your code for testability using your understanding of best practices, patterns, and principles of software development

Apply your knowledge of modern techniques and concepts to design and develop applications and services for either on-prem or cloud solutions

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
At Kinaxis, who we are is grounded in our common belief that people matter. Each one of us plays an important part in accomplishing our work, building our culture and making a global impact.

Every day, we’re empowered to work together to help our customers make fast, confident planning decisions. This is how we create a better planet – for each other, for our customers and for generations to come. Our cloud-based platform RapidResponse ensures that the products we need – everything from medicine and cars, to day-to-day items like toothpaste – make it to market and into our hands when we need them with minimal ecological footprint.

We make the world better, and you can too.


Software Test Developer, Algorithms




About The Team



The Business Algorithms team at Kinaxis creates customized solutions to optimize supply chains. Ever wonder how the hundreds of parts in your new smart phone come together from different suppliers all over the world? Kinaxis solves problems like that every day.

Our customers have terabytes of data that needs to be analyzed for the largest supply chains imaginable. Our algorithms move the global economy-- in seconds, not hours, or days.

It’s Big Data with an impact; Data Science on the front lines.

The Algorithms team works in a dynamic environment where real life supply chain challenges are being translated into complex algorithms that are coded, tested and released to world-wide known manufactures. Developers and Test engineers are working together to achieve high quality supply chain solutions, develop Next Generation frameworks to address testing complexity, and interact with Product Managers and customers on a daily basis.

We believe in the DevOps culture – we serve our own tools, frameworks, infrastructure. Automation is certainly at the top of our priority list.


Who you are



You thrive on delivering a quality product to customers and care deeply about testing best practices and efficient test strategies.

You enjoy complex logic/algorithms, working with Big Data.

You are driven by customer success, love to participate in customer-facing projects.

You prefer a fast-paced agile work environment and take pride in finding product defects.

You approach testing with creative ideas and innovative techniques.

You collaborate with Software Developers and Product Managers, and your passion is to identify and solve product gaps.

You’re a strong believer in Continuous Integration, and the DevOps mindset

You communicate fluidly, at the level of your audience, and seek to understand and be understood.

You like working in teams, mentoring, and sharing neat things you come across.



What you will do 




Technical




Design, develop, and support automated tests and corresponding infrastructure enhancements

Analyze, scope, review, and estimate test development activities

Develop test strategies and plans




Customer Facing




Learn Supply Chain business challenges and contribute to testing relevant Use Cases / Business Processes.

Participate in requirements elaboration and review product specifications.

Translate requirements into Test Strategies and Test Cases

Interact with Rapid Response customers directly and indirectly through Product Managers.




Process Oriented




Improve processes and efficiency of the team, always look for opportunities to strengthen the team.

Share your knowledge and mentor less experienced team members.




Team Player




Be part of the amazing, collaborative, and supportive Business Algorithms Team that is practicing true Agile where testers and developers share the same objectives.



What we are looking for 




Required




4+ years of experience in software test development and automation functions.

A degree in engineering and/or applied science.

Strong programming and scripting languages experience (Python, C#, .Net). 

Exceptionally strong analytical skills and experience working with complex data

Proficiency in requirements elaboration and test plans creation.

Ability to search for and structure information regarding complex processes / functionality.

The ability to ‘think outside of the box’ is crucial in this fast-paced environment 

Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills

Adaptable and flexible to changing priorities

Self-starter with strong initiative and results orientation




Definite Assets




Exposure to manufacturing/fulfillment/BI/Workforce Management/financial business requirements/practices. 

Knowledge of C++/Java

Familiarity with Jenkins CI/CD and release pipelines.

Knowledge and experience in relational database design and usage.

Experience working in agile development environment.



What we have to offer



Challenging Work - We love solving highly complex problems. And as the global leaders in our industry, we never stop innovating—our work is never “done. That’s because across our teams and in all roles, every employee is empowered to bring their best ideas forward and to jump in and solve the problems they’re passionate about.

Great People - We take our work seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously! It’s in our DNA to celebrate, laugh, and have fun. We are stronger, together, when we are open, honest, and above all, real. Every person is valued here and plays an important role in our shared success.

Global Impact - As a global team spanning continents, boundaries, and cultures, every day we are inspired by the impact our work has on our colleagues, our customers, our communities, and the world at large.

 Diversity, Equity and Inclusion - Diversity, equity and inclusion are more than words to us. They are the guiding principles for building a culture where we celebrate each others’ differences, continuously strive for equality and recognize that inclusion makes us stronger as individuals, a company and a global citizen. 


For more information, visit the Kinaxis web site at www.kinaxis.com or the company’s blog at http://blog.kinaxis.com/ .

Kinaxis strongly encourages diverse candidates to apply to our welcoming community. We strive to make our website and application process accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact Human Resources at accommodations@kinaxis.com . This contact information is for accessibility requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
No Agency Submissions Accepted.





Open to Remote Work




What We Are About:


Our Engineering team has established a culture based on thought leadership, independence, and responsibility. This powerful dynamic drives us forward as we work to make the digital world a safer place.

Those who join us represent the leader in Zero Trust Segmentation and work on a technology stack that ranges from operating systems to distributed applications to UI and visualization. Together, we will continue to build world-class products—driven by people with different perspectives, backgrounds, and a commitment to innovation in a time when the world faces its greatest cybersecurity threats in history.


What You Will Accomplish:





Help build a product that is disrupting the network segmentation space and changing the way data centers and cloud stacks are protected against attacks. 

Directly influence the design and technical direction of Illumio’s products as a senior developer of the user interfaces used by all of our customers. 

You will design, develop, and test full featured client-side applications using the latest JavaScript frameworks and modern visualization tools. 

Collaborate on feature design with a team of UX experts. 

Contribute to the evaluation, selection, and adoption of closed and open-source solutions. 

Take ownership of code quality by implementing industry best practices for linting, unit testing, and functional testing to ensure we build robust and resilient products 

Partner with Product Management to review, refine and set product goals and objectives that exceed our customers’ expectations. 

Develop deep understanding of the fundamental problems our customers need solved through direct interaction with Illumio users. 



What You Will Bring:





Bachelor’s in computer science or equivalent degree. Master’s degree a plus. 

12+ years building UI for modern web applications, reporting and data visualization and custom UI frameworks at scale. 

Strong foundation in software engineering and design pattern fundamentals. 

Self-driven innovator with a passion for software development, keeping up with technological trends, and working in a team setting. 

Demonstrated experience building modern web applications using JavaScript, 

html, css, and modern web frameworks such as React and Redux. 

Experience with UI test automation tools such as Jasmin, Mocha, Jest, etc. 

Experience building visualizations using High Charts, D3, or similar tools is highly desired. 

A customer focused mindset with the goal to providing the best possible products and services to our clients. 




Who We Are



Illumio, the pioneer and market leader of Zero Trust segmentation, prevents breaches from becoming cyber disasters. Illumio protects critical applications and valuable digital assets with proven segmentation technology purpose-built for the Zero Trust security model. Illumio ransomware mitigation and segmentation solutions see risk, isolate attacks, and secure data across cloud-native apps, hybrid and multi-clouds, data centers, and endpoints, enabling the world’s leading organizations to strengthen their cyber resiliency and reduce risk.

job_title: Software Application Engineers- TWO immediate openings/levels
description:
Do What You Love. Love What You Do.


At Workday, we help the world’s largest organizations adapt to what’s next by bringing finance, HR, and planning into a single enterprise cloud. We work hard, and we’re serious about what we do. But we like to have fun, too. We put people first, celebrate diversity, drive innovation, and do good in the communities where we live and work.


About The Team


Workday’s Talent Optimization team develops Machine Learning enabled applications that are defining the future of work. Our goal is to help large organizations break down silos and build more agile work environments, and enable the continuous growth of hardworking people everywhere. Through our solutions, we intelligently connect employees to projects, people and resources where they will have the most impact and personal growth. Our vision is to build a world where people are happy, excited and engaged with their work.

On top of all the cool software development we do, we are very proud of our outstanding team culture. We love hiking/crying up Grouse Grind together, skiing/falling down Cypress together and running/relaxing around Stanley Park together. And on the rainy days, we also love staying indoors, playing board games, doing yoga or just enjoying a beverage together.

If you want to build products that will transform the way we work, impact the lives of millions and have a blast while doing so, this may be the right job for you!


About The Role


Do what you love. Love what you do.

Workday Software Engineering roles offer exciting opportunities to evolve our award-winning products. You will be creating information systems by designing and developing software solutions to make a direct impact on Workday’s future. You will use groundbreaking technologies and methodologies to build customer facing applications that our users will never want to put down. And, you will work with world class teams to solve some of the most meaningful problems enterprise companies face today.


About You


Basic Qualifications


2-10+ years of professional software development experience leading, designing and implementing scalable enterprise software, components, frameworks, web applications

Strong understanding of Object-Oriented Design and Programming (Java, C#, XO), data modeling, structures, and algorithms

Experience with Front End technologies- React, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, RESTful APIs, and modern front-end frameworks (React preferred)

Understanding of Service Oriented Architecture

BS/MS in Computer Science or related field




Other Qualifications


While we look for common skills and capabilities in all our candidates, each team offers unique ways to elevate Workday products to the next level:


You’re smart, get stuff done, have great energy, and thrive in a startup-like environment

You see software development as a team activity, and thrive in a highly collaborative, agile culture where you’re always teaching and learning

You have a growth mentality and are overflowing with curiosity about technologies

Good understanding of the problem we’re solving and a passion for making a difference

Strong communication and organizational skills

Strong analytical and critical thinking skills

Resourcefulness in complicated situations and problem solving sessions

Desire to collaborate with others with similar passions

Proven ability to balance multiple priorities and communicate across organizational boundaries



We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.


Are you being referred to one of our roles? If so, ask your connection at Workday about our Employee Referral process!

Hiring an intermediate Java Developer here in Vancouver for a fulltime, permanent opportunity with one of our top insurance clients! 

- Hybrid model 2x a week in office

- Must be in Vancouver or willing to relocate 

- Backend Java development on enterprise applications

- Microservices

- Cloud development in AWS or Azure

job_title: Staff Software Engineer : Data Streaming, Core Infra - Slack
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.



 Job Category 
Products and Technology
 Job Details 



Staff Software Engineer : Data Streaming, Core Infrastructure


Slack is expanding our Core Infrastructure team - looking for experts to drive the way we architect, deliver, and operate the services that run at the heart of our Infrastructure.

Teams of all sizes from the worlds largest public companies to the smallest of startups use Slack to get work done. We work at a tremendous scale, aiming for “five nines” of uptime for all services.


1M Slack messages sent per minute via the API

300M events per minute broadcast to Slack clients

90B database queries per day

6B background jobs enqueued per day

2T metrics collected per day




Our Core Infrastructure Team Maintains And Builds The Lower Levels Of Our Stack, Including



Our systems deliver trust and scale for people all over the world to communicate and collaborate together, as well as internal capabilities like the company's monitoring fabric and detection/response security systems.


Edge services

Data Stores and Caches

Real-time messaging and event fanout

Asynchronous background job processing


We've done our job correctly when none of our users think about us, much like a vital utility. We don't typically ship new user-facing features, but rather ensure our systems are exceptionally performant, highly available, reliable, and scalable. In other words, we make Slack work seamlessly. Slack's API and web backend is built on PHP/Hack, and our backend services are written in Java and Go. Our data infrastructure is built on Kafka, Hadoop, Hive, Presto, Spark, and MySQL/Vitess.


The Data Streaming Team


We are forming a new Data streaming team that will focus on providing Kafka as a Service for the company at the scale of trillions of messages per day across dozens of clusters in Amazon data centers. The team will work both on extensions to the Kafka ecosystem to bridge clusters together and store streams as well as on highly reliable automation for tuning, operating, and scaling Kafka clusters.



Opportunities Include



We are seeking all levels of 
Software

Engineers 
to help take us to the next level of scale, performance, and maturity.


Measuring and improving the performance and availability of Kafka

Coaching other engineers on best practices for designing and operating reliable systems at scale

Contributing to prominent open-source projects

Building deep expertise with public cloud platforms, Kubernetes and Kafka (or perhaps you already have this?)

Architecting and building infrastructure for data streaming at Slack




Requirements




7+ years of experience in Distributed Systems

Experience with Java, Go, Python or similar languages

Experience with one or more public cloud platforms e.g. AWS, Azure, GCP

Experience with Kafka, Kubernetes, Terraform

Experience owning and operating mission-critical services

Experience with Agile development methodology and Test-Driven Development

Experience using telemetry and metrics to drive operational excellence




Education




MS or BS in Computer Engineer/Science or related field, or

Relevant work experience with demonstrated success in the above areas at scale


Slack has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture—we look for people who are curious, inventive, and work to be a little better every single day. In our work together we aim to be smart, humble, hardworking and, above all, collaborative. If this sounds like a good fit for you, why not say hello?

Slack is registered as an employer in many, but not all, states. If you are not located in or able to work from a state where Slack is registered, you will not be eligible for employment.Visa sponsorship may not be available in certain remote locations.

Visa sponsorship is not available for candidates living outside the country of this position.

For Colorado-based roles: Minimum annual salary of $158,000. 

You may also be entitled to receive

bonus, restricted stock units, and benefits.
