Description:* This person will be working on the Embedded Linux Software Team working on the middleware. Our client is moving towards a subscription-based business model to go with their devices. They have made features such as parental control, ad blockers, gaming boosters, virus security, etc.). This person will be working with this group. They work in an open-source stack but closed environment as they require other companies to partner with them to use their product.



Our client also wants to replace all ODM code with their own open sources code. This person will be kick-starting that program. They will work with the firmware team who will write the device driver and this person will integrate it into an open-source proxy server. They will stitch in the service abstraction layer on top.

25% of the time this person will need to do code reviews from overseas contractors. The rest of the time will be their own coding. They will be expected to give suggestions on the architecture.


Software design

Coding

Integrating software

Debugging issues

Code and design review

Supporting, refactoring, and improving existing code

Writing unit tests

Documenting software

Skills:* embedded c, multi-threaded programming, Linux, firewall, proxy server, rest API, Linux containers, open-source, web socket, applications, iptables, iptc, lxc

Additional Skills & Qualifications:* MUST HAVES:

4+ years of software C coding

Strong with Multi-threading and multi-tasking

Worked with Linux open source code and linux containers (LXC)

Has written code for IPTables (iptc) and firewalls

Understands proxy, and reverse proxy

Has worked with a REST API

Eager to learn and develop on their own

Have done code reviews



NICE TO HAVES


Shell programming

Cloud experience

Experience with Jira and Jenkins

Experience with code analysis tools:

Static code analysis (SonarQUBE, SonarLint, Converity or Klocwork)

Dynamic code analysis and profiling (Valgrind)

Linux build frameworks (OpenWRT or Yocto)

Configuration frameworks (LibElektra, kconfig or gconfig) * x86 virtual machines and Docker containers

Scripting languages - Lua, Python, or Javascript

Embedded SoC processors and SDKs (Qualcomm or Broadcom)

Cloud development (AWS cloud infrastructure, AWS Lambda, MongoDB, security)

Mobile application development

Experience Level:* Intermediate Level

We are looking for a Senior React Native developer interested in building performant mobile apps on iOS and Android. You will be responsible for architecting and building these applications and coordinating with the teams responsible for other layers of the product infrastructure. Building a digital product is a highly collaborative effort, and as such, a strong team player with a commitment to perfection is required.




Company




If it lives on a screen in the digital world, we build it.




From websites to mobile apps to media campaigns and everything else in between, we build it all with humanity to delight your customers and rapidly achieve returns on your digital investment. Our team is there every step of the way to bring that experience to life. Because to us, digital is more than a medium, more than a lifestyle – it is life.




How you’ll make an impact





Build pixel-perfect, buttery smooth UIs across both mobile platforms.

Leverage native APIs for deep integrations with both platforms.

Diagnose and fix bugs and performance bottlenecks for performance that feels native.

Maintain code and write automated tests to ensure the product is of the highest quality.

Transition existing native mobile apps to React Native.

Work with the quality team to ensure traceability from requirements through to unit tests and deployed application





The role of a React Native Developer requires:





Firm grasp of the JavaScript and TypeScript languages and their nuances, including ES6+ syntax

Knowledge of functional programming and component architecture

Ability to write well-documented, clean JavaScript cod

Rock-solid at working with third-party dependencies and debugging dependency conflicts

Strong familiarity with native build tools, like XCode, Gradle Android Studio

Understanding of REST APIs, GraphQL, the document request model, and offline storage

Experience with automated testing suites, like Jest or Mocha

Experience reading and understanding C++ code for cross-platform mobile libraries

About the role?


Reporting to the Senior Quality Assurance Manager, the BI QA Engineer will create and execute test cases to ensure the software products meet design specifications and product quality standards. The BI QA Engineer will test hands-on and follow established QA methodologies as well as being involved in other QA and project related activities. This position requires a highly motivated individual that is comfortable with rapid changes in direction and a fluid environment. The successful candidate should be detail-oriented, approachable, dependable, and reliable with good business sense and judgment.



What You'll Do




 Participate in the testing activities of the software to ensure the highest level of quality.

 Write and execute test cases, scripts and scenarios.

 Write moderately complex code/scripts to test systems.

 Identify and report defects, work with development team to ensure defects are resolved, and verify fixes.

 Create, maintain, or enhance existing test automation.

 Provide project and resource estimates required for the quality assurance effort of assigned projects.

 Work with other project team members to understand project requirements.

 Establish cooperative relationships to work efficiently with co-workers, and participate as a member of a Quality Assurance team




What You'll Need




1-3 years working as a QA software professional

Experience in Data Warehouse, BI reports, ETL Verification

Experience in Testing BI applications

Experience with web application testing

Experience using SQL Server and writing SQL queries

Experience with scripting or programming language(s)

Experience with issue tracking systems such as JIRA

Experience with source control systems such as Azure DevOps (VSTS)


An understanding of the following would be an considered an asset:


ETL process

Data warehouse and data model

Data-related services in Azure

PowerBI

Scala

Python

Data Bricks

Azure data factory

Automated testing

Data-Driven Testing

description:
Our client in the Oakville area has partnered with Randstad Engineering in search of an HMI Systems Engineer to join their growing team! In this role you will be responsible to assist with the development of technology and products. Working with the Advanced Development Group, you will be involved with emerging product areas. You will be engaged in purposive and systematic analysis, including complex problem formulation and solving in the field of the Human Machine Interface. This client is looking for a candidate that has an interest in the automobile of the future.

Do you have a diverse range of multi faceted skills with the ability to "think outside the box"? This role may be the opportunity you are looking for!


Advantages



 Dental care

 Disability insurance

 Extended health care

 Life insurance

 RRSP match

 Vision care




Responsibilities



 Acts as the subject matter expert in HMI system designs and technologies

 Leads human machine sensing applications at the technology and system level

 Interfaces with internal and external resources, and customers

 Investigates and evaluates technologies for further development in the area of human machine interactions (gesture, touch, haptics, etc)

 Develops robust and efficient signal processing based algorithms to analyze sensing data and various user inputs, applying a solid understanding of basic machine learning algorithms as appropriate

 Interacts as a design leader with global cross-functional teams responsible for mechanical, electrical and software engineering (Canada, US and Japan)

 Conceives and constructs testing methodologies for evaluating Human Machine Interfaces (interactional characteristics and functional requirements)

 Maintains current knowledge of technology and trends as they apply to the HMI area in the automotive industry and able to apply in the leadership of technical direction for future applications.

 Acts with a team-centric approach, sensitive to cultural and geographic differences

 Independently prioritizes the completion of tasks and resolution of issues to ensure compliance to customer specification and program deliverables.

 Self-starter, self-motivated, ability to complete project goals with minimal supervision with high attention to details and quality of work.




Qualifications



 Bachelor Degree in Systems, Mechatronics, Electrical or Computer Engineering,

 Working knowledge of human machine interface concepts, including:

 User interface design,

 Haptic systems

 Sensing technologies applicable to HMI applications

 Exposure to concepts in biomedical sensing, with at least academic exposure at hands-on level

 Working level of knowledge in measurement and processing of sensing data

 Capability to devise and implement basic machine learning techniques for data analysis

 Working knowledge of devising and executing usability studies for HMI devices/systems

 Experience working with MS Office, Matlab, programming languages suitable for HMI applications (C/C++, Python, etc), and CAE tools




Summary


Apply online today! Or send your resume to Ommaira Kawshy at ommaira.kawshy@randstad.ca.

description:
Opentext - The Information Company



As the Information Company, our mission at OpenText is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management.

Work with talented team members with diverse skillsets developing solutions in new technology stacks and integrating with new and existing software systems. Everyone on the team works regularly in a wide array of Salesforce, Cloud, and emerging technologies allowing you to continue to expand your skills with exposure to multiple areas in the Information Management and Content Management realms.

Looking for an individual that can take on additional responsibilities as an architect and designer in a couple of years. Individuals should want to seek more team leadership and architecture design roles.



The Opportunity



Compelling opportunity to work in the emerging crosshairs of Salesforce and Information Management technologies developing and enhancing enterprise solutions around processing, creating, transforming, and delivering multimedia, image, creative, and document-based files. Execute and satisfy requirements for globally known brands that depend on these systems to capture, create, curate, and control the delivery and distribution of business, entertainment, marketing, and other content across multiple channels. Like to work with digital content and the latest Cloud and Salesforce technologies? Understand how to integrate Salesforce with other Cloud technologies like Amazon Elastic Cloud, Google Cloud Platform, and Microsoft Azure with on and off Cloud platforms? Want to work on software that is used by companies everyone has heard of?

Apply for this exciting position and join a global, successful, and engaging Agile Scrum team that builds awesome software and has fun doing it!



You Are Great At




Meeting with product managers to determine CRM needs.

Developing customized solutions within the Salesforce platform.

Designing, coding, and implementing Salesforce applications.

Creating timelines and development goals.

Testing the stability and functionality of the application.

Troubleshooting and fixing bugs.




What It Takes




Previous work experience with application and software development.

Experience developing customer-facing interfaces.

Advanced knowledge of Salesforce CRM platforms.

Proficient in MYSQL, Apex, JavaScript, Native, and VisualForce.

Good communication skills.

Ability to problem solve high-level software and application issues.

description:
Description



At Laserfiche, Software Engineers in Test are experts in the testing area. They are specialists when it comes to implementing automated tests, running acceptance tests and writing detailed test specifications. In our case, effective collaboration across teams is imperative to being successful in this role as you’ll be working with product owners, tech support engineers and others with a variety of skill sets. These engineers work in formal and informal environments, create and test intricate user stories, and solve complicated problems with simple solutions.

Laserfiche is the leading SaaS provider of intelligent content management and business process automation. Through powerful workflows, electronic forms, document management, and analytics, the Laserfiche® platform accelerates how business gets done, enabling leaders to focus on growth across the enterprise.

Laserfiche pioneered the paperless office with enterprise content management. Today, Laserfiche’s cloud-first development approach incorporates innovations in machine learning and AI to enable organizations in more than 80 countries to transform into digital businesses. Customers in every industry—including government, education, financial services, healthcare, and manufacturing—use Laserfiche to boost productivity, scale their business and deliver digital-first customer experiences.

Laserfiche employees in offices around the world are committed to the company’s vision of empowering customers and inspiring people to reimagine how technology can transform lives.



Responsibilities Include




 Writing detailed test specifications and test cases to verify system functionality

 Writing code that automatically tests existing and new programs

 Running acceptance tests, confirming defects and validating bug fixes

 Conducting distributed load and scalability tests

 Compiling, analyzing, and reporting on performance test results and testing trends

 Participating in peer-group reviews of designs, code and documentation




What You Will Need




 Excellent analytical, problem-solving and debugging skills

 Strong organizational and communication skills

 Ability to collaborate with and support fellow engineers

 Ability to quickly learn and apply new software technologies

 Ability to prioritize and adjust tasks to accomplish objectives.


Click 
here
 to learn more about Life at Laserfiche

Laserfiche complies with all Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action regulations. Laserfiche makes all employment decisions – such as recruiting, hiring, training, promotion, compensation, professional development practices, discipline and termination – without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, sex, pregnancy, age, creed, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic characteristic, marital status, veteran status, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by law, except as may be permitted by law.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Open



 to Remote Work





No Agency Submissions Accepted.




What We Are About:


Our Engineering team has established a culture based on thought leadership, independence, and responsibility. This powerful dynamic drives us forward as we work to make the digital world a safer place.

Those who join us represent the leader in Zero Trust Segmentation and work on a technology stack that ranges from operating systems to distributed applications to UI and visualization. Together, we will continue to build world-class products—driven by people with different perspectives, backgrounds, and a commitment to innovation in a time when the world faces its greatest cybersecurity threats in history.


What You Will Accomplish:





Help build a product that is disrupting the network segmentation space and changing the way data centers and cloud stacks are protected against attacks. 

Directly influence the design and technical direction of Illumio’s products’ user interfaces used by all of our customers. 

You will work with team of UI engineers to design, develop, and test full featured client-side applications using the latest JavaScript frameworks and modern visualization tools. 

Collaborate on feature design with a team of UX experts. 

Contribute to the evaluation, selection, and adoption of closed and open-source solutions. 

Take ownership of code quality by implementing industry best practices for linting, unit testing, and functional testing to ensure we build robust and resilient products 

Develop deep understanding of the problems our customers need solved through direct interaction with Illumio users. 



What You Will Bring:





Bachelor’s in computer science or equivalent degree. Master’s degree a plus. 

3+ years building UI for modern web applications, reporting and data visualization and custom UI frameworks at scale. 

Strong foundation in software engineering and design pattern fundamentals. 

Demonstrated experience building modern web applications using JavaScript 

HTML, CSS, and modern web frameworks such as React and Redux. 

Experience with UI test automation tools such as Jasmin, Mocha, Jest, etc. 

Experience building visualizations using High Charts, D3, or similar tools is highly desired. 

Self-driven innovator with a passion for software development, keeping up with technological trends, and working in a team setting. 

A customer focused mindset with the goal to providing the best possible products and services to our clients. 




Who We Are



Illumio, the pioneer and market leader of Zero Trust segmentation, prevents breaches from becoming cyber disasters. Illumio protects critical applications and valuable digital assets with proven segmentation technology purpose-built for the Zero Trust security model. Illumio ransomware mitigation and segmentation solutions see risk, isolate attacks, and secure data across cloud-native apps, hybrid and multi-clouds, data centers, and endpoints, enabling the world’s leading organizations to strengthen their cyber resiliency and reduce risk.

Description:* This fully remote firmware developer position is for a forward thinking and established company who is looking for intermediate to higher level candidates to make a difference on an existing product. The role will focus on bare metal, driver development where you work your way up the stack, they and focuses mainly on low level programming. Additionally, professional working experience with RTOS is a strong addition. This position has an RTOS that can create tasks, scanning analog, and digital inputs. The code base is in C and would require professional experience working with C at the lower level. The project will be focusing on debugging and patching up the product while working in a sustaining environment. This contract will not be building on the product. This position is looking for someone who can come in and make a difference right away not someone who will need onboarding or training. The product is a renewable energy product that focuses on solar power and batteries.

Skills:* Microcontroller Programming (4+ years of professional experience) RTOS (4+ years of professional experience) Firmware C (4+ years of professional experience)



NICE TO HAVES:

Electronics experience (has knowledge of what a resistor and capacitor are)


Experience Level:* Intermediate Level

description:
Le Mouvement Desjardins est le plus important groupe financier coopératif au Canada et l'un des principaux employeurs au pays. Il offre toute la gamme des produits et services financiers et regroupe les expertises en gestion de patrimoine, en assurance de personnes et de dommages, en service aux entreprises de toutes tailles, en valeurs mobilières, en gestion d'actifs, en capital de risque ainsi que des modes d'accès virtuels sécuritaires, à la fine pointe de la technologie.


Niveau d'emploi


NV-10

Vous n’avez pas peur des défis et vous éprouvez de la fierté à livrer des solutions numériques exceptionnelles? Vous êtes reconnus pour votre leadership et votre esprit rassembleur ? Nous cherchons un nouveau leader technique pour apporter son expertise à nos escouades de développement applicatif AccèsD à Montréal !

À titre d'analyste programmeur Senior AccesD, votre mission est d'enrichir l’expérience utilisateur de nos millions de membres et clients sur AccèsD. Nous sommes à la recherche d’une personne passionnée comme vous, curieuse, et prête à repousser ses limites pour rester à la fine pointe de la technologie afin de livrer les meilleures solutions pour nos membres et clients. Vous aurez à démontrer un rôle de leadership auprès des différents intervenants dans le cadre de dossiers et projets stratégiques et complexes, à caractère novateur.


Ce que vous faites



Vous êtes appelés à interagir avec un grand nombre de parties prenantes œuvrant dans des domaines d’expertise variés

Vous accompagnez des développeurs dans l’appropriation des technologies

Vous amenez vos collègues à se dépasser. La maîtrise des relations interpersonnelles devient alors une compétence essentielle



Ce qu’il vous faut 



Vous êtes capable de gérer les priorités et vous avez une bonne capacité d’analyse

Vous avez une bonne attitude. Après tout, on passe nos journées ensemble!

Vous êtes autonome et proactif

Vous osez innover et surprendre

Vous êtes ouvert au changement, tout en restant orienté vers le résultat.

Vous avez des connaissances ou des intérêts pour : Java, Spring, Angular, TypeScript Architecture microservices, Bases de données et plus encore!

Vous êtes excité à l’idée de travailler dans une plateforme infonuagique et adopter le DevSecOps comme nouvelle pratique de développement

Vous avez une bonne capacité à transmettre des connaissances et à vous adapter aux différentes personnalités

Vous gérez bien la complexité et l’ambiguïté



Condition particulière



Nombre d’emploi disponible : 1




Profil recherché




Baccalauréat dans une discipline appropriée

Un minimum de six ans d’expérience pertinente


Veuillez noter que d'autres combinaisons de formation et d'expérience pertinentes pourraient être considérées


Pour les postes vacants disponibles au Québec, veuillez noter que la connaissance du français est nécessaire



Connaissances spécifiques



Connaissance de l'infonuagique, des microservices et autres nouvelles technologies

Connaissance de Java, Spring, SpringBoot, Angular, Typescript Architecture microservice



Compétences transversales Desjardins


Apprécier les différences, Apprendre avec agilité, Être orienté client, Être orienté vers l’action


Compétences clés au profil recherché


Gérer la complexité, Maîtriser la technologie, Planifier et coordonner


Lieu de travail


1050, Côte du Beaver Hall Montréal


Syndicat


Non Syndiqué


Date de fin d'affichage


2022-03-21


Famille d'emplois


Technologies de l'information (GF)

Address



100 King Street West



Job Family Group



Technology

Understands that the success of a developer is to understand the core business processes of the business unit and business requirements as well as the architecture patterns and technology strategy (e.g., Transformation, SmartCore, DevOps). Conceive and write detailed software implementations/code while ensuring that their code/configurations adhere to the security, logging, error handling, and performance standards and non-functional requirements. Writes, configures, and integrates code to create the software that aligns with architecture patterns and technology strategy. Understands the implications of various components (including technology strategy & architecture) to the overall design of a program, system, or eco-system. Evaluates new technologies for fit with the program/system/eco-system and the associated upstream and downstream impacts on process, data, risk (e.g., security). Works toward the objective of defect free software. Ensures that systems functionally meet requirements, align with architecture and promote the development of common assets. Supports the resolution of production issues and problems. Makes recommendations to improve BMO processes & systems.



 Supports research and development of development frameworks, and definition of standards.

 Leads and implements initiatives as required to deliver business objectives.

 Conducts independent analysis and assessment to resolve strategic issues.

 Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders and ensures alignment.

 Monitors and tracks performance, and addresses any issues.

 Reviews the work of other team members as required.

 Provides input into the planning and implementation of operational programs.

 Decomposes business requirements and translates them into detailed design specifications and code.

 Interacts with key business & technology stakeholders to define, analyze, and deliver requirements that reflect the needs of both the business and end-customers.

 Assesses the costs and benefits for different solutions and recommend/decide on appropriate designs.

 Designs solutions, writes code, performs unit testing, develops appropriate artefacts / documentation, and facilitates final delivery.

 Supports production issues, includes independently completing root-cause analysis and diagnosis.

 Devises new algorithms and data structures for target environment and platform attributes in alignment with architectural patterns.

 Builds solutions that are supportable, scalable and achieve our aspiration of common assets.

 Recommends or automates approaches to streamline and integrate technological processes and/or systems to improve operational efficiency and effectiveness.

 Supports the management of specific project deliverables & outcomes.

 Identifies opportunities to strengthen the development capability, such as: sharing expertise to promote technical development, mentoring employees, building communities of practice and networks.

 Stays abreast of industry technical and business trends through participation in professional associations, practice communities & individual learning.

 Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus.

 Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.

 Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations.

 Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.




Qualifications





 Typically 2-4 years of work experience in IT or business environment and/or B.S./B.A. in computer science, engineering, information systems, math or business

 Must have core skills - Java EE, Spring Boot / Spring framework, Java Rest & SOAP Web Services, Oracle RDBMS or similar, SQL, PL/SQL, DevOps Tools (Bitbucket, Bamboo, Ansible), Agile Development

 Good to have skills - Containers (Docker, Kubernetes etc.), NoSQL DBs, NodeJS or similar, Angular Framework, AWS Fundamentals

 Proficient level of knowledge in domain.

 Knowledge of software development practices, concepts, and technology obtained through formal training and/or work experience.

 Knowledge of required programming languages and can code with little oversight.

 Knowledge of technical/business environment and processes.

 Understand functional aspects and technical behavior of the underlying operating system, development environment, and deployment practices.

 Have facility with and understanding of the ecosystem that code operates in.

 Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience.

 Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.

 Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.

 Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth.

 Influence skills - In-depth.

 Data driven decision making - In-depth



We’re here to help


At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en.

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Actalent is looking for a QA Engineer to help support our client for a fully remote position!


Position Description:* Develop and manage our industry-leading products all the way from initial ideas to product launches including R&D, engineering, software development and testing, project management, system testing.



As a QA Developer for AWS native application, you are an experienced AWS developer in the software QA team helping the development team with developing automated tests and cloud monitoring. You will be part of our R&D development team, working closely with the developers in an Agile/Scrum team. To succeed in this role we are looking for someone who will be an active team player with a genuine interest in quality assurance and help in providing high-quality products to customers.


Your key responsibilities include:* Actively communicate with the development team and stockholders to understand the current application requirements and infrastructure.



Develop and maintain automated integration and end2end test for Microservices infrastructure. Develop and maintain automated UI and application end2end test. Design software QA documents like test case, test plan, traceability matrix Define and document best practices in testing strategy based on company process and standards. Work collaboratively with software engineering to define infrastructure and deployment requirements. Build and maintain operational tools for deployment, monitoring, and analysis of AWS infrastructure and systems. Perform infrastructure cost analysis and optimization. Develop efficient DynamoDB queries.


Qualifications:* Bachelor’s in Computer Science and a minimum of 3 years of experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience. 3 or more years of hands-on experience with AWS native application. 3 or more years of practical experience in the software QA field. Working experience with Cypress or Jest. Working experience with JavaScript. ISTQB or equivalent software QA training/certificate. Excellent team working and communication. Strong troubleshooting and conflict management. Programming experience with NodeJS. Hands-on experience with automated integration and end2end testing on Microservice based infrastructure. Familiarity with Linux and bash command. Good experience with git version management tool.



Thank you to all applicants! If you believe you would be a good fit for this opportunity, please do not hesitate to apply.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Elastic is a search company built on a free and open heritage. Anyone can use Elastic products and solutions to get started quickly and frictionlessly. Elastic offers three solutions for enterprise search, observability, and security, built on one technology stack that can be deployed anywhere. From finding documents to monitoring infrastructure to hunting for threats, Elastic makes data usable in real time and at scale. Thousands of organizations worldwide, including Cisco, eBay, Goldman Sachs, Microsoft, The Mayo Clinic, NASA, The New York Times, Wikipedia, and Verizon, use Elastic to power mission-critical systems. Founded in 2012, Elastic is a distributed company with Elasticians around the globe and is publicly traded on the NYSE under the symbol ESTC. Learn more at elastic.co.

As a Senior Web Developer at Elastic on the Marketing web development team, you'll be working collaboratively in a distributed working environment delivering valuable features for our web infrastructure that powers elastic.co. Elastic.co is our primary channel to communicate with potential and existing customers on how the power of search can solve their biggest challenges. We support stakeholders across the company and are working to facilitate a high quality customer experience at scale. We’re seeking a talented web developer and communicator to help push the our webteam and team to new heights.



What You Will Be Doing




You will be working on the application and backend layer that powers our flagship website, elastic.co. You will be working on enhancing our resiliency, introducing new functionality, and collaborating with engineering teams across the company to ensure we are delivering a first-class experience to our customers. 

You will collaborate with and mentor international teammates in a mostly text-based, asynchronous, remote-first team environment with occasional video calls and yearly conferences. You’ll be hands-on with the team and codebase, reviewing work, and providing constructive feedback.

You will help define the team’s overall technical strategy, collaborating on a product roadmap, and then breaking it into technical deliverables. You’ll act as an important and communicative part of an engaged and spirited team.



Our Team Style



We appreciate articulate and “humble people who want to grow as part of a team.

We welcome diversity in all forms. We embrace strange and risky ideas and appreciate characters of all sorts.

We hold each other accountable and work to a high standard. We take pride in the frequent, safe, and graceful delivery of innovative and valuable features.

We embrace open communication and challenge. We appreciate positivity and vigilance and strive for autonomy, trust, and personal and professional growth.


Our web application stack is primarily in Node.js, Next.js, with integrations to various platforms, both first and third party.





What You Will Bring




Previous experience building production web applications at scale, taking thorny problems and crafting high quality, working software solutions to them.

Experience in fullstack web development and managing infrastructure to support high availability, security, and scalability. 

Excellent practical judgement. You know how to prioritize, when to collaborate and ask for help, and when to be independent.

Measured and articulate written and spoken communication skills. You work well with others and can craft concise and expressive thoughts into correspondence: issues, investigations, documentation, and onboarding material.

An interest in learning new tools, languages, workflows, and philosophies that can help you grow. You can function well in an environment that drives towards change.


If this sounds interesting, we would love to hear from you! Please include whatever info you believe is relevant: resume, GitHub profile, code samples, blog posts and writing samples, links to personal projects, etc.



Additional Information - We Take Care Of Our People



As a distributed company, diversity drives our identity. Whether you’re looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Your age is only a number. It doesn’t matter if you’re just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.

We strive to have parity of benefits across regions and while regulations differ from place to place, we believe taking care of our people is the right thing to do.


Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary 

Health coverage for you and your family in many locations

Ability to craft your calendar with flexible locations and schedules for many roles

Generous number of vacation days each year

Double your charitable giving - We match up to $1500 (or local currency equivalent)

Up to 40 hours each year to use toward volunteer projects you love

Embracing parenthood with minimum of 16 weeks of parental leave
